description:
Yummmmmmmmm! This place is yummy. Line down the street durning lunch time. Inside seating very close together but doesn't bother me. Good environment. Staff is great. Good prices. Beer is in cans :/ 

The chicken has an Asian sort of taste to it very satisfying. The fries are amazing
author: China D.

description:
One of the best sandwiches you can get in SF for the price.
$8 gets you juicy crispy fried chicken on soft bread and a sprinkling of some other tasty accouterments. An extra $4.50 for the "Happier" Meal gets you some delicious curly fries and a beer/soft drink. I think the classic was a bit blander so definitely going with the spicy next time.

Super fast service and definitely a recommended spot.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Omg I love The Bird! I'm not surprised to see the long lines during the lunch hour.

I got to try their spicy chicken sandwich at OutsideLands, and I've been in love ever since.  The spice on the chicken builds, but the coleslaw helps cool things down a bit.  Everything about that sandwich was perfect.

I wanted to try their biscuit, but even going straight to their booth when the gates opened didn't help because they were out.  I got to try it a month ago during the lunch hour with their original chicken.  I thought it was okay.  The biscuit was a bit dry despite its buttery flavor.  And I think I just like the kick of their spicy chicken, so I missed that.

Over the weekend, I was able to go there for brunch, and though I felt the same way about their biscuit sandwich, I believe you can't beat its price.  Their biscuit comes with tater tots only during breakfast.  So if you're there for the lunch hour, I'd just pay more for the sandwich.

I also got to try an apple fritter, and for $1.50, you get 3, and that's just enough to satisfy that dessert craving some people have at the end of a meal.

It's communal seating, inside, and some tables outside.  There's also counter seating by the window.  Even though the line is long, I think it's worth the wait.  Their prices are really good, especially for Soma.
author: Vira P.

description:
The line is intimidating but it moves fast! And we event found a place to sit inside, which was a bonus.

I was in town for work which means a lot of decadent eating. I love fried chicken but the idea of it on a sandwich felt a bit heavy. Luckily, you can get their amazing chicken on a salad, which was a perfect compromise. The salad comprised of romaine hearts and a baby kale mix, braised beets, spelt, celery and apple, and your choice of dressing. I went with ranch because HELLO FRIED CHICKEN AND RANCH IS AMAZING. And the chicken was perfectly breaded, seasoned, and juicy. Perfectly prepared. 

The salad was great although I will say the super deep bowl made it kind of hard to get a good toss of the salad. In the future I'd probably take it to go and toss it and move it to a plate for the perfect ratio of all the toppings in each bite.

Some of my teammates got the sandwiches and my God was I jealous. They looked amazing. Next time I'll just say eff it and indulge. But the salad is a great option if you want to TRY to be good.
author: Annette J.

description:
TIMING:
   - Arrived at 4pm on a Friday and it was pretty empty
   - Started getting busy around 5pm
   - They have happy hour from 4pm-7pm!

FOOD:
    1. Fried chicken sandwich (non-spicy)
         - Buns: warm, soft, almost hawaiian-bread-like
         - Chicken: extremely juicy
         - Texture: crunchy in the best way possible
         - Spice: surprisingly had a kick for a non-spicy sandwich

SERVICE
   - Friendly
   - Quick (got our sandwich in about 4 minutes)

WOULD RECOMMEND?
   - Yes
author: Linda K.

description:
So update! I guess someone from this place didn't like my review so they replied to not apologize for me not having a good experience but to say others love it and if it's not for me then so be it. Just so professional don't you think. 

Well I'm from the south and the taste of your chicken sucks. Simple as that. The south has the best food in the planet. Maybe you should take out the special ingredient that tastes like perfume and then I may give a 1.5 star. My husband is not even born in America and he thought it was horrible. We don't like it and don't recommend it. Chick fil a is much better and they are professional in every area. Good day!
author: LaToya G.

description:
Nothing much to say, came in for a snack and ordered the chicken sandwich, chicken biscuit and a beer. The line was quick and we got our food quick and hot. We even got to keep our foam coaster which was pretty neat i guess. Recommend stopping by if you are in the area. 

-B
author: Brandon G.

description:
There is nothing more I can say about The Bird that hasn't been said already. The food is incredible. First of all, the hot wings are some of the spiciest, most delicious wings I've ever had, and I don't even like wings. Also, I've never even seen wings this large before! They must source their chickens from the UFC champion chicken farm - they're honestly triple the size of wings you would see at BWW. If I were to describe the mouth-watering chili rub that coats their hot wings, I would describe it in the crudest sense as a hybrid of maui onion rings and hot Cheetos, but that only scratches the surface of the depth of flavor. 

For only $8, you get their fried chicken sandwich: a massive, juicy, tender chicken coated in their signature spicy berbere spice blend, mayo and pickles on a freshly baked bun. The bun is hefty and substantial, not dry or flaky. The celery and house-made apple slaw provide a refreshing, acidic contrast to the spicy burger. In addition, make sure to get the curly fries: they're well-seasoned, and an amazing portion for only $2.50. Finally, they have sparkling water on tap - how much better can this place get! 

Since coming back to the east coast for school, I've had Chik-fil-A's spicy chicken sandwich but it just doesn't hold a candle to The Bird. This will be the first place I visit when I am back in SF again. Please please consider expanding to NY / Boston!
author: Claire L.

description:
Super tasty sandwich! The line when I arrived was a bit long but apparently not as crazy as it usually gets and not as long as how it was when we left. The line does move quickly and your order also comes out quick, so it's not a problem.

I ordered the regular friend chicken sandwich mild because I can't tolerate a lot of spice. The chicken was fried super well and wasn't greasy at all. It's also full of flavor. Make sure to get the mine homemade sauce hot sauce, so freaking tasty and not too spicy!
author: Valeria S.

description:
I have been dying to try The Bird for years and it has finally happened! Yes, the hype was worth it all. This is the best fried chicken sandwich in the bay --hands down!

My group of friends came here on a Friday evening. There was a long line, but it went quickly. The place was also packed, so we ended up taking the food to-go back at my friend's apartment nearby. I ordered the classic Spicy Chicken Sandwich ($8), which came in a fat and juicy slab of chicken smothered in fiery spices. Wow, they meat was incredibly tender on the inside, but so crunchy and crisp on the outside. Seriously, they've really perfected the chicken here into this amazing sandwich. Also, highly recommend the sandwich over the naked chicken which my friends weren't too pleased with. I am also a huge fan of spicy food, so this one was at that perfect level of spiciness (but definitely be warned if you're not much of a spicy person).

Best fried chicken sandwich. I'm salivating just thinking about the next time I'll get to eat this again, yum!
author: Cindy Z.

description:
More of a 3.5 

It was flavorful, but just very heavy. Wish there was less breading and more chicken. I know though it's fried chicken so I should know I'm not trying to eat healthy! The curly fries with the toppings were really good, lots of super curly ones in there! 

Overall, might return but wasn't the best I've had.
author: Nakita H.

description: When you want to indulge but have self restraint, you go for the salad + chicken add-on. Loved the spicy chicken, not overbearing and had a dry heat sensation with a crispy coating. My only regret is getting a half portion which only came out to 4-5 smaller chicken pieces. The salad itself was delicious and super fresh with romaine, celery, beets and some shaved apple. The house made vinaigrette had a tad of sweetness but overall a nice blend of acid and fat. I bet the creamy dressings are even better on top of a full serving of spicy chicken.
author: Julia K.

description:
Was on my way to dinner with friends but realized we had a few hours to kill and was starving after walking around SOMA. I just happened to be walking by chipotle and while I was tempted by hunger, I looked across the street to see the Bird and remembered I had been meaning to try this spot for a few months now but had not had the opportunity to partake.  The joint itself is not very large but it is well arranged to maximize the amount of patrons and make use of the kitchen space. They do have happy hours so definitely make sure to check out the menu for that. The folks are quite friendly from the moment you walk in and the menu is very visible the moment you walk in. They offer a variety of sandwiches (Fried and not), fries, wings and various biscuits. 

I happened to walk in they were still doing happy hour and decided to order a fried chicken sandwich and a set of hot wings. These guys are quick with making the food and all of it came out within 3- 5 minutes which I felt was impressive given the number of people in the joint at the time. The Fried chicken sandwich was very tender and I got the spicy version so it had a nice kick to it although I personally put a bit more hot sauce on it. The wings were also delicious and they literally give you a wing not your cruddy frozen wings but legit chicken wings. All of the chicken was juicy, tender, and packed with flavor. I also ordered the curly fries which were standard but obviously the stars of the show is the chicken which I highly recommend.  Definitely recommend hitting up this spot for anyone in the mood for some top notch chicken
author: Dan M.

description:
Parking is awful haha lots of one-way streets snd construction going on so park as close by as possible then prepare to walk! 

$12 combo for including original chicken sandwich, curly fries, and a beverage

$8 for a spicy chicken sandwich - has a good kick of spicy

Chicken sandwich is yum! curly fries are standard, a lot of seating is high chair seating/bar seating. Loud atmosphere so hard to have conversation

I'd torally recommend if ur in area!
author: Yeanne L.

description:
Don't let the long line spook you - The Bird consistently (and quickly) serves up tasty fried chicken sandwiches for eight bucks each. This spot is super popular with the office crowd, and for good reason. I recommend getting the spicy fried chicken sandwich, and some fries if you're feeling particularly hungry. I've heard the apple fritters are good too, but the sandwich alone is enough food for me for lunch.

I've yet to come here for their breakfast sandwiches, but I know they'll be just as good as their lunch offerings.
author: Kedar V.

description:
If you know me, you know how much I love fried chicken and fried chicken sandwiches. So when I saw The Bird pop up on Yelp on an afternoon in SF, I knew I had to try it. 

The line was long around lunch time (1 PM on a weekday), but don't worry, it goes very quickly. Their simple menu makes ordering very easy and it makes receiving your order happen very quickly. I ordered and before I could even sit down, they called my name. There isn't a lot of seating inside the restaurant so if you're coming during lunch, you might have to consider taking it to go. 

I got the fried chicken sandwich (spicy) and it was pretty good. Not the spiciest I've had, but the flavor was good. The fries were good too! We got the regular fries + the fully loaded fries.

I know they just opened up another location in Berkeley so I'm definitely going to check it out!
author: Jessica G.

description:
Busted a 20 minute mission out there for lunch today. There was a huge line but it moves pretty quickly. My order came out almost as soon as I was done ordering.

The spicy fried chicken sandwich here is BOMB. The fried chicken was moist and that spicy glaze had a great kick to it. I LOVE spicy foods and it had me sweating a little.

Well worth the walk there and the walk back, will definitely return!
author: Danh H.

description:
I came into this restaurant and it was neatly arranged. The menu was clearly visible and there were lots of seats available. I decided to get the Fried Chicken Sandwich which was ready about 3 minutes after I ordered.

Fried Chicken Sandwich- You can either choose spicy or non spicy for the chicken. I chose spicy and dealt with the flames arising with every bite I took. It was delicious! The chicken was extremely tender and the outside coating remained crunchy. The coleslaw added nice flavor to it. If I were to get this sandwich again, I would get the non spicy chicken sandwich and add the spicy sauce they provide if I wanted more flare. 

Overall, I would absolutely recommend this place for delicious fried chicken.
author: Felicia C.

description: A decent chicken sandwich in SF. Well priced for SF. I like the spicy much more than the regular. Worth stopping by if you're in this area.
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
Absolutely delicious fried chicken sandwiches here! Stopped by here after work with some friends after I had been eyeing this place for the longest time. 

The sandwiches definitely did not disappoint! Fried chicken was super fresh, hot, and crunchy. I ordered the non- spicy sandwich and added their hot sauce on top. It was absolutely amazing- just the perfect amount of spice. My only gripe about the sandwich is that one wasn't enough. I could have eaten two :P 

We also ordered the fully loaded fries- curly fries with sour cream, green onions, bacon, and cheese.  Really can't go wrong with these- they were a delicious side to the sandwich!
author: Sandy Y.

description:
Great chicken spot in San Francisco! Don't make the same mistake I made by thinking that the "naked bird" was a PLAIN chicken sandwich. When they say naked they mean just a piece of chicken without the bun. Kind of disappointing, but I guess I'm only to blame. They also had a nice selection of local beers. 

Don't forget about the loaded fries! Delicious
author: Alex S.

description:
Hands-down the best chicken sandwich ever! The chicken was juicy and the coding was flavorful. The chicken sandwich came with pickles and coleslaw on the bun. It was the perfect balance of sweet and tangy with the chicken.

Prices were really good and it was very quick. It cost $21 for two of us.
author: Chad B.

description:
Juicy, tender goodness! Such a blessing to work so close to The Bird. Don't be discouraged by the lines as they move fairly quickly. We usually go after 1pm. 

My go-to is the Spicy Chicken Sandwich loaded with their crunchy slaw and pickles. The bun is so fresh and doesn't get soggy. If you don't have work (or even if you do), the Happier Meal comes with the sandwich, curly fries, and a beer! Don't forget their homemade hot sauce!
author: Vanessa Y.

description:
I discovered this place about a year ago when I was visiting the Bay for work. It was close to where I was staying and I was hungry. 

Their menu is very small, which is usually a great sign to me because it means the place can focus on doing a limited amount of things very well. That's exactly what they do here. Fried chicken sandwiches, fries, apple fritters. 

It's easy to miss because there isn't a sign out front that says the bird. It's funny because there's a little sign of a fox eating a burger outside, rather than a bird. It's one of the most charming things about this place to me. 

You order at the counter, seat yourself and wait for them to call you. It's not huge inside so there isn't a ton of seating. I've never had a hard time getting a seat but I've never come with a large group either. 

I've had their spicy and their regular fried chicken sandwiches. The spicy is my go to and it is delicious. The chicken is always cooked perfectly, but it's still moist and juicy. The breading has Chinese five spice, which gives it a complex, warm flavor that I think really works. There are pickles and an amazing red cabbage, celery slaw on it. The slaw doesn't have mayo, so it adds texture and a fresh crispness without being heavy or overpowering. 

They also have perfectly seasoned and crisp curly fries, which you can order plain or fully loaded (ie sour cream, bacon bits, scallions). I've had them both ways and frankly they're better plain because they're so well seasoned they're perfect solo. They also have house made sriracha, which is better than the brand if you ask me. 

If you order a meal, it comes with a sandwich, fries and a beer for around $13, which is an incredible deal for the quality. The beer is served in a Bird cozy, which you get to keep. So fun!

I also tried the apple fritters tonight for the first time. They looked a little dry to me but when I bit into them, they were so moist inside with fresh, still crisp bites of apple, perfect amount of cinnamon. The dough was fried to be crunchy on the outside but soft inside.

I love this place. Will definitely be back whenever I'm in town.
author: Ashtar B.

description:
Really great chicken! I got the happier meal spicy chicken sandwich with fries and a beer. They have homemade sriracha! They give you a koozie with The Bird logo (LOVE FOOD TAKE AWAYS AFTER I PUT IT AWAY) 
The sandwich was very good the chicken had to have been the best chicken in a chicken sandwich ever! It was moderate spicy but also has a sweet kick which I wasn't expecting. Meal was very reasonably priced. Line was long but it went very quick and the food was ready at a good time! I'll be back!
author: Megan M.

description:
Don't let the long line deter you from trying this place! The line was out the door, but I got my food 10-15 mins after. When you get to the cashier, you get your food nearly instantly. 

I only ordered their spicy chicken sandwich, but they also have a great deal that includes beer. Their spicy chicken sandwich wasn't that spicy, but it definitely built up the more you ate it. They also have their own sauce, which I used for my french fries (but I would've preferred ketchup).

Overall, I'd recommend coming here! Great price, experience, and food!
author: Aileen J.

description: Long lines during the lunch rush but it moves pretty quickly! Cashiers are friendly and the guys behind the counter are fast at putting out the orders, so definitely a +1 for efficiency. I tried the spicy Naked Bird (just chicken with slaw on the side) and non-spicy fried chicken sandwich. The sandwich didn't stand out since the non-spicy was just kinda bland but the chicken's juicy. The spicy version is much better: the seasoning is evenly coated and packs a smokey kick! Chicken sandwiches aren't something I crave but given it's prime location, the Bird's a solid option. Just be ready to wait in line for at least 10 minutes during normal lunch hours.
author: Regina X.

description:
I went here right after they opened up around 9-9:30 as yelp showed this as a breakfast place. I wouldn't call this an ideal breakfast place but I am happy that I tried this place out. 

At the early hours there sandwiches weren't ready so I ordered the Naked Bird. The chicken was really tender and filled with spices. I really liked the place and plan to visit this again but sometime later in the day.

They don't have the name of their place outside and it can be missed if you don't know their logo. Lookout for a logo with a cat and it's easy to spot.
author: Harsh M.

description:
Great spot for a fried chicken sandwich. Delicious crispy tender chicken. Regular or spicy.  Both with killer slaw and pickles that balance the sandwich perfectly. I really like the home made siracha sauce. Adds a little salty heat but not too spicy. 

The loaded curly fries are really good too. 

But that's about it. 

Service is killer - 5 stars. 

The challenge is this place is super trendy and the lines at lunch are insane. If you get here before 11:30 or after 1:30 the line is tolerable. Otherwise it's not worth the wait.
author: Dave K.

description: Arrived for lunch on a Monday just before 12 noon and only waited for 5 minutes until we had food in hand. This is how it should be when your menu is as limited as this. However limited it is, they do things right. I got the spicy chicken sandwich and I was impressed! The chicken was the juiciest fried chicken that I have ever had. It burst with flavor and the whole sandwich had a nice balance. This is a great spot for a quick and delicious lunch, if you can time it right, lines can get long.
author: Thomas B.

description:
I love fried chicken place. For some reason, this place reminds me of the place I went to in Louisville but the flavor didn't compare to it. The flavor for my fried chicken sandwich wasn't there. I tasted more flavor from the sauce and veggies inside than the chicken itself. 

Not sure it was that impressive.
author: Rose F.

description:
I was looking for something low on carbs, they had a salad and you can add chicken.
I liked the salad it had a variety of vegetables and the size was good too. 
For $3.50 you can add half of a chicken portion and a full portion for $6 (which is like 6 ounces or maybe 8? of spicy chicken breast). I went for the large one.

We also got the spicy chicken sandwich.

We both loved our food! Recommended!
author: John G.

description: "This is a chick fil a sandwich gone elevated!" - my fiancé. I must agree.  The chicken patty wasn't dry at all. It was moist, packed with flavor, and crunchy on the outside. Then, you have the slaw that balances the spice and salt. Overall, a winner winner chicken dinner!
author: Briana H.

description:
Seriously, some Yelpers know me and witness me as a very nice guy who never complains and never use the middle finger as the "The Bird" as an offensive gesture. "Go ahead and ask them, if you think I am lying!"

I infrequently go to that part of the downtown area. But Fried Chicken sandwiches have become my favorite sandwich. Therefore I must check this place out for dinner. 

As small as this restaurant, this place can get really busy esp. lunch time. You stand in line and place your order. Above the cashier and kitchen is the menu with prices of the sandwiches, sides and specials. And below the cashier is selection of the canned brews, domestic and international. 

From the menu, there is a combo special, which is called "The Happier Meal". For $12.50, the meal has the popular Fried Chicken Sandwich, a handful of Curly Fries and a choice of a 12oz can of beer. The sandwich has a fat and obviously boneless fried chicken, a tangy homemade cole slaw and aioli sauce in a bun. The chicken piece was fried very well with a loud crunch. The sandwich is really good here. 

For my brew, I had a 16oz can of Pabst Blue Ribbon (PBR). The 16oz can is not part of the deal and $.75 was added to my bill. For me, a small 12oz can of beer will not cut it and the 16oz can I ordered was more satisfying. All beers come in a foamed can coolie, which you can take home. 

The restaurant also offer other dishes used with fried chicken and tasty and enticing sweet treats and random specials. 

After my contented meal from here and about to leave, I was going to use "The Bird" directly to the workers on a solid meal. But being a coward as I am, I didn't. I have class and know better.
author: Matt G.

description: Ya so the chicken was definitely flavorful, but there just wasn't enough of it. The slaw was okay, but same issue. The outside space was cute and service was fast. But I probably won't be back unless I have to eat in the area- which is what brought me in the first place.
author: Marissa F.

description:
This might be my shortest review of all time...

Don't be scared of the line during rush hours, it moves quick. Order a spicy chicken sandwich. Eat it incredibly fast. Ponder a second order. Leave fast before you've gone too far. Done. Best chicken sandwich I've ever had. Sweet, spicy, crunchy, tender, juicy, easy to eat... apologies to my coworkers as we were trying to chat with one another while I was talking bites for two. If you're into fried bird, come here. It's delicious.
author: Drew A.

description:
3.5 stars but since there aren't halves, this receives a 3 in my book. 

I heard this was the best chicken sandwich in town, so of course I had to pay a visit so I could verify for myself. Needless to say, I was a bit disappointed.

The price point is a bit steep for a burger and fries you can find at any typical fast food restaurant. It's a pretty simple chicken sandwich deep fried on the outside. I personally went with the spicy flavor and boy was there a kick! The sandwich is very flavorful overall and the chicken isn't dry, giving this a few positive points to tally up. On the other hand, the curly fries tastes almost identical to any standard curly fry.

The most disappointing part of the sandwich, however, was how salty the chicken was. It made the whole experience rather unpleasant. I honestly didn't want to finish my sandwich less than half way through but forced myself to because I don't like to waste food. (I know what you're thinking ... that's so Asian of me )

I may give this another try in the future because I've heard so many good things. But for now, I'm not itching to go back anytime soon.
author: Salena H.

description:
Crispy fried chicken sandwich at a decent price! Luckily there was no line when we arrived near the close of their happy hour around 7. They told us they had ran out of their wings about 30 minutes before we arrived. I didn't feel too bad because the regular price of wings were only a little bit more, but my friend and I decided to just get the chicken sandwich and curly fries and split it! It wasn't big enough to fill us both up but that was okay because we planned to eat later on. Our friend got the spicy chicken sandwich and was talking about how it was a bit too spicy for him but their homemade sriracha sauce was super tasty! 

The fried chicken was juicy but not greasy, and the curly fries were great!
author: Katrine U.

description:
I've heard The Bird gets quite busy but we visited on the weekend so were able to get a table and our food quickly. I've got to admit for not being a fan of fried chicken, I thoroughly enjoyed eating at The Bird!

I ordered The Bird Salad with their vinaigrette with a side of fries. The salad was layered with lettuce on the bottom, beets, celery and apple in the middle then topped with regular fried chicken. Top it with their vinaigrette, so tasty! 

I'm a huge french fry lover and theirs were great. Highly recommend getting an order of their fries and dipping them in their homemade sriracha sauce! If I wasn't traveling I would've taken a bottle of their sriracha sauce home.
author: Callie R.

description:
Wow, a really good chicken sandwich at a decent price! The place is usually full of people eating so maybe take it to go if you have a party bigger than 3 or else you will be standing around. The spicy chicken sandwich is no joke! It definitely hits you right in the mouth. The sandwich is juicy and the fries are perfectly fried.

Nothing to complain about! The meal deal is very well priced and comes with a can of beer. Nothing to complain about.
author: Taylor Z.

description:
My go-to lunch spot from now on when I need to spend under $10 in SF for lunch. I actually had a horrible first experience here, but after taking that bite out of the sandwich, everything bad that happened was forgiven. 

There wasn't an evident sign of "The Bird" when walking on the streets, but once you peek inside at the menu and notice the menu and the décor, you'll know where you are. There was a line almost toward the end of the block when I went here the first time, but it does move quickly. Once I was at the front (about 10 minute wait), I made my order. I stepped aside after I paid, waiting for them to call my name with my food. As I was waiting, another customer was getting ketchup, and just my luck, she drops the ketchup and it splattered, some landing on various spots of my clothing - pants, shirt, outer layer, etc. I wiped as much as I was able to, and then another customer told me that there was some on my back too. WOW!!! I was so lucky not to have any meetings after lunch, but it was quite annoying. Anyways, my name was called shortly afterwards (spent more time waiting in line than waiting for my food) and walked back to work to enjoy the sandwich. YUM!!! Amazing! 

The chicken was still crunchy, and the rub/flavorings were very on point. I normally do not like slaw, but the slaw they used went so well with the whole sandwich. The piece of chicken was decently sized - none of that bun is bigger than the piece of meat BS. I think the sandwich would have tasted better and held more of the crunch if I ate it right after receiving it, but I was not disappointed by the flavor. Semi-spicy, great crunch/texture, full of awesomeness. 

I went back here a couple more times, and had a much better experience - no ketchup or other condiments landed on me, and even tried their curly fries. Those were great too. Super impressed by the décor, the food, and how quickly the line moves.
author: Rita W.

description:
Been here twice while in SF. The sandwich isn't worth $8. The Apple slaw and burger consistency varied in these two visits. Some burgers had less some more. Some chicken thighs are juicy and plump, some are short and stubby so lesser portions. The 2nd visit: one of the bottom buns was legit torn. They are lucky I didnt give a shit that day. 

If this sandwich was priced at $4 I may be more willing to give it 4 stars. What keeps it from being 5 stars if you fix all the issues with the consistency of The Bird is if they provided their meal without beers and instead allowed soda to be subbed in at a lower price.

All in all, it's OK. It's a good, yet inconsistently done overpriced chicken sandwich.

Word of advice: everyone gets it spicy. I gather it's because of the unique taste...
author: Michael L.

description:
One of my favorite things about working in FiDi is you can almost walk to almost anywhere you want for lunch.  Having been in the area years before, I was stoked to find a new spot to try.  Fried chicken??? Say no more, I'm there!  

Let me say this, I've been here twice in the past week alone both due to convenience as it's only a 5 minute walk from the office, but also because their fried chicken sandwich is that darn good.  Yep, if you get here anytime after 12:00 PM, the line most likely will be out the door, but it does move fairly quickly.  

The menu is fairly simple as the most popular item is the fried chicken sandwich (the combo comes with beer and curly fries).  They have either the classic or spicy option (if you want a subtle kick).  They definitely give you your money's worth here as they stuff a huge piece of scrumptious, delicious chicken with some slaw.  It has just the right amount of seasoning and your last bite is as tender as the first.  

Tables can be hard to come by during lunch rush hour but wait a few minutes and one is bound to open up.  Great spot to either dine in (it can get noisy) or get it to go, but one thing is for sure....this spot is LEGIT!
author: Kevin C.

description:
The Bird is da bomb! With all of the uber healthy food options near the office in San Francisco, it feels good to (occasionally) be bad and enjoy some
fried chicken. This is a tiny, popular comfort food joint in the Financial District--expect a line during the lunch hour (it's worth it).

We waited in line for about 10-15 minutes and ordered at the counter. The menu is pretty simple, mostly fried chicken sammies, a salad, and fries. I ordered a salad with a half order of hot chicken on it--while the salad was tasty and refreshing, I honestly could've just eaten the hot chicken sans veggies. The chicken is super flavorful and pretty spicy! It was a work day and we weren't drinking until later, but I could see this fried chicken pairing *very* nicely with a can of cold beer (of which they have many). 

Snag a table inside if you can or take your meal to go. I'd love to come back but would try to aim for a non-prime time hour--I'll get a beer next time too!
author: Megan R.

description: Tiny little place, so we were lucky to find a indoor seat. Line was long but moved very quickly, they are super organized! We split The fried chicken sandwich and a salad. The sandwich was excellent, perfectly cooked chicken and a tangy cold slaw! We should have had 2! The salad was also quite tasty as well, not sure what they do to the beets, but they sure were good.
author: Joyce U.

description: Oh.My.God. I've never had such a good tasting fried chicken sandwich in my life. I've heard a lot of hype about The Bird but haven't had the chance to try it until today. Even thought Salesforce's annual Dreamforce conference was in town, at 12pm, there wasn't a huge line: I was able to place my order and get my food in less than 10 minutes. For a sandwich this good tasting, I'm surprised I'm not being charged $15, the price many sit down restaurants charge for an entree like this. I got the fried chicken sandwich (note: not the biscuit, nor the naked chicken), the first listed, and most popular item on the menu. The chicken is super juicy, and the buns cannot be beat. So fresh and bouncy! The sauce that's coated around the fried chicken cutlet is sweet, tangy and just the right amount of heat. It'll make you sweat, but it's not unbearable. 10/10 would recommend.
author: Austin W.

description:
It was extremely nice out the other day so I decided to take a stroll around and hit up The Bird. Had been wanting to go to this spot for a while and the $12 Happier Meal Deal seemed like just what I needed. 

The spot is kind of hidden in plain sight so make sure you are paying attention for the name and logo. The menu and setup and pretty minimal but there are a different few options if people want to mix things up.

I did the Happier Meal with a Spicy Chicken Sandwich and I was able to get a soda instead of a beer (I'm a wimp when it comes to drinking beer with spicy food). The sandwich and bread were great and it was actually pretty spicy, someone def saw me dabbing my face/beard with napkins and fanning myself down. 

The fries were curly fries and pretty decent, I was pumped about the House Sriracha but it didn't taste too much different than normal.
author: Isaiah W.

description:
America, have you heard? I got a brand new dance and it's called... The Bird! 

Cluck Yeah! Am I the only dude that remembers Morris Day and The Time, best known for The Bird? I mean someone cool must know Apollonia Kotero, right? I do! Oh geez. You dudes need to start living life, but hey, it's all about the love for chicken...

Yup, The Bird. The urban cafe just across of Yelp Corp. on New Montgomery... how about that for high expectations, yet somehow this straight forward chicken sandwich shop not only has met Jeremy S. expectations, but observing the long lunch lines they have excelled in this spot. It's like the Cluck Yeah version of the infamous Soup Nazi! 

It's Fryday morning I'm in the area and realize The Bird is already open open open... I swing on by and see zero line, so I calmly walk in and I'm greeted by Raven! What's up with all the bird talk at The Bird?! Get it? The cute, pixie greeter is Raven. Oh nvm. So after small talk about the menu - Raven is a smooth chirper, btw, such a good bird vibe - I order the Chicken Biscuit in mild (comes with a handful of tater tots). I also notice the "Happier Meal" which includes beer, but at 8am in the morning might be a push for even this bird, yet always a next time;) I sit my arse near the window, amongst the other fluffed up morning peacocks! More about The Bird...

*The Bird only uses free-range Chicken

*The Bird uses berbere spice blend to give the chicken that little special Oomph

*The Bird uses fresh buns & biscuits that's baked each morning by a local baker

*The Bird uses a special crunchy apple slaw - made fresh in house daily

All in all, I recommend The Bird. Solid! To me, the highlight was how much bang is in the biscuit! The other star was Raven... I'm not one to judge, well unless it's all positive, and I got to say Raven is definitely one of the best greeters I've come across in awhile. Such a charming young lady! Definitely potential for POTUS in 2020! I'd vote for her and her Flock of Seagulls any day! Raven's a STAR! 

Squawk! Hallelujah! Whoa
Ya'll sing it with me, just like this
Squawk! Hallelujah! Whoa... it's called The Bird!
author: Eric R.

description: Nice fast casual with a good fried chicken sandwich. It's good, not the best I've had, but a great option to stop for lunch.
author: David L.

description: Got the regular chicken sandwich- so good!! I saw the long line and was hesitant at first to wait but the line went by so fast! And I got my food just as quickly. Don't be discouraged by the long line! The food was a perfect portion size, even with the fries.
author: Rose C.

description:
Okay, heres the deal,

Is the chicken good? Cluck yes.

Are the biscuit chicken sandwhiches delicious? You know it!

Everything is crispy in all the right places, oh so flavorful (you gotta do spicy with their house made sriracha, trust me).

But Aaron, your asking me at this point, why only 4 stars?

Usually I am all about the food, but the location for this place is -1.  Super limited seating makes getting a seat during the lunch rush impossible. Also due to the high demand the line can stretch to the end of the block. While the line moves "quick" I don't feel like the experience is worth the wait. If you are down to chill and wait then totally go for it. But in general, I would pass during peak hours. I mean unless you NEEEEED some fried chicken, then this is THE spot in SOMA
author: Aaron K.

description:
Came here and got the fried chicken sandwich (both spicy and non-spicy), the loaded curly fries, and the fried chicken wings.

The fried chicken sandwhich was so tender and juicy. If you are looking for a sandwich with a lot of fried batter, this won't hit the spot. It focuses more on the inside of the chicken vs the outside. For those that think that spicy and non-spicy are pretty similar, that is so not true. If you've had the nashville hot chicken, that's what the spicy chicken here is like. It's a very salty spicy rub on the chicken. I personally love it and it just has soooo much flavor. The non-spicy was also good too, just not nearly as unique.

The loaded fries were nice, nothing too special, but I definitely enjoyed it.

The fried chicken wings were good and they are fried quite differently. It doesn't have much batter, and it reminds me of more of a glazed fried chicken. It was tasty, idk if worth it though.

Stick with the spicy chicken sandwich :D
author: Victor D.

description:
They have the best chicken sandwich in town, hands down.  The chicken is great for a couple reasons: 1. they use fancy chicken of some kind and it tastes better than Foster Farms. 2. they use chicken thighs instead of breast and it's way jucier, trimmed of fat, lightly breaded, and served with or without a spicy batter.  The sandwich also comes with a crisp cole slaw and pickles (I think).

I've also had the fully loaded fries (best in recent memory), curly with cheese sauce, bacon bits, and sour cream + chives and I can't go there an not get them now.

Additionally, I've tried the chicken wings and they impressed me they serve it with the claw still attached!  They are fantastic and they're the really big ones so you don't have to order that many, maybe like 3 and you'll be good, especially if you get some fries.
They have some good and reasonably priced beers that they even serve with a beer cozy, woot! :D

The sandwich is inexpensive (to me, at least), at $8 and the fries something like $4 but they have a "Happy Meal" which gives you both those items and a beer for $12.  

Service is incredibly quick and they're friendly and on top of it.  You just order at the counter and find a seat until they call your name.  This is a great place to get quick bite to eat on your lunch or get something to go, even.

 Finally, some smaller touches that really made the experience for me were the housemade ranch, blue cheese, and even an awesome siracha sauce.  All of it made fresh and nothing packaged.
Check it out.
author: Henry A.

description:
Wow! The serving time is incredibly FAST. As my group of friends started to order... The line began to get longer and longer. We realized that we should order together. So, we kind of inconvenienced them and added our orders last minute onto our friends in line to avoid waiting. After ordering, we sat for about a minute. Next thing we know, we're being called up to grab our orders. I was amazed.

We got the regular chicken sandwich and wings. I loved the regular bird sandwich. I tried my friends spicy chicken sandwich and it was a little TOO spicy for me. 

One thing to note, was that it can be difficult to get seats (or in a group, together). We were lucky to be able to. People immediately swoop once they see your table is free.
author: Lyra C.

description:
This place serves mind blowing fried chicken and one of my favorite fast food spots in San Francisco.
This place is small and usually gets crowded really fast.
Rush hour queue is long but it moves relatively quickly. Wait time is approx 10-15 mins.
We ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and the naked chicken.
author: Shraddha N.

description:
Quick Summary:
- The Fastest "From Order-to-Receive" Time ever experienced (compared to ordering specialized coffee or at typical fast food restaurants)
- Line starts at 12pm (lunchtime) and I witnessed going past two or three stores 
- Recommended to go at 12:30pm (but no seats in the restaurant)
- Curly fries are awesome
- (I have a low spicy tolerance) Spicy fried chicken sandwich is a good spicy, but the first two bites, I drank a gulp of water

I happened to stumble upon the restaurant on my way to an arts and craft store. I noticed a line that grew larger when I was walking back to work. I wasn't able to read the sign (it's only a picture of a cool looking fox eating a sandwich), but later discovered it by memorizing the street names and looking it up on Google Maps.

The following day, I decided to go because a close work colleague is a huge fan of The Bird. I went at a later time because I hypothesized it's better to go when it's nearing the end of lunchtime. I wasn't planning on eating in the restaurant, so that wasn't a worry either. (The restaurant looks small on the outside, but when you enter it opens up to several tables). 

The ambiance is clean, sleek, and modern. I liked the large mural of the fox. 

The line went by quickly and I saw the reason why: the food came as fast as lightning. A starving person will leave happy because of almost no wait time. 

Asked on the spot, "regular or spicy". I didn't know they had spicy, so I whimsically ordered "spicy." I've asked how spicy "spicy" is, and the cashier replied, "A few people said it was medium spicy." It was spicy. I have low spice tolerance, but it was a good burning spice. The only disappointment to this was that the spicy sauce moistened the fried chicken, so only a few parts were crispy. 
I also loved how it had apples and celery to give the sandwich a nice fresh crunch. 
Yes, I'm having a next visit, and I'm going to order regular to see how crispy it is. 

The curly fries were a bomb, and when I was eating this at work, it became a center of attention. Of course, I referred the curious ones to The Bird, so I hope they visit too.
author: Mito I.

description:
Not much of a line when we arrived on a Saturday afternoon. Although the place was busy the whole time. Menu is small and straightforward. 

Got the spicy fried chicken sandwich ($8) and curly fries ($2.50). Sandwich was decent, chicken was juicy, batter was flavorful but not freshly fried. Overall, it was a good chicken sandwich but not extraordinary. Probably slightly better than chick fil a, but more expensive. The curly fries though, were terrible. Skimpy portion and tasted exactly like Arby's fries and not freshly fried as well. 

We noticed they fry large batches at a time so by the time you get your order it's not super fresh and crispy. 

Happier meal seems worth it, for $2 extra you get a beer, probably the cheaper ones though. They have a decent selection of $2.50, $4, and $5 canned beers. 

Service was fine. It's an order and seat yourself type of place. Decent amount of indoor and outdoor seating as well. Worth a try but don't get too excited
author: Tim H.

description: Got my 'adult-sized' happy meal at The Bird. It came with a spicy chicken sandwich, curly fries, a cold beer, and a koozie. The chicken was crispy and flavorful, but definitely on the oily side. The curly fries were great. You really can't go wrong with curly fries. Make sure to try the house chili sauce. It gives the food an added kick of flavor. It cost ~$14 for the meal (it's originally $12.50, but there is an extra charge depending on the beer you order). I went on a Tuesday around 5pm. There was a line, but it was not a long wait. The cashier was friendly and the service was fast. I definitely want to go back and try their breakfast sandwich.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Sometimes I leave short comments on pages to jog my memory for when I get around to writing the reviews. On this particular spot, I had only written two words: "really delicious."

And really delicious it is. I'm not generally a fan of sandwich shops, but I've been back at least 3 times since discovering this place. That my friends, is #dedication.

The chicken is moist and strippy, perfectly seasoned with an unidentifiable mix of spices. The first time I went, they had dark meat, which really upped the deliciousness. White meat only the second two times, which made it slightly less delicious. The chicken is breaded, but it doesn't interfere with the deliciousness. The pickled veggies are not too pickled and slightly sweet, which go perfectly with the meat. 5/5 for that first sandwich I had, which made me lust for more ever since. 4/5 on the other ones.

Fries were fairly standard. I also got the curly fries topped with bacon / cream cheese / green onions / cheese. Hard to go wrong with that combo, but standard, 3.5/5.
author: Nicole H.

description:
Basically the fastest fast food service I have ever had. By the time I was done paying and signing my receipt, they had my order ready. It was actually pretty unbelievable. 

Ordered the spicy fried chicken sandwich and it was incredibly tasteful. It wasn't too spicy to the point where it covered up the taste of the chicken itself. I should've also gotten the fries but thats for another time.

I really like the idea of how they sell their items separately compared to other similar fast food locations where you need to buy a combo or so. Even with these San Francisco prices, this location is actually very cheap and affordable.
author: Timothy D.

description:
Food: 3/5 We got two fried chicken sandwiches, one spicy and one non-spicy. It wasn't the best fried chicken sandwich i've ever had but wasn't bad either. The fried chicken was a lil dry.  I also think we received a spicy one instead of the non spicy one so a total of two spicy ones. On the bright side, the food is pretty aesthetic. 
-2.5/5 Fully loaded fries: it was hella salty to the point where we drank cups & cups of water. dk if it was just wrong timing

Service: Service was great. we came here around when the place opened on a weekday and there was no line. the food came out about 10 minutes later. 

Price: Decently Priced. I like how they give you free water as well. & it's aesthetic !!!

Would I come here again? Probably not b/c I don't go by often
author: Celina D.

description:
Love this place. Best hot chicken sandwich in the city. We might not be in Nashville, but they sure know how to cook hot chicken. 

Great specials. There aren't many places in the city that you can go to and get a sandwich, fries, a tall boy, and a kookie for $12
author: Mateo G.

description:
The bird is the word!  Delicious spicy fried chicken sandwiches with friendly service!  When I first started eating my sandwich, I didn't think it was that spicy at all.  Later on, I started to feel the spice.  It wasn't terribly spicy, but it definitely was 'need to grab my water' spicy.  By the end, I didn't want to end up in a sluggish food coma, so I decided to get it wrapped up to finish later (it was just as yummy).  The housemade apple slaw and crispy chicken were good!  The chicken was juicy.  You can also get the sauce on the side.

Service was friendly and quick.  The cashier complimented my shirt and we had a quick conversation while I was paying.  Shortly after I filled up some water and snapped a few photos of the place, my order was ready.  They're fast, which is great for those working in this area.  The line goes by pretty quickly!

Would come back again to try the loaded fries or the "happier meal" (sandwich + fries + beer for $12.50)!
author: Stephanie Z.

description:
Their chicken biscuit with the honey butter and homemade sriracha are amazing and my main reason for coming here.  You can get the chicken biscuits all day, not just at breakfast. 

I also love the curly fries, but those are more generic in nature.

I'm giving them only three stars because I'm not a fan of the chicken sandwiches, and especially dislike the hot variety.  The sauce they drag it through is too heavy and not actually that spicy.  I think it's meant to be more lightly brushed-on, rather than dredged.

Anyway, I'll keep coming for the chicken biscuits!
author: Tay H.

description:
The juiciest fried chicken sandwich I have EVER had. I stumbled upon The Bird on yelp and decided to give it a try tonight. It meet all my expectations based off the pictures on Instagram lol. It's really upbeat atmosphere, food is awesome and, to top it off they sale beer by the can! Definitely chill vibes if your in the area looking for a good comfort sandwich. 

Chicken sandwich 10/10 - I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich + the chicken was SoOooooOo moist. Huge plus when it comes to fried chicken. It was the perfect amount of spicy. And the slaw and pickle just topped it off. All the flavors were delicious!!

Wings 8/10- good.. a little too much seasoning for me but I'm currently pregnant so I've been way pickier than usual with certain things. But overall liked them. Comes with celery and choice of ranch or blue cheese.

I also saw they made their own house siracha which I forgot to try but definitely will next time ! Along with the "loaded fries"
author: Courtney B.

description:
I think I found my new favorite fried chicken place! I just wish that they would open a shop closer to the outer city (psssttttt.....open one up in sunset!) so I could go more often. 

I went in for a quick bite to eat after a meeting in downtown and whoa, was I blown away. I first noticed their happier meal which is fries and a beer with a sandwich for only $14! That's so worth it, especially in downtown!!

I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich cause that zing always makes things better. The outer exterior was so crunchy and it wasn't from over-frying or anything, it was JUST crunchy!! The inside of the chicken was so juicy and moist and it didn't taste like fat or oil which was definitely a PLUS! The slaw and pickles added another type of crunch and freshness that made this sandwich taste all the more healthy and not like a fast food sandwich.

I will definitely be back again and again, PLEASE open one up towards outer city! Much appreciated!
author: Jonathan W.

description:
Was super disappointed considering San Francisco people are finicky and the bird has a full 4 star rating. Wait was not bad, only 15 minutes and the order came out in a flash. However, after taking my first few bites I'm realizing they are a tad rough with a few gristly things in the chicken. On to a new bite and I tear off big piece of the skin, like the meat is stringy. I move around to a nice big bulge on the other side thinking it's going to be amazing and it wasn't. That was my last bite. I've decided thigh meat doesn't make a very good sandwich or maybe they're not prepping the meat very well. 

The fries are nothing special, just greasy copycat of Arby's curly fries. The house made sriracha is is not very homemade just tastes like the Chinese bottled stuff. 

If anyone is in Los Angeles, try Howlin Rays, their spicy chicken sandwich is phenomenal.
author: Nicole J.

description:
Found this place thanks to Yelp! (not the signage)
In fact, if it weren't for Yelp, I wouldn't know what this place was. There is no visible sign that says the name of the place. See the photos!

Anyway, do not come here expecting any selection. 
Come in. Order a chicken sandwich, 
fries if you're hungry, 
a drink if you're thirsty. 
Your choice on the chicken sandwich is regular or spicy. The spicy is too spicy, but I keep ordering it anyway. It's so delicious. It would be smarter for me to get a regular and then top it with some of their home-made sriracha sauce.
Actually, I exaggerate. They do offer more choices, but why? The chicken sandwiches are wonderful! Go ahead and order the spicy if you like breaking into a sweat while you eat. And try that home-made sriracha sauce, if you dare.
------
Since my initial review, I went back with friends to try the wings.
Absolutely fantastic!
They are a little on the spicy side, but not too much. They're not as hot as those places that just pour Tabasco sauce on the Costco drummettes, and not as drippy either. They are juicy, just not dripping with hot sauce. The spices they use forms a kind of crust on the skin.
There is a nice picture of the wings already. You can see that you get a full wing, not just one segment. They are $2.50 ea, 3 for $7, or $2 ea. during happy hour (4-7, M-F).
All their beers are in cans. One guy in our crew prefers bottles and wished that they had a better selection on their "top shelf". The rest of us could find a suitable beverage from the choices available.
Still 5 stars!
author: Marvin M.

description:
Well-known for their fried chicken sandwich, which you should totally get! It is a solid chicken sandwich, freshly made. Wild card that I recommend are the wings. They are big and very juicy. They have a unique flavor, they look spicy but are pretty mild, medium (imo: 6.5/10). The red coloring comes from a heavy paprika spice. 

Perfectly fried, no dredge and good quality chicken.
author: Elsa C.

description:
This little place does pretty much one thing, but it does it well. Their chicken sandwich is as good as it gets, it has now become a sort of a chicken sandwich benchmark for me. The spicy chicken is spicy though, they are not playing around. The free koozie is a great idea too, instead of complaining why they don't serve beer on tap, you'll just say "hey, I got this cool koozie for free that's great" - boom. 
Reading some reviews here, including my own, I realize now that expectations may get a little bit too high. Remember it's a chicken sandwich, nothing more. There's a certain ceiling for that kind of food, and you're probably looking at it here, but it's still a ceiling. Anyway - good job Bird folks!
author: Gil S.

description: I have to say I was super excited to try this place but much like the Chicken they serve, my tastebuds didn't take off to soaring flavorful heights...womp womp. I ordered and was thrilled upon receiving my basket, it looked sooo yummy I couldn't wait to sink my teeth into the sandwich! Unfortunately, I was underwhelmed. The outside was so crispy it was hard to bite into and the inside was so beyond undercooked that I refused to eat it and just ended up tossing it out. Wish I could say I had a better experience considering the amazing yelp rating this place has.
author: Rita H.

description: In town for work and decided to try this place. Got the happier meal with the spicy chicken curly fries and a beer. Oh man, worth the wait. Definitely will come here for the food again.
author: Marcus C.

description:
I had a craving for spicy fried chicken sandwiches and was pretty excited I found the bird on yelp. 

At first glance, I thought it would be very similar to Howlin' Rays in LA. Prior to ordering, I had to remind myself to not compare it to Howlin' Rays to give it a fair chance.

I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich with a side of curly fries. The chicken was nice and crispy but was not spicy at all. I had ate it with their housemade sriracha which had a nice kick to it unlike actual Huy Fong Sriracha. This place is NOTHING close to howlin' rays. It has a completely different taste but is good! I love the housemade apple slaw the chicken is topped with. 

Seating is limited, so don't be afraid to share a table with strangers.
author: Lena V.

description:
A great chicken sandwich for a great price in the city! It is a free-range chicken coated in a berbere spice blend, which you can order as classic or spicy, with celery, a house-made (purple) apple slaw - I love a purple slaw, mayo and pickles on a freshly baked bun. The line gets INSANE though so plan to go much earlier than your desired eating time. I went at 12:30 and waited in line for 30 minutes. 
I ordered the classic fried chicken sandwich for $8 and I plan to go back soon for the spicy version.

What's really important here: they have curly fries for $2.50. Order them.

There are tables inside and outside, but because it's so busy - good luck finding a place to sit down. It's fast casual though, so people don't end up sitting for too long. They also sell beer so I think it's a great place to stop on your way to AT&T Park.

The restaurant is between Mission and Minna Streets downtown, and the sign has a fox eating one of their chicken sandwiches. It would be difficult to miss the line - you'll find it! A must try when you are in SF.
author: Bri T.

description:
I love the Bird! Came here with a coworker for lunch and we were blown away by how amazing the spicy fried chicken sandwich and curly fries were. The sandwich was truly perfection and honestly got me through the otherwise lackluster day I had. My only regret was not getting the happier meal, so I'll definitely be back for that!

Lines look long at lunch but it moves very quickly. Don't be intimidated by that because the brief wait is totally worth it!
author: Helen F.

description:
Holy chicken sandwich, batman! This tiny little spot in the financial district packs a big punch! I stopped in for a late lunch after the recommendations from a few friends that had recently visited the area. I'm so glad I listened, this place is awesome!
For starters, it's tucked away in a little nondescript storefront, so definitely pay attention while walking down the street.  The menu is simple- chicken sandwiches of varying spice levels, fries, and beer. I went with the spicy chicken sandwich and the loaded fries.  This sandwich made me forget about all other chicken sandwiches.  Here's why: 
1. The chicken. A perfectly cooked piece of white meat that took over the whole bun. I got the spicy, but don't be deterred if you're not a spice person.  This is more flavor than heat.
2. The slaw. Disclaimer: "coleslaw" is by far my least favorite word.  It just sounds so weird.  But this housemade slaw made me forget all about my aversion to the word.  This is not the soggy mess you'd find at your family cookout.  This is crisp, flavorful slaw that compliments the flavor of the chicken.
3. The pickles. Also made in house, also not your average wobbly afterthought thrown on your bun.  These are crisp, and slightly sweet.
All in all, I'm positive the sandwich was created to make my day.  Mission accomplished!
author: Shawniece H.

description:
Best chicken sandwich ever. Get the happier bird it's so good. You get a free cozy with your beer.
Pretty kick ass place.
author: Jayme M.

description:
Their sandwiches are insanely delicious. On top of that, their prices are super fair. The spicy sandwich doesn't feel consistent. It varies between extremely spicy to not that spicy. I usually just get the unspicy sandwich. 

I've been meaning to try the ice cream taco, but they're always sold out :(
author: Eric L.

description: Definitely a go to spot while I'm working by the office.   Although it's good, I wouldn't wait here during a weekday lunch as I've seen the line get insane long, and seating is quite hard even when it's quiet.  Otherwise, the food is good and I come back every once in a while.
author: Jeffrey H.

description: My friend and I were craving Chick-fil-A, but considering there's none in the city, we came here to The Bird and I loved it! I got the regular chicken sandwich (which was okay), but I tried my friend's spicy one and it was bomb! It tasted so much better because of the sauce! Their sandwiches are definitely not what you would call healthy, but definitely come here on your cheat day.
author: Angelina H.

description: Really hip and hype fried chicken place in Financial District/SoMa area - the aesthetics of the place and even the menu are very yuppie/SFish. In terms of food, the menu is pretty minimalistic and simple. I opted for the classic Fried Chicken Sandwich and enjoyed it. The chicken was moist and juicy and flavorful - the flavor is quite unique, different from flavoring of any fried chicken I've ever had. The vegetables complemented the chicken well, and the bun was nice and warm. I thought it was a bit too salty, however, and my friend who got the spicy chicken sandwich thought that hers was wayyy too salty. Curly fries are flavorful and a perfect level of crispy/mealiness. Overall, a great place to get a value meal for about $10, a rare price in SF!
author: Erica T.

description: We absolutely LOVED this place! The food was so good! I got the regular chicken and my husband got the spicy both were delicious! Also got the loaded fries totally worth it! We will be hitting this spot up when we are back in Sam Francisco!
author: Lizzy F.

description:
Long story short: Yes, it does live up to the hype. 

Finally got a chance to check out this place with some coworkers. Here's the breakdown:

-Came on a Wednesday at around 1pm. Decent sized line, but moved relatively quickly--especially after you order. Everyone got their food at the cashier or within the time it took them to get soda/water. A+ on efficiency. 

-Got the spicy chicken sandwich w/ curly fries. The chicken was moist, juicy, and seasoned nicely. I'd totally eat two in one sitting if I could. Curly fries are average. Nothing to praise or complain about. Can't usually go wrong with curly fries. 

-Housemade sriracha: So I'm not sure what the sauce actually consists of, but to me, it seems to be a mixture of chili sauce (sambal) and something else. Doesn't seem like there is any trace of actual sriracha in it (and I down that stuff like water, so I'm familiar with the taste), but perhaps it's in there with something else that's dulling the flavors. It's not as spicy or concentrated as plain sambal, so mild spice lovers can probably also enjoy! 
They offer this in prepackaged dipping containers on the side where you pick up your food. Used it for the curly fries (they don't have mustard), coworker used it in his regular chicken sandwich. Honestly I could pass on this, but nice concept. 

Overall, I'd definitely come back. They manage the line well (although 95% of people order the same thing and they're just constantly making those staples in an assembly line) and the food is great. Price is also good compared to other FiDi eats. Got the sandwich and fries for $11 and change after tax (sandwich: $8, fries $2.5).
author: Jessica J.

description:
I found this place by accident, little did I know that a gem was found! Their fried chicken is so yummy that you can't have it just once, you have to come back for it and it's worth the money!! What I also love about this place is they are open until dinner time, unlike others in the area that close post lunch.
P.s.: If you are considering Friday lunch here, plan before 11 am or after 1 pm as you may end up standing in a line for at least half an hour if not more.
author: Nikita A.

description: This place makes a delicious chicken sandwich. Chick-fil-A pales in comparison.  I had the Spicy sandwich with the slaw on it and it was a great combination, not over-the-top and not too messy.  This place is definitely worth a stop.
author: Brent W.

description:
A wildly popular spot for a solid, dependable fried chicken sandwich, which you can also get in salad and "naked" form. Besides the fried chicken, you can also get fries and wings. My favorite is the "happier meal" special which comes the sandwich, some curly fries, and a beer. At $12.50, not bad by Bay Area standards.

The lines get pretty long at lunchtime and even at dinner, but they move along reasonably well. There is limited indoor and outdoor seating so you'll likely have to grab your grub to go if it's busy. 

While nothing quite compares to the fried chicken sandwiches I've had at Gregoire and Hawking Bird in the East Bay, the ones they serve here are very good given the prices you're paying. Worth the hype.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Have you worked up an appetite while walking the streets of San Francisco and navigating around the world's most aggressive homeless population? Take a break from the circus and go to The Bird!

Pros:

-legitimately dank fried chicken sandwiches and wings. 
-delicious and great bang for your buck. These are not California portions. You'll be full. 
-a true oasis in a desert of vegan garbage

Cons:

-they'll charge you extra for more sauces, but in a state that's seconds away from implementing an air-tax, that shouldn't be a surprise. It's California, dude. What'd you expect?

-The Foodsman
author: Ross B.

description:
Amongst the hustle and bustle on and surrounding Montgomery St lies this perfect lunch spot ideal for anybody looking for a quick, cheap bite to eat.  Especially chicken! It's all fried chicken served, nothing grilled. 

Besides their delicious fried chicken and fried chicken sandwiches (which I have to admit are made so wonderfully.  The pickles, onions, lettuce, mayo and whatever else was in it seriously gave every bite a crunchy texture and such savory taste ... Not to mention the delicious buttery buns they use... Mmmmmmmm)

They also serve:
Fries (which you can "load" them with other toppings)
They serve a desert; apple fritters, which looked pretty yummy as well.

I was honestly confused and lost trying to find this place. It's tucked away in a little hole in the wall with no signs indicating that it was The Bird! Lol oddly the only logo or sign they have is a Fox? I randomly decided to go in and ask an employee where The Bird was located and she politely told me I was there. I wish they made it easier for people who are not locals to find.... At least put a sign up :)

The food comes out SUPER fast, the employees are all very friendly.

Note: that a line did form during the lunch rush so expect a wait sometimes... At least the food comes out fast (: 

Note: there isn't any parking nearby, so expect to make a walk.  

I like that this place isn't too far from Union Square, so its cool to visit while making a stop to eat here.


Pretty yummy place to eat!!
author: Tori G.

description:
If I had to rank a restaurant out of 0 to 10 for execution, the Bird would flap home with a solid 9. The Bird's industrial but homey interior demonstrates excellence but authenticity at the same time, and that's how I would sum up this entire place. It's signature dish is a spicy saucy fried chicken sandwich, topped by a patch of fresh slaw. It's clear they went for quality over quantity -- do not mistake it's sparse menu for lack of
culinary expertise. The spicy fried chicken hits top marks in every category: crispy, juicy, and flavorful. The craggy crust of the fried chicken is the perfect terrain for that tangy spicy sauce to deliciously adhere to. No doubt, with flavor this banging, expect the line to be swanging (around the block). Avoid rush hour times for best experience, especially if you want a seat.

Pro tip: sneak the honey from the tea bar into a ketchup  cup and drizzle that goodness over your sandwich for some real Southern lovin'. They probably don't want people doing that but hey sometimes you gotta risk it for the biscuit.
author: Alton Z.

description:
I've been wanting to try The Bird for awhile now because I work closeby and have seen so many raving reviews. I left the office early to beat the lunch rush and got there around 11:40am - there was still a long line. Like people have said the line doesn't take too long. It took me about 10 minutes to get to the register. 

I thought the sandwich wouldn't be enough to fill me up so I ordered a side of curly fries too (which later, I regretted.. the sandwich is definitely enough!) I opted for the spicy fried chicken instead of the normal, which I also regretted later on (though it was delicious!) 

I got the food to-go to eat at my office. There was some seating there, but definitely not enough for all of the people in line - a lot of people also took their food to go. 

First bite into the sandwich was not what I was expecting at all. I thought it would be more of a spicy, salty, tangy taste - but I was completely off! The sauce was sweet and tasted like it had a bunch of spices mixed in. The chicken, which was crispy even with the sauce, was juicy and not a single bite was dry. I also did not expect it to be so spicy. My lips were burning and my nose was running by the halfway point. Though I loved the flavors, I think I would go for the regular fried chicken sandwich next time... By the end of the sandwich I just wanted it to be over because it was so spicy, heavy, and I was extremely full. Even with that said, it was probably the best chicken sandwich I've ever had.
author: Hannah K.

description:
One of my favorite places for a good fried chicken sandwich that isn't fast food.

I'm a huge fan of the happy meal, which is a fried chicken sandwich, curly fries, and a beer. SF being what it is, the beer selection is quite impressive (although for the happy meal you can only choose from one in a can).

They also have house made "choco tacos" on the menu for dessert! 

Be warned: the stuff in the red squeeze bottles isn't ketchup, it is house made sriracha. It's delicious, don't get me wrong - but my dumb ass squeezed it all over my fries.
author: Aivy C.

description:
Yesterday on 2/17/2018, I visited to this well populated local fast food restaurant located at New Montgomery Street and it's called, "The Bird." The Bird serves the customers of all ages to taste their authentic and well seasoned fried chicken sandwiches every year! The atmosphere is very laid back and active as I welcomed there. The concept is much like visiting to a local fast food restaurant across the U.S. although it's much simple and easy-going as I entered a single line for ordering food. The interior looked very indie and casual filled with country-style and industrial designs across the whole room.

The employees here are doing a great job for making the customers like me a remarkable and fast-friendly service! No cons!

Now onto the food! As of 3 pm before closing its doors, I ordered the original fried chicken sandwich (without pickles) and a side of curly seasoned fries. As I ate it, that chicken sandwich is da bomb! Perfectly baked and deep-fried for perfection all thanks to natural spices and seasonings. The chicken cooked beautifully and ripe as I ate it entirely! The homemade cole slaw inside the chicken sandwich also tasted magnificent which I didn't feel and tasted unwanted artificial ingredients inside! On the other hand, the curly fries tasted amazing! Beautifully curly and crunchy for that fries! What a great lunch meal after all!

Parking at The Bird can be challenging to park. You can park at the nearby surface metered street parking nor the parking garage if it's available. Alternatively, you can ride a bike, walk, carpool, ride sharing or public transportation easier without the hassles and gimmicks.

All in all, The Bird is the most sensational and enormous local fast food chicken sandwich restaurant that I've ever visited for the first time right here in San Francisco's Financial District neighborhood! Perfect for friends, family and co-workers gathering. A well received and coming back for more! My rating: 4 solid stars.
author: William L.

description:
Good chicken fried sandwich but not the best.
However, they are somehow affordable and decent that's why they are so popular.
  However ( on the day that we were there) it was packed. It reached the point that they were too crowded and bad for the public safety.
  Will I come back? Well, if I walk by and the place is not this crowded I​ will definitely come back. But if it's this busy/ crowded, sorry but I will just pass them by without a second thought. 
 Affordable, decent but too crowded not worth putting myself against the crowd.
author: Dom G.

description:
The Bird is a great restaurant. I always get the fried chicken sandwich. I tried the spicy chicken sandwich once but it was too spicy for my liking. If you want to add some spicy to your sandwich without getting the spicy sandwich, just grab some of their homemade sriracha sauce near the pickup counter. The Bird only serves curly fries in which I am not a fan of, but worth a try.  

Check out my pictures!
author: Anita T.

description:
If you want to take some colleagues/friends out for lunch in SOMA, I'd recommend flipping The Bird. You'd be hard-pressed to find a better fried chicken sandwich in town (especially for the price).

For just 8 bucks you get a gi-normous free-range chicken coated in a spicy blend, topped with house-made apple slaw, mayo and pickles on a freshly baked bun. Believe me when I say that this gigantic chicken sandwich could easily feed two people or be spread out over two meals. The sandwich comes in Regular or Spicy. Word of caution: Spicy = super spicy (plenty of sriracha to galvanize your tongue and sinuses). While I'm a big fan of spice and all things nice, I think I may opt for the non-spicy/regular sandwich the next time around. 

If you're feeling adventurous (and not worried about carbs or calories), I'd recommend getting their "Happier Meal" which consists of their signature fried chicken sandwich, curly fries and a beer for just $12.50. It's one of the best lunch deals in town! And if a fried chicken sandwich sounds too heavy for ya, they also offer a Bird Salad ($6.50) made with romaine hearts and baby kale mix, braised beets, farro, celery and apple, and your choice of vinaigrette (champagne vinegar and honey), ranch, or blue cheese dressing. Hard to go wrong there!

The Bird has been nesting in this SOMA location for over 2 years now, and judging by the long lines to get in at lunchtime, this fast-casual restaurant has really taken flight. So if you're looking for some delicious fowl play or a chicken sandwich to-go (aka "poultry in motion"), then this is the place for you!
author: Kevin B.

description:
Probably one of the only shops where I can push for a 4.5 rating.

A LOT of chicken places fall short of perfection but The Bird comes pretty darn close--like, 0.5 stars close. I had Linner with an old high school friend here and he said he'd even prefer having this over a steak; and take it from him, he's pretty picky since his self-proclaimed "palette matured" over the years -__-".

That aside, the pictures can't be taken out of context and the birds come out HOT n fresh whether in wing, naked or crispy-breaded sandwich form.

When it comes down to the wire, I'd undoubtedly return to sf just for this chicken mang. BokBok!
author: Jason A.

description:
Came here for lunch on a weekday and the line was out the door (of course), but also moved very quickly. You order at the counter and then wait to pick up your sandwich which was all a very quick process.

The sandwich is really good and the chicken is very crispy. Unfortunately I don't work too close to here or else I'd be going back more often.
author: Megan K.

description:
Fried chicken. Spicy fried chicken. Spicy fried chicken sandwich. Spicy fried chicken sandwich with curly fries... It just keeps getting better!

I spotted The Bird the same way lots of people probably spot The Bird. There was a line streaming out the door which begs the question, "Why?!" Last week, I had a lunch to myself in SF but was starving and not about to wait in a long line. The hunger gods were in my corner and there was absolutely NO line when I walked by The Bird. I literally didn't have time to look at the menu which was a-ok because I stalked Yelp before and already knew how simple it was. 

I waited less than five minutes for my food to come out and cozied up to a hightop, ready to sink my teeth into this juicy sandwich! There wasn't one but TWO fried chicken patties perfectly breaded, crispy and hot. Like spicy? This had my nose running! In the best way (if there is such a thing). The fries were good, but I was mainly here for the sandwich and could barely finish it because it was so big. 

All of this for less than $10.50? Count me in! I'll definitely be back, but may opt for the naked bird (no bun) to really just enjoy the chicken for what it is. I also got my eye on those loaded curly fries. 

The Bird is the word, y'all.
author: Cassie P.

description:
Probably one of the best chicken sandwiches I ever had! I got the spicy chicken sandwich (the other option is original) and a fully loaded fries. 

I came here on a Saturday around 12:30 pm after my cycling workout class (work out to eat out amma right?!) Once I got to the restaurant, there were 3 parties in front of me which wasn't bad during lunch time. My food was ready in less than 5 minutes! 

You know the feeling of how you can't just 1 hot Cheetos? The right amount spicy that you can't stop eating it? Well that's how I felt about their spicy chicken sandwich! Each bite had a powerful kick but it was so tender, juicy and I just couldn't stop eating it!

The loaded fries didn't taste anything new or special but good thing they had their homemade Sriracha which made it better!

 Highly recommend coming here for a quick bite. However I wouldn't recommend this place as a first date spot! My mouth was all red from the sauce from each bite and it was really messy to eat the sandwich.
author: Frances K.

description:
You know what they say'? The Bird is The Word. And that is why we came here. 

Before I start, it's pretty funny seeing the other reviewers mention fried chicken as a trend in SF. I mean, you're about a decade behind the midwest at that point. Hope that doesn't trigger any hipsters. 

Point being, The Bird rocks. It's cheap, it's fast, it's greasy and it's super good. I got the loaded fries and fried chicken sandwich. It was amazing and hit the spot. I think that was only $13?
