And the sandwich was a great size. Even my friend, who is a pescaterian, ended up breaking his diet for it. Don't hold that against him though. He was being a team player. 

5/5 would eat again.
author: Aaron B.

description: The spicy chicken sandwich is within the top 2 best chicken sandwiches that I have ever had. It isn't too spicy, and has a great balance of other spices. I really like the loaded fries too. I will definitely be back here.
author: Aaron L.

description:
Solid fried chicken Sammy near the Moscone Center / Financial district.

The loaded fries are loaded and crispy.

This place is fun with a real throwback feel crossed with a hipster vibe and solid eats.

If your cousin owned a fried chicken place, it'd be bird. 

Opt for the spicy chicken as it's not but just more flavorful and do get the fries.

Beer comes in a koozie because... why not?
author: Dan K.

description: Took a little trip to SFMOMA and found the bird on whim. I didn't have high expectations from it but I am amazed at how juicy the chicken is and all the toppings in the sandwich just go together, creating perfection. Also ordered the happy hour $2 wing and it's a big wing and damn worth it. Better than chik fil a!!! But I'm from San Jose, so I'll just settle with chik fil a /:
author: Ivy N.

description: The Spicy Chicken Sandwich is legittttttt. So crispy. Tender. Juicy. Spicy (just enough). This is probably my favorite spicy chicken sandwich spot to go to!
author: Michael K.

description:
Love love their spicy chicken sandwich. The crunch from the apple/pickle slaw goes amazingly well with the crispy bird. The buns are toasted (and probably slathered in butter). They also offer combos that come with beer as well as discounts during happy hour (I believe ends at 6pm?) 

The line may be out the door but the line usually moves quickly, and honestly, if you're here at the right time, it's the perfect place for a quick meal. 

Also, this is not on the menu and sits right by where the food orders are picked up: HOMEMADE SRIRACHA. Get it now. Goes amazing well with their curly fries. I love my homemade sauces. I'm not usually a sriracha fan, but man, do I love the flavor of this homemade sauce. 

I know some folks highlighted that there may be inconsistencies. The only inconsistencies that I've noticed is around the spice level. But I love spicy food, and it's actually a treat when my chicken sandwich is spicier than usual (and I guess a slight disappointment when its not as spicy, but my stomach probably appreciates that). 

Side note, my boyfriend and I are obsessed with fried chicken sandwiches, and every city we visit, we find and try their "best" chicken sandwich. Each city builds their fried chicken sandwich differently. Our favorites are in LA (Birdies) and Chicago (Chicken Farm and Shop), but this place in SF definitely belongs in the top 5.
author: Teresa C.

description:
TIME: Monday @noon

When looking for this place, don't look for a sign that reads "The Bird", but rather, of a black illustration of a fox with a sandwich outlined in red in its mouth. It's located between Specialty's and Lee's.

Expect a line, but it will go by fast because here at the Bird, they are efficient with their small menu selection!

Here's what I had:

FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH - $8
I went for the non-spicy version! Be care though, the sandwich is hot cuz that's just how fresh this is! There's a big slice of pickle in there, which I took out, expect to make kind of a mess eating this. 

LOADED FRIES- $3.75
Curly fries with nacho cheese sauce, sour cream, bacon and green onions.
Pretty good! Great to share.  It has all the good things here and I recommended giving this a try. 

STAFF:
I felt the staff here were efficient and friendly.  They know they get a lot of customers so they work fast all while being very friendly.

ATMOSPHERE:
This spot is tiny with very limited seating during lunch hours. There are seatings outside in front but cmon, it's SF and we know how cold it can get. If you do plan on dining in, expect to sit super close to strangers. 

My overall take of this place is that I enjoyed it and happy to have tried it!
author: Tu-Anh N.

description: There isn't even a sign. However the free range chicken sandwich is fantastic. I went spicy and halfway I was thinking about my decision. Great zip, reminded me of Nashville Hot Chicken. House made Sriracha kicks it again.
author: Rob M.

description:
The Bird is the Word. Their spicy chicken sandwich is awesome. Literally falls and melts in your mouth. And of course you have to get the curly fries. Crispy, crunchy and just so good. I'd eat a whole bag of curly fries from them for a meal. 

The coleslaw was fresh, though I may try it on the side next time. With it and the spicy chicken being huge flavors, it was kind of a lot to handle in one sandwich. 

My meal was ready within minutes and the cashier was nice. I visited after work. Can't say the wait would be the same for lunchtime. Great location, but I'm sure it fills up quickly. I've seen the line go out the door and down the block by noon. 

Can't wait to visit again and try new parts of the menu. Best chicken in SF for sure!
author: Liz B.

description:
I turned vegetarian last year but if I ever break it I'm thinking it's gonna be for the Spicy chicken sandwich. It is the best chicken sandwich in Bay Area. They have both spicy and non spicy versions, and I recommend you try the spicy version (not extremely spicy but if u like spicy Indian food like me, you are gonna love it). Their loaded fries are amazing as well.

This is not at all vegetarian friendly. The prices are very low for the taste
author: Darshan R.

description: This place cranks. Make sure to grab their house Sriracha with your "Happier Meal" (Sandwich, fries, & Beer)
author: Danny L.

description: Consistent, and satisfying fried chicken sandwich in the city. I love their house made sriracha on their naked spicy chicken. Efficient kitchen operations so your wait shouldn't be long during lunch hours.
author: Paul L.

description:
Not the best feeling when you realize that your intended destination is going the opposite way from your job coming from the Bart station, and when you finally get there, you also find yourself at the very end of the line at the end of the block!  I go to the front of the line and hope that I have the wrong address, but NO, this is just how my life works- always want what everyone else wants, and always in line for something.  Fight or flight- I choose to fight and take my ass to the end of the line.  My inner party-pooper, flipping THE BIRD at my inner-cheerleader because she somehow convinced me that we need to try this fried chicken sandwich.  However,  I was determined to HATE this place and find the food nothing more than ordinary, that way I would NEVER have to come back. 

No more than 30 minutes in, I finally make my way to the front of the line.

Me:  One chicken sandwich, please. (Almost ordered two.  Why not make it work my while?)

Cashier lady: Spicy or regular?

Me: Regular (I want to taste the fried chicken for what it is)

Cashier lady:  Any curly fries or any other sides? 

Me:  No.  ( Nah, I already know what curly fries taste like, and I don't need it.  Plus, I'm on a diet. *Snort LOL*)

Cashier lady:  Anything to drink? 

Me:  (Perhaps a diet soda to keep things light??) No, thanks.  Just the sandwich.

Paid the nice lady and my order was already ready to go.  Took my lunch in a brown paper bag and trekked my way back to work.  I figured that my meal was going to be wet and soggy by the time I arrived, but surprisingly, it was not; and  It smelled SO good.  Took a bite of the chicken and it was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside.  There are vultures that I work with that can sniff and spot good food from afar.  So I take my lunch with me to the rooftop patio to hide out for a while.  

I'm glad I did because this was something that I did not want to share.  Have you ever eaten something that was SO good that you could cry??  I was having one of those moments.  I don't even like dark meat chicken, but this was way too good.  The slaw of red cabbage, celery and onion, and apple had a nice crisp to it. I loved the hint of sweetness the apples did for the sandwich as a whole.  I'm happy that I did not go for the spicy sandwich because what I had was perfect for the day.

Bird, I don't hate you.  You are wholly loved by many- myself included.  We shall meet again!  For breakfast next time, perhaps?
author: Leslie G.

description:
I love the fried chicken sandwich at Garaje, but it's just too far from my office if I wanted it for lunch. My coworkers all rave about The Bird, so I went to check it out!

- Fried chicken sandwich [classic or spicy] ($8): perfect portion with a crispy skin and juicy meat. I dig it! Normally I can handle spicy food, but their spicy fried chicken is on another level. Now, I just get their classic and pour on their spicy sauce so I can control how spicy it gets. ;)
- Curly fries ($2.50): pretty standard fries
- Fully loaded fries ($3.75): fries with sour cream, green onions, and bits of meat on top

During lunch time, there's always a line. But don't fret because their cashiers are fast and efficient!
author: Christine S.

description:
I'm going to have to fight you if you don't think The Bird is good. I would say it almost rivals LA's Howlin' Rays but man I wait so long for Howlin' Rays I sometimes feel like the wait makes the food taste better, but this ain't a review for them.

Fried chicken sandwich - Spicy. Thank me later.
Handle your spice though, spicy is a good sting but I added on their house made sriracha because I was looking to really obliterate my insides. Chicken is very juicy, flavorful, and.... .. .. m o i s t. Coleslaw in the sandwich was solid. I usually hate pickles but chicken sandwiches and pickles are so complimentary I couldn't take it out. Do yourself a favor, get this. Not life changing, but compared to anything else in the bay, this is pretty good for what you're paying.

Cost:
Chicken Sandwich $8
author: Kevin N.

description: Here is a very convenient place to get fried chicken burger. The chicken is tender and juicy enough, unlike any Korean-style fried chicken, or Japanese-style chicken katsu, or pop eyes. It's the meat in the middle of a burger, and they made it easy to chew on and has tons of more flavor than a beef meatloaf can offer.
author: Yanzhong L.

description:
Pretty f'n spicy! 

Enjoyed every bite. Couldn't finish. 

Need to type more to be considered a real review. 

Sheesh, yelp really takes itself seriously huh? 

They're probably reading this as I type....

Hmmmm... I think the coast is clear...
author: Martha S.

description:
Spicy fried chicken is da bomb! O.M.G. This chicken was actually spicy with a TON of flavor. Love the pickle in the sandwich - balances so well with the spice. My hubs got the spicy fried chicken biscuit which is served all day. Also very good and the biscuit was buttery and yummy (I had a bite of course because I can't resist trying everything I possibly can). 

Notes:
- apple fritters are only served with breakfast. Booo bc I needed something sweet after the spicy sandwich
- there's no fried ice cream sandwich on the menu anymore :(
- no line at 11:30 am on Monday. Wahoo
- loaded curly fries were cold. Not pleased about this at all. I love my fries hot straight from the fryer. For me that's -1 Star bc fries shouldn't ever be cold. And with a limited menu like they have there's no excuse. #sorrynotsorry
- I don't think there's a vegetarian entree option. I didn't check close enough but this is not a place for vegetarians. Sorry! (Actually sorry this time)
author: Lisa D.

description:
OK. So you gotta forgive the photo BUT I COULD NOT STOP eating this sando long enough to take a picture. 

I got the spicy. I have a decent spice tolerance so this was perfect. Spicy, but you could still taste the chicken, the slaw and pickles worked perfectly together and were a perfect accompaniment. 

I also got the curly fries. They were crunchier than usual curly fries, but I attribute that to the fact that this is a fried chicken place, and don't think anyone is looking for "chewy" at a place like this. 

I feel like The Bird is a place where each time I go I have the best of intentions of trying something new, but will wind up getting the spicy chicken again. 

Either way: I win.

So  damn  good!
author: C. K.

description: The tastiest chicken burger I have eaten in SF till now!! And Their homemade sriracha is just amazingggggggg
author: Manasi C.

description:
I came here on  a weekday for lunch. The line was super long and My first thought was that it would take forever to move. But since I really wanted to try this place out based on all the great reviews, I got on the line. 

The line moved really quickly. I was actually surprised how fast it moved. Once I ordered the food and filled my drink, my order was ready. Huge props for having an outstanding and super fast service. 

Really highly recommend this place the chicken is super flavorful and the right enough of spiciness . The portion of the burger was great as well. Not enough seats compared to the amount of people that come to this place to eat, but it really seemed to be a place where you just order tour food, pick it up on your way and go.

And obviously it's San Francisco so do not expected to find parking. Looking for street parking can get super hectic. Can't wait to try the burger again. Next time I eill make sure to bring my wife with me.
author: Chul L.

description: Really like this place. The lines are long but you'll get ur food pretty quickly. The sand which itself is really tasty.
author: Arjan N.

description:
Fried chicken, why must you taste so goddamn good?! I just can't quit you! *cries salty tears* My fellow derp, reppin' his corgi shirt, and I decided to scope this place out since I had bookmarked previously for lunch. I trusted him to navigate, but he might as well have been napigating because we walked in a circle before ending up here. He had one job... ONE JOB!

(°°） /(. . \)

We each ordered the spicy fried chicken sandwich ($8.50) which was served with crinkly pickles and slaw. The bun was nicely toasted, and quite possibly the best sandwich bun I've ever had. Yup, this is coming from the derpina who usually gets her burgers or chicken sandwiches "protein style" (read: lettuce wrap). My fellow derp highly approved of this deliciousness and 10/10 would recommend it. I have short term selective memory, so that may have been my paraphrasing....

Loaded fries were alright, but the curly fries got cold and soggy quickly, so best to stick with the regular curly fries if you're looking to carb load.

Friendly service and the interior is quite spacious inside! We didn't have any trouble finding seating despite being a popular place, albeit during a weekend lunch. We nap-igated back home to nap, of course, before taking shots of Japanese whiskey and SantaConning.

The force is strong with this sandwich. NOMS
author: Christina T.

description:
I really want to like this place more. The staff are super awesome and friendly. The food is served fast and hot. There is ample seating, and it's I z great lunch location for those who work in or near Fidi. The only gripe i have is that the chicken tends to be a bit oily and makes my stomach feel heavy. I'm used to friend chicken sandwiches made mostly with white meat, but I do believe they use white and dark meat such as thighs, and   like I said, it felt heavy in my stomach. I also was too crazy about the seasonings. But that could very much be a personal preference. Otherwise, the location good, staff and service were great, and the presentation is excellent. I tried it twice to make sure I was giving them a fair shake. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich, regular the first time, and spicy the next time. The fries were good. My coworker ordered the loaded fries and they looked bomb. They also had other things to do the menu such as dessert and getting the chicken on  a salad. 
My recommendation is to give this place a try for lunch. It was a little oily and heavy for my taste, but it's popular and your tastes might be different than mine. If I had bad service or the place looked sketchy I might advise to steer clear. But i think it is worth going and checking it out.
author: Ruby H.

description:
I've only walked by this place during lunchtime when the line is out the door. I stopped by one Monday evening to see what the hype is.

Stand in line and order at the register, we had to hover around for a few minutes to find a table, kind of a small space. I assume this place is great for lunch for the working professionals in the area as you can grab your food and go. They have a cool happy hour where beers are discounted. I ordered the fully loaded fries and the spicy fried chicken sandwich. 

Boy was this meal H E A V Y. I didn't even finish the fries and had to take the bun off for the last few bites of my sandwich. *commence heavy breathing*

Great place for a quick, affordable, and super filling meal. The bird is the word.
author: Genevieve M.

description:
The Bird is a great value for a good chicken sandwich.  Definitely a great price for the city and a place that I can go eat at or take it to go.  

Ambiance
This is a hipster look and feel place that is something I see in Portland and SF.  They have the old school chart for a menu and do not put any branding labels on their fountain drinks.  The seating in here is very cramped and limited.  This type of food is pretty quick so it is easy to get a table if one just waits for a little bit.    

Food
Nice fried chicken burger with a lot of meat.  It is an oily breading that is a great value for a chicken sandwich.  The spicy one has a good kick to it.  The loaded curly fries has a lot of toppings such as green onion, sour cream, bacon, cheese, etc.  Definitely worth a try but is a little bit on the pricier side.

Service
It's pretty much a typical order and wait to get one's name called.  It's pretty quick and efficient.
author: Simon N.

description: Was spontaneously summoned here by the GF for a random lunch date during work hours for lunch.  The line looked pretty long during lunch time but it actually went by pretty quick, it was like a 10-15 minute wait even though there was like 50 people in line. We got the chicken sandwich, some curly fries and a beer ! OMG everything goes well with one another.  the chicken is so tender and juicey!!!! I feel like it may be one of the best fried chickens there is.  It has a distinct taste that is different from KFC or popeyes and it fits really well in a sandwich form (I'm usually not a big fan of chicken sandwiches).
author: Ben Z.

description:
Love love love this chicken sandwich place! This place definitely surpassed Chick fil A in my favorite places to get a chicken sandwich. It's super hip and aesthetic inside too! There's limited seating inside, you'll probably have to share a large table with other people.

They serve you pretty fast, even if there's a line. I got my food like 5 minutes after ordering. I got the Spicy Chx Sandwich, and I really liked it. It wasn't that spicy, but that's okay because I still enjoyed all the flavors. One of the things I liked better than Chick fil A was the purple shredded cabbage, pickles, and sauce. I would definitely recommend trying this place if you're in SF!
author: Kathryn T.

description:
Winner, Winner, Chicken Dinner!! 

With all the awesome reviews and amazing pictures I had to give his place a try. It didn't disappoint! 

I had to go with "The Happier Meal", with a name like that, it has to be good. Your choice of an original or spicy chicken sandwich, curly fries, and a soft drink ( beer plus koozie available for a few extra dollars). I went with the spicy chicken sandwich. Boy did it pack not only a kick, but amazing flavor! 

The sandwich is made with free-range chicken, berbere spice blend that gives the chicken a little something special, loaded with there very own crunchy apple slaw ,mayo, and pickles served on a fresh bun that's baked each morning by a local baker. I'm Craving another one just writing about it.

The curly fries were so good. Seasoned to perfection. If you need an extra kick pick the sriracha sauce blend. I ended up eating them as is. 

Look forward to coming back soon!
author: Brandon L.

description:
I love spicy chicken and I have to say this sandwich was pretty darn good. Line was probably 20 people long upon arrival. For a moment I debated on if the wait was worth it but decided that since I stopped to specifically check this place out then I might as well wait. Surprisingly the wait wasn't bad...probably thanks to their small menu, they really whip people through there.

I'm a weirdo with some toppings so I ordered the spicy chicken without the slaw and mayo. Wow was it delicious! Had some great spice too which I'm not usually saying as I love the heat. Curly fries were also good. I had gotten their 'Happier Meal' which included a beer & koozie. Love the creativity! I'd stop again if I were in the area.
author: Savanna L.

description:
I decided to give The Bird another try today for a late lunch given this place is close to my office. 

Had the spicy chicken sandwich for the second time and I have to admit, it is pretty dang good. Solid 4 stars and very efficient and friendly service (this is an upgrade from my previous 3 star review)!! 

Will be back for more. Very tasty fried chicken sandwich and packed with a lot of flavor. I will try the non spicy one next.
author: Michael C.

description:
It's few and (very) far between in/around the Financial District that it could be said of a meal... "that was both extremely satisfying AND a great value."  The Bird definitely arouses those sentiments each and every time with its straight forward menu -- namely a spectacularly crunchy fried chicken sandwich, fries, and an relatively impressive canned beer selection.  Last but not least, the apple fritters are well deserving of a mention as well.

What drawbacks are a product of its own success... lines, and limited seating, particularly during prime lunch hours during the week.  Though I'd go so far as to say it's worth the effort every time.
author: Dan C.

description:
Fast, hot and delicious !  Only had a few mins for lunch and worried about the long line.  No worries!  They have it together here!  Once you pay and get your water, the sandwich is there in its deep fried glory!   It's filling so don't worry that it won't be enough.  

If you are not northern Chinese , the spicy chicken sandwich has a nice kick!
author: Curtis L.

description:
This place was poppin, and I can see why. My co-workers and I got there I think around 11:45 on a weekday, and barely beat the lunch rush. Line moved pretty quickly, so don't let the line out the door deter you!

I was almost going to get the Naked Chicken, but ultimately decided YOLO and got the Fried Chicken Sandwich. Absolutely no regrets. Chicken didn't feel too greasy, and the vegetables were a perfect compliment to the fried chicken. Price was actually pretty cheap IMO (less than $10), and it was the perfect portion. If you tend to eat more, you may want to consider adding fries to your meal.

I will definitely be back!
author: Daisy Y.

description:
Came here for happy hour with a few friends. 

I don't think it was particularly memorable overall - whether it be the food, drink or prices. I thought it was definitely a solid choice, but definitely not the best chicken sandwich I've ever had. 

I did like the curly fries, though mainly out of novelty. Rarely do you find a place that isn't Arby's that serves these. 

Overall not a bad choice, but also not mind-blowing.
author: Jenny D.

description: This place serves one of the greatest chicken sandwiches I've had in my life! For real, it makes Chick Fil A look like a cheap wig. The chicken was cooked perfectly. Tender and juicy. And it had a unique blend of seasoning, spicy and full of flavor. The bread wasn't too hard or soft. And it was tasty in its own right. Everything just worked and made sense. The loaded curly fries were also really good! The hardest thing was finding this marvel. It's kinda tucked away, but once you get here, you've won!
author: Preston I.

description:
Looked on yelp to find the best fried chicken sandwich in town when I was here for the weekend and came across the bird which is a 15 minute walk from where I was at the mall. 

The menu is not really elaborate but each thing on the menu was really great. We ordered two fried chicken sandwiches with a side of their homemade hot sauce and a side of curly fries which were all great - the only thing I would've changed was request breast because I'm not such a fan of dark meat however it was still great. make sure to get an extra side of the homemade Sriracha sauce it was very good and had a good kick

The place was packed but eventually settled down and the seating was interesting because it was communal but a little bit invasive I would definitely sit outside next time
author: Dani F.

description:
B..Bi..Bir..Bird.. is the word. If you're a fan of fried chicken (let's be real who isn't) then this place should be on your list of places to go. I will say that this place is a little deceiving because when you walk up to the place the sign outside isn't what you'd expect for a fried chicken place, but instead a fox with a sandwich in it's mouth. You know you've found the right place when there's a massive line out the door. 

I came around 12:45PM on a Friday and the wait time was around 15 mins and even by the time I was leaving at 1:30PM there was still a line. I would recommend coming before 11:30AM or after 1:30PM to beat the rush. The place itself is bigger than you'd expect. They have a couple tables inside & outside, but they fill up pretty quickly. 

I got the naked bird (spicy) & curly fries for ~$10. The naked bird is actually just the chicken and not a plain sandwich as what I thought it was, but nonetheless it was tasty. The chicken was fully coated with their spicy sauce. The spicy sauce was flavorful and wasn't crazy spicy but it did leave a small after burn after each bite. The chicken itself was moist & tender. I thought that the small plate of the chicken wouldn't fill me up, but oh was I wrong. Pair the chicken with the crispy curly fries and it's a great treat yo'self meal! They also give you a side of their slaw if you get the naked bird & there's some spicy ketchup near the counter where you pick up their order.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
This was our first meal in San Francisco and it really set the bar high! We popped in for a quick breakfast and both of us ordered the Chicken Biscuit. If you have a dairy allergy, ask for the biscuit without butter!! It comes with a huge glob on top of the chicken. You also have the option of ordering your chicken regular or spicy, but the spicy chicken is mostly just flavorful so don't be too worried! They have housemate sriracha to add some kick.

Also, our orders came with tater tots, which weren't on the menu, so that was exciting! They also have other chicken sandwiches and fries that are bigger meals, but we were satisfied with our breakfast for sure.
author: Sereena J.

description: Soooo yummy! You gotta try the fried chicken sandwich. The spicy version is SPICY so proceed with caution. Very competitive prices too considering the area. I crave their chicken at least once a week
author: Lillian W.

description: Delicious, juicy chicken. Top it with the spicy sauce and it's heaven ! The curly fries you cannot miss - absolutely delicious.
author: Satya Abhishek N.

description:
Although the line will undoubtedly always be out the door, The Bird definitely lives up to the hype.
The menu is concise, with its limited choices being part of the reason the wait isn't actually as long as it may seem.

I ordered the fried chicken sandwich, and for just $8(!), it's easily the best valued chicken options in town.

The meat is good, and served in a rather generous quantity. The slaw, although I'm not much of a vegetable guy, definitely played its part, and consisted of cabbage, a pair of pickles, onions, and some other green stuff.

Definitely worth checking out, if not regularing.
author: Jatin N.

description:
Crispy, spicy and fried. Really delicious and quick. 

Will return when I need fried food with minimal sides.
author: Trent W.

description: As soon as we got off the plane for our vacation in San Francisco this was our first stop. I was not disappointed at all. The Bird set the standard very high when it came to food in San Francisco. Arguably one of the best chicken sandwiches I have had. Their curly fries and great selection of beers were an added bonus. The food service is super speedy. As soon as I walked away from the cash register my meal was ready for me! One thing to note is to make sure you are aware of the specials. I ordered a chicken sandwich with curly fries and a beer. As I was done paying and about to walk away I noticed that there was a special for exactly the same thing I just ordered. The server never mentioned anything about it, and it would have save me $2! Overall a great place for a quick bite to eat!
author: Matt N.

description:
The food is good, the prices are very reasonable for San Fran and I would gladly go back.

The chicken biscuit was solid, dark meat, but well done.  Would have preferred a larger portion, but it was 4.50 so totally reasonable.  I didn't realize it came with hash browns so I also ordered curly fries which were solid.

All in all, an enjoyable meal.
author: Jordan O.

description: I only tried their $2 chicken wings this time, but they were truly amazing. If you like spicy, then you would like these wings; they are perfectly marinated.
author: Nishi S.

description:
Delicious fried chicken sandwich and buttery biscuit! On the small side but filling and a cheap option for lunch. Eat it quick otherwise it can get a little soggy. 

In terms of fried chicken sandwiches I think I have a slight preference for the one at The Architect's food truck but overall was really good and would order again.
author: Jess C.

description:
Does anyone remember that song by Project Pat ... chicken headhead?... I don't know why but when I think of the bird that song starts playing in my head.

I came on a Monday night about 6:30 still time for their happy hour (no line)... I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich $8, the fully loaded fries$3.75 and a chicken wing $2hh price..( don't judge me I had to try it all).

Everything I ordered was bomb.com... if I could have ordered  another chicken sandwich I would have... But I was totally full!... the chicken was perfectly cooked and moist...the spice level was just right if it was a tad more spicier it wouldn't have been enjoyable... the fully loaded fries was amazing... it was a perfect size to eat alone or even to share.

The only negative thing is that the seating is very limited... it's not the type of joint to sit around with your friends for hours..
. It's more of eat your chicken and go... they're not rushing you out but you can see the incoming looking for seats to eat their food as well...I will definitely be back for some more chicken.
author: Marshawna C.

description: The spicy chicken sandwich was really awesome. The chicken was fried right, the spice level was good and it hit the taste buds just perfect. I have always seen a long line here though the service is fast too
author: Sharad B.

description:
Haters, haters i say.

That chicken was BOMB and flavorful. I ordered the spicy chicken and it was amaaaaazing. Cole slaw was good, but could be more flavorful. Felt like it was missing something.

I tried the fries with cheese, bacon, sour cream and it was heart wrenching. It was highly reviewed but its not my cup of tea. Maybe it was the type of cheese used? Not really appetizing.

I got pretty full off of it though. I would highly recommend the spicy sandy!
author: Lynn C.

description:
The name is everything. This place serves chicken and who does not love that !!

Conveniently located near the Montgomery bart stop ( short walk) the outside facade is very non descriptive. I only knew it was a restaurant because I yelped it before going.  The interior has an industrial feel with high tables and a huge sign that says 'Beer' behind the main cash counter. The music here is insanely awesome if you love rap 11/10. It really adds to the vibe and I was an instant fan! 

The menu has a few items on it and since it was my first visit we tried the Fried chicken sandwich ($8.00) and the curly fries ($2.50). 

Note: The sandwich comes with a choice of spicy or regular so be sure to ask the server. 

The prices are very reasonable and the portions are very good too. The piece of chicken was well cooked, seasoned and very flavourful. The chicken was paired with great toppings ( cabbage, pickles etc) and the bun was very soft and fresh too. Since it is a big burger, it takes a few bites to get the full flavour which is super 8/10. The fries were good but not the best I've had as they were not as crisp as they looked 5/10. They were however seasoned well. 

The staff is extremely friendly and great to talk to and this place has good food, value for money and ambience. Also did I mention they have wings on the menu which I must try next time. 

Overall it was a really good meal and if you crave chicken this is the perfect place. I recommend it :)
author: Shivani B.

description:
I've been hunting for an egg sando in the vicinity of SoMA that is fried rather than microwaved, and The Bird's got one. 

It comes on a tasty rich biscuit and mine had a soft yolk that oozed yummily everywhere. Bacon and cheese too. 

There may be some butter involved on the biscuit, which really is not necessary. Possibly popcorn butter. That's a don't ask if you don't wanna know.
author: Lanny B.

description:
Ah, The Bird. You're gonna get a chicken sammich, you're gonna get it fast, and you're gonna get some curly fries to go with it because it's Tuesday, dammit, and every day is cheat day if you want it to be. The spicy sammich is spicy, but not painfully so, and is hella moist and tender. The fries are pretty good too, but they're really missing some sort of sauce to top them off with. The sriracha leaves me a bit wanting on that front. Some kind of spicy mayo would be :ok-hand-emoji:.

It's quick, the price is _fine_, and it's tasty. Just make sure you eat a reparation salad for dinner.
author: Shawn W.

description:
This place was pretty hard to find, because there's no flashy sign and there's a four legged creature on the front instead of a bird. I think it may be a wolf or a fox, but didn't get a good look. I actually walked past it once before actually finding it. 

Oh boy, I'm glad I did though. If you're a fan of greasy fried juicy chicken, this is your place! I got the spicy naked chicken, and it's exactly what the name sounds like. This place focuses on their chicken so their menu is not very extensive. The sell chicken sandwiches, chicken salads or chicken by itself. 

The naked spicy chicken is literally just spicy chicken. It's good chicken though. Juicy, tender, flavorful, greasy, spicy chicken. The spice level of this chicken is pretty high, and I had a hard time getting through two pieces without the spiciness taking over my taste buds. I definitely needed a glass of water with my meal. It also came with some kind of slaw. It was slightly pickled, and I'm too into it. It doesn't take the heat off the chicken.

The service here is cool. The people here are kind, and are willing to answer questions. I would like to try the sandwich if I ever come here again.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
I would call this one of the "all style no substance" type restaurants I keep seeing. When you go in, the restaurant itself looks like a hipster place with the decorations and styling.

But unfortunately the chicken sandwich I got was not good, and for the price was quite hefty. I had the spicy version of it, and while the seasoning was okay, the chicken was made rather poorly. The inside was juicy, which was good, but the outside tasted like it had been burnt or charred, I'm guessing either from bad seasoning or frying something with it that wasn't supposed to be fried.

The slaw that came with it was rather boring, and the bread surrounding it wasn't anything to write home about. The curly fries might as well have come from a Jack in the Box.

Overall, a cool looking place, but not one that tastes particularly good.
author: Tyler T.

description: Had to update because they were at Outside Lands,  the line was outrageously long and they still delivered the BEST chicken sandwich - juicy, hot, delicious - omg AMAZING.
author: Alexa S.

description: Cheap beer!  Good fries. The chicken sandwich was good, but is dark meat which probably should be advertised as my side kick does not prefer dark meat so it mostly went to waste. I ate 1/2 of the bun, slaw & pickle which was yummy.
author: Ondrea B.

description:
While the food is decent (though frequently they serve chewey chicken that's been under hot lamps too long) they restaurant is not run well at all. They are constantly getting orders wrong and they arbitrarily choose when they are and are not serving breakfast. 

The restaurant could be good if they got some adults in there to manage the place.
author: Edgar P.

description: What a great lunch spot! It's all about their fried chicken sandwich. The line may seem long, but it's worth it when you are in the mood. Try getting in line early before the main lunchtime crowd hits. They have great fries too.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Yaaaassssssssssssss! Gimme some of those delicious Chicken Sandossss!!! GET IN MAH BELLY!

The Bird knows what's up when it comes to fried chicken sandwiches. They know it on a whole 'nother level than us mere mortals.

I first heard of this place after reading online that LeBron ordered a bunch of sandwiches here while in the area. I've then come to know this place due to its ridiculously long line going down the block during the peak lunch hours. As such, I came here with a friend on the day before Thanksgiving at around 11:45am with the hope that not many people would still be in the area. The line was still going out the door at that time, but the wait was actually quite short.

I decided to get their spicy chicken sandwich and we split an order of their curly fries. We ended up going off to an office area to sit down since the place doesn't have lots of seating especially considering their popularity. The curly fries are pretty standard and come hot which is nice. The spicy chicken sandwich was a definite 5/5 experience though! The buttermilk buns had a nice buttery flavor to them with a slight crisp at the inner cross section. The pickles and coleslaw added a splendid crunch and acidity to the masterpiece. The fried chicken is really blew me away with how flavorful and juicy it was. The batter was fried oh so right to create a splendid discernible crisp without being too thick or too thin. The meat was just so ridiculously juicy in a way that other fried chickens aren't even comparable to!

For a delicious fried chicken sandwich in the San Francisco area, I would recommend none other than The Bird!
author: Joshua M.

description:
Hot chicken in SF? Yes, please! 

This place had some seriously mouthwatering hot chicken! The spice level was on point with the right amount of crunchiness. What really made this an amazing sandwich was the slaw; all of it combined into one heavenly sandwich. 

The prices were very reasonable, especially considering the location and there was ample space to find a place to eat (not sure if this is the case all the time though, as we did come after the rush). 

They also serve beer here, so you can get your buzz on with your hot chicken sammich here! 

This is definitely on my 'To Do' list everytime I'm in SF now.
author: Margaret P.

description:
Line out the door and service was pretty quick.  I placed mg order and by the time I was done getting a drink my food was ready. 

Spicy chicken sandwich is really good and it's a big piece of chicken. I'd come back.
author: Rome D.

description: The bird was the best chicken I had so far in the USA. It is also the very first chicken I had in the USA but I strongly believe it will be very hard to top. Will be back very soon.
author: Michał K.

description: The happier meal does, indeed, make me happier. Delicious fried chicken, fries, and a can of beer? Everything I want but I'm too afraid to say. Thank you!
author: Nic G.

description:
Fried chicken sandwiches and curly fries?! I saw one picture of their classic sandwich and I was sold. It was a long line but as everyone says, it moves fast. The menu is simple and the hardest decision is just classic or spicy. They come out hot and nicely crisp. The fried chicken is able to hold it's crunchiness against the pickles and apple slaw long enough to enjoy. And finally, a place other than Arby's that recognizes curly fries are the best fries! I kept them naked and they were perfectly seasoned. I'll try the fully loaded fries next time (basically all the dressings of a baked potato). If you're headed over after work, they have something just for you - the happier meal. It's a chicken sandwich, curly fries and a beer for $12.50.

#cluckyeahsf
author: Samantha L.

description:
Came on a weekday at 6:30 PM. There was plenty of seating, and lots of hooks to hang up bags and clothes, which is a huge plus.

We got a spicy fried chicken sandwich, a regular chicken biscuit, fully loaded fries, and some wings from happy hour. The spicy fried chicken sandwich was everything I wanted! Spicy and juicy chicken with tangy flavors. By the time I got to the fries and wings, they were cold, but they were decent. My eyes were hungrier than my stomach, and we ordered too much. The next time I come back, I think I may try the spicy fried chicken biscuit to start, and add on fully loaded fries if my stomach has more room. The line moves quickly, so I think this may be a good strategy for me since I enjoy my food hot and I eat very slowly.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
This spot wasn't even on our list of food stops during our weekend SF trip, but when we realized our original lunch plan had to fall through because the restaurant didn't open until 4pm, a quick Yelp search brought us to The Bird and we are sooo glad it did. 

We got a spicy chicken sandwich and a side of loaded fries - all of which came out to be around $13. The chicken sandwich had a decent kick and was super juicy! The green apple slaw was definitely interesting and added a refreshing element to the sandwich, but I wasn't crazy about it. I wish they used a softer bread bun but all in all it was probably one of the better hot chicken sandwiches I've ever had!

The loaded fries were curly fries topped with cheese and bacon and sour cream. First of all, I LOVE curly fries and always appreciate any store that offers them. The fries were well seasoned and I enjoyed them! The sauces were okay - nothing original. 

We got our food within minutes of ordering and there was no line - but we did come during off hours so that's probably why. Definitely a spot I'd recommend to anyone in the area.
author: Ellen J.

description:
We came here after MOIC and while we were walking, I was reading the reviews and was pretty excited to try it out. We almost got lost trying to find the place 'cause google maps wanted to take us up another block. We came around 2.15pm and there wasn't any line. We ordered the classic/spicy fried chicken sandwich ($8) and the fully loaded fries ($3.75). I really wanted to try "the happier meal" but thought it would be a huge meal. 

The chicken sandwich was huge! Most burger places always have a bigger bun but this was different. The chicken was bigger than the bun and it was so juicy, tender, and crispy! Juice was coming out as soon as I bit it. It was a bit greasy though. My friends said the fully loaded fries were pretty good and well seasoned. 

Spent about $9 just for the burger alone, pretty expensive but "normal" for San Francisco. 

Wouldn't mind coming back to try their other stuff!
author: Sheila C.

description:
Y U M !

Fried chicken sandwiches and curly fries- what more could one ask for, really?

I came here to catch up with a friend one weekday lunch and boy, am I drooling just thinking of it! You choose between a regular or spicy chicken sandwich and whether or not you want fries, and whether or not you want said fries "loaded" with cheese and bacon!

I chose the spicy chicken with loaded curly fries- and what a lunch! Spicy brined fried chicken (not breast meat!) with slaw, and crispy curly fries sent me into a food coma soon after, but it was definitely worth that.

Do yourself a favor and get some bird and potatoes!! (They've also got mini sandwiches for those with smaller appetites!)
author: Mary F.

description: I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and I was amazed. I walked in there thinking I might get a chicken sandwich you can find at any fast food joint and I was proven wrong. The spices balanced out with the zest from the crisp pickles that made every bite flavorful. The chicken was crispy and juicy. The service was quick, I went around 1:30 PM on a Tuesday, I literally got my sandwich in two minutes. The place was nice, neat, and a great hangout place to have a beer with friends. It's the best chicken I personally ever had and I will be going again when I get the chance.
author: Jocelyn P.

description:
Long lines during lunch time, but boy does it go by fast. The first time that I ate The Bird, I was late to meeting my friends, so they ended up ordering for me. The second time, however, I managed to get the tail-end of the waiting experience, and boy does the line go fast. Not really sure how they keep churning out their food so fast, but I literally got my food in under a minute after ordering at the cashier station.

The first time, I got their fried chicken sandwich, and the second time, I got their loaded curly fries and naked bird. The chicken sandwich is a piece of fried chicken drenched in delicious sauce, topped with various vegetables, and wedged between two soft buns. The naked bird is basically the bunless and vegetable-less variant of the chicken sandwich (sans bun and vegetables), and almost resembles a finger food and totally would be if it weren't for how saucy the meat is. The loaded curly fries are their basic curly fries with extra toppings of cheese, scallions, bacon, and ranch(?). 

Overall everything was really tasty; I especially liked how saucy the fried chicken was, though if I were to go again, I'd probably go with the sandwich, rather than just the naked bird, since it's more of a full-package kind of lunch, which to me is not only more filling, but also more satisfying. While the loaded curly fries were delicious, I'm not sure it's worth the extra money for the toppings, especially since there aren't that many curly fries to begin with. My ideal meal here would probably be a spicy chicken sandwich and curly fries...

They also have what's called "The Happier Meal", which consists of a fried chicken sandwich, curly fries, and a beer for around $12 before tax; if it weren't for the beer, I probably would try going for this.



TL;DR Don't be intimidated by the line because it goes fast, and get yourself some really yummy fried chicken for lunch!
author: Ed W.

description: Fried chicken sandwich is a nice choice but I couldn't finish :( The whole place looks very modern and there's space enough to eat
author: Daniela D.

description:
Cool concept, good value, lightning-fast service.

For $12.50, you can get the happier meal--chicken sandwich, curly fries, and a beer. So I did!
However, and this is the first time I've ever felt this way, the spicy chicken sando was TOO SPICY. Habanero-spicy, like not flavorful spicy, just hotness in your mouth. I didn't love it. 

And I worship at the altar of hot sauces.
So this was serious. I was devastated. Even my free beer koozie didn't save it.

The chicken also wasn't particularly juicy underneath the crispy breading. 

Maybe I would come back for the chicken and biscuits? Or the non-spicy sando.
author: Cindy T.

description: The Bird used be my favorite spot to grab a quick bite. On average I would rate it a 4.5/5. I have eaten at this establishment many times, but my last visit was rather disappointing. I even sent the business a feedback email in late July, but it was ignored. I think it is time to move on.
author: Andrew J.

description: I think this used space used be a grilled cheese place but this is much better. Crispy Chicken Sandwich is like none other. Nice and juicy. I'll definitely be back to try it in spicy. Seating is limited if you happen to go during a busy time. Chicken and beer done well.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
I don't give 5/5 very often, but will have to say The Bird deserves it. It's a tiny place just off of Montgomery Station, offering delicious chicken sandwiches and fries for pretty darn good prices (considering we are in SF). I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and was impressed that the chicken was super moist, and that the breading was crisp despite being saturated in their house made hot sauce. I shared an order of fries, and dipped those in their amazing homemade sriracha - highly highly recommend. 

For their small size, they have a decent amount of seating. Even though the line was somewhat long when we went in, it moved super fast, and my food was out a couple minutes after ordering!
author: Lauren C.

description:
Amazingly delicious!! I've been intimidated by the long line every time I think of going, but the line goes by super quickly. When I committed to coming here, I got my food in about 10 minutes. The most shocking part was that my food was ready before I finished paying for it!! 

If you enjoy spicy food, I *highly* recommend getting the Spicy Chicken Sandwich. It's so flavorful and delicious. I was also surprisingly full after finishing the sandwich, as it doesn't look that big. And it's only $8!
author: Sharon W.

description: When I want a good chicken sandwhich this is what I want. A delicious, well seasoned, mouth watering, crispy chicken. Not whatever that bland and over priced crap they sell at The Coup.  I've had both the regular chicken and the spicy chicken. Honestly the spicy chicken isn't that spicy to me but its still very good. Line at lunch is a little long but it moves quickly. Its also affordable compared to most lunch spots in the FiDi so you don't have to worry about a budget.
author: Kaylan W.

description:
Amazing spicy chicken sandwich. It is a little bit too spicy so you might want to try the regular fried chicken with homemade sriracha sauce. 
Curly fries is a most too.
author: ali e.

description:
My coworkers and manager raved about the sandwiches here so I figured I'd give it a try.. and boy, it sure didn't disappoint. I ordered a spicy chicken sandwich with a side of loaded curly fries. The sammich is sooooo good!!! Curly fries too but the sandwich definitely stole the show!

I was able to try the non-spicy chicken sandwich too so I must admit that the spicy chicken sandwich blows it out of the water! If you can handle mild spice, go for the spicy one! 

(Tip: Add the cheese.. it's not your typical slab of cheese.. it's gooey and melted) 

I really like how simple the menu is! FiDi eateries can get really busy during lunchtime so having a simple menu definitely helps with the rush.
author: Zizi W.

description: I ordered the spicy fried chicken with loaded fries and lemme tell you that fried chicken sandwich was BOMB! It wasn't super spicy but it hit the spot and I've never felt so satisfied after eating a sandwich. Asides from that the loaded fries was smaller than I thought but it reminded me of a baked potato with all the toppings! this will be my go to spot for fried chicken sandwiches in sf!
author: Samantha C.

description:
The spiciest wings I've had in a long time. My brother and I were incredibly hungry after a long day of work and saw The Bird. We walked in and were greeted with the wonderful scent of fried chicken. The surroundings reminded me of a tavern with tables and stools. We snagged two seats at the window counter. 

When I came, there was a happy hour wings special ($2 per wing). I didn't know how large the wings would be so I ordered six of them, which was a rookie move. I then got a fried chicken sandwich for myself. 

At the counter, they had some craft brews on display, which added to the tavern feel of the place. 

When they called our order, I picked up the basket with the fried chicken sandwich and three wings. Luckily, the staff was kind enough to walk over with the last basket of wings. My brother and I were shook by the amount of chicken. At first, I thought $2 per wing was a bit expensive, but after seeing the two baskets, I realized that it was a great deal. 

I got the friend chicken sandwich spicy so when I but into it, I was greeted with a symphony of spicy and savory tastes. After demolishing the sandwich, I tried the wings. I bit into one of them, and the spices immediately burned my mouth. I have a high spice tolerance, but these wings were next level. The ranch that came with the wings saved the day. My brother and I ate through the rest of the wings and we did so, we got used to the spice and could the taste the sweet barbecue flavor beneath the heat.
author: Nathan C.

description:
Now take a deep breathe: it's just a chicken sandwich but this simple chicken sandwich is a true masterpiece. 

The spicy chicken sandwich for $8 consists of the following: a bun, celery, house made apple slaw, mayo, pickles, and the fried chicken. And with that, you get so many flavors that just work together. The chicken, itself, is crispy and that spicy breading is unforgettable. It's the kind of taste that will keep you coming back for more. I mean, I've never had something like this and an hour after lunch I'm still thinking about it. The sandwich's niche is furthered layered by the house made apple slaw, something fresh and light that cuts through all the heaviness from the chicken. It's definitely one thing you should order from the menu if you come here.

To top it off, we also ordered the curly fries. Perfectly seasoned and my second favorite thing on the menu.

Important things to know: if you're planning to come here for lunch, get here before 11:45. The line will wrap like a burrito - around the corner and probably the block. You'll be waiting for minutes just to try this sandwich. Oh and there's tables inside and out. If you're coming with a friend, one stays in line and the other gets water in the back and find a table. I saw a few people standing up and eating their sandwich. You definitely need both hands to eat this sandwich. It can get messy.

Enjoy!
author: Tina M.

description:
Yes, yes, yes! Crispy juicy chicken sandwiches are the best. I love their spicy chicken (has a bit of heat to it, or maybe I'm just a wimp), and love that they pair it with apple slaw in the buttery sandwich. You can add their home made sriracha as well to kick it up some more. It's simple, but super flavorful. The curly fries are also delicious. 

One of the highlights for me is their "happier meal", which lets you get their fried chicken sandwich with curly fries and a beer! It looks like they had other items like ice cream taco, wings, and salad if you decide to branch out. 

Location is pretty convenient, and lines are inevitable during lunch time. Compared to Chick-Fil-A, as others have, I really think this beats it.
author: Alice K.

description:
This place is absolutely amazing. Walking to this place we saw a relatively long line so we were prepared to wait for 15-20 mins BUT the line just kept moving and never really stopped so we got to the register within 5 mins or less. The inside was very nice and kind of reminds me of a bar with hipster lights and signs and such. The menu is simple and they have the happier meal. SO WORTH IT!!!! 

The happier meal is a fried chicken sandwich (spicy or regular), curly fries, and a beer for 12.50!!!! We wanted soda instead beer and they were happy to make that change at no cost. 

The food came out literally 2 minutes after we paid. We were so surprised that it came out SO FAST. It was crazy. There were lots of seats around 11/12ish considering the small space and we found seats easily. And the food was BOMB. Super crispy and juicy. The fries were normal. The soda was extra cold and crispy. Sauce on the sandwich was gooood. Loved it. It was a regular/decent portion. I definitely was full after it. 

Bottom line: it was cheap, REALLY GOOD, fast, and worth it.
author: Sharon W.

description:
My boyfriend was dying to try this place out. The pictures looked so yummy.
Maybe it was what I ordered. Or maybe I'm a bit more picky. But I didn't think it was that crazy of a meal. I mean, I think it's a good option in the area. And they have beers, so you can have your own little happy hour while you eat. Always a good time.
But the actual sandwich itself wasn't out of this world for me. The chicken was crispy, the bun was okay. I just feel like I've had better friend chicken. Although a plus is that the chicken isn't super greasy.
author: francis c.

description:
1. The hot chicken sandwich is delicious. A bit messy to eat, had the chili sauce dripping all over my basket. The only tip I can give about eating hot chicken is that do not touch the spicy part with your fingers and then touch your eyes, you will see fire. 

2. The chicken is tender and juicy, crispy outside. It would be better if they used chili powder with some olive oil. The sauce I had was too liquidity. It made the bread soggy and then all went out on the other side. 

3. Nice casual atmosphere. They also serve ice cream. Their curly fries were average. Those came out lukewarm and a bit stale, maybe because I got the last batch of the day since I went there an hour before it closed.
author: Eileen H.

description:
That chicken sandwich. Holy crap. So delicious. The line is always a little intimidating when it's out the door, but don't let that discourage you. All you really need at The Bird is their fried chicken sandwich. The line only lasted about five minutes and after the order was taken, I had my sandwich in less than 30 seconds. The menu is small. Chicken sandwich and fries and that's practically it.

So is the sammy all they say it is and more? Yup. It's hella delicious and the word hella is not really in my vernacular. It's just that damn amazing. You choose whether you want it spicy or not and the magic chicken making elves do the rest. Red cabbage and delicious crunchy slaw and the most delicious piece of fried chicken make this sandwich the absolute bomb. The spiciness is not overpowering at all and adds a little bit of heat to this incredible-ness.

Have I used enough positive adjectives to convince you yet? TLDR: GO GET ONE!
author: Alex L.

description:
I'm one of those people that came here because it looked similar to Howling Rays. 

I got the Spicy Chicken Sandwich with loaded curly fries and extra pickles. It tasted really similar to the medium spice chicken sandwich at Howling.

This place did not disappoint! I like how the chicken had its own unique taste. I would definitely come back!
author: Jennie N.

description:
My fiancé discovered this gem while on our SF trip and I'm so glad he did! 

This place reminded me of Howlin Rays in LA. Those of you who know about Howlin Rays know that the wait time to order and get your food is sometimes over 2 hours. So when we literally walked in and ordered I was super excited! 

We had a sandwich and some fries. The sandwich was delicious! I forgot what lvl spicy we ordered but it was a perfect amount of heat. The fries were yummy as well! 

If I'm ever around the area I'll definitely stop by again! 

The staff was friendly and patient while we ordered our food.
author: Miriam O.

description:
Even though the prospect of a delicious fried chicken sandwich was more than enough to bring me into The Bird, it felt even more compelling considering that it only required a short hop, skip, and a jump to make it here from my office.  Add in the fact that it's from the same folks as Super Duper, which is one of my favorite burger joints around?  I mean, all of that just meant it was only a matter of how soon I could make it here...and when I'd come back again!**

Like Super Duper, The Bird's menu doesn't offer up much in the way of variety (in fact, it's even narrower).  At the same time though, there's no need to offer up much else when you do something so well!  Especially in this part of SoMa/Financial District, where it means being able to do something both well AND fast to get the working crowds in and out fast.  Of course, not that you'd be coming here for anything other than fried chicken anyways...ha!

-- FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH...$8
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-bird-san-francisco-2?select=BjyPtSj99u-Xb6VBGdLRNg)
Talk about a mouth full - this was HUGE!  I opted for their classic version (instead of spicy) and it was great.  The breading was crispy yet not super thick and the chicken itself was super juicy.  What's more, the bun was so soft and the pickles' acidity added a nice contrast.  I could've done with less of the slaw, but just because it had cilantro in it (blech).

-- CURLY FRIES...$2.50
(https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/the-bird-san-francisco-2?select=zeoznnVqn2rPv7y4T2Bz0w)
Given the price, the portion obviously isn't huge, but it's still well worth the money, even if you needed to double your order!  The fries were cooked up to a really nice crispness and are very well seasoned (not salty though).  What's more, they weren't super heavy or greasy either.  Yum!

Beyond how good the food is, the staff here is great!  Not only are they all really friendly, but they're fast and efficient too.  Both times I've been here, there have been lines to get to the register.  However, after ordering, I've never had to wait more than a few minutes for my food to be ready.  All in all?  In and out in about 15 minutes or so, if that, which is great when you're looking for something quick and tasty on the go (they do have a bunch of tables inside and out if you want to stay and eat, though).

Overall, FOUR AND A HALF STARS if I could, but I rounded down (for now) if only because of the slaw.  Which, I realize, I'll just ask for less of next time...which will be sooner rather than later!

**Five days, and only because there was a weekend in between.
author: Mike L.

description: The spicy sandwich is overly salted and the fritters are too sweet. I needed to take out the crust from the chicken and I spat the fritters out. Not coming back here again.
author: Jen Q.

description: The Bird is worth a try! I heard a lot of hype around this place. The prices aren't bad and they have a deal for $12 you get the sandwich, fries and a beer! The sandwich is $8 usually. Loaded fries are $3.75 and really good! Loaded fries are curly fries with sour cream, cheese, green onion and bacon. There's very limited seating so good luck! The line is usually really long, but service is fast and sandwiches come out quickly. The sauce is so good and the best part of the sandwich. The chicken is fried perfectly, but the bread gets really soggy at the end. I say go if the line isn't too long!
author: Caitlyn S.

description:
Solid chicken sandwich spot to grab on a lunch break if you work in the financial district! The line gets pretty intimidating, but it goes by fast! Otherwise, if you're visiting, I advise you to avoid coming between 11:30am-1:30pm so there's no hassle! 

The food is cooked to order so it's suuuuper fresh (and hot) when you take your first bites. If you enjoy some spice, try it spicy. Their fries are also yummers! +homemade sriracha on the side! Haha it's great
author: Dana D.

description:
Best ever? Nah. But pretty good. 

I almost yacked towards the end but I'm guessing it's because I ate too much...or it was the slimy texture that I got from one of the bites.  Not sure what happened but it happened.  

$2.50 for a tiny portion of curly fries would be my critique of this place.  Surely, it wouldn't hurt to give a real handful vs half a handful of fries. But $8 for a good chicken Sammy is a deal so I guess that they have to balance it out somehow.

BF says they have the best wings EVER. So, that makes it worth the visit I suppose.
author: Jessica C.

description:
The fried chicken craze is real! Around town folks are happily lining up around buildings for that perfect sandwich. The first bay area fad was Bakesale Betty's style sandwiches. Suddenly the new preference is Nashville style hot chicken. Unless restaurant owners are descendants of Prince's Hot Chicken in Nashville, they're going to have a difficult time replicating that country spice. 

IMO The Bird is a little over-hyped. Menu options are straight forward and simple which I appreciate. You can have your chicken naked, in a salad or between lots of carbs! Kudos on the  tall Miller hi-life cans (The most underappreciated beer on the market).  

The focal point is the chicken and I wasn't impressed. For the steady stream of customers, I was a little surprised my meal was not piping hot. The process from chicken fry to sauce dipping is clearly off and easily repairable. On the chili scale I was expecting the sandwich to be a little more spicier. The hot style seemed more sweet to me (Maybe I visited on a sweeter night, who knows). The vinegar based coleslaw was a little overwhelming. When a salad sits in vinegar for too long it almost doesn't taste like anything else.
author: Ralph A.

description:
So what I'm most impressed with is the chicken - which I suppose is the most important part. How do they manage to make it so juicy and tender and yet so crispy on the outside?!?! It's pretty much miracle.  

Sandwich all around was good. It could have used more mayonnaise - I pretty much think everything could use more mayonnaise. Next time I'll ask for extra. If they did a garlic aioli on it that would be BOMB.

Loaded fries are definitely worth it. In general the fries were very crispy and curly and very seasoned. Well done. 

Didn't get one, but they seemed to have a lot of different cans of beers that would be interesting.  

We got there about 11:10am on Wednesday and there was not yet a line. I'd say the line really got going around 11:30am and persisted till we left around noon. Not an excessive amount of seating, but they do have some outdoors. 

Pretty standard San Francisco prices.

If I go back and get a sandwich with more mayonnaise I'll probably end up bumping it up to 5.
author: Sarah C.

description: Fast service (they prep for the lunch rush), reasonable seating availability. As for the sandwich itself, it's good but not the best chicken sandwich I've ever had. Great for a midday lunch break, but I wouldn't go out of my way again. Personally, I like Sunday Bird inside Boba Guys better.
author: Andrea L.

description:
Who doesn't love fried chicken sandwiches? When I saw the bird on yelp, I had to come visit and I was certainly not disappointed.

With only a few items on the menu, the bird is a restaurant focused on fried chicken sandwiches, and it was pretty good. I got the sandwich combo, and changed to the loaded fries, which was basically the curly fries with some extra toppings. The fries were decent, but the sandwiches were truly the best, with juicy chicken and a nice slaw. My friend got the "naked bird", which we assumed was a basic sandwich, but it was just plain fried chicken. However it was still delicious, and quite a large portion as well. Overall a nice place for chicken sandwiches.
author: Carl C.

description:
Wow so cheap and pretty food.  If you love fried chicken this is a must try.

I loved that it was spicy and great sauces.

Main con was the chicken seemed over seasoned and was a bit salty.
author: Phillip N.

description:
If your looking for something quick easy, and delicious stop by. The line might be long but wait is close to none. These would be one of those sandwiches that you want to eat on the premises, simply because fried food doesn't have its luster if you happen to travel 10minutes after you get the food.

Again the wait was close to none, about 12 people in front of me less then 2 minute wait, and even less of a wait to pick up my food, finding a table might be the issue if you are with more then 2 people but if it is just you, I definitely recommend sitting inside or outside and enjoying the flavorful fried chicken sandwich, ask for the spicy it is not that spicy, add curly fries, have a beer or soft drink, several canned options, 21st amendment's watermelon and wheat beer, 40 of Old E, and your typical domestic brands.

What ever they are doing in regards to pushing out so much in short amount of time, I commend them on it, they have to be doing something right.

On to the food, the crispy chicken sandwich offered in regular or spicy was excellent. The chicken was deep fried and topped with pickles, purple slaw and a sauce, the bun was well toasted some corner bits of the toast were burnt but it did not take away from overall taste of this sandwich. Juicy, tender, no bones, piping hot, a definite must try if you are in the area and craving fried chicken sandwich

The curly fries was similar to your jack in the box brand, well seasoned only difference was it doesn't suck haha. On each table you are offered a medium spicy red sauce you can see the seed of the peppers in the sauce, again not too spicy but very good pairing if you do not like ketchup, or if you want to add more sauce to your chicken sandwich.

On a whole I will be back to get my fix of chicken sandwich when I have a craving. well done ladies and gentlemen well done.

chicken sandwich **** wow, piping hot, toasted bun, with that slaw you can't lose
curly fries **** better then jack in the box lol
price $ under $20 folks $8 for the chicken sandwich, $2.5 for the curly fries
service ***** QUICK and efficient
ambiance **** easily packed, slightly dark, several seating spaces meant for small groups or individuals
author: Clarence A.

description: If you see a long line, do not abandon hope. For one, they are really quick at pumping out orders. Secondly, and more importantly, their chicken sandwich is worth waiting for! It is filled with crispy fried dark meat goodness. Plus the default toppings of cabbage, pickles, and mayo are just enough to compliment and not overshadow the star of the the show - that tender meat. On a side note, the dough for the bun, not something I usually pay much attention to, was really good (airy but not dry and great at soaking up the flavors of the fillings).
author: Blake B.

description:
Come here for dinner some times before I go to my class, their spicy chicken sandwich is really good.  Not too greasy but not too clean either, you'll definitely get messy.  Their slaw is similar to bake sale betty's in oakland, so vinegary and spicy from the jalepenos. 

If you go earlier in the evening, they do $2 wing specials, which doesn't sound that special, but you actually get the entire wing, the drumettes, the flat and the tip, so effectively you're paying $1 a wing (for the edible parts).

Wings are crispy, and the sauce is spiced just right.

Worth coming for sure!
author: Tu T.

description:
I like The Bird. The Bird is simple. The Bird is good. The Bird is the best place to get a chicken sandwich in the area.

Don't let that long (sometimes) line out the door fool you, the line goes QUICK. The wait time for orders is about as low as any fast food place, usually ranging from 20 seconds to 2 minutes.

What I like most about the chicken sandwich is that it's balanced. It's got enough vegetables to balance the meat, and juuust enough sauce to keep it from being really dry.

The meat tends to have a very crunchy fried exterior, almost leaning towards burnt (never actually burnt though). The meat interior leans toward the bland side but works well in the context of a sandwich.

The curly seasoned fries are great! GET THEM!
author: Posu Y.

description:
If I had to describe my experience in 3 words it would be crispy, flavorful, and cheap.

This place really gives you a bang for your buck! I came on a Wednesday around 5:30 PM - there was no line at that time, but it did get more crowded around 6-6:30. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and curly fries. Here is my run-down on the two:

- Spicy Chicken Sandwich: Pretty freakin bomb. The buns were nicely toasted and very fluffy and soft. It came spread with some mayo, pickles, and this cabbage/onion coleslaw like thing that really added a refreshing zing to the sandwich itself. Now, the spicy chicken.... the STAR of the sandwich, WAS REALLY REALLY GOOD. It was extremely moist on the inside, hot and freshly fried with a batter that had a really flavorful spiciness to it. It wasn't too spicy too! If you can eat hot cheetos you can probably eat this sandwich. For me, I started to sweat a bit so I had to buy their home-made ranch for $0.50 because I wanted a cool factor. But overall, a really good quality sandwich for only ~$9

-Curly Fries: Crispy, tasty fries. A little on the pricier size for the portion in my opinion but they did taste good...

Overall, good food, hipster seating areas indoor and out. Would come again!
author: Anna L.

description: Came here for a quick bite for dinner. There was no line and I got my order within 5 minutes to go. There was a big line during lunch time when I passed by the restaurant. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and curly fries. Total was about $10 which is pretty cheap. Was told the chicken is spicy 7 on a scale of 10. I think it was a 5 out of 10. Wish it was a bit more crunchy. Would definitely recommend.
author: Rome N.

description:
Hands down, this is the juiciest and crispest fried chicken I've EVER had in my life. None of the dried out, tough chicken breast that restaurants give you, none of the soggy and spongy breading you get with takeout that steams in its own container. I was absolutely stoked to try this place when it first appeared on Yelpers' radars earlier this year, and even more excited that it lived up to the hype.

Is the line worth the wait? Knowing how long lines get around here on a weekday at 12:30 pm, maybe not. When I was here at 3 pm, the line was already touching the threshold. Considering the food is fried fresh (you can't mistake the steam that rises from your first bite, so give it a minute or two to cool), the line can only move so fast. There's very little seating, so it gets crowded in there fast. But once you get your food, that's when the real fun starts.

Imagine a beautiful, large chicken cutlet, juices flowing, a soft bun, crunchy breading, tangy apple slaw, and just enough mayo to glue the sandwich together. I'd say that crisp is actually the theme of the sandwich, actually. Between the mouthfeel of fresh celery, apples, onions, red cabbage, and that dang breading (seriously, I could go on forever about how I want to make my fried chicken this good), and the taste of everything coming together, the food's got a real punch to it. I've never had a chicken sandwich this good before. 

The focus is clearly on the quality of the food here, given the limited menu and rave reviews. There's few other items in the way of breakfast and post-meal accompaniments. They now offer their chicken biscuits all day, according to their changeable marquee sign. You can also get a midday beer or a hot ice cream sandwich (which appears to be warm, slightly sweet buns sandwiching ice cream and sugary toppings).

It's really a quaint and wonderful shop, and I'd recommend this to both locals and tourists grubbing for good food. Check out the dope art while you're there. It hits the nail a little more on the head than a coyote with a dead rooster in its teeth, because #cluckyeah, if I were that coyote, I'd go for the classic fried chicken sandwich too.
author: Gwen W.

description:
I've been here enough times to give my shining review about this place. Yes, it is SOO good!!! 

Their spicy fried chicken sandwich here let me tell you is super JUICEY, and the crispy crunch part is so flavorful and packed with that spice! The spicy chicken is pair perfectly with their apple cabbage celery cole slaw and slices of tangy pickles to cut through the grease. What can I say, it's so perfect!! I like to drizzle some of their house spicy sauce onto my sandwich too to make it extra spicy. Yummm. 

It is about $9 for a sandwich with tax. It's filling enough for lunch and certain will leave you in a food coma after. A heavenly food coma that is.
author: Hoyan L.

description: Awesome!!! I loved the heat! I loved the feel the ambience of the whole restaurant! The chicken was very tender in the inside yet crispy on the outside. I loved the very high caliente caspaisin level of he spicy chicken too! It was a fiery goodness! I would recommend that others who enjoy spicy food should also try this too!
author: Michael Y.

description: Cool space. Cool concept. For a fried chicken sandwich, it has a great flavor profile. The sandwich has celery on it. Sounds weird until you taste it. So good. Very SF, young and urban. They even have ice cream tacos
author: Kevin G.

description:
If you looking for some fried chicken in the city or just looking for fried food, The Bird is the place to go.  All their chicken is fried, so don't ask if they have grilled chicken hahaha.  Their menu has expanded through their time in DTSF- From a fried chicken sandwich, a salad with fried chicken (cus you know, diet #amirite..), to breakfast biscuit options now.  Prices are super fair for DTSF lunches and they are open on Saturdays!
They also serve beer, ice cream sandwiches, fries (curly or fully loaded[which has bacon on them]), hash browns, and apple fritters.
I usually order the Sausage breakfast biscuit which come w tator tots, and the spicy fried chicken sandwich is really good as well. 

Follow @foodhand_ on IG to see my post
author: Tiffany Z.

description: Perfect amount of spice and chicken. Curly fries with hot sauce at the table. I'm in heaven.
author: Colleen S.

description: This is the best chicken sandwich I've ever tasted the bread dressing condiments everything was just right with a beer to go with it . Not badd 4 12 bucks
author: Terry B.

description:
Wow. Today, I had the best and simplest Fried Chicken Sandwich I've had in a while. Imagine free-range chicken coated in berbere (oooh fancy) spice blend (get it classic or spicy), celery, house-made apple slaw, mayo and pickles on a freshly baked bun. All of that for $8.50. Not bad.

The first time I tried going to The Bird, it was at 12:30pm, and the line was SO LONG. This time, I came around 1pm, and there was barely any line, so I recommend coming here before or after lunch rush.

The various textures and and amazing fried chicken made for a wonderful chicken sandwich. I ordered the classic sandwich because I can't handle spiciness that well, but I also tried their house-made Sriracha sauce on the sandwich which added a nice kick and wasn't too spicy.
