Although the size of the sandwich wasn't that big, it was a filling and delicious meal. I definitely do not mind coming back here again.
author: George L.

description: Gluten Free fried chicken! Don't let the GF fool you. This cornmeal-breaded fried chicken is amazing. Plus they have curly fries, and at breakfast, these amazing apple fritter bites that I used to enjoy in my pre GF days. Yes, there's a line at peak lunch hours during the week, but it moves quickly. I suggest going there pre/post rush and getting your chicken spicy!
author: Erin M.

description:
We wanted to grab something quick to bring to the Giants game. 

The Bird was somewhat near where we needed to be. 

Fried chicken sandwich ($8) - fried chicken with celery, house made apple slaw, mayo, pickles, and bun. Great portion. Could use some type of sauce though. 

Curly fries ($3.75) = good, but very small shady portion. 

Not loving this place as much. I had better...
author: Owie N.

description:
TL;DR: Phenomenal fried chicken sandwich. Must go! 

Came here on a whim with a friend. The restaurant itself was a little bit difficult to pick out, since the sign on top of their door was small and hard to read. This could be glossed over though, because their spicy fried chicken sandwich was incredible. 

Spicy fried chicken sandwich [$8] - There were so many things done right about this sandwich. The fried chicken was crunchy on the outside, juicy and tender on the inside - perfectly cooked. The well-seasoned crust was so satisfyingly crunchy and packed such a huge flavor blast! The fried chicken was paired with a slaw consisting of slices of celery and red cabbage, and a pickle between two buns. I've never thought of all these ingredients together, but it was such a great combination that I am ecstatic that someone did! It was pretty spicy for me, and I usually have a high spice tolerance. For those who can't handle spice too well, I'd recommend getting the classic.

It's a little detail that matter for me. I liked that the cashier asked if I preferred my sandwich cut in half. It made eating the sandwich a little more manageable, and I easily saved the other half to enjoy later (just as good!).

Glad I came here on a whim. I will definitely be coming back to try their fried chicken sandwich again - classic style.
author: Cindy W.

description:
After hearing my friends talk about the amazing chicken sandwiches at The Bird, definitely knew I had to try it out! My friends and I came to The Bird for dinner on a Friday evening, and it was quite packed. You order up in the front, and they only have a few items to choose from. I got the regular fried chicken sandwich, which was solid. The fried chicken was very crispy and the inside was tender, and it's topped with some pickles and coleslaw mix that enhanced the flavors of the chicken. All sandwiched within some warm, buttery buns. I also got the curly fries, but they were pretty standard and not particularly memorable compared to the fried chicken sandwich.

Definitely recommend trying this out!
author: Alvin W.

description: Great sandwich. Went for lunch.
author: Neil S.

description:
The update the world has been waiting for! 

DAMN. That chicken sandwich. DAAAMN. When you eliminate an oppressor, Spi Ci Sos, the constituents shine. The perfectly crispy chicken, the crunch of the slaw, the creaminess of the mayonnaise (had no idea there was mayo on the first go around thanks to "you know who"), there were pickles, and if you're paying attention, you'll notice the celery expands the chicken sandwich by a full dimension. 

I will describe this chicken sandwich as "sexy". Don't think too hard about what this means. You know what sexy is. 

I ordered one sandwich and ate it slowly, controlled.  Then I got up and ordered a second sandwich and ate that one the way I wanted to - I scarfed that one, licked my fingers, bit my tongue, just got savage about it, like a zombie eating a brain (don't over think it). It felt good. This sandwich makes biting your own tongue feel good.
author: Danielle O.

description:
If you love a good fried burger this is the place for you !!! Best fried chicken burger I had in a very long time. I got the spicy chicken burger which juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. So bomb !!! 

They have pretty small menu as compare to other burger places in the city. But whatever they have on there menu is top notch. Also have Ice cream sandwich and chilled beer. Great place, fast service and delicious food !!!
author: Simran K.

description:
Bird Bird Bird Bird's the word. The Bird gets super busy during the lunch hour rush but don't worry, the line moves super fast. You'll have your fried chicken sandwich in a matter of minutes! 

I ordered the spicy fried chicken sandwich and curly fries. Now this isn't just your ordinary fried chicken sandwich (most fast food places focus on quantity not quality). You get a explosion of flavors in here with the crisp pickles, slaw, and celery. They give your sandwich a perfect balance of crunch. Plus you need it to soak up all the fat from that chicken. It's not very spicy but I'm a kind of guy that can take a lot of heat. It had a light kick to it which adds to the overall flavor. Man, just thinking about it makes me want to order one now. The curly fries were definitely good. If you're looking for more, get them loaded. I tapped out after that sandwich so unless you come with a big appetite, share the fries with a friend. 

For an even better time, order the happier meal (it includes beer). Your beer comes in a koozie that's for you to keep. 

Cluck yeah!
author: Tim G.

description:
The Bird isn't just a restaurant. It's a religion. Mention it and watch all your coworkers pop out of their cubicles like hungry meerkats. Ruin your offices' whole lunch hour by bringing it in after not inviting anyone to go with you. Fill the whole floor with the tantalizing smell of The Bird's chicken sandwich, and taunt them all with that coveted home made sriracha. They'll wish they were you as your face turns red from scarfing that wonderfully spicy chicken that may be too spicy for your white pallet but you literally cannot stop yourself from consuming it. Also I've heard they have breakfast so that's pretty cool I guess. 
Bonus: your beer comes with a branded koozie to add to the pile of envy in the office kitchen.
author: Christina C.

description:
This place is pretty dang good if you're craving some fried chicken! I luckily work nearby so it's super easy for me to swing by for a quick lunch or breakfast. Their breakfast options are simple, cheap, come with tater tots, and delicious. A little oily, but hey what do you expect from a fried chicken spot?

I also love their fries and the fact that they serve Sriracha ketchup. Moneyyyy! It's probably one of my favorite go-to "unhealthy" lunch spots. But beware: the line gets crazyyy long during lunch time on weekdays. So line up well before 12pm!
author: Sunnah W.

description: Is this the best chicken sandwich I've ever had? Yes. Was it perfect in every way? So so so close. I was in a full gorge sesh with my husband, practically making love to this chicken sandwich while the loaded curly fries watched. You too will have this experience. However, I'd be doing yelp a disservice if I didn't WARN about how this chicken sandwich tore up the roof of my mouth in the most painful way. My god if it wasn't so delicious I'd stop eating and nurse my mouth with what I expect is an equally delicious and soothing ice cream taco. Love this place and will definitely suffer the pain again one day once I've healed.
author: Daisy K.

description:
Came here based on Yelp reviews after visiting MOMA nearby. No lines, but busy inside. Good sign!

Ordered the classic chicken sandwich both regular and spicy. One with regular curly fries and the other loaded. It was good, but not fantastic. It's a really big piece of fried chicken, but it felt like it was missing something. The curly fries were fine, the loaded were ok, but again missing something.
author: corina o.

description:
Delicious for a quick bite! Get the non-spicy chicken sandwich if you can't stand heat. The hotness doesn't kick in until the aftertaste! The burger may look small, but is actually quite filling. The chicken is flavorful, bread is toasted perfectly, and the coleslaw (salad?) within pairs perfectly. Do order up their curly fries as well! 

You line up, order at the counter, pay, and find a table. They will call your name when your order is done. The interior is tiny so you may need to take to-go. Not much parking around, but location is easily accessible, as it is a 2 minutes walk from Montgomery Bart. Great place for lunch when craving a fried chicken sandwich!
author: Kristi T.

description:
The spicy bird is so spicy (and delicious). it makes my nose drip like a slightly leaky faucet. it burns my lips in peppery goodness. 

visited the bird game 4 of the nba finals 2018. warriors beat cavs. saw lebron cry. nothing like a good, spicy chicken sandwich and lebron tears to start a great weekend.
author: Christine Y.

description:
The Bird has been flooding my Instagram feed and it's obviously got a winning formula of tasty chicken sandwiches and a great location.  

We stopped by for a late lunch and it's nice to see it has continuous lunch to dinner hours.  There was a full crowd and lots of people dropping by with cameras.  Our order:

Fried Chicken Sandwich - $8.  Great fried chicken....probably double fried but very juicy and crispy on the outside.  I'm a little mixed on the slaw as it's a bit on the sour side with the pickles and the mix of celery, carrots, and cabbage don't really enhance the chicken sandwich for me.  I'd opt for naked next time.  I also think $8 is a bit on the high side for a chicken sandwich, but it is solid.  Didn't love the buns which are plain and forgettable.

Chicken Biscuit - $4.5.  They don't serve any other biscuit after breakfast so this smaller sandwich was our only choice.  I'd think the biscuit would be a killer combo, but the biscuit was dry and overcooked (was it left from breakfast) and the smaller chicken piece was too fried and both hard and dry.  Very disappointing.  

Fully Loaded Fries - $3.75.  The curly fries are covered with cheese and bacon.  Good and it's hard to not like something covered in cheese and bacon.  

Ice cream sandwich - $4.  They serve scoops of ice cream in the buns above that I didn't care for and I didn't like them for the ice cream sandwich either.  Yes, they include nuts and a warm chocolate sauce, but can you believe no one at the table wanted to finish this.  Yeah, that's not a stellar ice cream sandwich.

Overall, a nice stop but more notable for the great fried chicken in the main sandwich.  I didn't like the slaw and would opt for naked as well as skip the other menu items.

The Bird accepts credit cards, including Amex.
author: Randy F.

description:
They make a mean, MEAN fried chicken sandwich! I first tried a bite of my coworker's spicy chicken sandwich and immediately reminded me of Nashville hot chicken! (Even the red checkered wrapping paper!) I thought the spicy one was a bit too much for me, but I've gone back and tried the regular sandwich. The chicken is tender and juicy and packed with flavor, and the fried breading adds a great crunch. The buns are toasted, and the filling inside was delicious. There was a bit of celery and apple, which was a bit surprising, but adds a nice touch. Their loaded fries are also definitely worth getting. 

The lunch line looks intimidating even around 1 PM, but it went by surprisingly fast, so don't be too intimidated!
author: Ke C.

description:
This place is the definition of a SF/hipster chicken sandwich spot. The sandwiches here are good but it's been changed/hipsterized just enough if you're expecting comfort simple classics it's not what you're going to get. 
On my visit got the spicy chicken sandwich, loaded fries, and wings. 
The chicken sandwich was good, the meat was well cooked still moist and juicy. I like that they use thigh instead of beast which makes it more flavorful. It's served on a brioche bun and topped with pickles and apple slaw. IMO it wasn't that spicy, they use a spice rub based sauce that has a hint of heat and a fair amount of sweet. While I enjoyed it I still would have preferred a simple chicken sandwich dipped in hot sauce served on a potato roll bun like I'm used to back east, but for SF I'll take what I can get.
The wings were at best meh, they were large but really didn't have much flavor. The spice rub sauce was too sweet with no heat. Skip the wings and stick to the sandwich which is what they are good at. 
The loaded fries were a pleasant surprise, it's a bed of crispy curly fries topped with cream, nacho cheese, bacon, and scallions. It's simple stadium food but it was really well done and I liked it a lot. 
This place at peak hours has a line but they seem to be pretty fast and efficient. I'd recommend coming a little bit after the lunch rush to avoid the lines. Since there's no Chick-fil-A in SF, this place isn't a bad fall back option when a chicken sandwich craving strikes.
author: Peter P.

description: Best service hands down. Our order was ready by the time I paid. Food is awesome as well!
author: Johnny P.

description: This bird has flown the coop. Very disappointed first timer. Chicken very dry, overcooked, and tough. Struggled to cut with my knife and fork. How does one overcook chicken thighs that's normally the juiciest part of the bird? Two stars for the friendly and patient, order-taker cashier who explained the options. Salad ingredients fresh. Curly fries good. No chicken breast option.
author: Shelley F.

description:
This is the best spicy chicken sandwich in SF. Well worth the wait in line. I honestly didn't have much expectations going in, because I've eaten a whole lot of tasty chicken sandwiches in my life, hell, even chick fil-a is awesome. But this place just blows those other places out of the water.

Spicy Fried Chicken Sandwich (5/5) - The spicy chicken sandwich was perfectly juicy and had just the right punch of spice I was craving. I really enjoy spicy food, so the heat was no problem, though my friend, who doesn't take spicy food as well, was sweating a bit. The outside of the chicken had a decent crunch as well. The piece of chicken is a good size, not a small dinky patty like the one at chick fil-a. The coleslaw and pickles were strong compliments to the chicken. 

The curly fries were good, but pretty standard.

In my opinion this place is better than Howlin Rays in LA, which has a bit too much hype. I'd recommend coming here to anyone. If you're in SF you have to come here at least once.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Whenever I'm in the city I'm always excited to try out a new food place. Unfortunately not every food experience in SF has been pleasant but The Bird was certainly a great experience! The Bird was a bit hidden and hard to spot from the outside because it didn't have a sign that said it's name. Once we finally found the place we walked in, ordered and within 2 minutes, our food was ready! A fast food experience with quality food! I ordered the spicy fried chicken sandwich and the fully loaded fries. The food was also so cheap, another thumbs up! If busy, I'm sure it can get pretty crowded. There's a decent amount of seating around the area. 

Food: The spicy fried chicken sandwich was delicious! I believe they added some of their sauce and some cole slaw as well. The sandwich was huge and filling. 
The loaded fries were also delicious and filling!

Overall: Fast, cheap and delicious quality tasting food. If you're in the area I recommend you to try this place out.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
Checked out this spot right in front of our office a couple weeks ago.  I admitted the fried chicken sandwich was as good or better than many of the sit down restaurant that has famous fried chicken dishes.  The sandwich has the right amount of spice and accompanied by a sweet pickle on a soft bun - so delicious!!! 

Today I passed by and saw the long line - so the words must have been passed around!!! 

You must try this
author: Tom V.

description:
Yum, I love fried chicken! I came for a earlyish (11:30 am) social lunch out of the office and it didn't disappoint. There were a few people ahead in line but only about 5 mins to order. By the time I left at 12:15, the line was around the block so definitely get there early. The menu's limited, probably a good sign of focus. A few small tables indoors but don't count on sitting and dining in.

To cut back on the carbs and food coma, I had the salad with a whole order of spicy fried chicken. It was great quality and cooked perfectly juicy, tender but slightly springy, flavorful, on the inside, absolutely perfect texture. At the same time the breading was light and crispy. Definitely not like a Southern style extra floury breading a la Popeye's (my favorite) but like a fancy interpolation between chicken katsu and Chick fil A. The blend of spices was delicious and flavorful but didn't bring much heat. I also ate some curly fries, which were somewhat limp and reminded me of a less greasy Jack in the Box. $8 for a big fried chicken sandwich is a great deal for the heart of SF. I'd definitely come back given how close it is to work.
author: Truc N.

description:
This is the best fried chicken I've ever had. I stumbled upon it when it first opened and it was nearly empty. You surely won't find that any longer. 

I work near here now and have attempted to return but I'm not a big one for standing in lines and that seems to be the only way to get one of these delectable sandwiches these days. If you walk past and there's no line or it's not literally around the block, jump on it. You'll for sure be glad you did. 

My coworkers mentioned it recently and words failed me when trying to describe it. I resorted to yummy noises. They should seriously hire me to promote these sandwiches. I'm currently salivating just thinking about it. Bird, just keep doing what you do!
author: Anna P.

description:
The Bird is a mediocre chicken spot. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich combo which came with a sandwich and curly fries, and another guest in my party had the naked bird. The spicy chicken sandwich had a nice kick, it was a large fried chicken breast dipped in a Memphis like style sweet/savory hot sauce however it just lacked that "wow" factor. The slaw on the sandwich was ok, a bit vinegary and it also came with a pickle

My guests naked bird entree was a fried chicken breast cut up. The breading had a hint of sweetness to it that I didn't particularly care for and it came with many overly fried bits, almost more than chicken meat. I'm not a fan, however I do think that one should try it out for themselves, as everyone's tastes are different.
author: Aniah S.

description:
Simple menu, great sandwiches.  Homemade hot sauce is hot! 
We got spicy chicken sandwiches with curly fries to go for Opera at the Ballpark this year and it was perfect.  Came in after 5pm and was in and out.  
I love the slaw, pickles and everything else in the sandwich.  It's no Bakesale Betty but it's good enough.
author: Naty D.

description:
Order, sit, grab food when name is called type of set up.
The guy behind the register was friendly in explaining the selections though you feel bad taking too long because a line does form, understandably.. the food is good.
The spicy chicken is spicy, the ranch is great, and the loaded fries are seasoned and crisp..
Went back for seconds on the chicken biscuit and chicken sandwich.
Chill spot to grab a quick bite.. would deff recommend!
author: John D.

description:
The greatest pleasures in life are sometimes the simplest things. In this case, it's a fried chicken sandwich. YUM!

Pros:
+ Small menu
+ Ample seating
+ TV screens focused on the NBA Finals!
+ Affordable and delicious

Cons:
- They don't pick up their phones
- Don't think they deliver for large orders either

Recommendations:
+ Obviously, the chicken sandwiches (spicy!)

Still gotta try the regular sandwich.
author: Fanny W.

description:
So impressed with the bird. From the decor, the ambience and to the awesome menu, the bird definitely left me wanting more. 

Eats: 
The happier meal $12 9/10
(Spicy chicken sandwich, fries, choice of soda/beer) 
-where else can you get a happy meal that comes with beer?...exactly. 
-the fries were crisp, reminiscent of jack in the box curly fries but felt less greasy and has more crunch action. 
-chicken sandwich was definitely pleasing. The chicken itself exploded with so much flavor, I tasted smoky, spicy and sweet all in one bite. Definitely something I've never tasted before and definitely not just your ordinary chicken sandwich. The meat itself was super tender and the batter was just right, not too much nor too little. It held all that seasoning together without becoming soggy. There was a crunch in every bite. 
-the bun was super soft, I feel like it was an egg bun but I could be wrong. 
-pickles were tart and packed a punch. Did not take away from the sandwich at all 
-slaw was loaded with vinegar. Matched well with the other ingredients of the sandwich. 

Happy hour wings $2 each 7/10 
-wings had little to no batter on it. I enjoyed the natural crispness of the skin. 
-same seasoning of the chicken sandwich (sweet,smoky, spicy) 
-very juicy wing, but wished wing was larger. 
-is larger than wingstop/bdubs wings 

The bird is the place to go for your chicken needs. The unique flavor of the bird will keep you coming back for more. Excellent place to grab some lunch and for happy hour! Highly recommend!
author: James L.

description:
The establishment: buzzy
The service: Quick, kind, and hip - waited a total of 2 minutes after ordering sandwhich and the cashier gave me great hangover advice
The fries: Solid B+ - these are OK fries. Crispy enough, decently seasoned, but would prefer more crisp. 
The sandwich: B- - I consider myself a fried chicken expert. As any expert knows, your fried chicken should have a wealth of seasoning, be juicy in the inside without being greasy, and should have a hard crisped outside. I ordered the spicy version. I found it to have good spice, but the sandwhich was wayyyy tooo salty. In fact, I could barely finish the sandwich - all sodium. The slaw they put on it was crispy.

Overall: B. This place is OK. I probably wouldn't go back. Maybe to try the nonspicy version.
author: Jawhara T.

description:
I got here at 1:15 and there was a line to the door. Just be warned. The line did go pretty quickly though and I got my food within 15 minutes of getting in line, if not sooner. It stayed fairly busy the whole time I was there.

The whole space is executed well and they definitely have an efficient process worked out. This probably isn't a great place for a large groups as most of the tables are small and somewhat close together.

I got the spicy chicken sandwich, which was super good. I was amazed by how crispy the outside of the fry stayed and how moist the chicken was on the inside. Each bite released a bit of steam from the sandwich, it was incredible. I liked the slaw and pickles, they served as a nice counterpoint to the chicken and bun (which I think was brioche?).

Like others have said, the curly fries were nothing to write home about. Even so, I can't say no to curly fries. Do they even have regular fries??

On the other hand, their home-made sriracha is SO GOOD. So good. Is there a way I can buy a bottle? I was putting it on my sandwich and dipping my fries into it.

I'd go back. They had a pretty comprehensive selection of beer too.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Was in town for a conference and needed to get out of my hotel for breakfast.  I wondered up the street to this little spot and I am glad I did!  I had a great breakfast sandwich.  The place is clean and the decor is great.  My only (minor) complaint was the texture and size of the biscuit.  They were a little dry and small but it isn't bad for the west coast.  I've had better down south but these things were pretty damn good.  Go with the spicy chicken biscuit.  It's really good.
author: Rob P.

description:
Came during the lunch rush, but the move and workers move so quickly! I got the chicken sandwich (no spice), and it was amazing. Very flavorful, very juicy, and very crunchy! I also ordered a side of curly fries and enjoyed that as well. 

The Bird knows how to do it right, will def be back! I hear good things about the spicyyy version!
author: Carrie L.

description:
Hands DOWN. 

THE BEST muthafuckin chicken Sandwich i've ever had.

Juicy chicken, curly fries, tangy slaw and pickles.

"Happier Meals" come with a beer. You truly can't do wrong by going here
author: Matt S.

description: Keeping it simple is always the right play. The spicy chicken sandwich with fries and a beer was excellent. The chicken itself was almost an even blend of flavors reminiscent of Nashville hot chicken and Korean fried chicken. Home run.
author: Gray S.

description:
Somewhat overhyped, but this is still a nice place for a fast, affordable, and decent meal. Their chicken is pretty good. 
+ lightning fast food service
+ indoor and outdoor seating
+ fair pricing 
+ decent food
+ nice staff
+ beer selection

- limited menu options
- not much seating space/space between tables
- slightly above average but not great

To be fair I heard a lot of hype about this place and so I had my expectations up. Decided to come during dinner with friends; most of us ordered the Happier Meal, which comes w their signature chicken burger, a side of curly fries, and a beer for $12.50. Fair pricing for Downtown SF! And I gotta say the staff were very nice and food came out 2 min after ordering. 

In terms of taste, the chicken was tender and tasty. Overall, I would rate the food slightly above average. Decent but not great. Besides the chicken, everything was very standard. Personally, I found myself not a fan of the coleslaw and huge pickles in my burger, but hey, everyone's got their own preferences right.
author: Connie L.

description:
I would give this place a 3.5. I'm not really a fried-chicken-sandwich-type-person, so take this review with a grain of salt. That being said, since I'm not a fried-chicken-sandwich-type-person, it did not blow my mind to convert me. The husband, loved the sandwich - and he is a fried-chicken-sandwich-type-person. The loaded french fries were great and had that fake-gooey-cheese that is always so good. 

This place is great because (1) serves alcohol; (2) there is happy hour; (3) is open when everything else is closed.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
The chicken sammy and spicy chicken sammy are lovely with a delicious slaw atop.  The curly fries are crisp. My only issue with this place is the ice machine was filthy and they DO NOT HAVE SALT! There was not even salt on the fries.  BOooooo
Who serves french fries and then has no salt in the entire restaurant?
author: Sun M.

description:
Solid spicy chicken sando.. just missing the juiciness factor. Curly fries solid.. can't go wrong with curly fries.
Wings were solid.. just wished it was right in between peppery and sweet instead of peppery and sweet. Hope that made sense.

All to say I'd go again. And again. And again.
author: Ben L.

description:
I walked into this place on a Thursday evening (come at night if you don't want to wait outside for half a block) and was overwhelmed by the huge list of food options on the menu. The menu looked like it had as many options as In N Out! Should I choose the Naked Bird? A Bird salad? After careful consideration, I ended up choosing the Fried Chicken Sandwich ($8). After all, it looked like almost everyone in the restaurant was eating that sandwich. I ended up making the right choice anyways ;). 

The Fried Chicken Sandwich was crispy and the chicken was very thick! I liked how it was not oily nor salty. The bun was delicious! It did not taste like the 6-pack buns you would buy at Safeway. There was also a reasonable amount of cabbage and pickle. 

I came out of the restaurant feeling super full and satisfied. I will be back, 8-).
author: Kristina M.

description:
They pretty much do one thing but they do it perfectly. Think similar to chik fil a but cheaper and much higher quality. Its a small restaraunt but has plenty of seating in an upscale atmosphere and nice part of town. For around 10 bucks I got a giant spicy fried chicken sandwich and fully loaded curly fries. 

The chicken was juicy, crunchy, and flavorful and had a tasty but not overpowering heat to it for a nice kick. Its served on a roll with just the right amount of bread and topped with slaw and pickles sliced lenthwise. Im not usually a slaw guy but the sweet offset the spicy. They also have additional house made sriracha for anyone who wants it even hotter. All around a filling delicious chicken sandwich.

The fries are seasoned curly fries similar to arbys fries but better. I of course opted to get them fully loaded since bacon and cheese are always an upgrade. I devoured them instantly. So good! 

Service was friendly and helpful and the food arrived hot, fresh, and quick. You pretty much order at the counter and seat yourself and do your thing from there. Will definitly be back and highly recomend it for lunch to anyone working nearby around the downtown fidi area.
author: Sean G.

description: The spicy sandwich was wonderful and the slaw and pickles where just icing on the cake. Try to arrive just before lunch as the line grew quickly while we were eating. Quick service regardless.
author: Jared W.

description: If you're in the mood for spicy fried chicken, this is the place to go. The sandwich and even just the chicken is too good! Giving this a 5 because I can't think of anything that could be better!
author: Riya S.

description: We always go there if we are downtown, service is fast, the sandwich is the right hotness, and the music is always delightful. Plus we love the happier meal upgrade for grown ups.
author: Alec E.

description:
A place dedicated to fried chicken sandwiches!? YES! 

They only have like 5 things on their menu so you know it has to be good. 

I had the fried chicken sandwich, regular, with a side of curly fries. The chicken was superb - perfectly crispy and juicy. It came with a slab of apple slaw on top, which I wasn't particularly fond of. There was just way too much of it. The chicken was so good by itself, you didn't really need to dress it up with much else. 

Curly fries were on point. 

Next time I'm having The Happier Meal, which is all of the above plus a beer for $12.5.
author: Jeannette N.

description: I got the spicy chicken sandwich with curly fries. I probably should have gotten the regular chicken sandwich so I could get a baseline of how the chicken tasted, but I didn't. The chicken was all one big breast piece and the breading was nice and crisp. It was pretty spicy, the apple coleslaw really helped mellow out the spice. I also needed a couple of cups of water. The curly fries were great as well, not mushy at all. It came out to around $11 + tip, which is a pretty good price for the area.
author: Gretchen T.

description: Couldn't find anything wrong with this place. The chicken sando was cooked and seasoned perfectly with the best balance of onion/pickle/slaw. The tots crispy and my husband just licked the homemade Sriracha dish. The apple fritters were so good we got a dozen to bring home to the kids. But who am I kidding they're not likely to make it home!
author: Stephanie T.

description: Super fast!! Yummy spicy chicken sandwich...not spicy though. I'd go back for lunch...not super cozy vibe during dinner hour
author: Brigid M.

description: I'm very happy that this restaurant exists. It's such a simple and good idea I'm surprised someone didn't think of it sooner. Fried chicken alone is amazing, but eating the lightness of the apple slaw paired with the hearty fried chicken is a match made in heaven. This chicken manages to be juicy and tender on the inside, crispy on the outside, and flavorful through and through. It is a hefty burger and it's incredibly filling. The loaded fries are divine as well but a little expensive.
author: Naomi J.

description:
My family has been flooding with praise for The Bird for the better part of a month. They've tried to bring me twice now, only to be stopped by the reasonably limited open hours (opens at 9:00AM on Saturday, and is closed on Sundays). Finally, though, I was able to taste what my dad described as "the best chicken sandwich he had ever had". 

The restaurant feels clean. Despite how busy it is, you can tell the staff takes time to keep the place tidy. The menu is simple, making it an efficient ordering process. I decided on the spicy chicken sandwich, with my dad going for the original chicken sandwich and my mother opting for salad with chicken added on. 

That first bite was everything. I was Remy from Rataouille with music playing in the background and the flavors of the chicken manifesting as swirling colors around me. 

Actually though, the chicken was super juicy, the breading perfect in terms of ratio as well as seasoning. I could definitely taste the spice, but not so much that it overpowered the other flavors in the sandwich. The sweetness of the apple slaw and the tartness of the pickles really balanced the flavors of the chicken and the bun. The bun felt smaller than a normal bun, which was perfect, since I tend to find the amount of bread in a normal burger a little overwhelming. 

All in all, a perfect sandwich for a perfect price. I'll definitely be back again.
author: Waverly R.

description: The Bird have a great atmosphere with fast and efficient service. We ordered the spicy chicken sandwich with the loaded fries. I definitely fell in love with the loaded fries. The sandwich was flavorful but messy to eat. If you take it to go, I suggest eating the sandwich when you get to a table and not while you're walking or driving.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
We've been here a few times now and after every time, I consulted the interwebs to try to duplicate this amazing chicken sandwich.  Needless to say, I've been unsuccessful, but The Bird is just that memorable!  

I've had both the regular and spicy sandwiches, and I definitely prefer the spicy.  The regular was more peppery spicy, and spicy one has a different type of spice, more like a hot sauce type spicy.  It depends what you're looking for.  You choose what sandwich you want, type of fries, and a drink for $12.50.  Super reasonable, and for this reason I'd always recommend the "happier meal."  You also get a drink cozy for your beverage - BONUS! I've never tried the "fully loaded" fries, because all that heaviness just seems like too much for my stomach after a fried chicken sandwich.  
Each sandwich comes with coleslaw and pickles, which in my opinion, just makes the sandwich even more awesome.  If all of that doesn't tickle your fancy though, you can opt for a "naked bird", which is just as good.  Beware, the spicy chicken sandwich is quite drippy, so if you're not looking to get too messy, I'd rethink things unless you're a careful eater.  The mess is totally worth it, though.  I'm not lying.

I can't explain it - the chicken is perfectly fried and SO fresh and juicy!  The spice just tops it off.  The curly fries are also perfectly fried and seasoned.  

The only thing I would change about this sweet spot?  There are no gluten-free options, other than salad.  Boo.  

This last time, I had something to do in the area and my wife asked me to bring The Bird home for lunch.  The line was long, but don't be discouraged, it moves quickly and again, is very much worth it.  We were joking about how now that I'll be working in the area we'll need to create a limit for how many chicken sandwiches we can eat in a week.  Love the food, love the price, and love the staff vibes!
author: Ashley S.

description: I often go to The Bird for lunch, and the spicy chicken sandwich is exquisite. I am a big fan! 5 stars from me.
author: Ernesto P.

description:
Went on a weekday during lunchtime, so the line was pretty long.  However, it moved really quickly and my name was called right after I paid at the register, which was impressive.

The spicy chicken sandwich here is one of the best I've had.  It had the right amount of spice, and the chicken was really juicy/moist.  I also ordered curly fries with my sandwich, and I have to say that the fries eerily resembled the ones from Jack in the Box (which I also think are really good, so that wasn't a problem for me).  

I would definitely come again and I highly recommend this if you're looking for a bite to eat downtown.  Don't be scared away by the line - it's worth it!
author: Tim L.

description:
Loved our experience at The Bird ! I can't recall how I found this place, but after falling in love with Bakesale Betty's in Oakland I just knew we had to try this place. We got lucky with parking literally right in front of the shop, but don't plan on finding parking in this part of SF. We walked back and forth in front of it a couple times like idiots because it doesn't say "The Bird" anywhere outside so just know - you're looking for a sign with a FOX. 

We got two of the standard sandwiches and the fries. I love places where they have a limited menu - you know what this place is about. They also advertised a special that included the sandwich and a beer for $12.50 which, in the city, is a total steal. 

The sandwiches themselves were delicious - the slaw is flavorful and fresh which pairs nicely with a heavy fried chicken. We tried both the spicy and the regular and both were juicy, tender, and crispy, if a tinge on the greasy side. The sauce and bread are bomb too. I could take or leave the fries - they're tasty and the bacon is actual bacon, not bacon "bits" - but are pretty standard topped fries. The sandwich itself is different from Bakesale - it's more on the complex side flavor wise, but is still BOMB.

I can't wait to go back.
author: Kim B.

description:
Tl;dr: the fried chicken sandwich is delicious! The beer is cheap! They have ice cream tacos! The service is fast! Just go. 

I heard about the bird only recently, which was shocking as I love a good fried chicken sandwich and heartily miss the days when I could eat weekly Chick-fil-A back in Texas. So of course I hightailed it down there last week, and I was pleased by what I found. 
I got the spicy chicken sandwich (which was ready nearly instantly!); it had a spicy, crunchy slaw and came with a top-notch housemade sriracha. I also picked up some apple fritters on the side (3 for $1.50); they were good but cold/room temp, which made them less enjoyable. Next time I'll go on a warmer day and get an ice cream taco as dessert
author: Lindsey O.

description: OMG that is all I have to say. We were blown away by all the flavor. I wanted 5 spicy birds.. And the sauce at the tables OH MY GOD
author: Katherine U.

description:
Damn the lines here get really long during lunch. There aren't a whole lot of options but the ones you have are really good! I ended up with the sriracha chicken sandwich -- the spice isn't that strong but I think if I were to go next time I'd stick with the original and get the sauce on the side. 

The coleslaw in the burger definitely adds value to the eating experience especially if you're not a fan of spice. The curly fries are... okay. Potatoes are potatoes are potatoes ya know?

I also ordered some apple fritters which I think is the best bang for you buck if you have a sweet tooth. 

Overall a solid lunch spot if you're in fidi and if you're patient enough to stay in line for your meal.
author: Eunah T.

description:
I've been here way too many times.

The lunch menu is pretty simple: fried chicken sandwiches (classic or spicy--I highly recommend spicy), curly fries, and beer. This keeps the line, which is usually out the door around lunch time, moving quickly and I don't think I've ever waited more than a minute for my order.

At this price and quality, though, I'd gladly wait for 10 minutes. For $8, you get a big, chunky piece of chicken marinated in flavour (read: a berbere spice blend), and for $2.5 you get a generous side of crispy curly fries. I had this exact combo twice in my first week working in this area, I've had it many times since, and I'm going to keep coming back for more.
author: Yazad D.

description: Friendly service. Came at 8 in the morning so no crazy wait but there were people coming and going. Bummed I couldn't get their lunch (I know, it's breakfast but still). Got their breakfast biscuit sandwiches with fried chicken, spicy and regular. Friend liked the regular fried chicken. Mine was moist and definitely had the spicy but I wasn't a fan of the flavor of the sauce. It came off sweeter than I liked. Probably would've paired better with the lunch sandwich and not cheese and egg. Biscuit was super flakey and buttery. Comes with potatoes. House made Sriracha sauce was meh. Also a little sweet.  Would come back to try their lunch sandwich regular flavor. The beer happy meal is a nice touch!
author: Walerz B.

description:
Spicy fried chicken. Super crispy and super juicy. Topped with a light vinegar-ed slaw. On an amazing bun. And curly fries. They have curly fries. And homemade sriracha mayo. Oh. my. chicken.

Go here. Don't wait. I always recommend this place for lunch for colleagues travelling into SF.
author: Jennifer M.

description: The Bird really does a great job ensuring that they make an Instagram-worthy sandwich. When given the option of regular or spicy, I opted for spicy, and it was ready for me within a few minutes, which might account for the lackluster texture of chicken. When I first took a bite, I was confused if they accidentally gave me regular instead of spicy, but decided to use their side spicy sauce to add to it. I'm a big believer that when offered a spicy option, there should be zero confusion about if you got the right one--I want my mouth to burn a little bit! The meat was a strange color/texture, and the slaw was a bit too long and thin for my taste, leaving me with almost a hair-like feeling when I took a bite. I can definitely see the appeal of this unassumingly charming chicken shop, but I will probably not be back.
author: Elaura N.

description:
4.5 Stars

Portion size matches the price point, have no fear you will be satisfied 

Chicken is moist, flavorful and tender. One downside is that the exterior is not as crunchy as I would have liked. That aside, during peak, the sandwiches still come out hot and fresh and in an orderly fashion

Loaded fries is top notch goodness, on the smaller side but worth each delicious bite

Biscuit has good texture but crumbles too easily

Spiced version has a great lingering heat but the coating has a sweetness/spice rub to it that put me off

Overall Thoughts

Stick with the original and loaded fries!
author: Eddie W.

description:
One of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever had. Quick line and fast service makes what looks like a long wait short. 

If you're in the area it's must try
author: Kevin D.

description: Sandwhich, tatertots, and a coors banquet for under $13. Nothing fancy, but a fantastic chicken sandwich at very reasonable price.
author: Blake D.

description: As I waited in line down the block, I thought to myself "this had better be some cracking chicken sandwich".  Hoo-boy, was it ever.  Spicy, crunchy and moist all at the same time.  Gotta get back for the chicken biscuit.
author: Brady A.

description:
This was a good spot. The seating is a little tough, it wasn't to busy but it is a lot of group seating, or communal tables. There is alcoholic drinks there, I didn't partake, but cool to have the choice.

I had the chicken sandwich, it was a really really good sandwich, good size and the taste was definitely unique. quite a few tendons in the piece of chicken. But the flavoring was really good.

I also got the curly fries as well, they taste EXACTLY like Arbys, even my 6 year old pointed that out. Which there is nothing wrong with because those fries are delightful.
author: Ben C.

description:
SO. GOOD. 

This is by far the best spicy chicken sandwich I've had. I haven't tried Howlin' Ray's in LA yet, but that's on my list! I came here with my boyfriend and we split the combo meal. It comes with a chicken sandwich, curly fries, and a beer (Blue Moon was $1.50 extra). I think our total was around $14. So worth it! 
We got the spicy chicken sandwich and it definitely had a good kick. And if it's not spicy enough for you, they have housemade Sriracha hot sauce that you can add. The sandwich was a pretty good size. They definitely don't skimp on the chicken! It was juicy, perfectly fried, and crispy. I loved the slaw that came with it, it perfectly complimented the chicken with a little sweetness from the apple. I almost wanted to order another one after I had finished mine LOL.

Can't wait to come back!
author: Alyssa W.

description:
Had walked by and missed it at first.  Their logo is a wolf with a burger in its mouth. I was expecting to see a bird. $8 for a classic chicken sandwich and $3.75 for loaded curly fries.  Was delicious. Came by just before 5pm on a weekday, no wait. Food was ready within minutes. Fried white meat chicken was very moist. Love the slaw and pickles. I'm usually not a fan of siracha (i know!) but I couldn't stop putting on their homemade siracha on every bite of my sandwich. Fries were indeed loaded with nacho cheese, green onions, bacon and sour cream. What's not to love? 

They also have happier hour. $13 for chicken sandwich, fries and a beer.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description: Always enjoy getting a fried chicken sandwich, fries and a PBR. Quality is consistent and service is friendly and efficient. Lunch lines move pretty fast. Most orders are takeouts.
author: D B.

description:
There were many things that I liked about this place. In summary: 
+ Fast service 
+ Clean tables 
+ Good food (the spicy chicken sandwich was amazing) 
+ Filling portions 
+ Reasonably priced 
+ Convenient location from the muni station 

Here's the longer version: I almost walked past The Bird because there was no written sign that this was where The Bird was located. I only figured out that I had passed it when I saw that there was bustle of people waiting in line to order. The person taking my order was knowledgeable and was able to give me some recommendations depending on my preference. After some contemplation, I decided to go with the spicy chicken sandwich. There was definitely enough spice to give the sandwich a kick.

With regards to service, I was impressed with the speed of how quickly they got the food out in a timely fashion. I also liked the slaw that they put in the sandwich. It paired very well with the fried crispy goodness of the chicken underneath. I will come back here again in a heartbeat when I am craving a fried chicken sandwich.
author: Lynn T.

description:
As it should be, the chicken here is amazing.  I got the chicken sandwich, but I have to say that I think I would rather just eat the chicken.  The bread, slaw, and pickles just seemed superfluous to me.  I like the reasonable prices and quick service so I would definitely come back in the future.  

I've also tried the breakfast.  It was also really good, but I think the chicken at lunch tasted better.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Their breakfast is a super good deal, as you can get their chicken biscuit for less than $5. However, their apple fritters are a game changer. Soft on the inside with a crispy outside and a cinnamon glaze, these were 5/5 and go great with an iced coffee. It is worth a trip just to get these apple fritters, especially because you can get 3 for just $1.50.

I've been here for lunch as well, and their chicken sandwich is not the best I've had, but is very solid especially compared to the standard options like Chik fil A. They use chicken thigh which means the sandwich is juicy and not dry, along with a nice blend of spices, but the pickled veggies on the burger were a bit salty and took away from the chicken. Still, it was a decent 4/5
author: Alan N.

description: Don't be afraid of the long line, it is super fast, super good! Go for the fully loaded fries ;)
author: Leo A.

description:
Went here for lunch during the week. There was a line but it goes fast.  So fast that my order was ready before I received my change.  Now that's customer service. 
I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich which was delicious and not too spicy to me.  In addition, I got the curly fries, which were crispy and warm. 
Overall I would definitely return to this place.
author: Frank A.

description:
Come before 11:30 am for your chicken sandwich fix (or you'll be waiting as you watch others devour their chicken; you rather be sitting there eating and have others watch you devour your chicken.) Get it spicey if you're looking for a little extra flavor. 

$8 gets you a tender, crispy, juicy, flavorful fried chicken sandwich in the middle of fidi. That's amazing. $12 gets you a fried chicken sandwich + curly fries + beer. 

I've also heard the breakfast is AMAZING! Will come back for it and update my review. 

Thank you, the bird. You've made lunch during the week amazing.
author: Dana Z.

description: Loved loved loved.!!outdoor seating. Small portions at great prices. Very tasty. Friendly and fast service. Alcoholic options.You can't miss with this spot. .
author: Ebony R.

description:
affordable and yummy eats! Clean bathroom. 
Note that the spicy is extremely spicy. Was not expecting it and wasn't able to finish my sands.
author: Prash A.

description:
Color, texture, flavor, spice. The spicy Chicken bird sandwich has it all. Top it with the homemade Sriracha sauce for a double whammy and you'll wake up craving it on random weekend mornings like I do. You might think you don't like slaw but get it any way. The sweetness of the apple contrasts beautifully with the spiciness of the chicken. 

Lines go by fast (you'll probably wait 30 - 60 second per person in front of you) but they start forming early. I usually come around 11:45 PM to minimize my lunch time wait.
author: Arushi S.

description:
I walked a very far distance to make it to this Chx Sandwich joint.  Its been on my bookmarks for a lonnnnng time so I was excited. 

I can easily say I wasn't impressed.  The staff wasn't friendly at the front or when picking up my order (ie: guy even gave me a snarky comment when I asked him where the ketchup was).  Every available seat was extremely dirty and no one was cleaning at all.  The sandwich itself just wasn't that great.  I thought the accompaniments took over the flavor of the chicken and I just felt like I was eating a bun with apple slaw, celery, pickles...etc.  No bueno.
author: John H.

description:
I tried their regular chicken sandwich and their spicy version.  Both are excellent with a nice topping and bun.  It's a good choice for lunch.  There are a few other selections including fries and beer.  Not much else.  Place is always packed with a long line outside.

If you love a fried chicken sandwich lunch, this is a great place to go.
author: Keith S.

description:
The Bird was a great find in DTSF. We were looking for something quick, cost efficient and delicious that our group of 6 could all enjoy. This place did the trick.

I was a bit disappointed that the chicken is dark meat. Surprisingly, though I typically HATE dark meat chicken this was pretty good. My husband told me his chicken was over cooked and dry, though mine was nice and juicy. 

My mom and sister in law got theirs spicy and said it was a spicier than they hoped/expected but they thought overall the sandwich was good. I got mine "classic" and it had a little kick that was just perfect. The service was quick and friendly. The place got crowded for lunch and seating is very limited so be prepared to wait. The curly fries were good, though nothing spectacular. 

So if quick, delicious and nicely priced is what you're looking for then I'd definitely recommend this place!
author: Ronna B.

description:
Walking towards the restaurant, if you see a long line, that is for The Bird.  But because their menu does not have a massive selection and their cashiers are efficient, the line goes by quickly. I went on a Friday for lunch and even managed to find a seat for me and my friend to dine in! 

Here I ordered the chicken sandwich ($8) and my friend order the happy meal ($12.50), which comes with a beer with a beer cozy, curly fries, and a chicken sandwich. I thought the chicken sandwich was amazing! The chicken was moist and juicy. The slaw in the sandwich topped it off and completed the sandwich.

TL;DR The Bird has great value and the food is good.You can expect to pay closer to $15+ at other lunch spots in FiDi. So many people here on yelp compare it to Chickfila, but I think it is incomparable. You can't even get Chickfila in the city so proximity-wise it's not an alternative to The Bird if you are craving a chicken sandwich.
author: Steph L.

description:
So, chicken's never really been my thing. But, this chicken is my thing, savvy? 

I got the spicy chicken in sandwich form and it made me feel like a satiated feral creature that would have chased this very chicken down if fried chickens were still living creatures that could run. 

That said, my spouse had eaten this chicken on the reg and sometimes experienced a dry chicken.

 I believe spouse to be wrong and hold to it that this is peak chicken. Is that cumin on this chicken?

 Spicy chicken. Good chicken. Chicken with good slaw sweetness balance. I love you chicken. If I was a fox you would clearly be the one I would run off with in my mouth!
author: Liss T.

description: This was one of the only $ places open at 7:30pm in the financial district. VERY HAPPY I ate here. The chicken biscuit is available all day and was the perfect portion for me. It's also only $4! Note to self though, I would probably get the original next time. The spicy was delicious, but I found myself chugging water every second.
author: Mandy P.

description:
The Bird has a winning combo of affordable pricing, delicious chicken, and plenty of communal high top seating inside.

I ordered the original chicken sandwich per the recommendation of the man taking my order and I was definitely not disappointed. I do think the chicken is one of the best fried chicken I've ever had. Crunchy breading, but not too thick where it takes away from the chicken or scraps the roof of your mouth. When you take a bite the stringy dark chicken meat is flavorful, moist, and wonderfully steaming hot (literally!) I also love the slaw/pickles they put in there that really gives it a nice acid kick. 

Lunch can get pretty crazy, given how close it is to Montgomery BART, but we didn't have trouble getting there around 11:30. Would absolutely come back again.
author: Swan L.

description:
I'm surprised when people tell me the sandwich is just "ok." I've never found anything wrong with the food and it's always been great to me. There's a reason why the line is huge at lunchtime. I'm giving this place 5 stars because the sandwich is damn good, the service is very quick, and the price doesn't make me cry. For ~$9 after tax, this is a good value in SF. 

comparison: 
- Chick-fil-A in Fremont is ~$7.50 for a sandwich and a drink. The Bird's sandwich is much larger and far better (Chick-fil-A is garbage compared to The Bird)
- Hot Sauce and Panko is $11 for wings and a waffle. I think I'm getting better value and better food at The Bird.
- Sandwich shops around the area: you're gonna pay over $12 on average, and most of these places are no big deal. The only better value I can think of around the area is Saigon Sandwich.
author: Lance W.

description: Great chicken sandwich!! Spicy, LOVE pickles and a nice slaw...  Definitely go there again
author: Phil S.

description: When they say loaded and spicy, they mean it. Delicious flavor and juicy chicken. Also got a beer to go so that's superb.
author: Christina F.

description:
Mmmm, mmmmm, mmm! Just tasty! I always get the spicy fried chicken sandwich. The slaw is light and not super drenched in mayo! The chicken itself is fried nicely, packed with flavor and is nice and juicy on a consistent basis. Don't forget to try the loaded fries, which is curly fries with the fixins! 

It gets really crowded for lunch, but the line moves fast. Afterall, they're just constantly frying chicken and putting the sandwiches together. There aren't too many seats, but they do have a couple tables outside as well. They're also open pretty late, so you can come for a later dinner after grabbing drinks downtown or in SOMA. If you haven't had enough to drink, The Bird also sells beer! I hear their breakfast sandwiches are also well worth trying!
author: Aaron Y.

description:
Yeah I mean that sandwich is good.. BUT LETS ALSO TALK ABOUT THE BISCUIT. 

That is a biscuit I can get down with. Then proceed to die from a heart attack because of its buttery filled goodness. 

I tried to be good today and get a salad, (also delicious-- spicey chicken, beets, celery? YUM) but I also ended up with a side of biscuit. YAAAS. 

You can totally miss the signage-- its called the bird but the sign shows a fox with a chicken sando in its mouth. You wont miss the extreme line though! Worth the wait.
author: Maggie Y.

description:
A perfect example of doing one thing, and doing one thing very well. The chicken biscuit and chicken sandwich are all anchored by the really well executed fried chicken. Generously portioned and flawlessly crisp, the sandwiches are delicious.

The chicken biscuit which is $4.5 is I believe 1/2 of the chicken of a regular sandwich and come between a flaky biscuit (soft, fluffy). I requested the spicy chicken and it was a very mild spicy.

The regular sandwich came with cole slaw and pickles. It was all very tasty and very agreeable to the wallet.

The apple fritters were okay - nothing to write home about - seems to be the same base batter as the biscuit, but I wouldn't go out of my way to order these.
author: Madison W.

description:
UGHHH FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH!! Loooong lines but it is well worth the wait. My friends and I started lining up about half a store space from the corner and reached the entrance in about 20 minutes. Food came within 5 mins which is good because I'm starrrrvinnnnn. For $8, you got a huuge chicken sandwich. For another $2.50, you get curly fries, which is a pretty good deal IMO. This sandwich was packin'. Huge piece of fried chicken which was cooked well and flavorful. The slaw was a lot too. One thing I wish I could have more of was the mayo. I could only finish half of my sandwich and saved the other half for later. The curly fries were yum too. The fully loaded fries were even better. I would definitely come back another time. Drooling for the ice cream sandwich.

Place is also pretty small. Seats about 30 people tightly. Located in the back of the store is water, sparkling water, ketchup, napkins, etc.
author: Benita M.

description:
The Bird does it right.  You know what the smartest idea in the Restaurant game is?  Have a small menu and absolutely crush the two or three things that you do.  Don't have eight sandwiches.  Have One and make it Original or Spicy.  Brilliant.  Take a page out of this playbook if you are thinking of getting into the game.

A good chicken sandwich is hard to beat.  What are the keys?  Good Chicken.  Make it a nice, substantial, juicy piece.  Does it just melt in your mouth?  Yep.  Is Chicken the main ingredient in the sandwich?  You betcha.  How is the flavor?  Awesome.  Right on track.  Breading?  Just adds to the Flavor and Texture.  Flavor?  Flavorful.  How Flavorful?  Very.  What about the Spicy Version?  Makes the Chicken pop, blends with the breading, and sets of the rest of the favors.  Winning.  I will add that the Relish, Sliced Pickles and Mayo are the perfect topping.  If I had to knock this place down to a 4.85 or so, it would only be because they should use a slightly bigger roll for the sandwich.  They do a nice job dealing with the fact that the sandwich falls apart while eating it by wrapping it in paper that sorta acts as Chicken Sandwich Spanx (much like the In-N-Out wrapper being Double-Double Spanx).  I think they get the balance right, but I would be fine with more bun.  That said, I know there are a lot of non-Viking-like people for whom another 50-75 calories (carbs too) aren't a draw.  If you know what to do going in, you can manage it.  I recommend getting a fork while you pick up your food.  

I am a fan.  I recently tried their Fully Loaded Curly Fries (you can also just have regular curly fries).  For $3.75 they were well worth it.  I was working nearby on a Saturday - I think the Chicken Sandwich alone is plenty for lunch.  I have not tried their Chicken Wings, the last piece of the puzzle.  They also have a nice Bottle/Can Beer selection.  I've noticed that they have a Sandwich/Fries/Beer special for around $12 which is a heck of a bargain.  I've only gone on workdays.  

This was a terrific addition to New Montgomery.  The Melt was in this spot before and it was a spot I only really went because it was open on a Saturday.. This is a spot I look forward to getting a chance to hit as a result of working Saturdays.  After three trips, the bloom isn't coming off the rose.  Oh, and by the way...  They are fast!  They are practically faster than Jimmy John's.
author: Adam S.

description:
I work near The Bird and frequent the restaurant when I have a craving for something yummy and fried.

I have tried their regular and spicy chicken, the spicy chicken sandwich is to die for! I have yet to try their wings, which they only serve after 3 pm. 

The service has always been fast despite the long line that you will find during rush hour. I can't blame them, The Bird is that good!!! Oh and did I mention cheap :)
author: Lovejit K.

description: Tonight I was on Montgomery after going to see a flick at the Embarcadero theatre. I initially thought I would go to Chipotle, but it was closed. I looked around and saw something open on the other side of the street. I got closer and realized it was The Bird!! I had seen Bird on Yelp before and meant to visit a while ago, but never made a special trip. So tonight it was the only thing open on Montgomery around 9-9:30 pm. I decided to eat there. Z was with me, but he's vegetarian. I ordered the combo spicy chicken sandwich with curly fries and a soft drink instead of beer. It was $13-13.50. It was very delicious and I enjoyed myself there. The seating was pretty full at that time. We were lucky to get two seats together. Crispy chicken sandwiches are popular in SF at bars and all. There's Proposition chicken. I think I had a fried chicken sandwich last week in the Marina. I go for it unless it makes me terribly obese. The Bird was good!
author: Denise C.

description: I've been to The Bird a few times now and it's been a good experience each time. I view it as a "fancier" chick-fil-a. I've tried the classic and spicy sandwich, and so far the classic has been slightly better every time. The loaded fries are absolutely amazing and if you don't order them you are missing out. Curly fries with bacon, melted cheddar cheese, green onions, and sour cream? Yes, please. The line is extremely long at lunchtime, but they are pretty quick and the food comes out quickly as well. It's definitely worth trying if you like fried chicken sandwiches, and who doesn't like fried chicken sandwiches?
author: Radhika G.

description:
Tasty quick snack!

Right after I ordered, my order was ready, I was amazed. I got the spicy chicken sandwich with a side of curly fries. The chicken sandwich was so good, the chicken was well-seasoned, juicy, with a crispy outer shell. The slaw in the sandwich was so good, it was crisp and refreshing and cooled down the spiciness/heat of the chicken, but I definitely wish there was more of it in my sandwich. 

The order of curly fries skimpy and a super small portion, as I pretty much had 2 decent size curly fries and a bunch of small crumby pieces. The housemade sriracha was bomb to dip the curly fries in though!

Would come back for the spicy chicken sandwich for a quick snack if I was in the area but probably going to skip the curly fries next time.
author: Jennifer C.

description: This place is really good.  Tasty chicken sandwhiches.    I recommend it if you want a place to eat in the SOMA and it's not the normal burgers.   Prices are pretty decent too.  Standard for the area I got the meal.
author: Homer S.

description: This is one of my favorite lunch spots, but today I ordered a salad and didn't realize it had quinoa in it until it was too late. My stomach can't seem to digest this stuff and I ended up throwing up. It'd be helpful if the ingredients were visibly posted.
author: Yesenia P.

description: My favorite place to get a chicken sandwich! Since SF doesn't have Chick-fil-A, I was hunting for a replacement. The bird is definitely an upgrade version of Chick-fil-A!! Love their classic/spicy chicken sandwiches and curly fries!! The only downside is their hours. So make sure to check before going!
author: Theresa H.

description:
I saw the rave Yelp reviews of The Bird and had to check it out - though I walked right past it because there isn't a big sign outside.

Tip: come at dinner to avoid the lines. I had no problem ordering and getting my food around 5:15 p.m. I got the classic chicken sandwich and curly fries for ~$13. 

This is a hefty sandwich served with pickles, mayo and coleslaw. It will get messy, and you will need napkins. The chicken is well done - very juicy and tender though my sandwich had a bit too much fat to it. Fries were good but nothing super special.

The Bird was good, but not "OMG wow, I would wait 30 minutes in line for this" in my opinion.
author: Katie U.

description: Wow! The line was out the door and almost around the corner when I stopped by at 11:30 am. It was recommended from a local and I could not thank him enough! It was well worth the wait. Don't let the line turn you away, it moves fairly quickly.
author: Ashlee M.

description: Chicken sandwich was good but not as spicy as I anticipated. Chicken was crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside. The coleslaw and pickles was the perfect balance. Curly fries we're just ok. Seems like we got the scrap pieces from the batch because none of our fries were actually curly... but their house hot sauce made up for that. Adding their house hot sauce to the sandwich gave it an extra kick but still not spicy enough for my palette. I tried the bfast sandwich the morning before since they don't serve the chicken sandwich until 10am. Sausage egg biscuit was pretty good because of the sauce they use but nothing extraordinary.
author: Joyce K.

description:
1 star for charging extra ranch and acting snobby about it being home made. 

They're a bit light on the fries they give you too. You get better value at wes burger.

Edit: to respond to the owner: 
1. Maybe avoid penny pinching your customers for ranch sauce while putting barely on the actual sandwich 
2. Im supportive of you providing for your employees. I'm not supportive of you being a snob about your mediocre sauce being homemade
3. Keep charging $2.50 a chicken wing though and $2.50 for soda though. You're doing san francisco a solid

Imagine you put as much effort into putting ranch sauce on your buns as you did arguing with customers that are calling you out.
author: Kunaal A.

description:
This place is very cute! I went here for dinner one night, and I was amazed by the chicken sandwich. It's still one of the best sandwiches I've had in the city. Also, their beer selection was great! It was a nice middle ground of delish, good food and good beer for a very reasonable price.

A few downsides:
1. The space is small - it can be hard to find a seat. Also, the tables are very close together. It felt a little tight.
2. The chicken sandwich is a bit messy. The sauce was dripping everywhere, and it was very hard to keep clean during dinner. I would NOT recommend this as a first-date spot.

All-in-all, though, I'd defintiely come back for another one of those sandwiches :)
author: Remy B.

description: Amazing with a capital A! Had an awesome spicy fried chicken biscuit here with hashbrowns. I also drizzled some of the house made siracha on top. For dessert I had the apple fritters which were mind blowingly good. Delicious, affordable, and really hits the spot. This place is epic.
author: Shawn K.

description:
TLDR - Good, guilty lunch. They know what they do right and they do it

The bird is intense. Each bite is like a flavor boom, and that's what you want out of it. 

The chicken is succulent, juicy, and crispy all at the same time. The skin is so crispy i thought it was bacon at first.

So the first time I went I got the classic bird sandwich. that thing is good and quite heavy. This time, I got the naked bird. The naked bird was good too, just chicken and coleslaw which is the real point. HOWEVER - I will say that I think you get more meat in a sandwich honestly. The only real other difference is the addition of pickles and the buns.. I don't believe that the buns have any sauce spread on the inside or anything.

The fries were my favorite and so terrible objectively. like i felt guilty with every amazing bite of those loaded fries.
author: Samraaj B.

description:
This is a bittersweet, overdue review. I was craving fried chicken today, scrolling through Yelp! recommendations and came across The Bird. On the one hand, it is some of the BEST fried chicken I've ever tasted in my life... juicy, perfectly crispy crunch, spiced just right. Yes, there is a line, and is crazy hectic during the lunch rush... all worth it. Sadly, I will never have this most delectable amazing chicken again, as I discovered after eating the spicy chicken sandwich that I am very allergic to the berbere spice mix, probably the fenugreek. 

That being said, dealing with the steroids, and heavy duty antihistamines for days afterward were worth it... that's how amazing this spicy fried chicken sandwich is. 

Now get yourself to the Bird, eat this amazing fried chicken and be thankful you're not one of the very small percentage of people allergic to it!
author: Amanda F.

description: It's worth the wait in line. One of the best fried chicken sandwiches I've ever had. The apple fritters are pretty good too.
author: Matthew P.

description:
CLUCK YEAH, this is how a fried chicken should be!  The Bird has been on my radar ever since pre-opening.  Who doesn't love fried chicken sandwiches?  They kept their lunch/dinner menu easy with only a choice of regular or spicy fried chicken sandwiches. Now they have breakfast sandwiches.  I want to try their chicken biscuit sandwich, The Bird, can you extend breakfast hours until 11:30 or 12?  

I had plans to meet my friend here for lunch last week but some work kept me over our meeting time.  So she was kind enough to grab our food and meet me at my office.  I got the regular fried chicken sandwich and she got the spicy.  We shared some curly fries. I saw on their site they mentioned celery and mayo so I told her no celery and mayo.  I guess the celery is mixed in already with their cabbage mixing because I only got pickles and chicken between my bread.

The fried chicken sandwich was simple, but oh so delicious.  The perfect blend of spices coated the crispy chicken.  Every bite of chicken was so juicy and flavorful.  I don't like pickles, but these pickles were pretty dang good!  In between the soft bread, this hunk of delicious meat was so filling.  Curly fries were forgettable and not that crispy and didn't have much flavor.  

It's a steal at $8, especially for the area.  I'll be back to get my fried chicken fix during work.  Just two bits of advice for The Bird, I know I wasn't there in person to order, but can you please specify if the celery is mixed in with the slaw, I don't believe it is, and a lot of people don't like celery, so it would be cool to separate the two if they're not.  And two, seriously, can you consider extending breakfast hours, because the fried chicken biscuit sandwich looks amazing!
author: Cat C.

description:
Solid hot chicken sandwiches! While I'm not normally one for spicy foods, I've been to Nashville and had Hattie B's, which first turned me onto these great sandwiches. I've been here twice now and had both the regular and spicy. The spicy was plenty hot for me (read: multiple drink refills, slow to finish), but one of my friends from Atlanta added more of their House Sriracha to raise the heat. I'll leave his verbal review below:

"This is a really solid hot chicken place! Didn't know SF would even have one. While Hattie B's amps up pretty fast, this one has a nice level burn to it. I like it!"

He was pretty hyped up even after the meal. 
Would recommend and return!
author: Cindy S.

description: Good deep fried chicken sandwiches for lunch. The spicy version definitely has a kick to it with that whatchamacallit Viet hot sauce flavor. Always ordered takeaway because the place is packed. The lines are pretty long but they process fairly quickly like an assembly line (menu after all is pretty simple). Will need to try the breakfast items sometime.
author: Sonny W.

description: I had the spicy chicken sandwich. There was a line out the door but they were super fast. I would go back again. Great for lunch.
author: Scot M.

description:
Today I saw an article about a restaurant owner re-selling Popeye's chicken in their $10-$15 chicken and waffles entree. My coworker asked me if I would actually be able to tell the difference between Popeye's chicken and any fried chicken.

I thought, hmm for some places yes, and for some places no. This place is a solid YEEEEES.

Whoa, let me just say, first it's only $9 for a fried chicken sandwich (for FiDI that's a huge deal). And now, let's talk about the actual sandwich. What are they doing to that chicken? Because the piece I got was moist, well seasoned, and cooked to perfection. I really also like that it's topped with pickled cabbage and pickles. They complimented each other very well.

So worth! I loved it.

Space is nice. There's seats if you go early. I went at 11AM and plenty of seating but when I left around 12PM, there was a line out the door.
author: Mimi T.

description:
My coworker and I are always here... Like ALWAYS. This place is kinda small but they make it work. It's decorated nicely and I enjoy the atmosphere, not to mention the staff is always super friendly and ridiculously fast!

I always get the spicy chicken sandwich with everything on it and loaded fries! 

The chicken is tender, juicy, and the perfect amount of crunchy and spicy. The apple coleslaw is tangy and compliments the sandwich beautifully, as well as the zesty pickle and soft warm bun. This is hands down my fav chicken sandwich!
But the LOADED FRIES though!!! They're so good!! With cheese, sour cream, green onions, and BACON! Ugh if you haven't been here yet you're seriously missing out...
author: Nicole H.

description:
Spicy Fried Chicken Sandwich -- that's all you need to know about The Bird.

I haven't had a good spicy fried chicken since High School and The Bird definitely made me feel like I was in HS all over again.

Place gets busy but wait goes by quick. The workers work really hard to move the line and menu is super simple. 

Spicy Fried Chicken Sandwich - $12
Curly Fries - $3.75

All worth it. I'll be back!
author: Danny L.

description: Get the "happier" meal: classic or spicy (gotta be spicy if you can handle some heat) chicken sandwich, 'healthy' side of curly fries, and a can of beer in a free cozy you get to take with you. If you've still got an ounce of space left in your stomach, ask for an order of apple fritters (3pc). Quality flavors and worth the price.
author: Ally B.

description: Amazing chicken sandwiches! The fries are slightly salty. The line is longer at peak hours and finding a seat may be hard.
author: Para S.

description:
The First thing that came to my mind when i ate at this place is:
Don't you Know about "The Bird", Everyone knows "The Bird" is the Word.
Buh-buh-buh Bird Bird, Bird is the Word.
---Family Guy, Peter Griffin.

Alright, So i was here today for Lunch and reached the place around 12:40 PM, i was out with my food at 1:00 PM or a couple of minutes less. Though they have a line outside these guys are rolling orders. So don't be worries about line, join in.

Also the food is worth it, i mean it ain't exceptional but it is a very good Fried Chicken Sandwich. The unique thing about the sandwich is the Flavor, it is spicy but it also had a bit of tropical flavors. The Fried Chicken Sandwich is definitely worth trying once.  
The Curly Fries, were they curly,i had a few curly fried but the remaining were just arched. i mean my hair are more wavy, which required a pound of Wax to straighten it up. Also the flavor is okay.

But try the chicken sandwich while you are here you wont regret it.

Also they give you free beer(Pawtucket Patriot Ale), if you sing "The Bird" song by peter griffin on the counter (I am joking, lol)
author: Urvish -.

description:
I take my 3 stars back back. The bird sandwiches were just o.k., but in the last few months, they have really solidified their game!
The sandwiches are great - flavorful, generous on the crispy chicken and slaw, and piping hot! and the service is decently fast (so don't let the long line worry you tooo much).
author: Grace P.

description:
Probably the best chicken sandwich in the city. The chicken sandwich is seasoned with a berbere spice that I've haven't tasted in many other restaurants. 

Reasonable prices and amazing food, can't ask for more.
author: Katie N.

description: this place is a very good quick stop for lunch. their service is quick and the cashiers are really nice. my favorite thing on the menu is the original chicken sand which. it taste really good. this is a good place to eat
author: Jaymund L.

description:
TLDR - Crispy, juicy, deliciously fried chicken. So much satisfaction for $8

I'd heard a lot of good things about the fried chicken sandwiches at The Bird and honestly thought it might be overhyped like so many things in SF. But no, these sandwiches really ARE that amazing. I'm not really a fried chicken eater in general. A lot of the time, the chicken is dry or bland and if I'm going to be eating something so deeply fried and caloric, it better be damn good. So trust when I say this fried chicken is worth it.

* FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH ($8)
[regular or spicy; celery, house made apple slaw, mayo, pickles & bun]
Two giant pieces of chicken, fried to a nice crisp, yet still tender and so juicy inside! I got mine spicy, which my friend and everyone else on Yelp seems to think is very spicy, but I actually didn't think it was spicy at all. It was definitely big with flavor though. The fluffy, buttery toasted bun soaked up all the juices and the bright, tangy apple slaw and pickles complemented the flavor of the chicken well. I just wish there was more slaw/pickles to go with the hefty portion of chicken.
