The curly fries are good here as well (crisp!) and my friend said the ice cream sandwiches are delicious. They recently added a breakfast menu with a chicken biscuit sandwich for $4.50 too.

It's probably good I don't live or work near The Bird, otherwise I'd probably be having these $8 sandwiches more often than I should.
author: Jessie L.

description:
(09/02/17) 3.5 stars round down for now. I had been looking forward to trying this spot. I was still excited even after the long drive in traffic and minutes to find parking on a very busy and extremely hot day in the city (102°). 

I ordered the spicy fried chicken sandwich and curly fries ($10). The quality of the sandwich was good. The slaw gave the spice good balance and the pickles didn't overpower, which was nice bc that's why I usually order sandwiches without them. The spice itself was delicious but it almost had a sauced texture on the chicken which took away from the crisp/crunch of the breading, which is what I enjoy most with fried chicken. So that was a bit of a bummer. The chicken itself was plenty and juicy. The curly fries were hot and tasty but not much portion IMO. 

I will likely come back and try the regular fried chicken sandwich for a better crisp/crunch texture that I look for.
author: D B.

description:
Tasty and affordable fried chicken sandwiches! In downtown SF! What!! 

I found this place through browsing through Yelp reviews (shout out to Yelp Elite Jessie L.!), and believe me, this place is as good as everyone says! They are known for their fried chicken sandwiches ($8), in regular or spicy. The chicken was tender and crispy, and complimented so well with the buttery buns and crunchy pickle and apple slaw. I ordered the spicy sandwich, which is as spicy as sriracha gets (so not very spicy), and I was happy that my last bite included most of the ingredients, not only the buns, or the chicken. :) We also added curly fries ($2.50), which was just as crispy.

Very clean interior. You order up front and there are plenty of seating inside and outside. If you are sitting inside, be aware that you'll leave smelling a little like fried chicken. 

My friends and I visited on a Friday night and there was no line. Friendly staff and very quick service - food was ready within 3 minutes.

Street parking available but limited, since it is located near downtown SF.
author: Wendy F.

description:
Where to begin?! The bird is located right outside of my work on New Montgomery and is one of the most popular lunch spots in the city during the week. This line is insanely long at peak lunch hours, but people still wait, because this place is THAT good.

Their fried chicken sandwich is by far my favorite in the city. They also offer wings after 3pm and have some
good Happy Hour deals.

I've been here numerous times, but recently came for HH and got the wings. $2 whole-wings were delicious but very spicy! Cool beer selection as well. All in all, I'll definitely be back (likely more often than I'd like to admit).
author: Aaron M.

description: Okay experience - liked the venue and open seating space. The line moves quickly; which is definitely a plus. However, their spicy chicken sandwich didn't hit the mark for me. I enjoyed the fact it had a flavorful kick and the chicken itself was very tender. However, I couldn't fully enjoy it but because it was over saturated with salt. Not sure if they dosed the chicken itself in for extra salt but I felt like the pickled veggies on the burger were sufficient for a sodium intake. So yeah, spicy good; salt bad.
author: Gary Y.

description: Great spicy chicken sandwich. I'm not a fan of dark meat by any means, however The Bird does a great job of masking it. Great breading. Only drawback - I would prefer a bit more flavor. It tastes more  like a "spicy oil" rather than seasoned. Doesn't have much flavor beyond the spice. But still a great chicken sandwich due to the breading. The picked slaw was a nice touch. The special is a chicken sandwich, curly fries, and a beer for 12.50. Great deal.
author: Jo G.

description: I had the classic battered chicken burger/sandwich. I really enjoyed the crispness, and you pair it with the slaw and sliced pickle and it's pretty enjoyable flavor combinations. I definitely would come back to try the same sandwich but the spicy option. To top it off, it was quick to receive our food. They got their system down. We ordered and Barely after filling our beverages, they called our order for pickup.
author: Andrew T.

description:
I just moved to SF from the South so I was excited (but a little nervous) to try the chicken sandwich at The Bird. They surprised me and did an excellent job! I ordered the "happier meal" and had a spicy chicken sandwich, curly fries, and a Hell or High Watermelon beer. 
The chicken sandwich here is perfect! Not only is the chicken perfectly fried (they use a batter and not breading - soo good) and the toppings made it even better. It was a savory, crunchy miracle. 
The Bird satisfied this picky, Southern, fried  chicken connoisseur and I would definitely recommend it to anyone. 
Also - if you're wondering, the line moves very quickly. My food was ready as soon as my card was swiped. This place cranks it up to 11!
author: Gabby R.

description: Came here for the spicy chicken sandwich. The gave a generous amount of chicken but it was on the dry side. I prefer my fried chicken to be juicy so it wasn't quite up to par to my standards. Be sure to get some fries to go with the sandwich!
author: Jackie S.

description: I got the chicken biscuit for $4.50 and loaded fries for $3.75. I really wanted to like this place because the fries were pretty amazing and a good deal for its price and size. The nacho cheese, sour cream and chili perfectly complimented the seasoned fries and left me pretty full. The chicken biscuit was definitely a disappointment and too expensive for its size. The biscuit was dry and the chicken was overcooked and chewy. I tried a bit of my friend's salad which looked absolutely delicious with colorful beets, apples and barley. Unfortunately, the fried chicken she got on top was also overcooked. I would be willing to give this place another try since I love fried chicken but that would probably be it if I wasn't feeling it since the price is more towards the expensive end.
author: Irene L.

description:
The same geniuses behind Super Duper and Uno Dos Tacos have strikes gold again with their new venture, the Bird! Fried Chicken Sandwich, Loaded Curly Fries, Canned Beers, and fried ice cream sandwiches!?! CLUCK YEAH IM IN!!! 

Fried Chicken Sandwiches (Spicy or Regular - their spicy is not that spicy) are my thangg and the chicken has the right amount of crisp, juiciness, and to top it all off a very tasty and not too acidic slaw. Oh and did I forget the very creamy mayo and home made toasted bun to make this the perfect meal. 

Pair this with their great selection of canned beers and their loaded curly fries - seriously like a loaded baked potato and You're in for a mother clucking treat! 

Despite the sometimes long lines, the food comes out really quick and the staff is really nice. Huge props to manager Victor for helping me take the best yelp photos. He knows what's up! If you don't give a cluck and just want to have a good time, come to the Bird. Because the bird is the word!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description: I love love love love the bird!!! I'm not even a big fried food fan, but I crave this place 24/7. Price is super reasonable too!
author: LyraM45 H.

description:
Great chicken biscuit sandwich. 4.50 for a small sandwich??? Great deal! It has a very peculiar spiciness that I love. You can feel the spiciness through your tastebuds, but it doesn't overwhelm the flavors of the sandwich. 

A small shop with a about 5 tables and a little outdoor seating. Definitely going to go back when I'm craving a fried chicken sandwich. Especially for the price, this has to be one of the best bangs for your buck in San Francisco. 

Vibes: 3.5/5
Food: 4.5/5
Customer service: 4.5/5
author: Bito M.

description: the happier meal is one of the best deals in soma/fidi - sandwich, curly fries, and a drink (beer or soda) for $12.5 - it's a little more if you want a more premium beer, but still pretty good! i basically look for every excuse to come here :)  the wait during lunch time can be quite a sight, so make sure to come early, or late, or in the evening. i love that it's open on saturdays too.
author: Christina L.

description:
When it's windy, gusting in SF, having a fried feast is totally acceptable...Giving you fuels for keeping warm lol 

Waiting in a long line on a weekday's lunch, I could see how popular The Bird is! The line moves quickly and the food is ready moments after you pay. So, don't be dissuaded by the long line...

I got the salad and added half order of fried chicken. The salad mix was fresh. About the meat, it's definitely worth spending your calories! The batter was light and flavorful; the chicken insider was tender and moist. Even the curly fries would make your day better.

The Bird's Fried Chix elevates the ordinary fried chicken.
author: Jui Han Y.

description: I got the happier meal...spicy chicken sandwich, curlyfries, and a beer. Really great flavor and great value. Would definitely come back regularly.
author: Ben C.

description:
Awesome place! Great atmosphere. Kind of hidden but its what makes it cool. 
The spicy chicken sandwich is bombastic!
author: Mirela K.

description: There's always a line out the door at lunchtime but don't let that dissuade you because it moves very quickly. I ordered the spicy bird. The sauce was a flavorful bbq sauce with a quick kick. The chicken itself had a great crispy crunch and the meat was very juicy. The red cabbage slaw was also a nice change for sandwich "greens". As far as Fidi lunch spots go, it's a great deal.
author: Ro M.

description:
Dude, the Bird is the Bomb, and is far from your average fried chicken sandwich place. If you're looking for a simplistic menu that doesn't overwhelm but will cater to your liking, this place is it. They basically have fries and fried chicken sammies, but those fries are definitely not your average junior high cafeteria fries. They're crisp, delicious, and hot out of the fryer. The sandwiches are gargantuan. If they aren't stuffing a modest bun with two large chunks of chicken, they're jamming in a giant single slab that appears like an entire chicken steak. The slaw on top is amaze as well, filled with purple cabbage, onions, and celery bits, sandwiched in with two long pickle slices. 

Great deals for a ton of food, it's only $8 for a regular or spicy chicken sammy, and $2.50 for a generous helping of fries. 

I went in there during lunch, and there was definitely a line waiting to order and also waiting for their food to come out of the kitchen. However, I ordered a substantial 10 sammies and 10 sides of curly fries for a team shindig, and the order was ready in less time it took me to run next door, order a few salads, and stand waiting for those salads. I'd say it took less than 8 minutes to get out a large order during the lunch period. 

This joint took over the old Melt location, and I couldn't be happier. This place puts a smile on everyone's faces when they walk into a room and realize we've catered from The Bird. And when a bland sandwich and bag of chips or a wrap with soggy fries could run you easily $12-13, this chicken sandwich place definitely has much more to offer in terms of quality of food, speed of service and experience, and staff. Everyone is super friendly, quick to take your order, and efficient. 

Note: After 3pm, they also have a meal option where you can purchase a 12-16oz can of beer.
author: Alison A.

description: What can I say about the Bird? Amazing fried chicken sandwiches. Curly fries. A cheap beer! When I worked across the street this was my favorite treat. Don't be discouraged by the long line. I have lined up 15 people deep away from the door and I still get to the register within a few minutes and sandwich in hand right away. Keep doing what you do. I do miss the hot ice cream sandwich though!
author: Michael M.

description:
The bombest fried chicken around! The salad is actually pretty great too, especially topped with spicy fried chicken.


Update: chicken wings seems to have downsized. They still taste great but aren't the large meaty wings they used to be. Now they are like Wing stop sized, the drumstick looking part and the wing part instead of the whole wing. And they sell there as a "two wings".
author: Ming Y.

description: Finally made it here.  Line still long even fairly early for lunch.  Got the regular chicken sandwich.  Though the freshness was noticeable and the bun excellent quality.  Speed after ordering was fast.
author: Marc S.

description: Damn good fried chicken sandwich! Also, cheap price. Outdoor seating too! Situated on New Montgomery St on the ground floor level, the location is central and easy to get to as well.
author: Raj D.

description:
I dont know why so many people rate this as the "best fried chicken sandwich in San Francisco" :( Maybe I came at an off day/ weird dinner time but my spicy chicken sandwich was overly oily and hard to eat. I also ordered the curly fries and they tasted like something I could get from Jack-in-the-Box. They do have a great deal after 3PM, where you can get a meal for either a spicy/regular sandwich with beer. 

I probably wouldn't come back again unless it was around lunch time. Seems like most people come around lunch and have a great experience. For the price, its similar to other places around FiDi so can't complain about that.
author: Annie L.

description:
Came here for lunch on a weekend. There was a short line and I didn't have to wait long at all. I ordered two Birds, one spicy and one original. Both were good but I enjoyed the spicy one much more. The spice is very flavorful and hot complementing the chicken well.

Overall, I thought my meal was a bit overpriced for the portion I received but very good quality. I recommend getting your chicken spicy.
author: Michael C.

description: The Bird's spicy chicken sandwich is awesome!! But their normal chicken sandwich and curly fries are just fine though. There are some beers, and we can enjoy tasty fried chickens and beers too. Staffs are fine, and inside the shop is clean. Around noon on weekdays, they are so packed.
author: Yumiko H.

description:
I was craving a fried chicken sandwich all weekend and couldn't wait for Monday (right?) so I could run over to The Bird and finally get my hands on one.

I walked over around 10:30am and there was no line. I ordered the chicken sandwich with curly fries and my order was ready in less than 5 minutes. I grabbed a cup of their homemade sriracha and ran out the door.

First bite was exactly what I was waiting for. Toasty bread, tangy slaw, crunchy pickle, all dat spice, and a big ol piece of chicken. The chicken is so moist and the batter is perfectly crunchy + spicy. 

Fast +  affordable, can't wait to come after work soon for their 'happier' meal.
author: Angie S.

description:
Okay - I had to put this place off until all the hype settled down! Kept telling my co-workers about it and they have gone almost every week since so I knew it was clucking good. I tend to eat later in the day; went a little after one and there was no line but both patio and dining room were full. My lone order of a spicy chicken sandwich was ready before I had time to fill up my hot sauce togo container.  Got back to the office and cut the baby open to see the beautiful dark meat and crispy crust.  One bite and I knew it was a hit - I did not put the sandwich back down! Game over and I'm a fan 
Will be back as the happy hour looks legit for a pre-Giants game
author: Aaron H.

description:
I decided to try The Bird on the recommendation of a colleague who mentioned that it was pretty good. As is it is located in downtown, I was expecting it to a small to-go place but it turned out to be a decent size restaurant with mostly high top seating on the inside. Even around 1 pm it was almost completely full so it is definitely popular.

I decided to stick to the spicy chicken sandwich ($8) as I was not too hungry, so I had to ward off the pushy girl behind the counter who tried to push fries and drink on me. I was on my way with the sandwich in under 5 minutes, which means that the chicken was not fried to-order but was prepared earlier in the day.

The sandwich itself was decent sized and even by itself was good enough for a light meal. It had a nice sized piece of friend chicken which definitely tasted like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for some time. The chicken itself was not dry but it was not juicy either. The thick layer of batter that surrounded the chicken was  It was dry and after a couple of bites felt very oily. Overall a very average sandwich, not bad, but not good either, just A-OK.

Price wise it was in line with what you would pay for a sandwich, banh mi or a burger in downtown so no issues there. Overall I was not majorly impressed by this sandwich. It would be fine to throw it into the mix of places you eat at lunch to change things up, but I would not plan or look forward to the next visit.
author: Ahmad J.

description: I've been to the Bird many times, truth be told, it was amazing the first time I went, then I found it less and less tasty with each additional visit. I am not sure if there is something wrong with my taste buds, or the quality has gone down since it first opened. Their happy hour special is sad, so don't bother and just get the sandwich.
author: Jie L.

description:
Classic Southern-style chicken sandwich. The pickles and slaw are the defining factors for me with this sandwich - love the tangy edge it provides to both the regular and spicy options.

Best to get there early during lunch hour, 'cuz everybody's heard about The Bird. Also plan on finding a place other than the restaurant to dive into your glorious sandwich.
author: Darrin K.

description:
I work next to this place and lived a couple of blocks away but it took me months to try this place. I finally did a couple of weeks ago for their breakfast. I'm pregnant right now so I was like ok I want a breakfast sandwich. My coworker went here before and told me the breakfast was delicious so I was like ok let me stop by. OMG I have been missing out and now I'm addicted. I get a sausage and egg breakfast sandwich and its delicious. They make it fresh too as in you can see them making the egg and sausage in forn of you. The wait is fast though and so worth it. Best of all it comes with a side of hashbrowns but not just any hashbrowns. Its the mini circle hashbrowns that you can't eat just one. And on top of the delicious food, the employees there are super nice. 

to summarize, GO NOW FOR BREAKFAST. I have to still try for lunch.
author: Tao Tao W.

description:
I love how this tiny place takes feedbacks and work on them.. this is my second visit after my last post 3 months ago. 
The place looks clean and organized .. No complains. 
Still same great food, awesome staff and super fast orders.
Keep up the great work!
author: Ruby B.

description:
It is quite a travesty that a Chick-fil-A hasn't settled itself in the growing San Francisco establishments. Fret not there is a savior to satisfy your Chick-fil-A cravings. The Bird is not only a perfect substitute for Chick-fil-A, but in some categories even surpasses it. 

For a nominal fee The Bird provides a fried chicken sandwich so extraordinarily large that it rivals the size of an actual chicken that managed to consume some of that green ooze from the Ninja Turtles. The fried chicken is offered in two flavors: regular and spicy. I've had both, and personally prefer the spicy for the additional flavor, but it can be a little too spicy, so those of you who lack a tolerance for spice may opt for the regular. The sandwich is delicious and helps me overcome the lack of Chick-fil-A in my life. Without it, I'd find myself waking in the middle of the night in a pool of sweat longing for sustenance.
author: Ankur K.

description:
The lines can get long but it moves fast.  I love their happier meal, fried chicken burger, fries and a beer, what?  
Between this and a super duper burger, it's kind of hard to choose.  I'm just glad they're both around.
But I gave this place an extra star (5 instead of 4) because the price for "the happier meal" is about right and the lines move quickly even if it's long.  They appear to have their system down for the lunch hour rush so I appreciate that.  Haven't had a bad experience there yet and the food always have been delicious.  Until anything changes with my experience there, it's a well deserved 5 stars from me.
author: I Will A.

description: For the price, its great! The spicy chicken is a flavorful spicy and it's a great spot for a frugal dinner and beer after a long Tuesday. Happy Hour is 5-7 PM. The space itself is smaller along with the tables and everything else but again.. for the price it's worth it.
author: Jan Kirby Z.

description: Same owner as Super Duper Burgers but the Bird sandwich wasn't out of this world like I had expected with the brand it sits with. I have to admit that the chicken was juicy, but it had a HEAVY distinctive flavor to the chicken. Maybe a spice of some sort that didn't really agree with me. I couldn't finish the sandwich because the spice was pungent. Otherwise it's a great alternative if you don't like beef burgers!
author: Kay H.

description:
Long line but moves quick.
The chicken sandwich and curly fries were delicious! They weren't greasy at all, and I thought the coleslaw and pickles in the sandwich really cut through the fried chicken patty well. I really like fried chicken so I might opt for just the chicken on a salad next time.

I got the apple fritters too, but they were cold and very sweet. They would have been much better warm.
author: SY C.

description: The Bird is amazing...everything from their customer service to the lip smacking food. I tried the Chicken Sandwich, loaded fries, and the ice cream taco.  Everything tasted great.  Make sure to go there early to avoid long lines.  Must try place!
author: Ani R.

description:
Solid food from solid people. The menu is simple: fried chicken sandwich - spicy or not, curly fries - regular or loaded, add a drink if so desired and viola meal is served hot and delicious! 

First time. Late lunch. Short line. Ordered spicy and loaded. Short wait. And within five minutes first bite. Curly fries are awesome as-is... add sour cream, melted cheese sauce, and chopped bacon and you get AMAZING! Devoured in under two minutes. Onto the main event... the spicy chicken resembled KFC's Nashville style, dipped and dripped in red. Heat level was medium at best which is great in that it allows you to still eat and enjoy the chicken sans-drink. 

Bonus level: they have many canned beers and hot ice cream sandwiches. Will have to try next time... And believe me there will definitely be a next time!
author: Stephen Y.

description:
Do you like chicken sandwiches that are crisp on the outside, juicy on the inside and bursting with flavor? Of course you do!

The Bird serves up a top notch fried chicken sandwich at a very reasonable price: $8. 

As others have mentioned the apple cabbage slaw is a great addition (vinegar based so not too much mayo and excellent flavor). The chicken thighs are generously portioned and the seasoning on the spicy version is really tasty. 

Curly fries? A must! That homemade sriracha they have in the sauce pumps toward the back is que bueno. Definitely give it a whirl. 

In the mood for a beer with your sando? They have several light beer options, ranging from the classic PBR tall boy to artisanal Oregon and Bay Area local fruit infused flavors (a la blood orange and passion fruit). If you're coming after 3pm you can get a beer the fries and a sandwich as a combo...my kind of happy meal!!

My advice on the ice cream sandwich: skip it. Concept is interesting - waffle press scooped ice cream in a roll - but the bread to ice cream ratio is way too high.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Spicy fried chicken sandwich, fries, and a beer for less than $15? You got me hooked. The chicken was extremely tender, juicy, and the spiciness level was on point. The house-made apple slaw provided a perfect balance to the sandwich. And who doesn't love curly fries? Great spot for a quick and cheap lunch. Highly recommend!
author: Angela K.

description:
Came here for a quick bite while waiting to meet up with some family members for dinner at Roys after some barhopping action. The chicken is to die for. It's a small, simple menu for those who have issues deciding what to order, like myself. There are TVs. It's a super small area too but how long do you really need to stay? The menu is super, super affordable. You don't need ANYTHING EXTRA since they are just superbly seasoned. I don't have anymore words to describe this place. 

10/10 would recommend.
author: Kimm H.

description: Spicy chicken sandwich is good, fries are just average curly fries, wings are really good. If you get the plain watch out for the really strong cinnamon flavor on the breading. Other than that pretty good place
author: Russel R.

description:
Officially the best chicken sandwich I've ever had. Not an exaggeration. My boyfriend loves this place so he was happy I could finally grab dinner with him here. There was barely anyone else there at 7:30pm on a Friday. We placed our order right away. 

The chicken sandwich had a wonderfully generous amount of meat in it and was cooked to perfection. Not too dry and super juicy. It wasn't overly spicy either. The slaw they put in it is really flavorful and unique. 

The loaded fries were the perfect addition to the sandwich. Mm mm mm. We also got a beer since it was Friday night. 

The interior was clean and modern (and photo worthy). The service was friendly. Would go again in a heartbeat.
author: Emma W.

description:
YUMM.. This place is so GOOD! I'm so glad it's hella close to my office. I got there right before 12 and there was barely a line. Service is extremely fast here. The menu is simple - I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich $8 and was pleasantly surprised by the spice level.  The chicken was JUICY and had an amazing crispy skin all around! 
 
Writing this review is making me crave it.. I guess I know what I'm having for lunch tomorrow!
author: Annie N.

description:
If you're ready to come back to work with a food coma, then definitely check out the Bird! It is conveniently located in the SoMa district. 

I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich. The chicken was tender and juicy. It was pretty flavorful. For $8 you get a decent sized sandwich that will definitely keep you full for the rest of your shift. My only complaint is the amount of oil from the spices, but it is a fried chicken sandwich after all, so totally understandable. 

There can be a bit of a wait, so try coming after or before rush hours to get your meal.
author: Joyce W.

description: The happier meal made me even happier when I found out it came with a beer! Delicious fried chicken and super friendly service. Dont miss out on this place!
author: Ligia R.

description:
Key points! 
- Dark meat chicken
- Spicy means the fried chicken is quickly dipped in chili oil/butter
- Line is short at 11am

I found the sandwich a great mix of what I look for in a fried chicken sandwich. The chicken was juicy, tender, and crispy. The slaw added the right amount of acid. The only flaw? The spicy was too oily leaving residue dripping at the bottom of my sandwich. That was a messy miss. Note the bun is soft and steamed which I actually found to be a nice contrast to the crunchy breading.

Looking for a breakfast spot? They do small biscuit sandwiches here! Pass on the fried chicken as such a small piece turns into a dry hard shame but I enjoyed the egg sandwich. All orders come with mini hash brown rounds (coin size) for a balanced meal.
author: Tammy T.

description:
Oh gosh, I think Jamie W. wanted to give the bird to The Bird because of an overzealous server who refused to answer his question about whether he could replace the beer for a soda in their post-3PM $12.50 "Happier Meal" combo deal. The server just kept rattling off the benefit of getting the beer as if he was on automatic pilot. Jamie was grousing so much about the miscommunication that he scared the guy next to us away from our table. That was indeed a sour opening to what turned out to be an otherwise nice surprise from Adriano Paganini, the guy behind the Super Duper Burger chain, Delarosa, and Uno Dos Tacos.

There was definitely that Super Duper feeling about this decidedly fast-food operation, but their new-kid-in-town enthusiasm managed to win me over. That and the $8 Classic Fried Chicken Sandwich which surprised me as I wasn't expecting a big hunk of thigh meat at the center. Clearly brined in something tasty, the dark meat was so succulent that I wanted to call it Denzel. Apparently they use an Ethiopian berbere spice blend in the crispy coating, and the housemade apple slaw provided a fresh crunch. All of it was encased snugly in a bun that's baked fresh daily so they say (photo: http://bit.ly/2i9Kz7c).

All I know was that it was good, very good in fact. It's just too bad that the rest of the food was not nearly as interesting or satisfying. The $2.50 Curly Fries were greasy and entirely skippable (photo: http://bit.ly/2iyv8sk), but of course, you can't get a chicken sandwich without getting a side of fries. It's a McDonald's commandment. Out of curiosity, I went for the $3.50 Hot Ice Cream Sandwich, and it turned out to be a warm bun covered in powdered sugar and stuffed with green tea ice cream (photo: http://bit.ly/2i2eUXh). It was an oddity that reminded me of something you get at a Chinatown bakery. I'll stick with Denzel...I mean the poultry.

FOOD - 4 stars...stick with that chicken and all will be right with the world
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...still looks like The Melt, doesn't it?
SERVICE - 3 stars...well, don't ask Jamie
TOTAL - 4 stars...mighty fine chicken
author: Ed U.

description:
I came back today for lunch and I am more than ecstatic about "The Bird".  Everything I stated in previous review still stands true- juicy chicken, flavorful slaw, and crunchy pickles. Basically, a bomb ass fried chicken sandwich. 

You may be wondering why I am updating my review... so I saw that they expanded their menu today and I saw  "apple fritters". Being the fatty I am, I ordered those in addition to my fried chicken sandwich. Unfortunately, the cashier told me it was only available for breakfast. However, he turned around suddenly and offered me a small apple fritter on a stick! Think donut hole but apple cinnamon style. He mentioned that it would taste better hot, but I thought it was still pretty good! I guess I will have to make the trek here for breakfast to try. Yay for awesome customer service! :)
author: Eva L.

description: This is the best chicken sandwich in SF I've had thus far. Similar to Rheas but slightly more flavorful and $5 cheaper. Came in around 2pm on a Tuesday and got my food in under 10 mins. Had the spicy chicken with loaded curly fries. Very good and definitely contributed to my fat-assedness. The chicken had a light crisp on the outside and juicy interior. The hot sauce flavoring reminded me of a fancy organic Texas Pete without the strong kick, a perfect type of fog city heat. The curly fries were butter and ice. The only thing I can complain about is this fowl is still not as good as chic filla thus 4 stars. But maybe my more affluent peers would say The Byrd is a more classy chick fila and rate it a five. oh and the counter dude who took my order kept staring at the Buffalo on my Patagonia trucker cap; he probably thought I was a depressed Bills fan...
author: Johny B.

description:
I came here and was curious about the salad. The menu isnt very descriptive so you dont know what is included in the sandwiches or salads.

There was only 1 other picture of the chicken salad but i still couldnt see inside the bowl, but luckily, I tried it so I can tell you! 

Inside the salad, you will get lettuce, celery, apples, beets, some type of grain (not sure what kind), and vinaigrette. You can add half or whole piece of chicken to your salad, regular or spicy. I went with the regular. 

I thought the salad was pretty good. For almost $11, it was big enough to get me full. 

The sandwich looked good so I may try that on my next visit.
author: Claire W.

description: This place is wonderful! What their menu lacks in variety, it makes up for in deliciousness. What they do, they do well. The sandwiches are a bit dry due to all the spice they put on them, but I don't really mind. I'd much rather have flavorful than juicy boiled chicken. :P All in all a pretty great place. Go check it out! But don't go at noon. They're crazy booked then. Literally just offset your trip by 15 minutes. You'll be glad you did.
author: Grayson K.

description:
Came here because a SF friend recommended this spot to me...

Its hard to find this spot because there is no signs outside...but once you find it menu is simple...got the spicy chicken sandwich with curly fries.

Came out to about $12.00 without a drink...
Sandwich tasted okay, but something inside me preferred chik fil a more than this spot.

Fries were a-ok, portion was too small for me.

OVERALL: A-ok not missing much here.
author: James S.

description: Don't let the line dissuade you from trying the best hot chicken sandwich in SOMA. Fast service and cheap beers to help wash down each spicy delicious bite.
author: Travis G.

description: We didn't really have a good experience here.  The sausage, egg and cheese biscuit was ok with an odd almost nacho like cheese.  The spicy fried chicken sand which was lacking cohesive flavors and was served on a stale bun.  Curly fries were pretty good and the apple fritter bites tasted like pure grease and sugar to me.  So, overall I give it a big fat meh.
author: Gena L.

description:
The classic chicken sandwich is the bomb here. Soft brioche bun with juicy chicken patty, not too greasy, the texture is just right for the meat. This stands for the epitome of the opposite of an McDonald chicken sandwich, where one can see and taste the strips of chicken rather than some undefined grounded meat that had gone through 20 processing steps. 

The owner is the same as super duper - so the buns remind me of there quality if there bin at super duper. 

I also tried the spicy chicken version (quite spicy) - didn't enjoy it as much. 

The vanilla and sour cherry ice cream sandwich is an interesting concept with soft bun with soft vanilla ice cream with sour cherry jam. It's more like an Asian dessert rather than the usual American ice cream sandwich. Interesting to try but probably not something that I would go back to. 

Super nice people work here - very effectively run and like the vibe here!
author: Rebecca C.

description:
One of the most jaw-dropping experiences I've had in SF was watching this kitchen prepare their spicy chicken. That's a bold statement given that I walk on Market St daily and have seen things that can never be unseen. However, you'll know what I'm talking about when you see them dousing these gargantuan pieces of chicken with their mouth-watering spicy sauce. Seriously, order your food and wait for this spectacle to occur - definitely an award winning show.

The Bird always has delicious food and their long lines are deceiving as they move quickly. The only disappointment I've had so far was ordering their chicken biscuit and realizing how small it is compared to their regular sandwich. Also it feels like they've been adding too much slaw to their sandwiches recently, but you can always remove the extra yourself.
author: Jay R.

description:
First time I came here on a Monday around 3pm and there was NO line! The spicy fried chicken sandwich definitely lived up to its' hype. I saw a couple reviews raving about the curly fries, but they were pretty typical. The house made Sriracha sauce was bomb as well. Small little restaurant, has about 8 tables in total inside and out. 

The second time I came here, the line was super long but it goes by so fast. Probably because the food comes out very soon after you order. Don't be discouraged by the long line!!! You'll be eating the delicious sandwich in no time.
author: Monique L.

description:
OMG! Walking by on our way to get coffee, the "housemade apple fritters" sign pulled us in. To where? We weren't sure, because like all hipper-than-thou SF places, we couldn't find the name of the shop. But what the hell? We went anyway.

I ordered apple fritters, an orange juice, and a chicken biscuit. The guy asked if I wanted it regular or spicy. Being an idiot, I went spicy. 

While waiting for my sandwich, my friend and I dove into the apple fritters. So. Good. Like donut holes, but apple-y. The OJ was definitely fresh squeezed and delicious. 

The spicy chicken biscuit comes with a side of tater tots and is gloriously yummy. It's a perfectly cooked piece of fried chicken (and trust me on this, because I am the queen of overlooking chicken), with a spicy sauce. A bit too much for me in the morning, but still damn good! The tater tots are only ok, the only thing that wasn't perfect!
author: Deb G.

description:
I had two sandwiches here, the bird was a good sandwich, sriracha sauce with it was okay.  That alone would be 4/5 stars.

However, the customer service here is awful.  I ordered " two naked bird sandwiches", which I thought was going to be equivalent to the bird sand sandwich without the pickles and other condiments, however, what I received was just the fried chicken fillet, and the condiments that I didn't want, and no bun.  I wish the cashier would have pointed this out, but he seemed more willing to push the line along without providing great service.

My friend who ordered the same thing was told by his cashier that the nake bird didn't come with a bun.
author: John T.

description:
Overall: There was a wait when I arrived for lunch on a Thursday.  The lines move quick, so it wasn't too bad.  They passed around curly fries to sample when the lines are long.  They have seats inside and out.  All they need to do now is to expand their business and open multiple locations all around SF. 

Food: Spicy Chicken Sandwich ($8) was a hit. The portion was plentiful.  The spice wasn't too spicy, but you definitely feel a little kick.  I'll be back to try the fries and wings next time!

Ok, as for me... it's time for food coma to kick in. And for you? it's your turn to try it, you won't be disappointed. =)
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Their fried chicken comes out piping hot and incredibly delicious. I ordered a spicy naked chicken and it hit the spot. If you're very hungry, however, consider ordering the full sandwich and the fries.
author: Regina L.

description:
Cool Lunch Spot:

Good: 
1. Food. Yes sandwiches are great here. Very delicious. 
2. Simple menu. 
3. Efficiency  always a huge line, but people work extremely fast. 

Bad:
1. Only one style of chicken sandwich and it's fried. I would ask to have grilled chicken as well. 

Recommend!
author: Jenna F.

description: Limited menu, but they do what they do really well. This satisfies my occasional craving for fried chicken. The ingredients taste really fresh and the flavors blend really well. The classic and spicy are both good options, although I lean toward the spicy. The loaded curly fries are great, but maybe too much food for my typical lunch. The service is fast and friendly. The only drawback is that there is often a very long line during prime lunch hour.
author: Patrick B.

description: I stopped by during happy hour and ordered a chicken wing, curly fries, and apple cider. The chicken was great, but without happy hour prices the chicken wing alone would've been like $4. The cashier told me the "wing" was the drum and thigh, but in the case you decide to visit just know that it's not and you truly only get a wing. Their overpriced as most things are in SF, but the spicy chicken is good and you get sauce so I guess you get a bit more for your money.
author: S. M.

description:
This is a pretty decent chicken sandwich place, but it's pretty hard to find considering they don't actually have a huge sign to announce where it is. The place was very hip and cool inside. The menu is very limited, which makes it easier to order, but I was only able to try the chicken sandwich. 

The food itself was fine, I got the more popular option, which is the spicy (only 2 options either mild or spicy). It was definitely hot but it a little bland. I would recommend this place to anyone who likes spice, but I myself would probably try something else next time.
author: Sophia C.

description:
I love the spicy chicken here!!! I don't care too much for the bun or the slaw but the chicken is soo crispy and extremely flavorful. (Tastes kinda like some louisiana dry rub). I think once you get toward the end of the sandwich, the spice start to kick in lol. The curly fries are okay, nothing special. 

The wait is long during the unGodly lunch hour but just don't go at that time and you'll be okay. 

REMEMBER TO GET THE SPICY VERSION!
author: Yen P.

description:
Small place and usually buzzing during lunch time filled with young professionals who are catching a quick bite to eat before they head back to work.  Really fast self service and clean bathrooms. Easily accessible being super close to Montgomery BART (5 min walk). Easy and simple menu and affordable prices.

We ordered the classic and the spicy fried chicken burgers with curly fries. The spicy was tastier than the classic but honestly both burgers had really bad quality chicken. You could tell from the taste as well as the color. Curly fries were beyond average and couldn't really taste that earthy flavor of potatoes. Not returning again. Much better choices around the city.
author: Heliana M.

description: I went for a conference there, and seeking for a place to grab food. The chicken Burger is Okay, the vege in the Burger is a surprise.
author: Yiwen Z.

description:
I've been wanting to check out The Bird for sometime now, but every time I ask my friends to accompany me I get a response similar to "the line is always so long." Today I finally found a coworker to come with me to The Bird and brave the line. 

First, the line might look intimidating, but it goes by REALLY fast. We got there around 12:15pm on a Wednesday and stood in line for 5 minutes. They were also giving samples of curly fries while we were waiting. Second, the sandwiches are worth the wait. The Bird only serves a spicy or non-spicy chicken sandwich ($8!!!), curly fries, ice cream sandwich, and beer. Simple. Easy. Delicious. The sandwich is huge and it's so hard now to find a lunch spot in SF for $8. Come to The Bird. Stand in the line. Eat. Enjoy. Trust.
author: Cindy A.

description:
I definitely took the word spicy way too lightly here. The spicy chicken sandwich kicked my ass. I wanted something with flavor rather than something dull hence why I got the spicy chicken sandwich. It was really hard to truly enjoy this sandwich when your tongue is burning every 5 seconds. I was gulping down water so fast that I was getting bloated. If you look past the intense spices, I could tell this was a very decent fried chicken sandwich, juicy on the inside and crunchy on the outside. If only the chef didn't wanna kill your taste buds with spices I would've really enjoyed this sandwich...

They should offer spice levels like mild, hot and caliente because the level of spicy that was served went straight to "burn off your tongue spicy"
author: Virginia Y.

description: I usually only come here for breakfast. The line is too long at lunch and I think I actually like the breakfast sandwich better! I am from KY so I appreciate a quality biscuit. Plus, the breakfast sandwich comes with tots :-)
author: Kate P.

description:
I came to check out The Bird to see how it stacked up against my go-to fast food chicken shop... and I can say with confidence that while I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the sandwich, I was not without my complaints.

To begin, it was nearly impossible to spot this place. The only mention of "The Bird" is in black writing against a black brick wall. 

At $8 for a sandwich not including curly fries, which are an additional $2.50, I was a little disappointed by the portion of fries I was given. The fries were perfectly crisp and absolutely delicious, but far too little in quantity. 

If you're a spicy kind of guy, get the spicy sandwich for no additional cost. If you're not, well, you're in for a rough ride (very spicy).
author: Mika A.

description:
If it's good enough for LeBron James, it's more than good enough for me! In case you haven't heard, during the playoffs LeBron James stopped by The Bird to order some food for him and his teammates. Now I don't have any big sporting events coming up (feel free to hook me up with some tix though), but I still can come to The Bird and try their AMAZING chicken sandwiches.

The Bird is my favorite chicken sandwich shop in the City! During the usual lunch times on weekdays (from 11:30pm to 1pm), this place is PACKED with the lines extending half a block! Don't fret though as the lines move fairly quickly. Seating may be hard to find during the lunch rush, but seats tend to open up quickly. They have a few small tables outside as well. The menu is pretty simple. They're most known for their chicken sandwiches and you can order it classic (non-spicy) or spicy. I've ordered both several times now and I prefer the classic one as my spice tolerance level is pretty laughable. The spicy does have a good kick to it so if you tend to like your chicken sandwich spicy (like LeBron does), then order it spicy. The chicken sandwiches come in a fresh bun with the fried chicken, apple slaw, mayo, pickles, and celery. The fried chicken has a nice crunch to it and the white meat of the chicken is very juicy, moist, and tender. The other condiments actually adds a unique flavor to it - a bit of sourness and sweetness that compliments the spices of the chicken sandwich very well. As for sides, they do curly fries which are nothing to write home about, but still crunchy and light. They also have an option for their curly fries to get fully loaded fries which has bacon, cream, green onions, and cheese on top.

Also their apple fritters (served only during breakfast hours or until they run out) are really good! It's 3 for $1.50 and they have good weight on them meaning 3 should be enough to satisfy your morning hunger. Haven't tried their other breakfast items yet, but if it's like their chicken sandwich for lunch & dinner, I'm pretty sure it's really good.

Overall this place is really good. Totally would recommend this place! The chicken sandwich is top notch and the prices are affordable! The chicken sandwich is only $8, curly fries $2.50, fully loaded fries $3.75, and the bird salad $6.50 (+$3.50/$6 for half/full chicken on top). You can get a meal that will fill you up for $11. They also have a combo called The Happier Meal which is $12.50 for chicken sandwich, curly fries, and a beer. #cluckyeah
author: Alvin Y.

description: Ordered the combo for dinner and added a few bucks for their premium beer. Chicken was very tender and the flavor was very good. The sandwich doesn't fall apart on you which is good. There is hotsauce on the tables for you if you need more spice. Came with curly fries which were nice and crispy. I had a good buzz, they were very quick in their service, tables were clean, and I believe they were playing some hip hop when I was there. Overall a very good experience and I will be back again for their breakfast or another quick and easy dinner!
author: Alex H.

description:
A huge chicken sandwich for under $10. What more could you ask for?

Most places give a tiny flat piece of chicken for the meat. Not this place. The chicken here is chunky and juicy. Just the right amount of crunchiness and flavor.

Indoor and outdoor seating but it can get crowded during the lunch rush. The food comes quick, though, so you can easily pop in and out.
author: Johnny L.

description: Anywhere that offers an adult happy meal wins in my book. Spicy chicken with fries and a beer, comes with a koozie!! The heat was real, had me sweating a bit but in the best way. Bread holds up to the chicken well. Super quick service. The line was long but moved quickly.
author: Paul S.

description:
I woke up this morning with the intentions of coming here for lunch; penciling in The Bird, 1:00pm.  

Game Plan: 
6am - starve myself for 5 hours 
Plan Fails:
7:30am - hunger kicked in; Philz coffee and buttered bagel
9:15am - two Hawaiian rolls
10am - slice of swiss cheese
Game Plan back on schedule:
12:45pm - arrived at the Bird, only two people ahead of me
12:55pm - received my order
1:10pm - done, head back to work

The chicken sandwich is ginormous!  Once I pulled it out of the bag and held it in my hands, I was shocked.  I looked to my left and looked to my right, giggled, and wondered if anyone else was surprised by the size.  I didn't know what to do with it; squeeze it for plumpness, snap a photo, angle it to fit in my mouth?  All of the above.

Classic Fried Chicken Sandwich - MOIST chicken with a crispy exterior.  Different interpretation of slaw but still good.  Soft buns.
Curly Fries - Not too crispy, I would pass on these

Cool beans for the moist towelettes and beer.
author: Linda N.

description:
Honestly I don't see what all the hype is about. It's a good replica of a Tennessee hot chicken. The only difference of real Tennessee hot chicken and this, this chicken wasn't crispy, crunchy goodness. The spicy had good flavor but wasn't crispy. 

And can we please stop using home made pickles on stuff. Just use delicious best maid pickles, like the sandwich is supposed to have. No one likes your sweet/ weirdly soft pickles. 

My tip: go there, grab the spicy to go, grab some of their "home made" siracha  and deep fry the sandwich again. Then I'll give it a 5.
author: Andrew M.

description:
The spicy fried chicken sandwich is a must!  The chicken itself was super moist, flavorful, and crispy skin.  Spicy sauce on point!  The slaw in the sandwich complimented the chicken very well too.

Also the breakfast fried chicken biscuit sandwich was so delicious too!  Really good deal - came with hashbrowns for $4.50 but if you wanted the "happier meal" which came with the beer, it would be $12.50!  A little tip, must eat this with jam!  Takes the flavor up a notch!

A must visit!
author: Dominique L.

description:
Have had my eye on this place for a while now, and finally got to check it out Friday evening after a spontaneous trip to the SF MOMA. 

Got there a bit around 5:30p and didn't wait at all, both to order or for my food. Got a classic fried chicken sandwich (~$9) to go, and was in and out with my food in less than five minutes. Plenty of seating inside plus some outside tables. 

Sandwich was good - ratio of bread to chicken was perfect for me. Chicken was juicy, not dry, and not bready. I took out the pickles because I don't like pickles, but the slaw was good (maybe wish there were more apples) and I liked the celery. Their house made sriracha is a must-grab for dipping! 

Curly fries were tempting, and will try their spicy sandwich and maybe other items next time when I come with friends.
author: Laura C.

description:
The pros: it's fast (like super fast, less than 5 minutes for my burger and fries). It's also casual dining and they have a bunch of beer (but very little non-alcoholic offerings). The regular fried chicken burger is good - comes with coleslaw and a nice warm bun. 

The Cons: the curly fries are minimal in size, and just ok in taste. I didn't get the fully loaded ones so maybe I missed out. The burger, when ordered spicy, has a strange pungent flower-like taste on the batter. I would definitely go with the original only, unless eating things that taste like a petunia interests you.
author: Jessica D.

description:
The location in Financial District is a bit hard to find. It's a small little restaurant right around the corner. I've heard they can get crowded after work during happy hour, but I came around 7pm and it wasn't too bad. We were easily able to get a seat by the windows.

Ordered the fried chicken sandwich, the spicy version. Definitely was spicy!! It was definitely worth it, though, because the sandwich itself was so good. Fresh, lots of flavor, with a decent kick. I think it even had little apple bits in it, which was very unique.
author: Sonia D.

description:
My co-workers and I ventured out a whole block (joking) to try this new fried chicken joint after I had spotted it on the upcoming elite events list. 

We were surprised to find out that the restaurant is owned by the same person as Uno Dos Tres, Lolinda, Super Duper, El Techo, etc. 

The trendy minimalistic space pairs well with the super basic menu consisting of fried chicken sandwich (regular or spicy) and several types of fries. They have a variety of beers as well. 

The regular chicken sandwich ($8) is a hefty portion size. Everyone agreed that it was a very solid lunch choice. While my co-worker wanted to give it 10 stars, I'm settling on 4. The chicken batter is crisp and thin while the chicken is very tender & there is lots of it per bun ratio. 

However, while the chicken piece is large, I found the flavor of the batter rather bland. The slaw made of thin slices of green apple, fresh cabbage, and sweet pickles were the highlight of the meal. I wish I could have had more slaw on my sandwich as it only graced one half of it. I also would have liked to see fried chicken added as an option.

The loaded curly fires are also a good option as a snack in and of itself or as a compliment to the sandwich for the truly hungry.
author: Nina M.

description:
I went to The Bird's Pre-Opening event, where they dished-out free fried chicken sandwiches.   I continued to see the long lines each day during the lunch hour, now that they've opened and the long lines are for a reason.  They serve two fried chicken filets in one sandwich, with their apple slaw on their special buns.  They lie pickles on the bottom bun that provides a really nice crunch as you bite into your sandwich.  The chicken filets are crispy and not oily.  The flavor of the sandwich is also really good and I think it's priced reasonably.  

The sandwich at the Pre-Opening contained only one filet, so it was nice to see the owners gained valuable information and they decided to now place 2 filets in each sandwich.  I was a bit disappointed in their loaded fries, since the cheese didn't melt properly to the fries.  The order wasn't very big, but I will opt to try their curly fries, since those seemed to be enjoyed by other patrons inside the restaurant.

The long lines can be intimidating, but it appears to move at a decent rate.  I went after 1pm, to allow the line to die-down a bit.  I was able to walk-in easily and place my order.  

I'm glad to find a convenient and reasonably priced option in SOMA.
author: Lon H.

description:
Came here a little after 12 pm with a friend. Originally the long line turned us off, but after around 10 minutes of waiting, we were already at the front! It didn't hurt that someone was passing out samples of curly fries while we were standing there!

I got the fried chicken sandwich and figured I could add their homemade sriracha in case I wanted a little spice. I didn't want to get the spicy chicken because I was scared it would be too spicy for me. When we got our orders a few minutes later, we were both surprised at how big the sandwiches were! The buns are indeed soft and the chicken thigh pieces are huge. I love the dark meat here, it makes the sammy so much more tender and juicy instead of dry chicken breast pieces that you normally get. Kudos for their homemade sriracha as well, it had a slight kick without setting my mouth on fire!

Would love to come back, especially since it's right next to my office!
author: Tara A.

description:
Definitely a fan of "The Bird" after recently trying the Spicy Sandwich and loaded fries. The fries and sandwich had some interesting problems, however. The "loaded" fries were not quite "loaded" with a small helping of gravy and toppings. Most fries I dipped in ketchup as I ran out of toppings pretty quickly. 

The sandwich on the other hand WAS "loaded", while I wish some of those toppings could have gone on my fries. On the sandiwch were; pickles, veggies, a slaw and spicy sauce, and it was pretty good, but honestly think the star should be the chicken, imo there was too much other stuff on this sandwich that could have gone on the fries. 

The chicken was "very good" but not quite fantastic. The sandwich all together was delicious, but a little too spicy for me (preference). I'd be interested in trying the non-spicy version to really judge the chicken on its own next time. 

Overall, a pretty good chicken joint that's worth another visit!
author: Giff D.

description: Lines out the door, so get there before the lunch rush! Super quick service and great prices considering it's San Francisco. Limited seating, so you may have to take your meal to-go.
author: Sheridan T.

description: There is a line out the door (and around the corner) every day for a reason. They make an amazing fried chicken sandwich. There is nothing amazing about the menu, there are only a few items on it.  The fries aren't great. It's crowded and small, a lot of people getting take out so I wouldn't be crazy about eating in the restaurant, but you can. For takeout though, one of my favorite spots around.
author: Joshua C.

description:
A-well-a bird, bird, bird, b-bird's the word,
A-well-a bird, bird, bird, the bird is the word.
A-well-a don't you know about the bird?
Well, everyone knows that the bird is the word!

What can you expect from The Bird? Probably a long line that does move a long and a big burger with lots of flavor that should be filling. The fried chicken is pretty good, not the thickest juicy piece, but it was a nice consistent thickness. I didn't find it that spicy but others have disagreed with me. I also got the curly fries but wasn't thrilled by them, make sure to grab/make a container of spicy dipping sauce.

There are high tables and stools for sitting, but when it is busy you will be lucky to get a seat.

Also if it is busy make sure to hold on to your receipt, there can be a large group waiting and if the names clash/aren't written down properly it can cause a bit of confusion.
author: Tristan L.

description:
I've been wanting to try out this place for the better part of a year and I finally did about three weeks ago! Trying to find it at night was sort of difficult because the sign isn't very obvious, but I managed to get there in the end. You order at the counter and then they call your name when it's ready!

Overall, I would say that their spicy fried chicken sandwich is good, but not amazing that I would crave it and go out of my way to get it. I believe I spent $13 for both the chicken sandwich and curly fries, but I'd rather spend that kind of money at Super Duper or somewhere else.

In any case, I've heard good things about their ice cream sandwich though, so maybe I'll go back just to try that!
author: Trisha V.

description: Man this place is great always a go to spot for lunch or just if you wanna get a quick bite! I bring my staff food from here all the time, they all love the spicy fried chicken sandwich!!
author: Enjoy S.

description:
The best chicken sandwich I had. The chicken was moist. It was flavorful and fried perfectly. I got the spicy and it's a great compliment to the slaw. It was delicious! Great price for it size and location. 

The fries was yummy as well. Not huge order but regular is only $2.5 and $4 for loaded. Yum! Great addition to the FiDi. 

The line is always long, luckily I have my lunch late. At 1:30pm, 5 minutes  for line and 5 minutes for the food. Highly recommended and will be coming back, a lot!
author: Sandy B.

description: This is a great place to visit if you want a fried chicken sandwich. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and it reminded me of the food from my hometown (Atlanta). I wasn't expecting such a large portion and good quality chicken meat for only $8 in SOMA.
author: Renee G.

description:
Preeeettty good. Many of the folks on my team are from Atlanta and loooove Chick-fil-A. ... meh. So when they heard about The Bird, there was not a moment spent to wait for all of the team like we usually do. To beat the lunch rush we jumped in line around 12:15pm and by 12:45 we were back at our office enjoying our food. This place is not even in the same category as Chic-Fil-A. They are far superior. 

First, they use dark meat instead of white which makes for, in my opinion, a more tender, savory meal. Second, the crunch is what this fried chicken sandwich is all about! I ordered the Spicy Chicken Sandwich. It made me reminisce of my college days when Jack in the Box's Spicy Crispy Chicken Sandwich was a regular evening meal. Oh, don't pretend that wasn't your jam too! We all progress in different ways. 

Lastly, the fixings! Oh my gosh! Celery? Who would think to put celery on a chicken sandwich and expect it to taste good? They did that! Sliced red cabbage that tasted as if it were tossed in a vinaigrette mixed with parsley and what I think were carrots.. maybe? All topped with a firm dill pickle. I made the mistake of forgetting to say no mayo. Ugh, I can't stand the stuff. But whoa! This mayo is comparable to the mayonnaise in Europe. Thick, whipped and delicious! The curly fries had good flavor, but I prefer my fries to be fried a little more. Although I love a good sriracha it didn't really go with anything. How about a house made ketchup instead? 

Bread buns are made daily by a local baker. The chicken which I hope is also local is free range. The menu is to the point. Chicken, curly fries, drinks! No fluff. Pricing is on par for a lunch spot in the Financial District, so expect to pay around $10.00. You could definitely split the sandwich if you wanted to. 3.5 stars.
author: Jaylena P.

description:
Looking for a good fried chicken sandwich? The Bird is where you need to stop by if you're in SF. Small location so not ideal for very large parties. They do have a few tables outside to sit at. 

Get their 'Happier Meal' which comes with the sandwich, fries and a beer for $12.50. The slaw on the sandwich is great and a nice addition.
author: Bianca M.

description:
The Bird might just (dangerously) become one of my go-to spots for lunch in FIDi.

Love the simple menu:
+ fried chicken sandwich ($8): classic or spicy
+ curly fries: regular ($2.50) or loaded ($4)
+ dessert: ice cream sandwich ($3.50)
+ drinks ($2.50, $4, $5): canned sofas & beers

I picked the spicy chicken sandwich & curly fries. The food was delicious! The spicy chicken sandwich is a much fancier version of Chick-Fil-A. You get a very generous moist piece of dark meat that is fried to a perfect crisp. It's layered onto of a crunchy apple slaw. It's a bit messy to eat but everything about that sandwich including the bun was delicious! The spicy fried chicken had a bit of a kick but was not too spicy -- if you prefer more spicy, add their homemade siracha. The sandwich should be enjoyed right away otherwise the apple slaw will make the bread mushy.

The curly fries were nice & crispy. It went perfectly with their homemade siracha. Ohh man, that siracha was sooo good -- I want to layer it on top everything I eat! I have to admit.. despite being very full, I kept nibbling on the curly fries just so I could eat the siracha ;)

The spicy fried chicken sandwich was so filling that I barely got through my curly fries. I almost wished there was a mini version of the fried chicken sandwich as that's the only way I get to enjoy both my burger & fries at Super Duper. For the time being, I'd have to work up my appetite to tackle that spicy fried chicken sandwich + curly fries + siracha sauce triple threat combo!

Definitely make your way out before the lunch crowd. By 11:30am, the line was almost out the door! There are some seating indoors (maybe for 30 people or so).. although it seemed most people were taking their food to go.
author: Ruby C.

description:
Came for a quick dinner at this place. I was super intrigued by their chicken sandwiches! I ordered a Spicy Chicken Sandwich. It's pretty big and they give you two big pieces of crispy chicken. It is loaded with a tasty sauce and veggies. I usually don't prefer to eat sandwiches, but this place was definitely good and worth the trip! 

I want to try their loaded fries next time! Will come back!
author: Natalie L.

description:
Read the update from The Bird. Edited my score but left my original issue so others don't go through the same.

Thanks!

Don't order online! Ordered via Postmates, order is accepted. Looking forward to some delicious food as I'm hungry and really wanted this. They cancel it for no reason 25 minutes later so now I have to wait even longer for food. Thanks. Either decline the order or fulfill it once you've accepted it.
author: Julian K.

description: This review is in comparison to Howlin' Rays in LA... unfortunately The Bird spicy chicken sandwich was not up to par in my eyes. Good... but not memorable. Besides the chicken sandwich being A-OK, I thought the service was fast and they have a good combo deal $12 for a sandwich, fries, and a cheap beer. Overall I think it's worth checking out, but definitely not the best fried chicken sandwich I've ever had.
author: Elaine N.

description: The best chicken sandwich I've had in my life! And its actually spicy! Their h ok memade sriracha is also amazing. Worth every penny spent and then some.
author: Reeham N.

description: Unfortunately, the consistency of the chicken is very rubbery, and the spicing is over-the-top loud.  It seems likely they use low quality ingredients.
author: Andrei G.

description: BOMB chicken sandwich! Everybody talks about The Bird because its that freakin good! Great beers to go with your sandwich which is packed with flavor and freshness...I mean FLAVOR, mmm my mouth is watering now just thinking about that fried chicken sandwich. If you haven't been to The Bird make it a plan to go and taste what the SF Chronicle calls one of the best sandwiches in the city and they're right about that! The classic fried chicken sandwich comes with a pickled slaw and if you get the Happiest Meal you get it with curly fried and a choice of beer (if you're like me) which comes with a koozie to drink that beer in true Bird fashion. The meals come out fast, literally less than five minutes and your order is ready, listen for your name! The Bird is one of my favorite places to go have lunch with my coworkers, we love it and it remains a building favorite!
author: Karlos G.

description:
The Bird only offers fried chicken sandwiches, and they are rather good at it.  I had a longer lunch break today and walked a half-mile to this restaurant.  Very surprised to see a 10-minute line at 11:30 AM, and it kept on growing afterwards.  

I ordered the Spicy Chicken with a side of curly fries.  Sandwich was good sized and I really liked how the chicken had a nice crispy, golden crust and seasoning inside and out. The pickled veggies helped add some nice acidity which is great for fried food.  Fries were crispy and had a nice corkscrew shape.  Instead of ketchup, they offer house-made Sriracha sauce that was excellent.

Highly recommend The Bird for a quick bite.  The line does move quickly and its best to eat-in I think.
author: Daniel C.

description:
I'm going to say it right now: The Bird is better than Organic Coup. 

I don't really care if the chicken is or isn't organic at The Bird.They know how to make a mean fried chicken sandwich, even more so than those Coup places. 

Upon ordering their spicy chicken sandwich ($8), the first thing I noticed was the spice kick. On a scale of 1 (bland) to 5 (lava), I can tolerate up to a 3. Thus, the spiciness was a little more than enough for my tastebuds, offering enough to make my tongue tingle, but not hiss air. The home made apple slaw and celeries is understated, and yet an important component to keeping the sandwich fresh, light, and relatively healthy-tasting, which I appreciated a lot. 

Curly fries (an extra $2.50) were optimally fried and thus had a good crunch to them, but really nothing to write home about. If anything, it served as a good compliment to the sandwich itself. 

They offer several drinks as well (beer and soda), and a "hot" ice cream sandwich (not sure how that would work, but sounds interesting nonetheless). But the star of the show here is the chicken sandwich, and deservedly so. 

*cues Surfin Bird by The Trashmen and proceeds to the Peter Griffin dance*
author: Viet N.

description: Best fried chicken sandwich! I love their idea of a "Happier Meal" which includes a sandwich, fries and beer. I got the spicy chicken sandwich and curly fries. My only wish is that it didn't close so early, but other than that...flawless!
author: Lillian B.

description:
I really want to go back.

I came here on a visit to the city with my family and will be returning as soon as possible.

Environment: The spot is super cozy and hip feeling. They offer a variety of seating options. The menu is clear and can be seen easily from the entrance. Everything looked very clean and tidy. The bathrooms were very clean. 
5/5

Service: When we walked in to The Bird, we were greeted and there was someone ready to take our order. We weren't quite ready to order yet but it was nice knowing we wouldn't have to wait if we wanted to order immediately. The food came out promptly. No issues with service whatsoever.
5/5

Food: Definitely the highlight of The Bird. I ordered the Spicy chicken sandwich. The chicken was crispy on the exterior and incredibly juicy on the interior. I also ordered the loaded fries which are curly fries covered in toppings(see photos). Fries were good but not as noteworthy as the chicken sandwich. There was a stellar selection of both soft drinks and beers available. 
5/5

Definitely check out the bird if you're craving a high quality chicken sandwich.
author: Jared S.

description:
My coworkers read about The Bird and decided to stop by and grab lunch for the office. Since they only make a certain number of sandwiches, they headed over on Thursday, October 20th a little after 11am. They were back by 12 noon.

Since The Bird only serves a FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH (REGULAR OR SPICY): celery, house made apple slaw, mayo, pickles, and bun ($8) and CURLY FRIES, that's what everyone got. I tried both the spicy and regular sandwich. The spicy one was good. The breading, crispy and flavorful. The regular one, however, was a little bland. They use chicken thighs which I actually prefer. I find chicken breast sandwiches can be a little dry at times. But not everyone liked the thighs. Some found the chicken a little too moist and tender. The curly fries were good. Nice and crispy.

I hear they now serve loaded curly fries. I may be back just to try that!
author: Elena N.

description: I love chicken and beer! Cute place with a pretty good chicken sandwich and really good hot sauce! Reasonable price as well
author: Menana B.

description:
This place is ALWAYS crowded during lunch. Why? BECAUSE ITS DELICIOUS. I have tried their regular chicken sandwich and their spicy chicken sandwich and salad and the spicy chicken is by far my favorite. Even cravings worthy - because I do crave it probably once a week. 

I usually get the salad with spicy chicken which comes out to $10.96 + tip. The salad comes with romaine hearts and baby kale mix, braised beets, farro, celery and apple with a choice of dressing: vinaigrette (champagne vinegar and honey) or blue cheese. The vinaigrette is my go-to (makes me feel healthier). 

But seriously, come here. The lunch line (from 11:45-12:30) is long, but goes fast - you can have food in hand in 20 min even if the line is halfway down the block. Their breakfast hashbrowns are good too!
author: Anna P.

description:
"Happy Meal" - 4/5
Spicy fried chx sandwich - 4/5
Curly Fries - 3/5
Homemade Sriracha - 4/5
author: Jeff M.

description:
Decided to check on The Bird based on Yelp reviews. Anyways, I went on a rainy day and there wasn't too much people. I was expecting to take my food to-go given the small space in SF but surprisingly there was ample space for a sit-in dining. 
I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich with a side of curly fries. The price was a bit expensive for a sandwich but the portions were huge. My sandwich came out piping hot, so had to wait for it to cool down. The slaw in the sandwich was crisp and a delicious pairing to the sandwich. Chicken patty was huge, my son couldn't even eat it correctly as it was sliding off his burger. *wished they had a kid's size*
The curly fries were nothing impressive and reminded me of the Jack-In-The-Box fries. 
Overall, decent place to stop by whenever you're in for a quick fulfilling lunch!
author: Mary S.

description:
Pretty good sandwich. I got the spicy, which I think I regretted because I am sure the original is much better, I snuck a bite of my friends when they were not looking. 
But the happier meal of sandwich, fries, and a beer is amazing! Great Friday lunch!
Will update to 5 stars once I have the original instead of spicy.
author: Jeffrey O.

description:
I ordered the combo with loaded fries and normal chicken. It was all good. The food, cleanliness, people, style. 

Gripe: too much nutmeg is the breading. 

Otherwise it's spot on. The house made sriracha is exceptional. The fries are good too though I would have liked more bacon.
author: Michael H.

description:
Give me The Bird!!  

I like how they specialize in Fried Chicken Sandwiches and everything else is second fiddle.  The menu is so simple, you gotta love it!  Fried Chicken Sandwich (regular or spicy), Curly Fries, Loaded Fries, Beer.  And basically, that's pretty much it, for now.  They do plan on expanding their menu to include Grilled Chicken Sandwiches and some vegetarian options.

I couldn't resist ordering their Spicy Chicken Sandwich and then for the Curly Fries I figured might as well go all out and get them Loaded (http://bit.ly/2eye0wU).

Spicy Fried Chicken Sandwich -- celery, house made apple slaw, mayo, pickles, and bun.
Yeah, this is as good as a Fried Chicken Sandwich can get.  Two big fried chicken breast pieces inside kicked up a notch with the spicy coating.  It was balanced out with the apple slaw, celery, and pickles.  The bun though kind of fell apart on me mainly due to all those elements in the sandwich, but I managed to keep the sandwich together to the last bite.

Loaded Curly Fries -- bacon, cheese, sour cream, green onions
Basically like a loaded baked potato, but with Curly Fries.  This was good and can basically hold it's own as a meal if you don't get the sandwich.  Lots of bacon and cheese!

The place does get really busy during peak lunch times.  I arrived about 10 minutes before opening there were already a few people waiting outside, but when it opened it was still easy to snag a table.  It only took about 20 minutes after opening when the line went out the door.  Glad to see business is doing well for them so far.

The Bird is off to a great start.  In my opinion, they really don't need to do anything else to their menu, but it's nice to see they're exploring other options.  As long as they keep cranking out epic fried chicken sandwiches, they'll be just fine!

--
author: Rodney H.

description:
Ordered The Spicy fried chicken burger. It is sweet, hot, savory, crunchy - an explosion of flavor. I pretty much enjoyed the Burger. oh and also, They prepared in in 3-5 minutes, which is pretty quick compare to super duper.

I do have to point out that their menu is pretty empty, and the burger is a tad bit expensive ($8+tax) for the portion. Having said that, I wouldn't mind having it again. 4.5/5

correct typo*
author: KG N.

description:
so good！
the chicken burger is the best i have ever had！
and price of it is nice！
.
they had a sign at the coner of the street but i still missed the sign
author: Yantong Z.

description:
wow, this place must be minting money.  they always have a line that strings halfway down the block, but yet you can get your food in minutes.

If Elon Musk made Model 3s like The Bird makes fried chicken sandwiches, then TSLA stock would be worth $600 (sorry, obscure reference).

Seriously, I thought Chipotle was fast, but they've got nothing on The Bird.

As for the sandwiches themselves, they are definitely quality. Juicy and thick with good breading, and a good pickle-y salad mix stuffed in there. Personally, I prefer Naked Lunch in North Beach, which really has my favorite chicken salad sandwich, but this place is a close second.

They also have loaded baked potato fries, which are extremely addictive.
author: Jimming C.

description:
Came here for early dinner, heard lunch is crowded.
Ordered the chicken sandwich and curly fries. The chicken was indeed juicy and delicious, however overall the sandwich was just okay. I hope the sandwich has a bit more refreshing/veggie component to it. 
I would give 3.5 if possible, but rounded up a bit because I wouldn't mind coming back :) But maybe next time I'll just order salad with chicken, the chicken itself, or try the breakfast sandwich.
author: Ya K.

description:
Bird's the Word!

A line I'd gladly stand in---crispy chicken with creamy ranch sauce treasure waiting for me at the other end.

Ive enjoyed the biscuit, apple fritters, sandwich and salad. My lucky day will come when their desserts are not SOLD OUT.

The Bird says what it means. 

Their spicy chicken packs heat. It's a lot to ask, a dish matching its name and seasoning done right. 

Fried anything should be crispy outside / moist inside. The Bird produces just that.

All sauces are made in house. Did I mention their biscuit is the best in town? 

The Bird offers quality in the best form of a fast food breakfast/lunch venue in FIDI. Thank you.

Worth the wait, right? 

Tip the lovely staff, they are so pleasant even with a mob of ppl around the clock. (Hungry appreciates you!)

Last note: eat chicken sandwich later, not right away. The juices along with the slaw---heaven after 30 minutes. It's cooled and you won't burn your mouth. 

You're welcome.
author: Trish Z.

description:
I came here on a Wednesday with my coworker and waited in line for about 20 minutes. The line moved quickly, and our sandwiches came out equally fast.

There was actually a decent amount of seating because most people just eat and leave. 

We both ordered the spicy fried chicken sandwich. The sandwich itself is visually appealing. I love spicy, very hot foods and thought it had a good, but not overwhelming amount of heat. The patty has a sturdy, thick breading that for the most part stayed on but was HUGE. I had to unhinge my jaw to take bites.
