I didn't love how thick it was or the mismatched chunks of white and dark meat (I read they are made of thigh meat).When I first got the sandwich I noticed the bottom of the bun was already starting to fall apart because of the slaw. The slaw felt a bit clunky, with large chunks of cabbage and celery. It had enough acidity and I didn't think the pickle was necessary.

Overall it was okay. I no longer quest for the perfect fried chicken sandwich since I discovered the one at Hi-Tops but it would have been nice to add another one to the rotation.
author: Christine M.

description: This place was cool a little over priced and while the chicken had pretty good flavor mine kind of had a lot of gristle. Overall I think Chick Fil A was probably better but I'll have to give it another try some time to see if it changes my mind
author: Jesse C.

description: I got the classic fried chicken sandwich, and it was alright. A little monotone in flavor (just salty, would have appreciated more cream and acidity) and the texture could have been more varied than just dry and crispy.
author: Josh L.

description:
The spicy chicken biscuit and hashbrowns may be my new go-to breakfast! So good! 

I didn't comment about this is my previous review, but the restaurant is very nice. I love the vibe it has.
author: Josh M.

description: good food. Basically they have just chicken sandwich with different side and ferries. It's a small place with good service and friendly staff. We had our sandwiches a minute after we ordered. good price and fresh. Definitely go back there again.
author: Kashi E.

description:
Went back here again, huge line but they are very quick at pumping out sandwiches! 

And the food is consistently great. And for $8 it's on my list of top lunch options in downtown.
author: Altair T.

description:
Superb deal $8 for a super yummy chicken sandwich in the heart of the city 

Bun is crunchy , veggies is fresh and crisp , chicken is most and spicy . The crust is to die for .

When I take my bite , the juices keep flowing out . 
Thank you for making my day by this heartfelt stomach fulfilling sandwich! 

Bonus point : I paid in cash and the register was not one of those with pre selected tip cashier . I like that this register style does not force me to give tip
author: Phoebe W.

description:
Soooo good. Can't stop thinking about it. The spicy chicken had so much flavor and the coleslaw was the perfect pairing with it. And the loaded curly fries are delicious as well!
The staff was very friendly and helpful too. 
A little hard to find because they don't really have a sign though, but worth the hunt!
author: Marcella M.

description: Best fried chicken sandwich I've had! I've come here twice. The first time, I got the Spicy Chicken Sandwich, and oh man, that thing packs quite the punch. Way too spicy for me, haha, and I feel like my spice tolerance is decent. It was so flavorful, though, I tried to keep eating, until my tongue starting burning and my nose started running. The second time I went back, I was smarter and got their regular chicken sandwich. Still amazing! But a much more enjoyable eating experience. Their chicken isn't dry at all, and there's just the right amount of breading. The bread that they use is bomb, and the toppings that they add all complement each other's flavors perfectly. It's simple, but it's so good! Highly recommend if you're in the area.
author: Ashley Y.

description:
Raging ____
A ____ Called Wanda
The ____ In Times Square
The ____s

? Bird ? Cricket ? Fish ? Bull ?

do you know the right animal?
duhhh the right animal is FRIED CHICKEN
beezy
do i need to tell y'all get all food "loaded"?
i just did #cluckyeah

(^_^) Spicy Chicken Sandwich $8 (http://bit.ly/2e6oZMY)
spice got turntup after early reviews
tender juicy af

(^_^) Loaded Curly Fries $4 (http://bit.ly/2fxKbB1)
bc you ain't basic

mad crowded quickly but depending how ballin you are you can still get seating *after* you get your food don't be a sucka trying to save tables n shhh (i'll still sit there anyway like #osnap)
author: Dan B.

description:
Ornithologists rejoice!

If your going to open a few doors down from yelp you best bring your A game to the show.

The bird brings it. My spicy chicken sandwich was delicious although taking it to go made it a tad messy. Good bun, great crunchy condiments, crispy large chicken breast.

 The loaded fries were okay. Curly fries, cheese sourcream, bacon and peppers. Again this could have been a function of not consuming for 10-15 minutes.

Good beverage selection alcoholic and non.

The bird should definitely do better than the previous tenant " the melted" pun intended.

Line looks long but they're very efficient.

Eat there
author: David G.

description: Quick and easy. Their combo is the way to go. Wing deal during happy hour is dope. If you're from LA and have had Howlin Rays, the heat level on this is at a medium. It's delicious and the fries and sauce are great. Definitely worth a try if you're in the area!
author: Victoria G.

description:
This is my favorite fried chicken sandwich spot in San Francisco. If there were a chick-fil-a in the city, this might be a different story. 

The lines are typically long during lunch on the weekdays due to the proximity to the financial district but don't be deterred. The line moves really fast and the staff cranks our consistent, delicious fried chicken. 

Personal recommendation is to go for the happier meal which includes curly fries, fried chicken sandwich, and a beer!  Oh yeah, and don't shy away from the home made sauces on the side.
author: James C.

description:
Dinner review. 

Fully loaded fries - 3/5
Wings - 5/5
Spicy chicken sandwich - 5/5

Overall, "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description:
Oh my god almighty. I don't even know what to do with my life right now. Where do I even start? Is this real life? 

I was in town for a conference and wanted to grab something quick and close to my hotel. The Bird came up on my Yelp search and I figured, why not? The reviews were solid and my spirit was down for fried chicken. Off I went... I was on an adventure, Charlie  

The place was fairly spacious, though I can imagine how packed it must get during lunch. The menu is limited (which I appreciate) so I went with their top item, the chicken sandwich (spicy). Holy mother of chicken breasts, I in for an experience!! Not only was the sammich HUGE, the bun was yummy, the chicken was well seasoned (and juicy AF), the heat was on point, and the fresh pickled veggies brought it all together. This. Gave. Me. Life. Though I will admit I might have inhaled it...

I wish I could take The Bird with me to NY. We could be happy together.
author: Kristin F.

description: Awesome chicken sandwich,awesome chicken wings. The hot chicken wings are really hot but delicious! Not much seating but it's San Francisco so that's how it works. Fun place to go before a Giants game.
author: Michael R.

description:
I was recommended this spot by a local friend. It's a basic spot, chicken, fries and a drink (beer too!) For $12.50 I got a spicy chicken sammich, fries and a beer. They call it 'The Happier Meal'. The food came out literally minutes after ordering it. Mind you we got there around 1145am. Not sure if this is how they normally operate on the quickness, but if it is, that is great! 

The sammich was juicy and tender. Very tasty. Who doesn't want a beer on their lunch break?

Parking? Good luck! Street parking is HARD to come by. Finding the location is a bit tough too as there is not anything really marked. Find the fox displayed and you've found the spot.
author: Kevin Z.

description:
I'd been waiting for the right opportunity to finally try this place after waking by several times. Usually the line is super long. 

But I walked by on a Friday around 11am and there was no line at all. 

IT WAS DELICIOUS! I got the spicy chicken sandwich with curly fries. The sandwich was great. The chicken was juicy and had just the right amount of spice from their homemade siracha. Topped with slaw and some yummy pickles.

The fries were typically curly fries. Good but nothing special.

Overall I'd definitely come again and get the same exact thing
author: Landon S.

description:
The Bird is a brand new fried chicken burger place in FiDi/SoMa. I made my first visit to the place at around 12.30 pm, 2 days after they had opened but they had run out of chicken since they were only stocking 200 patties at that time (reminded me of some of the invite-only tech launches like Mailbox).

I tried my luck for a second time a couple of days after that and even though I did have to wait for 20 minutes, I successfully walked out of the place with a fried chicken burger and fries in hand. The burger was good (like a fried chicken burger can be bad?!) but there was nothing particularly special about it. 

PS - You're gonna have to wait at least 30 mins if you show up anytime between 11.30 and 12.30 since it's still pretty new (a hot and new biz *wink*) and a lot of people show up for lunch every day since it's open only from 11am to 3pm.
author: Gaurav K.

description:
Ok...let me write a full review. My buddy and I were looking for a place to have a beer on a rainy day and just happened to be walking by this place so we jumped in. My buddy ordered the "crazy" fries or whatever they're called and I told him I'd order some wings. When I ordered wings the lady said they were $2.50 each! She assured me they were pretty big like you would get at Buffalo Wild Wings. I've never been to Buffalo Wild Wings, so that meant nothing to me. I just couldn't see myself paying that much per wing, so I ordered a sandwich instead and a beer.  

As mentioned in my previous post the sandwich had stale bread and the chicken was way too greasy. Perhaps worst of all, the beer was warm. I tried some of my friend's fries. They were cold with disgusting nacho cheese and stale bacon bits I wouldn't feed a dog. My buddy was still hungry so he went and ordered some wings. They might have been the smallest wings I've ever seen. These had to have come from baby chicks. And no ranch or any other dipping sauce by the way (this may have been my buddy's fault, although I've read on other posts you pay extra for them). We didn't even finish them! He paid $2.50 each and we didn't even finish them!!! 

We talked for a little bit after and let the left over wings sit there. After a few minutes I noticed a disgusting puddle of oil that came from the wings. I left the place feeling sick. 

Sure everyone has their own tastes but this place was just gross and there are so many way better options (like McDonalds). I would usually give a place a couple chances since maybe the first time was just an off night. But sometimes the experience is so bad, you'd be a real dummy to try it again. Fool me twice...shame on me.
author: Jon M.

description:
Awesome. Simple menu that will never let you down. Fried chicken sandwich and you choose whether spicy or regular (I always go for the spicy). The happier meal is like basically fully covers you with a fried chicken sandwich, curly fries, AND a beer. 

All things aside, I come back here out of the many fried chicken sandwich places that are popping up because its not too greasy, the chicken has a perfect texture and the slaw is fire (i'm not usually the biggest slaw fan).
author: Thielson D.

description: Food was delicious. The chicken sandwich is amazing! The biscuit has the best hint of honey. Horrible service from the little guy helping us out. Asked him a question and he had the most annoyed look on his face then just shook his head no. Would probably go back.
author: Steff S.

description: This place is affordable and has a great chicken sandwich. The staff is amazing and very friendly.
author: Angel R.

description:
The star here is the chicken, as it should be. Hands down, the most succulent chicken I've ever had in a fried chicken sandwich in SF. The portion size is satisfying and for $8, it's a great deal, dare I say the best deal in SF for a good fried chicken sandwich since most other places are in the $10-$12 range.

The celery, apple, onion slaw is OK, but could be better. I know they offer a spicy chicken option, but it feel like the slaw itself could use a kick. More pepper? Some lemon or other acid? Less celery or more finely cut celery so it doesn't take away from the other ingredients? I don't know.

The curly fries were good for $2.50 and again the portion was just right, I didn't feel disgusting after eating them. No need to share these.

Overall, pretty worth the hype, don't be turned off by the long line as it moves fast and there is plenty of seating inside as most people take their bird to go. Can't wait to see how they spice things up!
author: Gonzalo S.

description:
With so many nicer-than-fast-food burger places popping up, it's good to see a fast casual joint specialize in fried chicken sandwiches to take on Chick-fil-A.  It sure beats the McChicken hands down, but the Southern Comfort Kitchen food truck still slings my favorite fried chicken sandwich.  However, The Bird is consistently open 6 days a week for Lunch & Dinner so, unlike a food truck, it will be there when you crave it.

Spicy Fried Chicken Sandwich: Pretty solid.  Soft tasty bun.  Lots of tangy crunchy flavor in the pickles and the slaw.  The chicken thigh was quite tender with a nice batter and a decent fry.  Personally, I would have preferred if it were cut or pounded thinner so there was more surface area to crisp up.  But still quite tasty.

Loaded Fries: Just the right amount of fries to complement the sandwich, but not make you feel disgustingly full. The curly fries were very crisp and nicely seasoned, but not overly seasoned like some curly fries tend to be.  I liked the bacon and green onions as loaded toppings, but felt they were a bit skimpy on the shredded cheese.
author: Adam B.

description:
Okay it's good, but is it worth waiting in line? I'm not sure. The Bird is wonderfully simple - I got a fried chicken sandwich and curly fries. And props to them for serving a "Happier Meal" with chicken, fries, and a beer.

Will I be going back? You bet, but I won't be waiting in the long line for it.
author: Nikhil S.

description: Good bang for your buck. The spiciest flavor isn't too spicy so I'd recommend even if you're scared it'll be too spicy. The venue is pretty small and fills up, especially around the time people are leaving work
author: Bonnie B.

description: Great spot! Quick service, accommodating to my no-mayo request, overall a very cool spot. Not the best ever fried chicken sandwich, but definitely top 10.
author: Jessica V.

description:
I was excited when I first read about this place. My husband went with his work friends and said it was "just okay" I didn't trust his opinion. A cheesesteak sandwich is my fav and a fried chicken sandwich might be my second fav.

This place was just disappointing. The chicken portion on the sandwich was HUGE, and the loaded fries were okay, but the chicken was (underdone?) maybe or just a bit too rubbery, and there was no crunch factor on the chicken. $15+ for loaded fries, a sandwich and a seltzer. 

I will not return - despite how amazing the ice cream sandwiches sound.
author: Amy W.

description:
I tried this place out, finally, while working a gig at the Moscone Center. I went around 1 and the line is was out the door. But don't be discouraged. I literally only waited, in line and for my food, for a total of 10 minutes. My chicken was out fresh, hot, and fast! I wasn't able to enjoy it in the restaurant but I would in the future, as it was cute and quaint. And they served beer, which is needed on some workdays. 

The most important part: the food! It. Was. Amazing. I got mines extra spicy, because I'm a spicy food freak, with a side of their Sarachi ketchup. The chicken was moist and seasoned to perfection. Crispy and scrumptious. With the tasty coleslaw to offset the heat, everything was perfect. If I wasn't moving to Houston tomorrow, I would be back whenever I was close by in the City.
author: Saushe Y.

description: Solid spicy chicken sandwich. Crispy exterior, juicy dark meat. Good bread to meat ratio... actually it's quite a bit of meat. The fixings are complementary but not overpowering. The curly fries are standard. The line can get out the door during weekday lunch hours so come early.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Simple menu, great tasting food.  This is how you know they got it right - they only offer a small selection, but they do it so well!  I have heard such good things about this place, but every time my coworkers think about going, they always talk themselves out of it because it's during the lunch rush. and the line is always so long.  I finally got to try it when I went for a late lunch (around 1:30p), the line was short and the food came out quick.

The only thing that I would knock them for is the size of the location. It's small, so there is not a lot of seating.

Hopefully they can expand to more locations, or make this one bigger!
author: Eryn S.

description: I had the spicy chicken sandwich  meal  it come what the sandwich,  , & beer  for $12 not a bad deal. The Spicy Chicken Sandwich was good spicy not too spicy, nice and juicy. The curly fries cooked to order. I place I recommend for a quick bite for not a lot of .
author: Travon B.

description: Great quality and totally affordable. Also doesn't make you feel like trash after eating it!
author: August M.

description:
I selected the spicy chicken sandwich:  The best chicken sandwich I've ever had. Bar none. From the slaw/relish to the taste of the chicken, it was excellent. 

Definitely recommend the hand-made siracha sauce.
author: Michael S.

description:
Pros
Real Tasty Spicy Chicken Sandwich.(Heavy portion)
Instant order delivery at the counter.
Clean Good cozy Ambience
Great staff and location.

Cons

No hoardings showing the name of the shop.(may be i missed it) Anyways look for a Board with the picture of a Fox biting a sandwich (something like that) and its next to a Korean BBQ Place.

Sitting outside - it would have been really great if the trash cans were little further away from the seats.
author: Praveen N.

description: When craving fried chicken in downtown SF area, this place was highly recommended. I ordered the regular chicken sandwich and my friends got the spicy chicken sandwich. I though it was pretty tasty and so did my friends. They said the spicy wasn't too spicy but it had a good kick. I loved the slaw that was in the sandwich, I think it gave it a nice twist of flavor. The location is pretty small but we went on a Saturday at around 1pm and we were able to find a table. Overall this spot was pretty good!
author: Elise P.

description: Love this place! Best Chicken sandwich I've ever had! Love the spicy chicken, and where else can you get a Happ"ier" Meal?
author: Austin W.

description:
Loved everything about it.
The little cozy place, the spicy sauces and the succulent burgers - it is as good as it can get.
Perhaps one of the best chicken burgers I've ever had. 
Curly fries are done to perfection and the chicken wings were oh, so spicy! Loved it!!
author: Asmita V.

description: They screw up my order every time I go. Always somehow overcharge me. I can't go back now because each time I do I feel ripped off. Once they sold me lunch items when it was breakfast, refused to refund and replaced with much lower costing items. Another time they combined my two separate orders into one item half the size but charged me for the two separate orders. It's too bad the chicken is great
author: Paul B.

description:
It's hard to find a delicious and affordable meal in the city anymore and The Bird satisfies that. I got the spicy chicken sandwich which comes with Asian slaw and also got the loaded fries. The chicken itself is tender and moist and fried part was nice and crispy and had great flavor. I liked the slaw as well as it added some good tang. The loaded fries were really good as well and complimented the cheat-day meal.

I've also had their breakfast sandwich as well. It's the same chicken except it's between biscuits instead of buns. It comes with a little bit of sauce, but that's it. I added cheese to mine and it was still really good because the chicken is good. It also comes with tater tots and for $5, it's a really good deal.

Overall, it's a good place to come and get a delicious meal for a decent price.
author: Sophia Y.

description:
This place is okay, just okay. I think my expectations were too high -- our office is across the street, and several of my coworkers came back with rave reviews. And while it was tasty, speedy, and affordable for San Francisco, here are all the things that prevented me from rating it higher:

- The non-spicy chicken is a little bland. There's also a weird spice in the breading that adds a touch of sweetness to the whole thing. Maybe allspice or clove? Idk.
- The chicken to bun ratio is off. The chicken is so thick it's hard to take a bite of the sandwich without everything squeezing out. I appreciate the generosity, but it just makes it hard to eat.
- Speaking of which, the integrity of the bun is off. About two bites into the sandwich, my bottom bun completely shattered and fell apart. Heh.
- I think these are the same folks who run Super Duper. I like Super Duper, but find that their burger is missing acidity. Ditto for their chicken burger; the slaw comes with is super fatty and creamy, but not very acidic. The only element of acidity is the pickle. It just needs like, an extra lemon or lime squeeze and it would be so much better!
author: Michelle L.

description: Talking to some people, I got mixed reviews about this place, but once I went it was so good. It's reasonable priced for San Francisco and the spicy chicken sandwich was awesome. They're lightening fast and the service was overwhelming friendly. They usually have a long line for lunch, but it moves quickly and you'll probably have your food in less than 15 minutes. Don't listen to any haters on this place, it's so good.
author: Charles T.

description: Really good for cheap and quick meal. If you're gluten free you can get it without bread. Place is small so get it to go or you can sit outside. The line moves quickly so be ready with what you want to order -- menu is super small so that shouldn't be an issue.
author: Farheen A.

description:
My favorite chicken sandwich in San Francisco!
Spicy one must try!!!
author: Ting-Shan Y.

description: Chicken sandwich was good. Ran out of apple fritters by the afternoon. Overall good food. We went Sunday afternoon wasn't a big wait.
author: Monica A.

description: I highly recommend this place! This is hands down one of the best low key spots in San Francisco!!! Took us a second to find the place cause there's no sign only a fox eating a sandwich but once we found it it was amazing. Food was delicious, customer service on point, and best part the food was ready even before me & my girlfriend had a chance to start a conversation.
author: Alex D.

description: Love the spicy chicken sandwich and the loaded frys! Honestly, I'm obsessed! The service is always quick too especially if I'm in a rush. Also their salted caramel ice cream taco is to die for!
author: Tiffany M.

description:
I am torn between 3 and 4 stars, but judging by the insane pain in my stomach I will keep it at a 3 for now.

First time trying "The Bird" today at 11:30, stood in a line going out the door, waited about 10 minutes. I ordered the regular fried chicken sandwich $8 and the loaded fries $4. I then added a can of seltzer $2.5 (same price as a beer.. regrettable buy) I waited in another line for my food for about 6 minutes and I grabbed some ketchup/ sriracha to go. (great containers by the way)

The sandwich and the fries look great, the restaurant is clean and having an open kitchen really makes you feel better about what you are about to bite into. Sadly it wasn't as amazing as I was anticipating from the look of the line and the vibe of the people!

The chicken was under-cooked in the middle and dry on the bottom and then it was covered in the fried goodness which kind of seemed plopped around the cooked meat? It wasn't crunchy and it just wasn't the best ~bite~. The "slaw" on the sandwich as I have now realized was covered in vinegar (I'm allergic, whoops) and had no seasoning otherwise. It tasted very fresh, but I had to add salt and pepper! 

Don't get me wrong, It wasn't a bad sandwich, it just wasn't amazing. Sorry to report the play by play, but when you go somewhere selling one thing specifically, you go in assuming it's the best!!

The curly loaded fries reminded me of being a kid. They are the SAME exact curly fries that you remember, but covered in delicious goodness. These were a hit!
author: Molli W.

description:
This is quickly becoming one of my go-to lunch spots. It's situated right in the heart of FiDi and has pretty short wait times. Not to mention, it's also pretty cheap.

There are some places that like to dazzle their customers with an abundance of choice and flexible menus to meet every sort of dietary requirement - The Bird is NOT one of those places. The Bird is where you go if you want good fried chicken sandwiches, plain and simple. In fact, the friend chicken sandwich, which is available in both a classic and spicy version, is basically the only main item on the menu. 

They do also offer one or two other items like biscuits and the loaded fries are great too, but the fried chicken sandwich is undoubtedly the star of the show.

If you know what you want and want you want is a really good fried chicken sandwich for $8, head on over to The Bird.
author: Sahil S.

description:
Solid 3-star Southern-style Chicken. Sandwiches are good, so are fries, but it is not something worth half-an-hour wait. The place is super-popular now anyways, and the lines are beating the ones at nearby Senior Sisig.

I haven't try the Happy Meal option with booze so far, but heck, why not?
author: Jakub S.

description:
It was my last day of work at my former employer, so naturally a few of my buddies from the office invited me out to crack open a few cold ones and grab a celebratory bite to eat.  There are few things in the world that tickle my feathers more than a tall can of ice cold beer with some crispy fried chicken, so it's no coincidence that one of my favorite rap albums is the classic 2003 banger, "Chicken-n-Beer" by Ludacris.  I personally want to invite Luda out here and buy him a meal because it's honestly that good and I think he would appreciate it.  I first rolled into The Bird about a year ago for breakfast when I was walking to work and saw a long line of humans eagerly awaiting entry.  The shop was new and they were offering some killers specials, so I decided to give it a whirl.  While I stood in line (outside, because it was so long) my mouth began to water as the scent of chicken biscuits swirled up my nostrils.  A song from another Southern rapper named Yelawolf came to mind.  He said, "You know what I put on chicken biscuits?  I put jelly and hot sauce on my chicken biscuits."  Then he cheered excitedly, "ALL AT THE SAME TIME!"

Alas, I'm at the register where a very friendly young man took my order.  I asked for one spicy chicken biscuit and one regular chicken biscuit.  The breakfast chicken biscuits come with tater tots that also taste delightful.  Once I had the actual chicken biscuits in my paws ready for my morning feeding, I waltzed over to the condiment station where they had jelly and hot sauce.  It wasn't just any old packets of junk that you find at other fried chicken shacks; The Bird has homemade Sriracha sauce that is bombtastic and not too spicy, but with just enough kick to keep the eyes open.  There was also a large jar of strawberry jelly that I lathered on my biscuits, and pulled a Yelawolf by dumping the homemade Sriracha on the fried chicken ALL AT THE SAME TIME!   Dude, I'm tellin' you, please, do yourself a favor, go here and try this one day.  Have you ever been hungover on your way to work?  You know when it's some coworkers' birthday and you get dragged out to some happy hour and it ends up being super fun and you drink too much and dread going to work the next morning because you feel groggy?  Don't take Tylenol or any other drugs; simply go to The Bird, gobble up some chicken biscuits n' tots, and start drinking copious amounts of water and you'll be happy and gleeful again.

So whether you're in the mood to jumpstart your morning, or you want to go out for supper with some buds, this is the place for you.  The chicken sandwich I grubbed for supper is about 2wice the size of the chicken biscuit, so if you're a chugger like me, go for it, but if you're not in the mood to get heavily stuffed, order the biscuit.  As far as the beer selection goes, it's really good, too. Being the chugger I am, I ordered the 32 oz. oil can of Miller High Life aka "The champagne of beers" but that's just because I couldn't resist that massive oil can full of beer.  The IPAs they serve are much better.

And last but not least, there's just a chill vibe in this shop.  Literally every single employee that I've encountered there has been super friendly and they are always playing good music.  Go to The Bird for breakfast, lunch or supper.  You won't be disappointed.  Shout out to the cooks, shout out to the staff, shout out to management, keep doin' what y'all do.  See you next time!!
author: Andrew B.

description: A local version of "chick Fillet". the spicy chicken sandwich is the way to go! Juicy fried chicken with slaw in your sandwich, mmmmm!!! Definitely not a diet food but sure satisfies a great cheat meal! I wish they made different levels of spiciness that people can choose from, not all like the same levels of spiciness.
author: Christine J.

description: Holy busy. 20 deep line and full inside. I'm assuming they must know what they are doing w all the people here and the only thing they sell is chicken in 3 variations and in spicy or not. I ordered a spicy sandwich and fries 10 bucks. Big piece of chicken nice and juicy. Don't be attending an important business meeting as you will wear this sandwich. Very pleased w it but not enough to become a regular. For those of you that get heart burn easily bring the tums with you
author: Tony B.

description:
The fries are over-cooked.
The chicken are a bit salty and spicy.
Howerer, it looks like many people like their food.
author: Hui C.

description:
Their sandwich is SOOO good....WAY TOO good actually it even taste HEALTHY....not oily all. 

The chicken it self is very moist even when they have long lines out the door BUT it MOVES FAST!!

The slaw and pickles gives a great balance and crunch to the spiciness of the chicken. the bread is fresh and isnt soggy. HUGE SANDWICH for $8!

Fully loaded curly fries are TOO die for and its only $3.25?!! Bacon, sour cream & chives over curly fries.

arghh. just thinking about the food makes me want to get another one NOW. 

if you havent tried the Bird then you MUST go soon. Great and efficent customer service. 

i'm kinda glad i dont work in the Fidi because i would eat it everyday....
author: Carol Y.

description: My coworkers and I make a biweekly pilgrimage to The Bird. While I typically bring my lunch to work because I don't enjoy many lunch spots downtown, the spicy chicken sandwich here is a worthwhile treat! I have also tried the salad, but the best part of the salad was the chicken. This is definitely not a salad joint. The curly fries are also excellent, as are the ice cream sandwiches! Get here early if you don't have a long lunch break.
author: Alice L.

description: A perfect breakfast sando that even comes with a side of tots. Not too big or filling that you won't be able to eat lunch, not too small that you're still hungry when it's done. If anything I'm just sad I didn't get more biscuits. Hot damn this was fire.
author: Molly H.

description:
The regular and spicy fried chicken is just mind blowing. I love how soft the bun is with the crunchy apple slaw with the outstanding crispy and juicy sandwich. With a chicken sandwich and curly fries will be a complete meal to eat for anytime of the day, I would say. 

Service is great, but as for a heads up it may be a possible wait if you go during lunch hour in the FiDi (Financial District).
author: Brittany L.

description:
Spicy chicken sandwich was horrible ! Waaaaay to much chili powder or cumin something over powering flavor. Wasnt spicy in the sense of hot, spicy in the sense of tooooo much chili powder. Didnt even finish it. The spot was nice, service was good, but just wasnt good in my
Opinion. I think I should have tried the plane chicken vs the spicy.
author: Amin R.

description:
Small menu revolving around fried chicken. Which means they specialize in fried chicken. And yes, their fried chicken is pretty special. Big ol' hunk of juicy meat with thin crisp batter. $6.50 for the chicken sandwich, and it'll get ya full. Lots of fresh and crunchy slaw. Nice artisan bread.

And, when they say spicy, they mean spicy. Not mild. And it's the creeper kinda spicy where you'll probably start to get numb about halfway through your meal.

Curly fries and salad are also good and fresh. And, lots of canned beer to choose from.

I wouldn't change anything about this place! Except, it would be great if this was closer to my office. But it's probably best it isn't. Gotta look out for my waistline!
author: Emily C.

description:
I tried the original and spicy fried chicken ($8) and both was delicious and highly recommend if you haven't already tried this!! The wait wasn't too bad as I arrived 1130-1145. There is a long line if you come after this but generally it goes pretty fast. 

Spicy was more flavorful but it was too salty (might've been that batch) for my taste. I typically order mild or medium and I was able to tolerate it. 

Loaded currly fries portion was small and remind me the concept of In-N-Out animal style fries. I can go without this but just wanted to try it. I would recommend splitting this with a friend if you're also ordering one of the fried chicken. 

There's also a breakfast sandwich but I think it's only until 1030AM M-F i believe. Def want to try this out one of these days. 

Price is very worth for the amount of chicken you get and it's very juicy. Prob one of the best fried chicken sandwich I had in awhile. A lot of places make it that it's really dry.
author: Sherry Y.

description: Super awesome chicken sandwich place. The vibe was super awesome and so were the people working there. Answered all my questions about the entire menu and gave me recommendations for my first time. The gf and I split the "Happier Meal", which was the sandwich, curly fries, and a BEER all for $13. Definitely filling and super good.
author: Navdeep D.

description:
Worth the wait!! The line here moves pretty fast and the food comes out almost right away. They have a pretty good assembly line going in the kitchen. I probably waited about 15 min from the time I got in line and got my food during the 12pm lunch hour. 

I had the classic chicken sandwich and it was AMAZING!! I was curious to try the spicy version, but thought I should try out the regular one first. The chicken was perfectly tender and juicy. Totally fresh and high quality! The breading on the chicken was so crisp and flavorful; it had a warm and sweet spice to it... cinnamon maybe? Anyways, it was really unique and scrumptious. Comes with pickles, slaw, and mayo and the most buttery and squishy bun!! In case you can't tell I loved this sandwich; I practically wolfed it down. Decided to skip the fries. I guess they used to have curly fries, but now they are crinkle ones? Anyways, they looked bland and boring. Maybe the loaded ones would be okay. 

Awesome place and really reasonably priced. The sandwich is definitely worth $8. I'm going to come back to try their breakfast too.
author: Kelly E.

description: The spicy fried chicken sandwich from The Bird was absolutely PHENOMINAL (and the wonderful curly fries didn't hurt either)  Cooked to perfection and the slaw/pickles on top were so flavorful and amazing! Service was great and quick as well.
author: Jason P.

description:
I literally work across the street from The Bird at 140 New Montgomery and always notice the lunchtime line that forms outside this joint. It's been a few months since it first opened and today was the first time I came to see what the hype was all about. 

First off, if you want a table, get here early! By noon, all the tables were already taken. The line went out the door, directed by stanchions - greatly appreciated with constant traffic. When you get in, you'll notice a few focal points in eye sight: a huge BEER sign, apparently they sell beer lol, and a theater style menu, bright and easy to read. The menu is sooo simple, focused on just a few items, with the hope to perfect what's offered. There's high top tables inside and table tops outside for lots of seating however, the early "bird" gets the worm. The staff is super friendly, super efficient. I love the assembly line of chicken sandwiches they create as orders are placed. 

Hands down, the most popular item is the Fried Chicken Sandwich, your choice of spicy or classic, for $8. Between two toasted buns, you have a huge deep fried, white meat chicken patty topped with an apple slaw and sliced pickles. There's also (I believe) some kind of sauce: thousand island, mayo type or aioli like. I also order the seasoned curly fries for about $3. OH EM GEE! The chicken sandwich is out of this world! I got the classic version, the chicken was crispy and flavorful, juicy and tender. The toast buns gave depth and a great foundation for the party in between. LOVED the apple slaw, a little bit of a tang accompanied with the pickles gave a fresh vibe and different texture, creating a well balanced bite for your taste buds. What a smashing hit! HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS. For my fries, I was a little disappointed to discover that they gave me crinkled fries instead. I didn't notice them putting my to-go bag together, don't know if they were out of curly fries, but I've seen friends eating their curly fries in the past so super disappointing to come back to work and discover a mediocre crinkle fries. Just seemed like a defrosted bag o' fries you pick up from your local Costco. 

Aside from that little hiccup, this place is awesome. So worth the wait, so worth the walk (not for me though, I work across the street lol), so worth the price. Unfortunately this meal is not on my approved list of healthy items but when you're looking to live a little, fly over to The Bird and check them out!

CLUCK YEAH!
author: Rockne H.

description:
I knew I was in for a treat when I saw the absurdly long line that was formed before it opened. I eagerly got in line to wait my turn. Of course, not long after, a nice employee came out with free samples of their Curly Fries for their long wait.

They only had a limited menu at the time I visited, which is understandable as they just opened and are a new place finding their way. You have four options:

1. The Regular/Spicy Chicken Sandwich (5/5 Awesome)
2. Curly Fries/Loaded Fries (3/5. They're not that special, you get what you expect).
3. Warm Ice Cream Sandwich (4/5 An interesting treat/dessert).
4. Beer (2/5 You probably have your own preferred brand).

They were just churning out Fries and Sandwiches, so the line moved at a decent pace and you got your food only about 2-3 minutes after ordering. I wish their side items were a bit better, but they got time to improve.

Downsides were ultimately the price of the Chicken Sandwich and the relatively unfriendly service, but hey, it's San Francisco. 

I'll definitely be back, and maybe show up even earlier to beat the line.
author: Alton D.

description:
Just came here with my guy. We arrived a lil before noon and there was no line.

It's confusing- you wont find the name of this restaurant anywhere on the outside of the building or the inside Look for a painting of a wolf/ dog instead - that's the place! It's right next to Specialty bakery cafe.

Their spicy chicken sandwich is out of this world moist, perfect spiciness. The coleslaw and pickles in the sandwich are the star of this dish - they complement the fried chicken so perfectly. What a perfect sandwich. Curly fries are great too!
author: Lina S.

description:
Solid fried chicken sandwich. In a city of overpriced fried chicken sandwiches (looking at you, Rove Kitchen), the Bird is a welcome addition.

I wouldn't expect anything less given that they pretty much only offer fried chicken sandwiches and fries. It makes it easy to decide what to get.
Do you want a non-spicy fried chicken sandwich or a spicy one?
Do you want regular curly fries or fully loaded fries with bacon, cheese, and green onions?

I chose the regular sandwich ($8) with regular curly fries ($2.50). The fresh brioche bun (no sesame seeds) holds up really well to the big piece of juicy fried chicken. The chicken is crispy and has a nice, not-terribly-heavy-or-oily crust. The apple slaw and pickles don't do much, but don't hurt the sandwich either. The sandwich is flavorful, but it's not heavy in sauces. I would prefer a tangier sauce like a BBQ sauce instead of the default mayo, but it's fine as is. The spicy version of the sandwich is too spicy for what I would want to eat a whole thing of, but if you like spicy foods, you'll definitely find the spicy version more tasty. As for the curly fries... GETTTT IT. I haven't had curly fries since the Arby's days.

The line has gotten considerably better since the grand opening days. Plus, once you order, the food comes out ridiculously fast, so don't spend too long going to the bathroom or packing up your condiments.

I did see what looked like a giant bag of frozen fried chicken that they were dumping into the fryer. They never claimed housemade batter and hand-coated or organic and blah blah SF culture, so take what you want from that, but it's still delicious.
author: Alice T.

description:
I love places that only have one or two signature items in the menu, especially when they include fried chicken. The Bird has two fried chicken sandwiches (approximately $8) - regular and spicy. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and it definitely did not disappoint. The chicken was juicy, spicy, and deliciously fried, and the sauces were spot on. The service was extremely fast; I went around 12:30PM, and while there was a line, I was in and out of there in under 15 minutes (I ordered to go). 

While I didn't stay to eat at The Bird, there was a decent amount of seating and it looked like a place that served all sorts of clientele. There were students, businessmen and women in business suits, and tourists. Definitely a must try if you like fried chicken.
author: Mili P.

description:
"Do you feel like eating the best fried chicken sandwich in the city?" asked my overly ebullient boyfriend.
"Uhhh you're not overstating that?" I replied, laughing at his proclamation.
"Nope, let's go."
A few minutes later, I'm delightfully satiated and a yelp review is complete.
author: Heidy S.

description:
Ok I came back to try something else because my roommates ordered a ton of stuff from here and it all looked and smelled amazing. 

This time, I tried the spicy chicken salad (+full bird). I'm impressed by the amount of things they put into it. I actually got pretty full. While they advertised a kale and romaine base, they ended up serving mixed greens and romaine (like, totally unacceptable! lol jk it was good because made it less hard to chew). The salad also came with lemony apples, beets, and barley (i think) which mixed pretty well with each other. 

I think I got a bad piece of chicken last time or maybe I really didn't like the crust but I think I understand why. The breading does not stick well to the chicken and it is a little extra. Also, it almost tastes... healthy like a gluten-free tofu nugget made with cornmeal or something. Anyway, I really liked the chicken this time because I got the spicy one and it was juicy and actually spicy. Yum. Beware of the strong flavor though--not dank level but you'll be thirsty. 

I definitely want to try their deserts the next time I come here and I'm glad I was able to have a better experience.
author: Lydia Z.

description: Spicy fried chicken sandwich is delicious. Kinda messy and a bit too much onion for me but overall a great chicken sandwich. The loaded fries were pretty good too. Props to the staff, we accidentally left a box of desserts at the table and when I came back about 20 minutes later they had kept it behind the counter for us!
author: Lainy C.

description:
The best fried chicken sandwich I've ever had! Chicken was extremely fresh and juicy for a fried piece of chicken. Nice vegetables selected to compliment in the sandwich. I was beyond surprised by the flavor in my first bite. Beyond tasty!

I'm a fries lover of all type. I would give their fries a 5 star rating! Love the cut, texture and flavor.

Great place for a quick bite or make it more social event with friends as they have a selection of beers.
author: Kevin C.

description:
Okay, first of all, let me preface this review with the context that I am a fiend for a fried chicken sandwich, a connoisseur of the form.

Anywhere that offers a fried chicken sandwich, that will usually be my first choice. I've tried a lot of chicken sandwiches in the city. I've tried a lot around the state. It's been a bit of a mission for me.

The Bird serves up what I consider a genre-defining sandwich. The regular is really good, the spicy sandwich is divine beyond words. The spice blend really sets the flavor profile above all the rest I've encountered. It is literally my perfect fried chicken. The slaw is on point, the pickles are great, the bread is exactly what it should be, the chicken itself is exquisite, and the curly fries are perfect.

And it's quite affordable. I'd probably pay half over again what they charge and happily consider it a great price.

Stupid good, all around. The only thing I would change is their location, because it's kind of a pain to trek across the city from where I am. Ah, delivery options would be appreciated, too.
author: Austin M.

description:
Out of all the food I tried during my brief trip to SF, this place was probably my favorite (ditched other food plans so we could eat here twice). I will miss the juicy, crispy, flavorful chicken :( There are similar places in SoCal like Birdie's and Two Birds but I would still say this chicken sandwich was better. Not overly breaded, not too dry, unique-tasting herbs. Their house-made Sriracha was delicious. We also tried the salted caramel ice cream taco and it was surprisingly good! 

I tried both the non-spicy chicken sandwich and the non-spicy naked chicken. I think the chicken sandwich was better because of the mix of everything in your mouth (delicious bun, slaw, pickles, and the fried chicken). The naked chicken was better for enjoying the chicken alone, and less messy, but if I went back I'd definitely get the sandwich again.

Their service is quick and brusque. Nothing outstanding, but not rude either. Good for a quick bite of delicious top-notch fried chicken. I highly recommend!
author: Jenny L.

description:
I was craving a breakfast sandwich...and the Bird was listed under SF Eater's 9 Outstanding Egg Sandwiches (https://sf.eater.com/maps/best-egg-breakfast-sandwiches-san-francisco). 

I came here the other morning before dropping off my bf at work. We came around 9:30am, and there was no line, woot! Skipped the morning working crowd! I was able to order 2 breakfast sandwiches right away. You get to choose between sausage or bacon, and it comes with these tater tots in coin shape, all for $4.50. Wow. 

The food came relatively quickly, and when we took a first bite of the tater tots, they were luke warm. Breakfast sandwich was also luke warm. A little on the disappointing side. The size was tiny, but what do you expect for $4.50? It was kind of nice, not having a huge brunch like how every San Franciscan does on the weekends. Ketchup was something to note though. They have regular ketchup, but also their HOMEMADE ketchup, which was spicy! Different and delicious!

Ambiance was actually pretty nice for a fast-food type of joint. They have a cute light-up sign in the back spelling "BEER," and a cute painting on the wall of a dog eating a sandwich. Service was nothing special, seems like they hated their job. They do have water on tap, but it was also broken at the time I was there.

Breakfast sandwiches only served from 8:30-10:30am. After that, they transition to the lunch menu, which I have to try next. I NEED TO TRY THEIR FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH NEXT!!!!!
author: Jocelyn L.

description: The Bird is so so good- wish I would have gone there sooner. The fried chicken sandwich is the closest thing to southern heaven you will find in San Francisco. The lines are long right at 12- so make sure you go early or late. I've only been for lunch and I've never dined it because it is typically too crowded. I'd suggest getting food to go and definitely go for their sauce!
author: Carol Ann V.

description:
Came here for lunch on a weekday after seeing the popular reviews and tasty looking photos. Line was long, but moved quickly. They have a really efficient operation that churns out burgers fast. We waited less than 5 minutes.

Ordered the fried chicken sandwich and loaded fries. Chicken was perfectly spicy, juicy, and hot. Bun was perfect, and slaw was fresh and refreshing. Loaded curly fries were dressed with cheese, sour cream, bacon, and green onions but not too heavy.

Awesome spot for lunch, will definitely be back!
author: Tim X.

description:
Yes please!  I was staying town for a conference and turned to my trusty Yelp app to find a quick spot to grab some lunch.  'The Bird' showed up on my app and was only a short distance away from my hotel. I went on a Friday around noon and the line had only a few people in front of me, but the place was pretty full of people chomping on their deliciously crisp fried chicken sandwiches.  

Smiles and laughter filled the air as I anxiously waited (the very short) line to order my food.  I ordered the classic fried chicken, curly fries, and a root beer.  A few minutes later they were calling for me telling my order was ready.  

I quickly found a seat next to some other happy customers and dug right into the crispy, tender hunk of fried chicken.  So many textures and flavors.  The slightly sweet and tangy apple slaw was a great crunchy contrast to the tender chewy bun, and complemented the crisp of the savory perfectly fried chicken.  I stuffed my face with curly fries in between bites of the chicken.  Sure, these curly fries are basically Arby's curly fries (i.e. not homemade), but who doesn't like curly fries?  

What would I do to improve what was already a delicious meal?  Perhaps having fountain soda and draft beer (instead of cans and bottles), and homemade hand cut fries (if done right) would make this place near perfect.  But hey, I already gave this place 5 stars so I guess this is just nitpicking.  

If you are hungry for a delicious fried chicken sandwich, I'm giving you The Bird.
author: Paul W.

description: Food was very good. The people working there, not so much. It gets really crowded so I'm sure they work hard but the people seemed like they didn't want to be there at all. Come here to try the unique chicken sandwiches, not a friendly experience except for other diners
author: C M.

description:
I was doing a Yelp search for good lunches in the area, and I came across this place. I didn't want just a salad for lunch, and a fried chicken sandwich sounded amazing since I didn't have breakfast. I saw that lines could get kind of long at lunch, so I decided to go around 11:15 and order to go. 

I ordered the fried chicken sandwich and curly fries. The sandwich didn't take long to come out because I think they had some just sitting there. The fries were definitely not fresh, they were lukewarm and soggy. I like my fries extra crispy and hot. 

When I opened up my sandwich back at my desk, it looked really big. As I bit into the sandwich, the ratio of stuff in it didn't feel right. There was way too much slaw, and that started making the crispy chicken kinda soggy. I ended up scraping off the majority of the slaw. 

Compared to the rest of the fidi, this place is considered a deal, but this place just isn't for me. Glad I tried it though. May try the breakfast one day....who knows.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
Their spicy chicken sandwich is worth the wait. For $8, you get a sandwich with a nice big hunk of fried chicken, so large that it sticks out of the buns, stuffed with slaw and pickles and mayo. Usually breading falls off or I pick it off and sometimes I pick out slaw, but I did neither of those things with this sandwich. It needed no adjustments from me. The chicken was incredibly juicy and even though I finished only half at The Bird and finished the rest of it later, the sandwich held up and it was just as good a few hours later. 

Limited seating inside but it seems like most people take their food to go.
author: Yvonne K.

description:
Honestly I prefer Chickfila.  Ordered the fried chicken sandwich and I'm not sure what spice is in the batter to fry the chicken but I was not a fan.  Nutmeg? Cinnamon? It's something I couldn't figure out but it was way too overpowering.  Quality was good other than that.

Fries were fries.
author: Jessica L.

description: EVERYTIME I COME TO SF IT IS MANDATORY TO COME HERE!  Man when you have a craving for a good chicken sandwich and brooskie head their way. Love the texture of the sandwich and their loaded fries. The beer cozies are dope to haha.
author: Michael R.

description: Absolutely _delicious_ spicy chicken sandwiches, but the last two times I've been (out of 5), I've had a stomach ache and headache for the rest of the day afterwards.
author: Vincent K.

description: There are burger shops, then there are burger shops that sell chicken sandwiches, then there are chicken sandwich shops which specialize in all things chicken. Chicken sandwiches are very well underrated in my opinion cause everyone always says they want a burger, this place will help bring light to what you're missing out. A little bit messy to eat, but what'd you expect xD
author: Dion L.

description:
Super awesome food best spicy chicken sandwich 
Although line in lunch time is huge.

Find enough time to stand in line for 15 mins in peak lunch hours
author: Raman K.

description:
Writing an updated review - and yup, I came here TWICE on the same day. I was craving their biscuit sandwich so I came for breakfast... and come lunch I wanted their chicken sandwich so guess where I ended up? Yup, you guessed it.  

Breakfast chicken biscuit sandwich - there's some sort of weird mayo that they slather on. This was meh to me and I should've told them to put it off, but perhaps others may like it. The biscuit was excellent! The most unhealthy breakfast I've had in a while but worth every bit. The biscuit was not too dry and not too buttery, but still crumbly and oh-so-delicious. Went great with spicy chicken.
The hash rounds were good - crisp and hot, not too salty. 

Lunch - line was out the door but moved pretty fast, so don't let the line scare you. Spicy chicken sandwich was spicy, moist, crispy, awesome bun too (refer to my previous review or any others for more details on the chicken). I still think this is the best fried (spicy) chicken sandwich I've ever had. 
For some reason, the curly fries I ordered weren't that fresh! This was odd given that they were super busy so they should have been cooking constantly. My fries weren't that crispy and tasted like fries that have sat too long (starting to edge on being soggy). I ate in the restaurant, so this isn't attributable to ordering to-go and having the fries steam itself to sogginess, as would happen if you did that.

Their ice cream sandwich is REALLY good. It's some sort of hawaiian-type bun that they cook in a waffle-like maker (NOT FRIED) with ice cream inside. I ordered the strawberry chocolate chunk. I couldn't taste much chocolate but the strawberry was nice and refreshing, especially after a heavy fried sandwich. Overall, not overly sweet which is GREAT.
author: Melody L.

description:
Went in to the place expecting to be blown away...and honestly, I wasn't blown away but I caught a quick gust of wind. 

The Chicken sandwiches get all the reviews and I wanted to try it all. Ordered up the Chicken Sandwich AND of course added an extra piece of meat to it, a Spicy Chicken though. Good call. Felt like the original piece was a bit dry (they did have the extra pieces just chillin on the grill tho). 

The spicy piece was good & flavorful, I'll probably just order that next time. The cole slaw and additional condiments on the burger were pretty good tho. The best part of the meal to me were the Loaded Fries = loaded bake potato but with Curly Fries. The fries were nice & crispy, quality cheese, and good sour cream. 

Overall it was a great burger, good fries and even better service.  I'll be back. @doublemeatplease @oohsofull
author: John M.

description: I am really disgusted. Found a hair in their chicken sandwich.
author: Sachin N.

description:
I ordered the happier meal which comes with chicken sandwich, curly fries and a beer! The chicken was very tender yet crispy on the outside. It tasted as if they had large pickle slices in their sandwich, in any case it was a good ratio. 

Seating is very limited, but don't be shy!
author: Carter L.

description:
Are these reviews real! 
I really wanted to like this place. We traveled far and wide for this place sent money on car services to come here and the food is a major miss.  I've a foodie this is just a disappointed, the food looks good but that's about it. The spicy chicken sandwich is sooo spicy and blend you can't even taste the chicken, that toppings are a fail, and the curly fries taste like fast food, not fresh or homemade, yet the line is out the door. Man i miss NYC food. Epic fail.
author: Chlöe S.

description:
Great chicken sandwich! Juicy chicken and nicely flavored. Spicy one is good.

Also have good beer selection and provide sparkling water for free.
author: Hyun Goo K.

description:
There is a sketch of a fox, not a bird, in lieu of a shop name. 

We had the spicy chicken sandwich and spicy chicken biscuits. Both were fantastic. The spice had a real kick to it and the spice level was pretty high, maybe 7.5 out of 10. Fries were really crisp and yummy too.
author: Lindt C.

description:
YUM! I think this place lives up to the yelp hype. The chicken sandwich is well battered with seasoned batter, and the meat itself was so moist. The amount of chicken in the sandwich is also a good portion, but I was still left wanting more before it was just that good! 

They have a spicy chicken sandwich too, which I might have to try the next time I'm there. 

Lunchtime is packed, but if you go during 2-3pm there shouldn't be any lines.
author: Cindy H.

description: There spicy fried chicken is the best in the city for reasonable price.I usually go there at odd times in the afternoon as it is always crowded.
author: Trinath R.

description:
This is the only place I know where the regular chicken sandwich and the spicy version are equally good in their own way. While I definitely prefer the spicy, the regular is awesome. I almost hate to tell people about this place as it can get pretty crowded at lunch time but they deserve the shout out. 

And definitely get the loaded fries over the regular. The combination of the bacon bits, cheese, and sour cream is definitely worth the extra $1.50. 

I will go to this place every time I am in San Francisco (and that is often).
author: David H.

description:
If you are looking for a quick, filling lunch in the FiDi, then check out the Bird's $8 fried chicken sandwich. For me, it totally hits the spot. 

The piece of chicken is enormous. The portion size was enough that no sides were necessary for me. I liked it enough to come back 2 consecutive days to try both the original and the spicy. The breading on the chicken is crisp, spiced right and doesn't fall apart. The chicken is juicy and cooked perfectly. The slaw on the sandwich has apples and cabbage which offers a nice tart, bright crunch. After trying both versions, I will opt for the spicy and ask for extra mayo as I feel like the sandwich could benefit from being a little more creamy to balance out the hot sauce. 

Also, if you can, eat the sandwich there instead of to go because the bread is soft and gets soggy quickly. 

Order at the counter where they display their offerings of canned sodas & beers. The place gets super packed at lunch time, but by 1:30 it clears out enough to get a seat by the time the food is ready. There is a little outdoor seating which will be lovely on warm afternoons. 

I have yet to try their hot ice cream sandwich or loaded curly fries, but I'm sure I will as I plan to visit the Bird on a regular basis.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
Once upon a workday dreary, while I pondered,
weak and weary,
Over many a quaint and curious volume of lunchtime hour--
While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a grumbling,
As my stomach gently mumbling, mumbling at my brain to scour--
"Tis my appetite," I muttered. "Mumbling at my brain to scour--
For the Bird and nothing more"

The Bird is so good. They're so fast. The line gets so long, but it's kind of worth it if you're not in a rush. The Bird is so good.
author: Vernon L.

description: Really not sure what's the hype. +13 dollars is a lot for sandwich and fries when it is slightly better than chickfila. The toppings of slaw and pickle inside is great. The bun and crispness of chicken isnt that much more spectacular. The fries portion was really small too. The positive is the food is delivered super fast
author: David L.

description:
The Bird is the future.

Only a restaurant which perfects a dish can carry the rent at this location (after the previous tenant).

The Bird happens to be such establishment.

The sandwich around which they built the business is - possibly -perfect.

And this approach is - i believe - the future of fast casual food.

Master one basic beloved staple, make it unbeatable, throw in required "accessories" like sides and drinks - voila -  winning formula.

This is what The Bird does.
author: Oleg H.

description:
The line was so long when I got there, but it kept moving so it wasn't a big deal. 
The sandwich and fries are in big portions, so bring your appetite. If it weren't for the simple fact that I moved to a new state, I would definitely go back for my chicken sandwich cravings. 
Highly recommended spot in SF.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Went for lunch during the rush and the line flew by. Ordered my food and it was ready in no time!

Got the spicy chicken sandwich and was blown away. Best chicken sandwich I've ever had. Add on a side of curly fries and homemade sriracha and you've got a certified banger of a meal.
author: Tucker N.

description:
I love fried chicken. I love bread. I love curly fries. I love the bird.

I go for the spicy chicken sandwich and it's amazing. The lunchtime wait is well worth it, but the line can stretch far down the block. There's usually no wait for dinner though, so check it out later in the day to avoid the line. Be warned though, you might need to take a nap after consuming the deliciousness. Oh and their breakfast is also great.
author: Matt G.

description: Cool small quaint place. Awesome friendly staff. The menu is rather basic but the chicken sandwich is not bad at all. I wish I had got just the plan curly fries. I am personally not a fan of the nacho processed cheese but if you like it you will love the loaded fries. If you are looking for a chicken sandwich that is resembling that of the south this is not it. This dark meat sandwich is good though if you give it a try. I recommend stopping in and giving them a try.
author: Kayode W.

description: Okay! WOW!!! Just wow!!! Had the spicy chicken sandwich and added more spice! You want flavor, fresh, juicy, moist inside and crispy outside? Get this! You won't be disappointed! Delish!!!
author: Aaa T.

description:
Gotta love places that focus on certain things they make really well! This place makes chicken sandwiches really well. It's not the best I've ever had, so that pulls off a star. But that doesn't mean you shouldn't eat here. These sandwiches are truly delectable. 

Don't let the line scare you off. It moves fast.

I prefer the spicy.
author: Aakash G.

description: I've been here a handful of times and I'm always impressed! The spices, the chicken and the apple slaw they use on the sammies -- all stellar! Friendly staff, quick service and fresh ingredients. Thanks for being one of my neighborhood favorites! Until next time birdies,...
author: Ashley C.

description:
My husband and I got the happier meal which was perfect! For $12.50 you get a sandwich, fries and a beer. You can pick between a regular or spicy chicken sandwich. We got the spicy one and it's not super spicy at all but packed great flavor. 

It was busy when we went but if we were able to still find a table. It's a smaller building and can be easy to walk past. 

Overall I was very please with my lunch there and would go again!
author: Tiffany B.

description: Yummy lunch... If you can stand waiting 5 min in the line... The chicken sandwich and pickled slaw were perfect. The homemade siracha sauce, together with the curly fries is to die for.
author: Dennis H.

description:
Surprise goodness. Simple menu. Good chicken, good fries. Hard to say much more. 

Hard to find. Signage is odd. Line out the door helped me find it. 

Not chick-fil-a but if you don't have the crown jewel of chicken, a pretty good local option. 

Check it out!
author: Charlie B.

description:
So, when we visited our adult son in Seattle, we walked into his house and his roommate was at their dining room table, eating a chicken sandwich from Skillet.  The next day, I had to have one for myself.  And now, that is the standard by which I judge all fried chicken sandwiches.

And The Bird comes close.  Very close.  Skillet adds some fennel to their batter, but The Bird has a slaw on their sandwich that would make Donald J. Rump crawl to Kim Jong Un's house on his hands and knees.  Well, maybe not that good, but it's damn good.  Sweet but not sweet, sour but not sour, crunchy and light and not drenched in its own juices.  The batter on the chicken itself is crunchy and tasty, and the bun was light and slightly sweet.  Curly fries were just a touch spicy, but crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside.  

I'd go back.  In fact, I can't wait to take our son to The Bird and let him taste the SF cousin of Skillet.
author: Jane C.

description: The Bird is the word! I'd heard about this spot close to my office for awhile, so along with 6 other co-workers we came here to eat lunch last Friday around 11am. 11am you say? Yes the place gets absolutely packed anytime after 11:30am (we tried going the previous week around 12:00pm and that was a no no). The staff was friendly and the food came out in under ten minutes. I ordered the chicken sandwich with a side of fries and a root beer. The sandwich is fantastic! It's not dry at all and very crispy and moist. The fries were an absolute treat. They were very crispy and had great taste to them. The place is a bit small, so seating is definitely difficult when they get busy. As we left the line was down the street, so get here early for some solid food!
author: James R.

description:
Finally made it to The Bird! I have been wanting to check it out since my friends said it rivaled Bakesale Betty. Here is my analysis...

Bread - good quality nothing mind blowing 
Chicken - PERFECTLY fried but a little over seasoned for my liking. 
Slaw - yummy but I prefer Bakesale Betty's slaw 
Fries - their okay, I want them to go back to the curly fries.
Atmosphere - great location for a lunch spot! Plus it has outdoor seating, perfect for enjoying their beer sandwich combo on!
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Like Darin K. said, a bit underwhelming... The chicken is moist, yes. I think they use chicken thigh though which is the smart thing to do. Chicken breast can be so easily overcooked and dried out. Everything is just so heavy (i know, i know it's a fried chicken sandwich!), but i wish there was bti more slaw on there to balance everything out. Also, it's a bit pricey for the size. I wasn't that full after my meal :( However, this would be a great place for drunk food! I can imagine how awesome that juicy, greasy sandwich would taste after a night of drinking! 

=]
author: Judy W.

description: Long line and the sign is a bit hidden but the food was great. Definitely loved the Sriracha on my sandwich and fries!
author: Delta B.

description:
My favorite breakfast joint!!! Granted, not so many options around me. But for $5?!

I've gone here for breakfast and got chicken and biscuits several times. Best biscuits ever. Delicious fried chicken that's juicy while crispy. And the apple fritters!! I've ordered for my company for breakfast too and everyone loved it.
author: Ke D.

description: I didn't get to try it but went on memorial day Monday and it was closed at 7:15 PM. Just make sure to confirm the hours.
author: Meagan H.

description:
When you basically only have one specialty, you better do it right. Holy crap does this place do it right.

Line of people out the door, but plenty of seating somehow with a line that moves ever so quickly. $8 spicy or regular chicken sandwich with slaw, pickles, and a thick piece of fried chicken breast. 

I originally thought I'd be paying 2x for essentially a chick-fil-a sandwich. But nope, this place takes it a step up. Get the chicken. Get the fries. Enjoy the meal!
author: Andrew C.

description: I decided to give this place a shot. Why not? I have been on the chicken sando hype train. I had high hopes for this place but it def missed the mark. The quality of the chicken was subpar. The "spice" is not overwhelming at all. It was good, but not something I will go out of my way for. I feel like it was missing something.
author: Ross S.

description: Phenomenal lunch near SFMoMA. Line moves fast. Why would anyone go to chipotle across the street when they could have this?!? Delicious chicken sandwich and curly fries
author: Wendi M.

description: Had their spicy fried chicken salad, and it was great! The salad came with a mix of various chopped greens, beets, apple slices, and had a really great homemade vinagrette (light, a tad tangy, lots of black pepper). The spicy fried chicken is SPICY so don't try it if you can't handle some spice. I can eat pretty spicy and I found myself chugging water to wash the flame down. I'm going to try their normal fried chicken salad next time. I definitely recommend and would aim to get there early as their line gets longer the closer it gets to noon!
author: Cynthia H.

description: My second time at "The Bird." I was happy to see that the consistency was still there. Nice spicy crusty outside and juicy tender meat on the inside. I had thought about making the rounds to as many chicken sandwich locations as possible. However, there is no need. "The Bird" checks all the boxes for me.
author: Anthony W.

description:
Had my chicken sandwich to go.  A colleague in the office brought one to me as a surprise.

Now THAT"S better than a sharp stick in the eye.

And yeah - the sandwich rocked.  I'll be back.  Soon.
author: Lewis C.

description: Absolutely delicious.  Highly recommend.  I heard this came from the same folks who brought us Super Duper.  The spicy chicken sandwich was amazing.  I can't help but think that daikon pickles would make it even better, but what do I know.
author: Angel S.

description:
The chicken was very moist and pinkish, so not sure if it was completely cooked or a marinate. Not what I was expecting, similar to Bake Sale Betty on Telegraph in Oakland with a toy different favor. 
Bake Sale Betty much better, I do not like Wet chicken.
author: Rachelle M.

description:
Hurry so you can say you ate here first.  Best deal in town.
Spicy Chicken Sand, Fries and a Beer $12 bucks!
That spicy chicken sand blows Chick Fillay out of the Hen House!
author: Brian H.

description:
*** In Short ***

Fantastic, fiery, fried fowl.

*** In Depth ***

With Monday being one of the unfortunate days where my company doesn't provide lunch (#firstworldproblems, I know), and photos of the fried chicken sandwiches from The Bird haunting me from my Instagram feed the week prior, the decision on where to eat was an easy one, for once.

Showing up right around noon, I was faced with a very short line of four or five people ahead of me, managing to order and receive my spicy chicken sandwich all within the span of ten to fifteen minutes.

And by god, what a sandwich it was! Crispy, juicy (expect to make a mess), and flavorful chicken, a bit on the salty side, but offset by the pickles and slaw, all on a fluffy, toasted bun. And lest someone tell you otherwise, they aren't joking when they call it spicy: I have a pretty high tolerance level for spicy things (ghost pepper candies what what), and this definitely still had me sweating a bit.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - Seating primarily consists of high tops here, unfortunately, there there is a bit of lower, accessible counter seating by the front windows, as well as regular two tops outside. That said, during lunch time, seating might be somewhat limited, so you may be better off taking your food to-go and eating somewhere else. Seating area aside, getting around the rest of the venue should be fairly easy, though you may have to maneuver past a number of people, depending on the time.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description: Pretty good chicken sandwich, cheap and quick eat I would say. It was strongly recommended by one of my friend as the best chicken sandwich he has ever had, but I wouldn't go that far. Nevertheless, amazing chicken sandwich! Try the spicy one if you're feeling adventurous. They have pretty long wait lines during busy office lunch hour.
author: Rahul D.

description: Decided to try out SF's hot chicken offerings and was given this spot as a recommendation. I got a spicy fried chicken and it was excellent. Not too hot, but more heat than any of the chain restaurant attempts I've recently tried. The curly fries were not on the level of the chicken, but they were fine. I'll probably go again to check out their breakfast while in town.
author: Hosie T.

description: Tasty, definitely prefer spicy fried chicken and curly fries. Great food and value for money
author: Balu V.

description: Best spicy fried chicken in San Francisco!!! Quick & simple meal but the spicy chicken goessss hard. Very juicy & succulent - fries are crispy + they have a meal that includes beer!!! I always try and make an effort to come out here for my chicken fix
author: Rj L.

description:
Really good chicken sandwich. 
Spent ~$13 and got about three and a half curly fries. The service is good, but it's swarming with techies and bros (but what else should be expected in SOMA). 
Really clean, though.
author: Zak C.

description:
I loved The Bird's spicy chicken burger!! 
Often times fried chicken tends to be dry, but The Bird does a wonderful job retaining the chicken's moisture. The chicken was so juicy and their breading to chicken ratio was perfect. They also use chicken that does not have growth hormones.

When people tell that something is spicy, I take this with a grain of salt. I enjoy spicy food. Spicier the better! Their spicy burger is indeed spicy, but not like jalapeños and flaming chili flavored spicy.

I am amazed at the seasoning they use for the chicken breading. It is tangy and is made with a wide variety of spices. I thoroughly enjoyed the unique flavors. I felt like there was a hint of spices that came through, which made it taste like Indian food.

The spicy burger comes with slaw and pickles. The slaw is not ice cold and is seasoned with cilantro, which went very well with the flavors in the breading. The pickles were light and not over-salted. All of the components they used, had a purpose in constructing the burger's overall flavor profile. I appreciated this thoughtfulness , as burgers should not include everything, but the kitchen sink.

I went in for an early dinner and there wasn't a line. The service was efficient and friendly. Even if the lines are long, this is a place that is worth giving a try.

Being only one person, I could only eat so much. But, I really wanted to try their loaded fries and hot ice cream sandwich. 
I can see myself eating their spicy burger for lunch several times a month. For $8 you are getting a delicious burger that is much healthier than regular fast food and beef based burgers. Do your taste buds a favor and visit The Bird ASAP!! 

If in the area , I would definitely come again. Until next time spicy burger!!
author: Uma A.

description: Their sandwiches are pretty good, not stellar, but pretty good. I'm not a huge fan of dark meat chicken so I was a little disappointed when I bit into my sandwich. The vibe of the restaurant is good and the service was good. Plus, it's a great stop if you're near the new SalesForce Transit Center.
author: Jen V.

description:
Overall - that's a pretty darn tasty bird!  You should go, but get there before the rush so you don't have to stand in line.

Service - I managed to get here before the lunch rush, thus, I didn't have to stand in line which was great.  I have put off trying out The Bird due to the long line.  

With no one waiting behind me, I didn't feel bad asking a lot of questions about the salad.  Is it meal size (yes), what's in it (baby kale, romaine, beets, fuji apples, farro) and how much is a half order of chicken v. a full order (about 4-5 large slices v 8-9).  The woman working the cash register was super patient with the litany of questions and really nice overall :).  They are super speedy, and my salad came out in no time.

To avoid the questions, it could be helpful to have a more descriptive menu available somewhere.

Food - I like fried chicken, but it's not something I would consider at the top of my list of favorite foods I would select to eat for the rest of my life on a deserted island.  I might reconsider that stance after eating The Bird's spicy chicken.  

Amazingly flavorful, crispy outer batter with super tender, juicy chicken on the inside.  Yes, I think that is probably a marketing line from one of the major fried chicken chains, but it is really true for The Bird!

The salad part of the salad was a generous helping of greens, beets, and apple.  I would have  liked a little more farro, but honestly, with the chicken being as good as it was, who cares!

Ambiance - It's a small interior w mainly communal seating options and also has some outdoor seating for when the weather is better.  I didn't pay a lot of attention as I had my order to go, but it wouldn't be a bad place to eat lunch or a very casual dinner.
