Price/value - It wasn't a cheap salad, but I can't say I know of any places in the area that offer a very inexpensive salad.  The quality and quantity for the money are definitely on par with the surrounding options with the quality being superior due to the awesome chicken!
author: Sara E.

description: Pretty good chicken sandwich and fries that cost me around $11.50 which isn't too bad. Very good service though as the staff was very friendly and helpful and made my experience enjoyable. The food kinda lacks the "wow" factor but overall I was happy with my meal and enjoyed it
author: Brian B.

description: Really enjoyed this place! The chicken sandwich came out not 1 minute after ordering. Fantastic service and great food! My one request would be a ranch sauce or aioli that might cut the heat of the spicy option! Other than that, fantastic!
author: James B.

description:
This place is so good, though probably not healthy.

$4.50 gets you a great breakfast sandwich and hashbrowns are included.

The apple fritters are awesome as well!
author: Mike W.

description: Not really sure why this place has 4 stars unless strictly based on service which was great. Beyond that, their food is far from good. The plain chicken sandwich is lacking flavor; the spicy chicken sandwich really wasn't great- not only were the spicy seasonings off but the added veggies/slaw/pickle did not compliment the sandwich at all. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.
author: Tariq D.

description: I love this place! The spicy chicken sando delivers on flavor! Its a smokey chipotle taste. One of my favs on the menu! The Fully Loaded is also amazing. Considering how long the line gets during lunch your order comes out fast!
author: Victoria M.

description: Excellent chicken sandwich with a kick--I can't believe the breading on the chicken is gluten-free! The spicy sandwich is not for the faint of heart. Smoking hot chicken with refreshingly cool slaw--cluck yeah!
author: Yad L.

description:
I've been here quite a few times now, and always order the spicy fried chicken sandwich. The line is pretty short if you can get there before the lunch rush. If you don't, be prepared to wait! The wait is usually not that bad unless it's raining as it has been. During the first few weeks when this shop had opened, they were giving out samples of their fries to people in the lineup. 

The burger itself has a nice taste, with the spicy chicken combined with a nice apple slaw. They also make their own sriracha sauce, that is dope with the fries or even added to the sandwich itself.

Due to the proximity to my work, and ease of access from transit I have to give this place a 5. Definitely my new go-to place for fried chicken, sorry Naked Lunch! Still need to try the fried ice cream
author: Rajeev S.

description: Really great fried chicken sandwich and it's priced fair! I'm always impressed with the consistency of the product and the efficiency of the Kitchen. Thank you!
author: Noah M.

description: Delicious spicy fried chicken sandwiches. I also love their super yummy spicy fried chicken biscuit sandwiches.  However, the biscuit sandwich does not come with free tater tots after 10am. I highly recommend this place if you want a high quality fried chicken sandwich.
author: Brad F.

description: Mmmm that's some good chicken. A little better than Popeyes or Mickee D's premium sandwiches with 1/2 the shame and none of the judgment you get from all these sf food snobs. And that house made sriracha is good as cuss. I want to buy a jar of it and mix it w my oatmeal and bananas for breakfast.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Chicken sandwich packed with lots of flavor. The chicken wasn't dry and it was a generous sized sandwich. Sandwich wasn't over-dressed and the bread went well with the bite. 

A must try if you are scouting for the best chicken sandwich in the Bay Area. 

(happy hour $2 wings -- i'd stick to the chicken sandwich)
author: Christy C.

description: This is a great example of smart fast food. Limited and quality menu (really enjoyed my fried chicken sandwich and curly fries), large variety of beers, fast service, and very efficient use of space. Will definitely be bringing friends.
author: JJ M.

description: Fast service, spicy chicken wasnt as spicy as i would like.  However chicken was super juicy.  Overall good experience and would come back for the food.
author: Kun c.

description: Came here on a rainy day to avoid the long lines and it worked. Spicy Fried Chicken Sandwich was good but I don't know if I'd wait in a long line for it. It's a couple of blocks from the financial district so I can see it getting busy for lunch.
author: Minh H.

description: Came here the other day before the busy lunch crowd arrived. I had some pretty high expectations from this place and I will say that it was good but it did not exceed my expectations. Overall, it's a good fried chicken sandwich. I ordered the spicy one and my wife got the original and I actually liked hers better. The fried one I was not too crazy about their spices on it. Their homemade Sriracha is actually really tasty and goes really well with the sandwich. For the price of the fries, I wish they would have given a bigger portion. I would probably come back but with all the options in SF, it might be a while before the next time comes.
author: Steven K.

description:
This place is so good! I had the spicy fried chicken sandwich with a beer and they went together perfectly. If you are spice sensitive though, I highly suggest just getting the classic because I couldn't handle the spice all at once. I ended up eating a little bit there and taking the rest home for a second meal. I finished the beer there though :p

Not a whole bunch of seating, but enough for the amount of customers that were there when I went.

Could be a little difficult to find if you aren't looking for the storefront, just look for the fox/dog holding a sandwich in its mouth.
author: Cicely M.

description: My favorite thing about The Bird is probably their breakfast. Their fried chicken biscuit sandwich is so good! I actually much prefer it to their lunch sandwiches, and there's never a line in the mornings :) They don't have any honey at their establishment, but whenever I take it to go I always make sure to add that touch of sweetness to make it extra good!
author: Tiffany K.

description:
The Bird offers a very solid fried chicken sandwich for a very reasonable price, no wonder the lines are huge at lunchtime! (Pro-tip: Show up for dinner and there's never a wait.)

The menu at The Bird is straightforward and simple: Do you want a spicy or regular fried chicken sandwich? Do you want curly fries with it? Make two decisions and you're on your way. My recommendation: Get the spicy if you're looking for great taste and you aren't afraid of falling asleep for the rest of the day. Go for the regular if you're looking for something a little bit lighter (yes, I recognize that a "light" fried chicken sandwich is a bit of an oxymoron). As for the curly fries, get them to share. The sandwiches are pretty big in and quite filling on their own, but the curly fries are perfectly crispy and savory, so you don't want to miss out.

The fried chicken is crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside, and it's a pretty hefty portion. The apple coleslaw in the sandwich really rounds out the intense flavor of the fried chicken, a perfect combination.

If fried chicken wasn't so unhealthy, I'd be here all the time!
author: Brittany C.

description: Not as delicious as expected! :( gets crazy busy in there. Loaded fries were the one thing I really looked forward to but it wasn't anything special :/ the restaurant had great aesthetic though!
author: Ariel A.

description: Food is relatively inexpensive for the FiDi area and is a break from the boring saadas, soups and sandwiches. I get so tired of the same food working in the fidi but this place is fresh and delicious!
author: A g.

description: Amazing service, had an issue with my order this weekend at the booth at outside lands. The staff and manager were super helpful and efficient getting it sorted out, amazing service considering it was at a festival booth! Thanks for the great service!
author: Miranda W.

description: Great little spot right near my hotel.  I got the breakfast biscuit with sausage,so good!  Nice staff,good service and good music.
author: Carmen J.

description:
TL;DR - Cheap, filling, not your typical "fast food"

A chicken sandwich actually having a flavorful, whole piece of chicken in it? Yeah. And all for $8! I get the spicy because its delicious. I also love the pickled veggies in the sandwich.

The fries are like jack in the box curly fries (meh) and the hot ice cream is like.... an asian bun with ice cream inside. I got the salted caramel and it tasted just like milk. No flavor at all. Pass on the fries, pass on the sides. GET THE SANDWICH.
author: Crystal Z.

description: Solid Hot chicken... delicious, moist, spicy, incredible. Worth the visit, worth the wait.
author: Mith R.

description:
If you've ever wondered if a place has it all: greasy curly fries and chicken sandwiches under the guise of a hip minimal interior, you're in luck.

How's the chicken sammie, you ask? Pickles and slaw on a thin bun that sandwiches a big fat juicy piece of fried chicken -- The Bird rates as 'pretty damn solid'. Reservations go under the fact that spicy really isn't that spicy and could use some additional seasonings to amp it up.

But vibes is where it's at: Hip signs. Subway tile. Plentiful seating and clean presentation. A nice view of all the beautiful people walking by. BEER. Gotta love it.
author: Anthony N.

description:
If I give you a name, I'm probably not asking you to change that name to the dead name on my credit card and scream it 

Have a little compassion for your LGBT guests 


Update: manager asked about it, no feedback
author: Robin H.

description: Super simple menu. I was nervous about the line and trying to find a place to sit. It's not the most comfortable situation (shared hitop tables with stools), but it's doable. The curly fries and chicken sandwiches are like crack. The sandwiches aren't easy to eat either. So there's a lot of discomfort. But it doesn't really matter, because the sandwich is so effing good. And get it spicy.
author: Derek B.

description: I like the bird sandwiches very much but not so happy with the service. I just ordered To go for 3 spicy sandwiches , 3 spicy wings and 2 fries. But, after opening packet, i did not find any fries and the wings are not spicy.
author: Sarfaraz H.

description:
Typical SF prices for a new & hip lunch spot ($11 for a Fried Chicken Sando + Curly Fries). Don't be foolish, get the curly fries. Neither greasy nor a heavy meal at all--IMO. On a nice day, expect a line but it moves swiftly.

This place should not be located two blocks from my office. But honestly, I'm a little glad that it is.
author: Juan T. K.

description: Another welcome addition to the area. They only serve 2 items on the menu! The fried chicken sandwich and curly fries, I guess why have other items when you can do two very well. The sandwich is truly loaded and yummy. The fries were good too and they were generously handing out samples that day, so I had a lot. I am a fan and will be back.
author: Sunil R.

description: Soy FREE!!!!  I was the happiest camper in the world munching down on this incredibly, spicy bliss of a sandwich and fries.  For someone with a soy allergy finding incredible "fast food" is beyond happiness.
author: Cheryl I.

description: Ran like a well-oiled machine. Despite the appearance of a long wait (long line), got to the front pretty fast, and my order was immediately ready for me after paying. The price is decent for the amount of food you get. Perfect place to pickup lunch to-go.
author: Charles B.

description:
Oh man, now I know why they call it The Bird. They put A LOT of chicken on one sandwich. I went with the spicy fried chicken sandwich with everything on it and was not disappointed. Their curly fries were really good as well. Good prices. I'll definitely be back to try their loaded fries.

They are a bit of a victim of their own success because this place usually has a very long line. It would be great if you could order ahead/on a computer inside the restaurant.
author: Ellen H.

description: If there's a line - wait. Simple, delicious food. Treat yourself to an Adult Happy Meal (Chicken sando, fries, and a beer). Reminds me a lot of Howlin' Rays in Los Angeles.
author: Eric M.

description: How does one make such a perfect combo or spice, crunch & juiciness for a chicken sandwich?! I'm blessed to work so close to The Bird.
author: Shayna T.

description:
Ok, so a friend of mine went here and totally recommended that I try it. Totally lives up to its reputation! I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich (I mean is there any other way to go?) and was thoroughly impressed! The chicken piece was huge and really juicy. After a few more bites, I was totally sold on why this place has a SUPER LONG LINE during lunchtime hours. The owner happened to meet my coworker and I outside the restaurant since he was passing out free samples of the chicken and fries. He was super nice and even took the time to walk us inside and explain the menu and facts about the restaurant. Super nice guy. (You can tell he really wants the place to succeed!)

Anyways, I also ordered the loaded fries and was also amazed too! Nacho cheese, bacon, onions, sour cream, and curly fries. Can't do any better! I would totally recommend coming here if you're in the mood for a really really really good chicken sandwich, but only if you're ok with the lunchtime rush line or coming after the lunch-rush is already over.
author: Nick C.

description: This could be the best chicken sandwich I have ever eaten!!! Wow. So good. Wish we had one of these on the east coast!!!
author: Bill B.

description:
This is easily the best chicken sandwich I've ever eaten. It's a simple menu, but they get everything absolutely right. I don't know what they do to their chicken, but it's incredible. 

For lunch, there's always a huge line, deservedly, but they get the food out pretty quickly. The employees are super cool, patient, & helpful. 

The restaurant is small, but they use space well & there's plenty of seating. 

I've had the classic chicken sandwich, curly fries, & loaded fries. Each of them are fantastic. I have to try the spicy chicken sandwich. If you're okay with a bit of a mess, definitely get the loaded fries.

I absolutely recommend this spot if you can swing by.
author: Daniel M.

description: One bite and I instantly fell in love with their spicy fried chicken sandwich! The chicken was crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. Be careful if you don't have a high tolerance for spicy food though, as the jalepenos they add inside are REALLY spicy. And don't forget to order dessert as well, the hot ice cream sandwich!
author: Victoria T.

description: We stumbled upon this place walking around downtown and had no regrets! Delicious, tender chicken sandwiches with the right amount of kick and paired well with their unique coleslaw dressing. We also got the loaded fries which were quite tasty. The lunch line is long but moves very quickly. It can be difficult finding a place to dine inside though
author: Susan S.

description: Amazing wings - try to go during they're happy hour (4-7p) and get the $2 ones...seems expensive but they are the hole wing so they're big.  We got everything that was super spicy and our mouths were on fire but it was all super good!  Also got the mint chocolate ice cream taco and that was tasty too.  There was a sprinkle of sea salt on the top which was a really nice touch
author: Geena G.

description: I'm not quite sure what all the fuss is about on this place. Let me say the chicken sandwich was just fine. And the slaw and pickles do you differentiate it. But the chicken itself was simply average in my book. And the curly fries tasted no better than that out of a company cafeteria. I may or may not return to this place but I'm still on the fence if the food is actually worth the money.
author: Robert C.

description: I was in town for work and excited to try this place as I heard it was "the best." I have to say I was super underwhelmed with the flavor and overall sandwich. I will say the slaw was ok but my sandwich was a mix of white and dark meat falling apart in the patty as chunks. I have to say that part really grossed me out and I didn't even finish the sandwich because the difference of meat. I wouldn't recommend this place and still so surprised this is labeled the best.
author: Adriane G.

description: The spicy chicken sandwich is sooooo good. The spice level is just perfect. Don't get discouraged by the queue outside this place. It moves pretty fast :)
author: Divya P.

description: Was staying the at the Marriott Marquis by Mission Street and was looking for a bite for lunch. I saw that this place had some great reviews and was only a short 5-10 minute walk away. I decided to go at about 12:30 PM on a Wednesday. When I arrived I saw that the line extended to about 15 people outside the door. I had almost a two hour break so decided to wait to see what all the fuss was about. The line moved pretty quickly with two registers taking orders about 15 feet beyond the doorway. The staff was very helpful and efficient. I placed my order for the spicy chicken sandwich which was about $9. I took my receipt and waited to the side. There are some seats there but not enough to accommodate the busy lunch crowd so I wouldn't count on getting a seat there. There is a small condiment station with some things including ketchup and water. After about 5 minutes, they called my name/number. The sandwich was great. Tender and great flavor throughout. I would consider it to be one of the best chicken (or spicy for that matter) sandwiches that I have ever had. I would definitely return again when I am in the area.
author: Jason P.

description: Stopped here while at a conference in SF.  Place was very hard to find, but once we finally found it, it was well worth it.  I had the spicy sandwich with fries.  The price was reasonable for SF and food was good. Highly recommend for a quick bite to eat while in the conference center area.
author: Riley P.

description:
Sandwich (Spicy)- The bun was little bit too burnt for my liking. The sandwich was full of spices, yet paradoxically the chicken seemed bland and uninspiring. I  don't know how they prepare it, but I would recommend marinading the chicken before frying. I had read the reviews, got pumped, walked 20 mins to the spot (add an extra 5 because I missed the spot), yet after devouring my meal within 10 mins, I was full but not satisfied. There was a little hole in my being that wasn't complete, and I can't quite put my finger on it. All I could say was meh.

Curly Fries (Fully Loaded)- Heart-stoppingly delicious. I would recommend eating it asap before it cools down too much.

To sum- Imagine if you have wanted a dog for many years, and all you could think about is getting a dog. Then you finally got the dog. You have a blast with this dog for a week before it is tragically run over. You are upset, however deep down you know a dead dog is better than no dog, because you did have the dog at one point. However, when you didn't have the dog, at least it wasn't dead.
author: Jide O.

description:
The husband wanted to bring me here for our last lunch in SF. I loved it. The chicken is very well battered/seasoned and the coleslaw has the right amount of tart and sweet (pears or apples in it?!). We got some messy fries as well, which was fries + load them up with cheese, bacon, green onions and sour cream.

The only thing I didn't like (which my husband thought I was crazy for) is the chicken was just TOO much. I prefer thinner sliced chicken filets for my chicken sandwich, but it felt like I got a whole half fried chicken sandwiched between the bread (which again, isn't bad, just not my personal preference).
author: Cat S.

description: Damn I usually go to The Bird once every 2 months, and this time the loaded fries were terribly disappointing. I got a spicy sandwich, which was always good, and loaded fries. The loaded fries today were so damn soggy and all mushy that it tasted like mashed potatoes. Tsk Tsk today Bird.
author: An L.

description: I LOVED this sandwich. I got the spicy one (be warned, it is actually spicy, even for someone who does spice regularly) and it paired beautifully with all the veggies on the sandwich. Whenever I think about that sandwich I get hungry. It's also a pretty good price for this part of town at $8.
author: Max P.

description:
I love places that have a small menu, but a small menu done well. This is exactly The Bird. 

-Atmosphere: the aesthetic of the place is kinda hipster-ish. I don't really like "hipster" vibes, but I liked it here, at The Bird. 
-Food: Just tastes that good. The Chicken Sandwich was anything but basic - the flavors of the slaw and pickles really made the sandwich unlike any other chicken sandwich. 
-Fun Fries: I'm a french fry lover... and their Loaded Curly Fries did not disappoint. I'd honestly come back here just for a meal of the fries. Really, I would. 
-Housemade Siracha: Yes. Plus, it wasn't an additional charge. 
-Location + Price: This place is very close to my school in the city... with that said, sometimes you can expect meal prices to be on the higher end for takeout. Not here. I got a filling meal (sandwich, fries, soda) for all under $15. I know $15 sounds a little on the higher end for a takeout, but this "meal for one" was actually split between myself and BF for a super filling snack.
author: Enne Mae G.

description:
Came on a Saturday late afternoon right before closing, so no long lines and fast ordering. 

This place is a true testament to the practice of doing one thing and one thing well. The spicy fried chicken sando was ace. It was spicy without being burning, and the apple slaw was cooling and sweet, pulling my taste buds in the opposite direction. Bun was soft and warm and we'll chosen. Price was fair if not considered cheap. Honestly I got nothing to complain about. Sometimes you don't wanna dive too deep. It is what it is, and it is your fried chicken sandwich fix, plain and simple.
author: Krish B.

description: Great tasting sandwich and fries. Get the spicy. Menu was simple and easy to navigate. I wanted to try the tacos but they were sold out. Would come again for sure
author: Abhay D.

description: I really wanted to love this sandwich but I just didn't. I ordered the norm, chicken sandwich. The chicken was okay, there was fat in the chicken that they didn't remove before breading and frying it so that turned me off a little bit. And I wasn't a huge fan of the slaw that came in the sandwich. It was a little sour for my liking. The reviews hyped me to try this spot, especially since I love fried chicken. But all together the sandwich just didn't wow me.
author: Dara S.

description:
It was definitely a solid fried chicken sandwich. It came out super quick and it was a hearty sandwich but something was missing. It didn't wow me or anything but it didn't disappoint me. It was just good but nothing special? ..I wanted to like it a lot more...  Maybe I'll try it again and get the spicy version. 

The curly fries were also just ok. Nothing special to them - same ones you get anywhere else. Maybe I'll give the loaded ones a try next time?.. But it feels like too much to be eating with a fried chicken sandwich? 

They do have a lot of great beer options though which is great. There is also condiment option of sriracha which is nice as well. There's a good amount of seating inside, with quick turnover, and there's also some tables outside. A good lunch option for the neighborhood but not sure if it would be a destination spot.
author: Veronica L.

description: The sandwiches are OK, but my main gripe is with service.  Our office has now ordered from The Bird four or five times, and not once have they marked which sandwiches are spicy and which are regular.  It would be so simple to write "S" for spicy or "R" for regular on the foil wrappers, but I guess they're too busy to be bothered.  We have 10 people in our office and at least a couple of them have wound up disappointed each time, as we try to figure out from the coloring of the meat whether a sandwich is spicy or not.  Today it was my turn -- I wanted regular and wound up with spicy.  Now I have heartburn.  Since I'm the boss, our office is not bothering to order from them again if they can't get this simple procedure right.
author: Zach G.

description: This place is soooo good! The hot chicken sandwich is not for the faint of heart. Almost burned my mouth off but was so tasty couldn't stop eating. Delish
author: Carly S.

description: The fried chicken sandwich is really awesome. The line was too long but it moved pretty fast. And I got my sandwich with in 3 min after my order. Pretty good  service and great food.
author: Linitha T.

description: The chicken sandwich is amazing. It can be really popular around lunch but the line always moves quickly.
author: Sherman C.

description:
Great chicken, crispy outside and juicy inside.
Service was quick and friendly. Best fried chicken sandwiches for reasonable prices.
author: Michael L.

description: Best fried chicken sandwich in cali hands down. Simple menu. But oh man the spicy chicken  sandwich is so addictive i need to go to rehab.
author: Ardalan M.

description: The curly fries here are amazing - the crunchiest bits have the skin on. The spicy chicken sandwich was pretty good - but I wasn't the biggest fan of the slaw in all honesty. The lunch time lines probably aren't worth the wait so try to go before 11 am or after 1 pm.
author: Sam M.

description: Just "pretty good" versus "awesome" - I was hoping for more. The fries were cold, soggy, and had the canned nacho cheese on them. The chicken sando was large enough but sort of bland. Still delicious though. I think this place is 5-stars for the 20-something tech-job crowd in a hurry at lunch, but likely 4-stars for more discerning folks expecting chicken and fry greatness from a highly-rated pricier place downtown.
author: Ryan B.

description: Spicy chicken sandwich is da bomb. Went during non rush hour and was less than 10 minutes to get my food. Chick Fil A of the city!
author: Fernando M.

description:
Holy moly,  they must add crack to their seasoning or something because that chicken sandwich is addicting. The bun is fluffy, the slaw is great, the pickles are perfect, and the chicken is so juicy. Get it spicy, its really just a hint. You can make it spicier with their homemade Sriracha (it's legit).

I'd pass on the fries, loaded or otherwise 

It's a good thing I normally eat at the office, otherwise I would be taking years off my life standing in line every day and clogging my arteries with some damn good fried chicken.

I never trusted the Colonel anyhow.
author: Chanel H.

description: Great spicy chicken sandwich. Curly Fries were also very good. If you are in the area I would suggest you stop by. Their lunch combo is a great deal.
author: Jeff M.

description: This place is sooooo good. Spicy chicken sandwich was bomb. First time here definitely going to come back
author: Brandan B.

description:
I came to try this out vs The Organic Coup sandwich.  For about the same cost I get curly fries with this place.  

Chicken fillet was 2 white meat slices spliced together and fried.   Not dry.  Seasoning was what you'd expect from a fast food place.  
Curly fries were fine for me, crispy and not too greasy.

From a value perspective it's right on the money (for SF) for those who'd rather skip McD/Burger King, and want chicken vs beef (Super Duper).

There was a line but it moved fast, another 10 min and my order was ready after paying.  

Single unisex restroom, air or paper towel dry.
Seating inside!
author: Drew B.

description: This is the only place I have been where I don't need extra hot sauce. Ive been here about 5x throughly impressed with the food quality, cash wrap line, and the quick completion of food. The spicy bird is simple with a few ingredients but really meshes well together. I usually get two burgers they're just that good. Get in my belly!
author: Rajeev B.

description: The flavoring or spices used was just something I'm not accustomed to. I won't be back and I can't recommend. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich with curly fries. I couldn't eat the sandwich. I couldn't even eat the chicken alone. There is something in the seasoning that was a complete turn off for me. I even tried dipping it in some ranch dressing, but that didn't even mask the flavor. Ughh...sucks for me because I used my last $12 dollars on that meal. I just assumed this place would be good because the line is usually outside the door and the reviews are so high, but I guess..."to each his own.."
author: E C.

description:
Get:
Fried Chicken Sandwich - Get it, eat it right away.  go take a nap.



gotta love places that just focus on one thing, and just make it amazing.
author: Steven F.

description:
First off, I have to say the service was fantastic. Literally (yes, I mean literally) 5 seconds after I ordered from the generous cashier, they called my name (I'm pretty sure it was mine because my two friends who had ordered before me also got their's immediately upon ordering) and my Spicy Chicken Burger and Curly Fries were waiting for me.

Their fried chicken was definitely my type of fried chicken. It wasn't like the typical KFC or Popeyes fried chicken coated with bread that everyone usually thinks of (and that I find greasy). The chicken was fried and covered with some kind of spicy seasoning and thin layer of coating that kicked your taste buds after you took a bite of it. It reminded me of popcorn chicken that you could find at a boba cafe, except the piece of chicken filled the entire burger. The curly fries were also great, as I dipped them in their homemade Sriracha sauce that they give out in little containers for free.

Because I would come back again and the fact that I'm taking time to review this place, I would definitely recommend this place to someone who is or even isn't visiting San Francisco. The heat or the lack of air conditioning (or very little if there was any) didn't stop me from leaving. It has to be on everyone's SF to-do or must-try lists!
author: Eric O.

description:
As far as fried chicken goes, The Bird is pretty good! (I am not big on fried chicken but the great reviews convinced me to try this out). The slaw on my sandwich was delicious, and I loved that the chicken was not oily or greasy. The curly fries went well with the meal, and the Sriracha ketchup was unique and unexpected, but so good! 

Also, customer service is a big deal to me, and The Bird was a great experience! We arrived around lunch time and the line was huge; the employees were efficient and friendly, and they had a guy outside passing out samples of the curly fries and Sriracha ketchup - yum!
author: Natalie C.

description:
Located in SOMA this place serves one thing: chicken sandwich, ok also wings after 5 pm so technically 2 things.

The menu is super simple, fried chicken sandwich-spicy or non, curly fries, and dried fried chicken wings available after 5pm.

We ordered 1 of each item. I love curly fries so the free ranch dressing was definitely spot on. The non-spicy sandwich was definitely bland, would not order that one again while the spicy one had a nice kick. The slaw with apples was very refreshing and I appreciated the extra side of it as we ordered to go. The hot wings were spicy but also overly salty.

I would not recommend waiting in line for this place (don't even want to think what the lunch hour might look like). Also for those who have a preference, the chicken is made with dark meat.
author: Betty C.

description: First time at The Bird today! I've been interested in trying the restaurant out since it opened but the lunch line is normally out the door and around the corner. I want sure if the long line was all hype because the place is new or if the food was that good. Today, I got my answer, the food is BOMB! I got the spicy fried chicken sandwich with curly fries and it was amazing. The sandwich is like crack! The only negative is that the curly fries we're burnt! Good, just burnt. Everyone should try this place
author: Rhett B.

description: I had the original fried chicken sandwich. ...spicy version with all the original fixings on it. Curly fries. Soda. $8 chicken. $2.50 curly Fry. $2 bottomless soda. I usually like spicy things. But thought this was too much and overpowered the flavors of all the fixings on the sandwich. But that is personal taste. Whatever you do. ....get ALL the standard stuff on it. It all goes together. The flavor and crispy outside is great. Very most chicken inside. Big piece. Fries were standard. Nothing special. I couldn't find any ketchup without sirracha in it. It's good....but sometimes i want regular ketchup. I will come back. Very good.
author: M P.

description:
The best chicken sandwich for the price point in the city imho. Get here EARLY during weekday lunch or be prepared to wait in a LONG line. The price is right (about $8) and admittedly I'm not a huge fan of fried chicken sandwiches but this one was absolutely delicious. A large slab of mouthwatering , savory chicken. I didn't try anything else but it was very filling.

Have taken a number of people here and everyone has loved it . 

The line moves pretty fast even though it can get long. They are also Closed in Sunday's.
author: Rod M.

description:
Breakfast sandwiches are soooooo good. You can pick sausage, chicken (or maybe bacon..not sure). Comes on a biscuit with a fried egg and cheese. Pro tip - put some of their strawberry jam on the sandwich, it sounds weird but it's amazing. Only meh part are the hash browns it comes with, which run a little on the greasy side (though they'd probably be perfect if you're hungover). No line at breakfast time!

Only thing that's kept me from coming in for lunch is the long (long long long long) line. Every. day. Really exited to try their chicken sandwich though.
author: Rachel K.

description: This is a favorite spot. I view it as something in-between the fast food and restaurant experience. The main differences being the quality of food (much better than fast food!) and the alcohol (which you obviously wouldn't find at McDonald's). The service is great, the food is killer, and the atmosphere is fun and hip. The only problem I have with this place is that their ice-cream sandwiches are always sold out! Probably because they're too delicious. I've yet to try one, but I'm determined. The spicy chicken isn't that spicy, but it's enough to make your nose runny. Come here if you're looking for a fast and delicious bite. Expect to leave with a full stomach.
author: David S.

description: This is how chicken between two buns is supposed to taste. The house sriracha sauce is a spicy cherry on top for all you flavor chasers. Seriously, stop on by to this place and have yourself a wonderful foodie moment!
author: Alex Y.

description: Great chicken sandwich for lunch. Line can get long so plan accordingly. Definitely better than ChickFilA any day. Pair these with fries and beer and you're good to go. If you're eating here around lunch time you may not be able to find a spot to eat. There are definitely places to sit and eat but don't be surprised if you have to take it back to the office and eat. Hopefully you're close by.
author: Ryan C.

description:
I met up with some friends to try this chicken sandwich because I heard it was from the same guy that created SuperDuper Burger.

The location is pretty close to a BART stop which is pretty cool but the signage is kind of small so you may miss it.

My friends and I arrived a little bit before closing on a Saturday so luckily there wasn't a crazy line or something. I thought this may irk the employees but they were pretty nice considering we were strolling in pretty late.

The cashier was super patient with us as well and gave a pretty thorough analysis to my friends ordering the spicy version. I kind of tuned it out since I know I'm a chicken (pun intended) and wanted to play it safe with the spice at first.

I got the classic sandwich, the loaded curly fries and a beer. The sandwich was good, the fries were really good and the beer came with a koozie!

Pretty good spot but I'm not sure if I would be able to wait more than an hour for this place like I've heard some people have had to do. Definitely would go back if there was little to no wait. One thing I regret was not getting an ice cream sandwich.
author: Larsen R.

description:
The Bird is definitely the word! 

This place only has 3 items on their menu, 2 of which are small side items, and they're completely killin' it! They make one type of sandwich, ONE, and I have to say it...I'm in love. I can't deny it. It's a MUST MUST try, get here early because they only sell 200 of these fried chicken babies a day and you don't want to miss out. 

**The guy in front of me ordered about 20 fried chicken sandwiches, if that doesn't tell you how good these sandwiches are then I don't know what will. 

You will always find a line out the door as soon as they open, but the wait is soooo worth it ( it's not long anyways, it goes by pretty fast). And plus, you tell me another restaurant where someone comes out with free curly fries samples for the waiting patrons. Another plus plus, they make their own sriracha, which for someone that douses sriracha on mostly everything, their version was pretty darn great and fresh. 

The fried chicken sandwich is AMAAZINNGG. Comes out hot and fresh, super moist chicken, HUGE sandwich, great balance of flavors between the chicken, coleslaw, and pickles, need I say more? My girlfriend and I got the regular and spicy fried chicken sandwich, just to compare, and really it's a personal thing, whether you like spicy or not, but regardless of what you choose, you will be in chicken heaven! 

PARKING: wouldn't recommend lol take the muni here because it's located in downtown FD, which we all know is cray. 

SERVICE: awesome! Besides the free curly fries sample, you'll also find the owner coming around to ask how things are and how the sandwich tastes, very good man! The place isn't so big, fair amount of seating, but can get pretty crowded so I would suggest going early if you would like to eat there. 

PRICE: $8 Fried Chicken Sandwich (Regular or Spicy; I recommend Spicy YUM), and this is worth every penny. They're not like other restaurants who make fried chicken sandwiches like sliders, no, this sandwich is huge and without a doubt fill you up! 

~$4 for the loaded curly fries; this one was on the small side for the price, but never the less delicious.
author: Vivian S.

description: A little overrated for me. Twice I've eaten there and both times I'd finish my chicken sandwich thinking, "This is what all the hype's about?!" I was however happy they have curly fries but I dont really see myself going back anytime soon.
author: Jaye P.

description:
Time: 2:45 pm on Friday
Cleanliness:  Clean
Greeting: No greeting as I walked in
Organization: There were two registers, one where a man was helping a customer and the other where a man was counting money.  I stood in front of the register of the guy counting money.  Nothing happened as I stared at the guy counting money.  Neither cashier look at me or said anything.  Eventually the customer ahead of me finishes and the man helping her asks me what I would like.  Organization was confusing...
Wait in line: No wait to order
Ambience: Rustic, outdoorsy, nice
Neighborhood: Feels safe, lots of business people walking around
Wait for food: Less than a minute for a spicy chicken sandwich
Menu: Nice and simple, not much for vegetarians
Taste: Very good, fresh ingredients, crunchy pickles.  Might be a weird thing to complain about but the chicken was too thick for me...  spiciness was just right
Temperature: I took it home and ate it within 30 minutes and still good, chicken was still nice and *crisp*
1 Hour Later: Tummy was 100%
Friendliness: Not the best experience, cashier was slouched and looking around and didn't feel like he was listening.  Examples: I asked what the veggie options were and he just said that's all we got.  So I had to ask about each item to find out if they were veggie (is so and so veggie?  is so and so veggie?).  I expected him to look up at the menu and list the 3 or 4 items that were vegetarian.  Then I asked how long it would take to get my order and he didn't answer so I thought he didn't hear me but then couple exchanges later he said it would be a few minutes.  
Comparable Places: Definitely better than Popeyes, McDonalds, or KFC, solid chicken sandwich
author: Kentaro T.

description: Really? Y'all wouldn't know good fried chicken if it pulled down your pants and smacked you on the ass. Bland. But service is fast, and water is cold, and curly fries are curly.
author: Keasha P.

description: Finally got to try this place. Every time I walked by the line was super long. Very small menu: spicy or regular chicken sandwich, curly fries or curly fries loaded and a hot ice cream sandwich. They also have beer and that is it. The regular sandwich tastes good with the slaw, a little stringy. They are mass producing these sandwiches so quality goes down a little. As usual in SF you have to get there early or else the line is very long. For $8 it was worth every penny.
author: Ken A.

description:
I've been several times for the morning menu, and I adore the food. However the staff is rude, disorganized and slow. They clearly hate working here and it shows. I keep trying it, thinking maybe it was just one or two or three or five bad days. 

I've worked service jobs, I get it, it's not glamorous but I wasn't rude for no reason. The cashier didn't greet anyone, hardly responded when I asked a question and ignored others in the restaurant who were trying to order. The worker who was handing out food would ignore the up orders while 5 of us waited for their recognition. This is a simple concept, it's should move quickly, especially when it's not busy. They were very slow this particular morning.

I encourage folks to walk past, and patronize a local restaurant where at least you aren't scowled at and ignored.
author: Meghan S.

description: Very disappointed in this. Finding parking, to start, was rough because of its downtown location. After paying $10 for parking (which is pay any time for great food), we arrived at the restaurant at about 10:15am on a Wednesday. We wanted breakfast. And we found out they weren't serving breakfast. No real good reason too. The worker (sure, it wasn't her fault) said on Wednesdays they open at 10am, and they just don't serve breakfast. Why? Random. That was our taste. That was our expectation. It was reasonable. Big bummer because we wanted to fuel up for a big day with a big breakfast eating some sausage or bacon, egg and cheese biscuits. But no. It was really a letdown, especially since every other restaurant we've visited on this trip has been fantastic. Boo to The Bird.
author: Brian W.

description: Hello White Fence Farm meets chic-fil-a. By far the best chicken sandwich joint in town. Highly recommend visiting. I tried the Southern chicken sandwich, coleslaw with the pimento such a great combo. Then, after realizing it was so good, I had to get another sandwich. So I tried the Nashville Chicken, just the hot version. I want to try the very hot next time. I still can't decide which one is better. Guess I should just order both again!
author: Tyler D.

description: Interesting sandwich to be had here. I got it plain as most of the accompaniments didn't appeal to me. The chicken itself is wonderful without covering it up with coverings.
author: Tommy R.

description: delicious fried chicken with good price. ordered takeout at around 4:30, so no line,quick and friendly service. Will come again
author: Janet H.

description: I was looking for a new lunch spot and The Bird came up on yelp. I looove a good fried chicken sandwhich. It's more of a fast casual dining spot, with a pretty chill atmosphere. I walked in and ordered a spicy chicken sandwhich (you can get it classic or spicy) from Alejandro, who was prompt and polite with my order. The sandwich took about 5 minutes. While it wasn't the best I've ever had, it was pretty damn good, and for only $8, that's not bad at all. I'll be back
author: Sami M.

description:
When you are on a tight budget and need something filling, something that isn't great for you but something that you crave, then get to the Bird.   I took one spicy and one regular fried chicken sandwich to go.  While they had lost that so highly prized and ethereal crunch after a few hours till my dinner, they were still good.  The slaw above the chicken lent a bit of sweetness to the sandwich, the chicken itself was A-OK, and the bun didn't decompose as I worked through each sandwich.

A good place.
author: David D.

description:
I came here at about 1:30p on a weekday, and luckily there was a very short line and still chicken sandwiches left. Let me just say that I have very high standards for fried chicken, so I had very high expectations because I've seen the crazy line wrap around the block here. 

My thought is that the chicken sandwich here is decent and I'd probably come back and get it again, but it is not out of this world. At $8, it is really a pretty cheap lunch in the Financial District.  However, it also sits pretty heavy in your stomach afterward (but what do you expect out of a fried chicken sandwich?) 

The chicken sandwich comes with a giant piece of seasoned chicken (tender and flavorful), their slaw (which contains red onions which I really don't like, celery, red cabbage, apples), pickles and mayonnaise.  Their current menu is really simple and great, and I think they have a few more sandwich options coming soon.  I think my main issue with the sandwich was that I didn't like the spicy seasoning that much.  My favorite spicy chicken sandwiches are from Chic-fil-A and Popeye's, if that helps as a comparison point. 

Thinking about other famous fried chicken sandwiches in the Bay Area to give you other comparisons, I know there is Bakesale Betty's in East Bay. I actually think that this sandwich is better than Bakesale Betty's (don't crucify me please!) because it is more flavorful. The Prospect in the Financial District also does a really good fried chicken sandwich, but it is twice the price and at a sit-down restaurant.  I'd recommend that you come here and try the sandwich as I think a lot of people have really enjoyed it and the price isn't bad!
author: Lin Z.

description:
I love it when restaurants specialize in just one item. At The Bird, it's all about the fried chicken sandwich. You have two choices: classic or spicy.

I got the classic, and it was all kinds of amazing. The chicken was a giant hunk of tender and juicy meat with crunchy batter that isn't overly greasy. The slaw and the pickles inside the sandwich gave it a nice balanced taste and texture.

Loaded curly fries are good but nothing special. Can't mess up on curly fries.

Reasonably priced at $8 for the sandwich + $4 for loaded curly fries/$2 for regular curly fries. I say go with the regular because the loaded didn't come with that much toppings.

Got here at 12:30 on a week day and the line was about 30 people deep. Only took about 10-15 mins to get to the front of the line though and our order came out 2 mins after we ordered. Not too bad for lunch rush hour.
author: Catherine C.

description: Visiting in this beautiful city, wanted to try something new to us.  Ordered 3 sandwiches, 2 curly fries and slaw on the side.  Got our order and got back to the hotel.  Had 2 sandwiches, no curly fries and 5 orders of cole slaw.  Not happy......  regardless, ate what we had but we won't be going back...
author: Kathy E.

description: This is a geat sandwich spot! Chicken is always super crispy, yet still very juicy. And the loaded potato fries are my absolute favorite. If you're in town try to get a quick bite. Stop by they are always super fast on service.
author: Cynthia C.

description:
I was pretty excited to meet here with a friend after reading rave reviews on Yelp. 2 stars are for the very friendly cashier and the short wait time. Although I was glad the wait was short as I came during my lunch hour, perhaps it was too short as I'm almost sure the chicken was undercooked. After a few bites of the chicken being a strange texture, I looked down and noticed the chicken was pretty pink in several places (see attached pics). I showed my friend and he confirmed that it was probably best to not eat it as well. A woman that worked there came to bus the table next to us and I told her that the chicken was pink and looked undercooked so I was not comfortable eating it. She shocked me by saying, "That's happened to me too, I've mentioned to them that the chicken's pretty pink sometimes..." She proceeded to walk away behind the counter to mix some slaw. I looked at her a few times as I thought she would relay my comment to another team member either in the front or their kitchen in order to make this right. Working at a cafe myself, I would think a replacement meal would be in place as I paid $11 for a sandwich and curly fries, but was only able to eat the fries and a few small bites of the sandwich. Already a little late getting back to work, I just left. I should have asked for my money back, but too late as I'm back at work still hungry and hoping that I don't experience food poisoning in the coming hours. I wanted to take my boyfriend here, but I think we'll play it safe and avoid this place.

***Edit 8/11: Victor has assured me that my bad experience was just a fluke. Excellent customer support on his end and I will be coming back for another try. Updated to 4 stars as I am impressed by the sincerity expressed!
author: Megan M.

description:
I dream of fried chicken sandwiches with organic chicken not sure I messed up and went when they first opened but what a let down. Batter and no taste to the sandwiches. Heard lebron went there and got sandwiches which disappoints me even more.

I'll try it again everyone at work says the spicy one is amazing
author: Laura G.

description: Great chicken sandwich place.   I had the spicy chicken sandwich and loaded curly fries.   Both were very delicious.  The spicy chicken sandwich might have been a little too spicy for me but I still enjoyed it.  I will probably try the regular next time.   This place gets super busy during lunch time so just be aware of that before you come.
author: Shawn A.

description:
Nice big chunk of fried chicken though the spicy chicken was almost too spicy - hard to taste the chicken. I liked the pickles a lot but wish they had more to balance out the big piece of chicken. Pretty good value for $8.

The loaded fries were a big miss. Looked really good with the bacon and cheese on top of the curly fries but didn't taste like much of anything except mushy umami. I wouldn't order these again.

Though it's no longer limited to just 200 sandwiches a day the place still gets long lines at lunch. To avoid try to come before 11am or for a late lunch. Between 11:30-noon it's still down the block.
author: Jean K.

description:
First visit, good impression. Tried their spicy friend chicken sandwich and curly fries. Total was just over $11. There is some seating in this place, but during the lunch rush it's pretty tight. A friendly owner type was handing out samples of the fries while people waited for their food, which when paired with the friendly and efficient counter people says good things about their desire to give good service.

Food was good, though I had to wait to eat about 10 min while I walked back toward work (looking for a place to sit). The sandwich was tasty and the bun and cole slaw were so good that they made a pleasing bite without any chicken.

The chicken was a little reminiscent of Chick Fil A, maybe with a little heavier batter. The meat seemed to have been marinated in some way that made the meat very moist, if a little stretchy. I was very pleased with the sandwich.

The fries were pretty standard, tasty and fried properly. I love that they also have a beer selection, wish I wasn't grabbing my stuff to go at 11AM.
author: Patrick S.

description:
Hmm. Tentative, and surprised, three..maybe even 2.5... stars. I will be back for another shot and update buuuut ....
This go wasn't a roaring success for me. Went with the original chicken sandwich and curly fries. The slaw, bun and pickles were good. Ok the slaw was amazing. 

The chicken, the raison d'être, was.. ok. First of all, I'm pretty sure it was dark meat - is white meat is available upon request? Second of all, the second bite was into it was one of those sinuous, gristley bits that makes one terribly glad to be eating alone behind a cubicle wall. 

You know, you bite in daintily, with poise and grace like you do, and then you can't cut all the way through because there is some weird bit that doesn't conform to your teeth's understanding of meat. You pull back as the entire sandwich begins to unravel, undecided about whether to simply abandon it, go big and allow chunks of gristle to hang from your mouth as you rip it apart, or use your hands to assist? 
Then there was another sort of fatty bite towards the end. 

The homemade sriracha is amazing, too - mix it with ketchup/catsup... so good. The curly fries were standard.
 I'm very interested in the ice cream sandwiches. 

It would be difficult for it to feel *more* hipster to me - there is no sign that I could find - you have to make your way around the line and peak at the menu to make sure you're at the right place.  Several people announced "This is my first time," in almost bashful tones as if there was some kind of shame in not being a bird insider.  That kind of thing is usually not a big turn on for me.  I was one of the only women in the place, definitely the oldest (under 40 still). The cashier wasn't super thrilled with my questions and I couldn't hear his responses...maybe cause I'm old.

But I'm pregnant and fried chicken sandwiches are really my thing right now so i will give it another shot and attempt my order with white meat specification.
author: Laura M.

description: Stringy chicken, but good value.  Chicken has an Indian flavor, so the sandwich tastes a little unorthodox for an American classic. Still a good sandwich but not worth the long wait during lunch hours.
author: Declan S.

description: Totally subpar, no idea why this is so highly rated. Fries are great. the spicy chicken it was just okay at best - overly spiced to cover up a subpar tasting hot sauce.
author: Alex R.

description: I keep trying to give this place a chance. But after the nearly raw chicken filet they served on the sandwich today, I'm done. Had to throw out the whole sandwich. The risk and incocsistency is not worth nine dollars.
author: Andrew F.

description:
Their fried chicken sandwich is tasty, but that line...

I love how simple the menu is and how easy it is to get a hot meal. If you're not here right when it opens, I'd try another day. The line is brutal.
author: Christina S.

description:
Price = 4
Chicken = 3
Curly Fries = 4

This place was perfect for something quick while I was on the way home. The chicken has a bit too much cinnamon if you ask me, but is still pretty good. The curly fries were perfectly crispy, and at under $10 a meal its a solid spot.
author: Lex M.

description:
You ever find something that was so good you didn't want to do it so much that you'd get sick of it? After one visit here, I can tell you this is one of those things. Stopped by The Bird yesterday before heading home at around 5. No line but place was about 75% full. Very minimal menu for more focus on quality. Placed an order of a classic with curly fries and received it in less than 1 minute. 

The curly fries were great. The sandwich though, a perfect blend of crispy and juicy. The skin made the sammich seem fried at just the right amount of time to catch that golden threshold while the meat inside was very tender and moist. Mix that with their apple slaw and celery and it just... I'm getting emotional... elevates it to an even higher plane with the flavorful crunch that they add. The pickles adding that last sweet tang. Please visit this place it is miraculous. The free-range and freshly made/baked aspect of their ingredients are bonus points.

Definitely coming back to try the rest of their menu.
author: Clint J.

description: The reviews are true. A small place that has few menu items, but the fried chicken sandwich is awesome and reasonably priced. I get mine spicy. See piks attached of my visit. There's a reason why there's a long line at lunchtime, so go early, 11am to 11:15am, beat the crowd. It's one great sandwich, the fried chicken is good size, the condiments add to the experience. If you are downtown San Francisco and nearby, stop by and give your taste buds a treat! Five stars, well done
author: Steve M.

description:
First trip here, but I know the pure genius of Adriano Pagnanini. Everything this guy touches turns to gold. Lolinda, super duper burger, Belga, Flores. All succeed in having a focused small menu that is every well executed. They do their work well. 
The bird is no exception. I had the spicy chicken sandwich. Man. This was a good fried chicken sandwich- like they looked at a chick fil a and decided to kick its ass. It's that good- crispy fried, great flavor, cooked perfectly. 
I got the loaded fries ( why not?) without really looking at what it was. It turns out to have a cheese sauce, sour cream, bacon and chives. I hate cheese sauce, always, except this time. It was great! 
Total meal was $11. Another great restaurant from Paganini
author: John B.

description: I was staying at the Palace nearby when I was in SF and loved the outward appeal of The Bird. It's a trendy, cute restaurant. The apple fritters are SO good! I bought some for my coworkers but was very tempted to eat them all myself. They're small, round, and sweet (but not overwhelmingly so). I live in the South so I'm particular on my chicken biscuits, but these aren't bad. The chicken was hot, juicy, and well-fried, but had too many fatty pieces in the chicken for my preference.
author: Amanda Claire K.

description: The best fried chicken sandwich in the city, hands down. The spicy one is to die for. The curly fries with the sriracha sauce is finger licking good!
author: Hemant J.

description:
Their service and quality have deteriorated. Cashier charged me more than expected because he didn't let me know that certain beers were priced more when I ordered the combo meal. $16? Too expensive. Also didn't ask if for here or to-go so I got it for here when I wanted take out. 

Their sandwiches are now made pretty sloppy. In the last month I've had 2 burnt chicken sandwiches. 

What is going on?
author: Geronimo Carlo R.

description:
Yelp HR/Payroll team approved! :P 

Skipped across the street with the team to see why the BIRD this place is is so crowded all the time. I'm one of those people that eat salads almost every day so when I feel like having a fat day. I use it wisely.

Thank you for the mini amusement park in my mouth. 

Keep it simple. Keep it legendary :)
author: Jeanie L.

description: The Bird serves the best fried chicken sandwich I've ever had! And customer service was very friendly too. I arrived when they opened and beat the lunchtime crowds and line. The fried chicken was super moist although the edge of the bun was slightly burnt. I was too full to have the hot ice cream sandwich. They told me that the sandwich consists of your choice of chocolate, caramel or pistachio ice cream in between hot sandwich buns.
author: Diana B.

description: My favorite chicken sandwich! The breading is crunchy and the chicken is very juicy and flavorful. I love their spicy chicken sandwich with their homemade Siracha sauce for extra kick. Great price with their great food make it a best choice for lunch.
author: Ai S.

description: Super good food, super good atmosphere, pricing was really affordable for the quality.
author: Taylor M.

description: Meh - it's OK for the money. Not worth the wait if there is a line out the door and literally a dozen places or more in SF with much better fried chicken sandwich.
author: Aaron P.

description: This was a cool chill environment and not to mention a welcoming setting. The employees were nice and helpful considering it was my first time in here. The beer selection is broad and now getting to the food, it's really bomb, if you're looking for soul food styled into a lunch version. I didn't have to wait long for my order to arrive and it was warm! The fries were also tasteful, my boyfriend loved it so much he ordered a second sandwich.
author: Citlali G.

description:
Service made mistakes
They won't make my sandwich how I like it (ketchup in the bun) when I order to go.
Curly fries were soggy, not crisp.
Chicken was way over cooked so the breading crunched like a pretzel. The chicken was also a mix of white meat, dark meat, and a lot of fat pieces between that made the texture horrible
author: Tylor L.

description:
A hot, a new place here in the financial district, and after eating here I can understand why. For those expecting to get your traditional fried chicken sandwich thats not what you will be getting. This chicken sandwich is just something else in its own unique way.

The Bird has a very urban hipster atmosphere, with its movie billboard menu, neon lights, artwork, and visible metal beams. That urban hipster flare is completely reflective in its chicken sandwich. From the looks of it the sandwich looks amazing. But after taking a bite its quite the trip.

I ordered a spicy chicken sandwich, which was composed of the fried chicken, which was moist cooked great, a couple pickles, a slaw, composed of red lettuce, red onion, celery, and apple, and a bun that had a hint of cinnamon. It was an interesting taste, the balance of the slaw and the cinnamon were an unexpected flavor combined with the little kick from the cinnamon. Dont get me wrong though it tasted great.

However despite it tasting great, it was not without flaws. As I kept eating the sandwich, I began to miss the aspects of a traditional chicken sandwich, such as that tangy sandwich spread, real crunchy succulent chicken. Perhaps the biggest cons were the weak breading which fell apart at times and the lack of emphasis on the chicken.

However The Bird is a nice refreshing take on the signature chicken sandwiches of places such as Chick- fil-A and great experience if youre nearby
author: Adrian E.

description:
Bird bird bird, bird is the WORD.

They have a very limited menu: fried chicken sandwiches (regular or spicy), fries, ice cream, and an assortment of soft-drinks and beer. Don't be intimidated by the long line, it goes quick promise! Because of the small menu, the lines moves fast, which I can see how this can be such a successful lunch sport. The owner also came out to help bus tables and ask everyone how their food was. Lots of feels for this place.

Now the sandwich. I got the spicy chicken sandwich and shared a side of fries with a friend. The sandwich is HUGE. I think it's almost 2 thighs in there. Super juicy, you an tell it's been brined for a flavor that is apparent throughout the entire chicken piece. For $8, this is such a steal.
author: Minh N.

description:
Good, affordable, albeit unhealthy, lunch option in SF.

Thanks line moves pretty quickly and if people don't linger at their table once they're done eating, it's pretty easy to grab a seat.

The sandwich is delicious, good bun, good slaw, crispy chicken.
author: Anna S.

description: One of the better fried chicken sandwiches I've had in a while! I came right before closing on a Friday night, so it wasn't packed and my sandwich was ready in less than 10 minutes. I tried their original Fried Chicken Sandwich (Chicken Coated in Berbere Spice Blend, w/Celery, Apple Slaw, Mayo, Pickles, $8, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=39MBHcPTXLAw6PDPwRFZQA&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg), and the chicken was very crispy without being dry. However, I wish I had opted for the spicy version since that one looks so good! I loved their apple slaw, which was super crunchy and a nice pairing to the fried chicken. There's plenty of seating inside (all counter style seating) to eat your sandwich there. I will definitely be back to try their spicy chicken sandwich and their ice cream! Parking is a bit difficult in this area, but there is some street parking available on nearby streets.
author: Amy D.

description: Easily one of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever had. Probably the best. I can't think of anything better. Great taste. The right amount of spice. Good fries. And they have a meal that comes with a beer. How can you top that?
author: Josh L.

description:
The Bird is, in a word, cluckin' amazing. 
I stopped by today to try it and I'm pleased to report that it is worthy of the considerable attention they are getting (as helped by LeBron of course).
It's a simple place and menu but that's key because they can focus on doing it well, and do they ever. I had a spicy chicken sando with curly fries. Curly fries were standard  - on point, but the sandwich was mind blowing. Crunchy slaw meets hot, spicy chicken battered in the most perfect seasoning imaginable on the palate and BAM! it's one and done (or two if you're really hungry). 
I'm not thin so I can't eat this whenever I want but if I could this would be top of my list. I eagerly look forward to my next visit. Can't wait, actually.
author: Matt H.

description:
Best Chicken sandwich ever!!!! If you are a fan of spicy food, get the spicy chicken sandwich. 
Staff was really friendly and helpful.
You must try their loaded potatoes and home made siracha sauce :)
author: Monica D.

description:
I am so surprised by all the 5 stars, maybe ppl here haven't had a good fried chicken. I've tried this place twice and both has been the same experience, very greasy chicken with a gamy after taste (dark meat only), the coleslaw is mounts and mounts of onion, and that's about it. I hate raw onion and even if I didn't I would not have this much onion for lunch on a work day. I asked if there was a no onion option and pretty much had to get no coleslaw which is supposed to add flavor and freshness to the sandwich. Had 2 bites and the grease was so heavy that I threw the sandwich away and ate the fries for lunch. 

If anyone has had Bakesale Betty's sandwiches in Oakland then they would know what I'm basing my judgement on. 
French fries was OK but the Bird salad looked good, I haven't tried it yet and saw someone carrying it out. I won't be back for the chicken but maybe for the salad without meat.
author: Shell S.

description:
Despite my fear/hatred of birds, they serve the BEST Fried Chicken Sandwich EVER! The bun is soft. The chicken's not dry, which is SUPER important. The breading isn't break-your-teeth hard but there's still a crunch. You can either order it regular or spicy - but you should ONLY get it spicy. It's not even spicy, like at all. They'll also ask if you want mayo, pickles, and slaw in it. Say 'yes' every time. They put these special toppings to make it the best Fried Chicken Sandwich for your benefit, so don't take away their specialty. Also, for $8 - can you get another Fried Chicken Sandwich for that price in the Financial/SoMa District??

The Hot Ice Cream Sandwich is the next best thing! If you love the sweet Hawaiian rolls, you need to order this too because they use those soft delicious rolls for the bun. You can pick between 3 flavors: chocolate, pistachio, and salted caramel. It's super quick and they're super soft! It made my day.

Also tried the Loaded Fries. But I, plus everyone I've talked to, don't think it's worth the $4 out of my pocket. My friend said the regular fries aren't worth it either and compared it to something you could get at a fast food restaurant. If you're lucky, they might be passing out samples of their curly fries with their sriracha ketchup, and that's really all you need to try the fries.

If you get there but there's already a line outside of the store, don't worry about it. They've got 2 cashiers and they're SUPER fast. I wouldn't suggest eating in-house though because there's very little room and most people are standing around the tables, waiting for their food, which makes things awkward.
author: Athena C.

description: This place is amazing and I'm from the South! This fried chicken is so delicious. I hate to say it, it's even better than Chick-fil-A and I love me some Chick-fil-A.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Delicious, filling, and great value!

My preference is the spicy chicken sandwich - packed with flavor and only $8! Not too much seating inside but luckily the food is super convenient to grab to-go. The line moves really quickly as well. I always make sure to recommend this as a great quick lunch or dinner option for friends working in the area. 

Plus, Lebron came during the NBA Finals and ordered 10+ sandwiches, so there's that.
author: Jenny M.

description:
Was here for work recently, and the standard chicken sandwich was probably the best chicken sandwich I've ever eaten. Nothing else has ever come close.

The apple fritters were delicious, and the only "ok" piece I had was the breakfast sandwich. It was yummy, but just not as amazing as the chicken sandwich.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Wow so good!!! I ordered the spicy fried chicken sandwich and it was delicious and very spicy. The slaw compliments it well.
author: Jasmine M.

description:
This is a new place that popped up where The Melt used to be. After having the Organic Coup (and being told that that was the best chicken sandwich in SF... spoiler: it isn't), I had a hankering to find something better. Thankfully this place delivered! I haven't tried the regular version, but unless you are completely averse to any level of spice whatsoever, I would recommend getting the spicy version, since it's not really spicy, just has flavor. The chicken is moist, but it's good because they use dark (thigh) meat in the patty, not breast. 

I've heard people rave about the fries, especially the curly ones. But they're just ok. Probably the same level of quality of a Carl's Jr. or something. Not as good as Jack-in-the-box. They could be a lot crispier. Make those things well done and I think you'd have a good pairing with the sandwich.

Also tried the chocolate hot ice cream sandwich. It was a scoop of ice cream in a slightly toasted (just the outside) hamburger bun. :| It kind of reminded me of a profiterole... Not terrible, but not worth getting more than once.
author: Brian H.

description: Good value for what you get. The spicey chicken isn't too spicey though. It would be good to have a variation of spicey sauces available.
author: Yama H.

description: Tried this place for the first time during my visit to SF! Line was really long outside the door, but it went by pretty fast. Service at the cashier was really good and we got our food right away. Seating is limited during peak hour during lunch time, but we got lucky finding a seat. The food was amazing and I can't wait to go again!
author: Kelly A.

description: When I want a really good fried chicken sandwich, I go to Chick Fil-a. But not anymore. This place has me ruined for fried chicken sandwiches anywhere else. The fried chicken, as one should expect, is juicy and flavorful and the outside has a nice crunch. The bun and slaw aren't just merely the supporting cast; they hold their own as well. The the apple or pear in the slaw adds a nice sweet taste and the bun is fluffy and soft. Overall, it's an unbelievable fried chicken sandwich. And to make it even better, add some of their house-made sriracha ketchup. OMG! (The curly fries are really good too, but seriously, all anyone cares about is the chicken sandwich.) It's so good, I went back two weeks later and I don't even live in SF. I would go back every week if I could. Enough said. Go eat some chicken there.
author: Benjamin L.

description:
Don't bother for lunch, the line is ridiculously long. Refreshingly small menu-- fried chicken is their schtick. I got the spicy fried chicken sandwich and the flavor was good, the slaw on the sandwich was good the curly fries were good. No taste complaints. The sandwich was an offender of my #1 food pet peeve: food that is difficult to eat/falls apart when you eat it. They place what I assume to be two chicken breasts on a single sandwich, they both fell out at some point.
Also- note: I thought the spice level was perfect, but the two men next to me were sweating and complaining about it being too spicy... so unless you have a higher capsaicin tolerance like myself, you may want to be a little more cautious.
author: Emily G.

description: Solid Hipster/Chicken sandwich. Got the meal deal with a can of hamms. Was there at 11 - by the time I left there was a line outside the door.
author: Randy B.

description: The bomb!  Soul food at its finest!  Spicy chicken sandwich has a bite on the backend.  Loaded fries are off the hook. Seven-year-old said it's the best chicken sandwich I ever ate!
author: Page P.

description:
Chicken sandwich.

Moist - I believe some of the sandwich was dark meat, which was fine with me.

Not too expensive - probably because of the dark meat.

Order it spicy if you like a little kick.  The flavor was great!

Fries were hot, but could have been longer.  I don't like small fry pieces.

Service was good.

They serve beer in cans and offer a happy special which is a chicken sando, fries and a beer- Olympia, Colt 45 and Keystone I think.

Get there early, the line gets ridiculous after 12.  There were about 40 people in line as we exited around 12:15.

Compared to the Organic Coup, this sandwich was $2 less and just as good or better.
author: Curtis C.

description: This is a good chicken sandwich spot. Their happy meal special is great cause you can get a beer with your meal. The sandwich was delicious & very neat. I would definitely eat here again.
author: Saul M.

description: The first time it was good the next two times made mad me made mediocre at best it's tryna create a fried chicken sandwich that's just a miss on tastes buds but it's a chill spot very busy location but I will say the loaded fries are a two thumbs up so not a total lost beer fries socialize it's a four star spot fir that!!!
author: Rolin S.

description:
Biz just opened near the office so decided to check it out.

They specialize in chicken sandwiches which I jumped at the opportunity. I've had chicken sandwiches from Naked Lunch on Broadway which is amazing so excited that a place opened so close to work.

I'd give them a bit of a pass on the quality of food especially since they just started and are figuring out their menu and logistics, I definitely like the sandwiches from Naked Lunch better though, I'd say their chicken sandwich is average, I really enjoy the slaw on the sandwich but the fried chicken was pretty underwhelming.

Service was pretty quick despite loads of people, so that was nice. Might come back another time once things has settle down to see if they've settle into the groove of things.
author: Davis W.

description:
Very quick and easy food, even at lunch time! The space is standard packed, but not really an issue since you can take it out to a park, if necessary. 

The menu is simple. I got the spicy chicken sandwich and the loaded fries. The fries were pretty basic - fries with cheese and whatnot. I usually like my fries crispy, but with all the toppings, that ain't gonna happen. For the burger, YUMM. My friend described it as "chick-fil-a on crack," which is a pretty accurate description. The fried chicken is juicy, and the slaw is delicious, complementing the meat perfectly in a savory and yet sweet way. The crunch is a great texture to the more tender feeling of the chicken. The "spicy" chicken sandwich really isn't spicy though, so their homemade sriracha is perfect to add on for some extra sauciness. I went twice within two weeks... and didn't regret it at all.
author: Joan Y.

description:
Lousy - threw the food right into the garbage!

My first time there, I had the breakfast sandwich. I opened the package and it was a mess. Cheese everywhere and the contents just slid right out of the bun. Also, the biscuit they use...one half was broken and the whole thing just crumbled - never again.

Today, my co-workers and I got the chicken sandwich (I ordered the spicy one). The cut of meat was gross (not sure if it was a thigh or what). It was fatty, dark, and nasty. It also seemed greasy. Again, I took one bite and threw it right in the trash.

I do not recommend eating at The Bird. There are way better choices in the area!
author: Kevin K.

description: Simply just great food. The chicken on it's own is the best I've had in Cali and the spice packs a kick!
author: Levy T.

description: A fried chicken sandwhich with apple colesaw, pickles!! Yummmmm!! GREAT service & can't beat the price!
author: Naida M.

description: There are so so so many cool things about this place - there's just one thing I didn't like, the chicken - which is kind of the point. Im more of a bake sale Betty's kind of chicken man- so it might simple be a matter of preference. I would come here again though just because its so cool and you can get a happy meal if you buy a beer
author: Tim B.

description:
NOM NOM NOM. Recently opened with long lines, my first experience will not be my last.

The fried chicken sandwich is better then salt house, which i think is too big and not as flavorful.

I ordered spicy, cause why not, I like spicy and it was good. There is also house made sriracha, if you like it more spicy and the slaw was refreshing and went well with the sandwich. The slaw was red onion, apples and celery with a lite herb vinaigrette. 

Since the pickles are from Super Super, I wish there was a jar like Super Duper, as I love pickles and wouldn't mind some extra ones one the side.

Got it with some curly fries, which was super tasty.

Overall it was a good sandwich, granted that it got a little messy near the end of the sandwich.

Thanks,
mei
author: Mei L.

description: Simple, easy, fast and delicious! Spicy fries chicken is the way to go! Interior is clean and modern, staff friendly, decent selection of beers. Definitely worth snagging a bite!
author: Cody F.

description:
I like The Bird as it's straightforward on what they offer.  The fried chicken sandwich was really good and a massive piece of chicken in that.  I also got the fries and was definitely full after my meal.

Be warned that there will be a line but it moves pretty quickly.  Chicken lovers check this place out!
author: Blake B.

description: Wow, great place for a quick bite.  Great fried chicken sandwich and loaded french fries.  Cool, hip ambiance.  Very reasonably priced.  Will definitively go back again.
author: Jimmy W.

description:
