What makes this place amazing is the mixture of a quick to order simple menu and amazing food.  I had the SPICY chicken sandwich, but it also comes in non spicy.  Super good. 

Be aware the line can get very long but the line goes very quick and it's worth the wait.
author: Bradley H.

description: I came here and ordered the chicken sandwich and curly fries.. their menu is small but the food is good. The people working there seem relatively nice... there isn't too much seating. If you like a fresh and juicy fried chicken sandwich this place is worth checking out.
author: Amanda O.

description: Came here after work with co-workers to check this place out! Very affordable being that it's in the Financial District - only $8 for a huge chicken sandwich. I opted for the spicy chicken sandwich, which was a little on the spicier side for me because of the spices - but their ketchup helped a lot. The fried part was crunchy and it has the perfect amount of batter to make it - not too much or little. I also really liked the juiciness of the chicken - good job on mastering that! They have homemade ketchup & sirarcha that you'd might want to try in their condiments area. I like the variety of beers they have - I tried the Ellie Brown one because it had a dog on it :) - it was tasty! I wasn't able to finish my entire sandwich, but it's a good deal for the price. I also tried the loaded fries with my co-worker and it was on the smaller side, but it was also tasty. Definitely will return :)
author: Amanda C.

description: Hands down the best chicken sandwich in San Francisco. Get one. No. Get two. Lol they are both great but the spicy one is the way to go.
author: Shashi P.

description: Best fried chicken sandwich I've ever had, ~$8
author: Thomas L.

description:
Once loved this place....but the last experience ruined it for me. Dry bun, cold chicken, no curly fries?!?, and bad service. 

I paid 20 for a happy meal and soda, that could get you a good meal elsewhere.
author: Aaron M.

description:
I found the fried chicken to be very bland and lacking salt, but it was very juicy! I topped the sandwich with the coleslaw, which is non-traditional, but also falls into the bland category. Personally, my experience would've been better if a BBQ sauce option was available to the ketchup and hot sauce offering- 

Great seating space, lots of room. Though with many tables open, all were left with trash and dip drippings on the table. The staff does not do a very good job keeping the tables clean-
author: Jessica E.

description: Ordered the Spicy Chicken Sandwich and it's the best chicken sandwich I've ever had. I don't think I can oversell this place. The chicken was moist, the crust was crunchy and spicy along with the pickles, it was amazing. I had some curly fries on the side and they were a solid side to the sandwich.
author: Bryan S.

description: I can do that it was would and like and I can I have been a lot and I have and I can I have been a sent and dogs and dogs dogs dogs and dogs and dogs cats are not the credit and dogs cats and cats dogsled cats and dogsled and cats Android and I love you and I have and cats and are are Android is there a any and dogs dogs cats Android to and the invention the I have a been a great time weekend as I have been a sent from my go-to the quick response and dogs cats Android to and cats Android and dogs cats Android and cats and dogsled and cats and dogs and cats and dogsled and I love you have a been sent and cats are not the me know if you and dogs and dogs cats are and Android
author: Eric M.

description: This place is a GEM. I'm a sucker for places with short menus, it takes the guess work out of ordering. The chicken to bun to coleslaw ratio is fantastic. You get a healthy serving of juicy chicken and the flavor of the coleslaw complements the seasoning of the chicken perfectly... not to mention their delicious house made sirachia. Service was quick and friendly!
author: Alexandra S.

description:
Big pile of meh. The food is good, but nothing outstanding. A place for millenials looking for a cheap meal, but who end up spending too much anyways because of the add-ons. You can get your fried on here.

Just so you know, the 'Bird salad,' at $6.50, contains no bird. You have to pay another $6 or so to add that in.
author: Wayne Q.

description: I love the spicy fried chicken sandwich and the curly fries.
author: Anil M.

description:
The curly fries are back.  It's great to see either them listening to feedback or working out whatever supply chain or cost issue they might have had.

5/5, would cluck again.
author: Chris S.

description: Recently discovered this fried chicken sandwich stop and it was amazing. Mildly spicy fried chicken that is still moist and tender paired with some pickles and veges to tear away at that grease makes it a perfect combination.
author: Thomas C.

description: The line can be a little long, but it's an awesome place to grab lunch to bring back to the office. The spicy fried chicken sandwich is perfect. Dat thigh meat makes all the other chicken breast sando's look weak. They top it off with coleslaw that cuts through the grease and tempers the heat. The curly fries are on point like at Jack In The Box - I mean that it the utmost respect.
author: Huey N.

description: Solid sandwich. Definitely recommend the spicy option if you like spicy. Chicken was nice and juicy. Great play
author: Ryan Z.

description: I have walked past The Bird countless times and have not gone in -- not because I didn't want to, but because my friend said if I went once I'd never stop thinking about it. He's right. The chicken sandwich is the best.  The chicken was HOT, the slaw topping was COLD, the pickles add the right amount of tang, and the seasoning was spot on. They have homemade sriracha as well. This sandwich will take you to your happy place. Enjoy!
author: Alex D.

description: The Bird serves a solid fried chicken sandwich.  The batter has some clove or cinnamon which makes it unique and nicely complemented by the lightly sweet apple slaw, though I wish there was proportionately more slaw.  The pickles were fresh and nicely crunchy, reminiscent of Super Duper.  The curly fries were very good, both in texture and seasoning.  Overall it was a very satisfying meal, but it wasn't the best fried chicken sando I've ever had (hint: my favorite is still in Oakland).  But at $8 for the sandwich + $2.50 for curly fries, this is definitely a place I'd return to if I was in the area.
author: Beatrice W.

description: One of the best fried chicken sandwiches I ever had! Dripping juice in every bite. You got to get the spicy version.. Don't cheat yourself!
author: Mista N.

description: This place is just ok. Not impressed for the price. I think Jack in the box's crispy chickens sandwich is better.
author: Alan L.

description:
One of my favorite chicken sandwiches in SF!

I usually go for the classic chicken sandwich. The chicken is so juicy and delicious and overflowing from the bun. Plus their curly fries! Everything is amazing!

I stopped by on a Saturday once and didn't realize they closed early. I got there 5-10 mins after closing and was told so by the cashier. But while I was outside, trying to figure out where to get food instead, the owner or manager came out saying they still had sandwiches left and said I could order still. I thought it was nice that he ran out to let me know... because I was craving a chicken sandwich from The Bird!
author: Bora L.

description:
We've been looking for a decent chicken sandwich place in the city for the last two years. Finally tried The Bird and overall it was okay. I got the spicy chicken sandwich with the coleslaw and pickles on the side and the S.O got the regular chicken sandwich done the same way and we also shared an order of the curly fries.

Everything came out the way it should be, things that were supposed to be hot came out piping hot and the coleslaw was tasty. It had a mixture of celery, apple and red cabbage with the apple cider vinegar; that was nice and refreshing, none of that mayo-y stuff in it. The curly fries came out hot and crispy.

Although the chicken served in their sandwiches is dark meat it was tasteless. The piece was hot and juicy, however it lacked in flavor. It was cooked perfectly fine, batter was crispy, but just didn't have any taste to it. My spicy chicken, all the seasoning was in the batter but the chicken itself tasted bland. Wanted to love this place but only loved everything else but the chicken. 

This place is fairly new so maybe other people will recommend the same thing--that the chicken requires some  seasoning to it.
author: Jenny L.

description: I've had great sandwiches here but the service... I stopped in this morning to pick up some breakfast on my way to work. It was annoying to find that you were "sold out" of coffee but fine.. I placed my order for a sausage biscuit and began to wait.. and wait... and wait.. after about 7 minutes (checked the time on the pod cast I'd just started) it was obvious my order hadn't been started but I was patient.. When a customer who came in after I came in got his food is when I asked for a refund.. no one offered any sort of apology but instead told me it was because I'd ordered a sausage biscuit and they take a long time.. I'd never had to wait as long as this and or watch other customers get their food first... in the time this exchange was taking place another customer who came in after me got their food.. and again I was told that it was my fault because of what I ordered. The young lady who was on her phone and sitting in the dining area who came over to process the refund never apologized, at all, never said.. oh I'm sorry I'll refund you and it looks like it's almost ready.. she told me I ordered wrong. she then told me it would take 5-6 days to get my refund of a whole... 6 dollars. I've enjoyed getting lunch and breakfast at the Bird and I think that time's come to an end as long as this crew is working, Not only were things taking so long but the attitude at every turn was that it was my fault and in no way lifting a finger towards correcting the situation. When I expressed that I was really disappointed in the exchange and suggested that they shouldn't just tell me I ordered wrong she simply told me I could email the general manager.. What a crappy way to start a Monday morning.. you want some breakfast and you get terrible service from a child.
author: diction d.

description: Juicy, nicely seasoned chicken sandwich with tasty slaw! The line was long around noon but it moved quickly. These guys know how to take and process orders efficiently. I love the curly fries too!
author: Laura B.

description: Good, casual spot for a delicious Spicy Chicken Sandwich! Which was actually spicy! In the best way, as in it was flavorful and not just spicy for the hell of it. Only issue was that the bun was too toasted for my liking, making it a little crumbly. A detail to remember for next time!
author: Kevin D.

description: I stopped by here for lunch with a craving for hot crispy spicy chicken and I was not disappointed.  Three things were great about my experience:  Quality of food taste, quickness of delivery and value.  I ordered a spicy chicken sandwich to-go with loaded curly fries.  Within a couple of minutes I was out the door with a couple sides of sriracha ketchup.  The sandwich was a good level of spicy (I love it spicy) and was hot, crispy and delicious.  The loaded fries didn't hold up as well as I walked to where I ate a couple blocks away because they were covered with hot cheese, sour cream, bacon and chives.  No doubt, these would have been better if consumed immediately but they were still good.  The sandwich is less than $10 which a great deal for a hot delicious lunch in downtown SF.  I will definitely go back.  The wait was about 15 minutes as the line moves pretty fast.
author: Branden W.

description: Worth the hype.  Came here for dinner around 6 and there was no line.  No line for a delicious dark meat crispy fried chicken goodness deserves a 5 stars for being the best I've had in SF so far.  The loaded tots could be a bit bigger but whatever it was delicious.   Would I  wait 30-45 min for this during lunch though? hmmmm questionable.
author: Vince L.

description: Very good lunch option if you're in downtown SF area for work. While there is a line, the line moves quickly. Chicken sandwich is moist and with a nice kick. Also, great value for your money.
author: Zesty Z.

description: The place was small, so you wouldn't notice that there's a sandwich shop there I didn't know that place exist if it wasn't for yelp. I came there and there was a long line but they were fast. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich. My ordered came in fast and I could say that the food was good. will definitely come again.
author: Sel E.

description: Got a breakfast biscuit from here and added spicy chicken. It was really good, I wasn't a huge fan of the cheese as it was like liquid cheese, but if that's your thing you'll like it. Also, pretty small biscuit.
author: Jared M.

description:
Stopped by here on a Saturday afternoon so it wasn't too crowded. The decor is awesome, and they had the Giants game streaming onto the tile wall. 

I got the "Happier Meal" which included the fried chicken sandwich (regular or spicy), curly fries, and a beer (choice of Olympia or Hamm's) for a great price of $12.50! They also had a pretty solid selection of canned craft beers, ranging from $4-$5. Less than 5 minutes after we had ordered, our food was ready. Very quick turnaround. 

The spicy sandwich was amazing! Perfect level of spice and the sandwich didn't need any hot sauce, which is rare for me to say. The breaking was also spot on, as it was nice and thin, not too much. Only thing I didn't like was the celery in the slaw, which is because I personally don't like celery, although it did do a good job of toning down the spiciness of the sandwich. 

We finished off with the apple fritters, basically an apple donut hole with a little glaze. Nice snack to end it, with 3 of them only costing $1.50. 

Would certainly stop back by when in the neighborhood.
author: Brandon S.

description: Holy chicken biscuit!!!! Simple, well sauced, crispy, tender and HOT!! With a beer? Does life get any better? Line can be long and with good reason but even with the line out the door from the end of the line to tastebud bliss is ~15 minutes. Well done Bird!!
author: Kellen M.

description: I ordered the original chicken burger as my colleague said the spicy is really hot! And just opted to  have their homemade sirarcha sauce (yummy). The burger was super juicy, crunchy and tasty! The bun was good too. I suggest you go there before lunch as the line can get crazy. They have water station and they offer complimentary sparkling water (wow). It is a small burger restaurant with few seats inside and some chairs outside.
author: Pauline P.

description: Good cheap eats for SF. Lol. $13 for sandwich, fries and a Hamm's beer. Good food though. Free soda water.
author: Rudi R.

description: Simple menu, but great food!  Ordered the standard fried chicken sandwich with signature curly fries and, even with a line out the door, had my meal in my hands within 2 minutes! Chicken was savory and flavorful, and didn't leave me with an upset stomach like Chick fil A sometimes does.  To top it off, it was very reasonably priced for SF - 10 bucks total! Totally would recommend and looking forward to coming back again.
author: Anthony P.

description:
Since you guys seem to be much more responsive on Yelp than over email...

I really like your food... but sometimes your hash browns taste like your donuts.  Please filter the oil or use different fryers!  :-)

xx,
Nicole
author: Nicole L.

description: The Bird does chicken well. They make a killer chicken sandwich and anywhere that serves curly friends is a winner in my book. The breading and spices on the chicken are super flavorful and the house made sriracha brings it all together.
author: Ashley M.

description: The best. Nice juicy piece of chicken, great slaw that compliments the spice, and a fluffy bun. There's always a line but the line moves fast! They are constantly churning out fried chicken so your sandwich will be straight out of the fryer.
author: Melissa N.

description: We came here for dinner after visiting the MOMA. It wasn't too busy so we were able to order and get our food quite quickly. The chicken sandwiches and loaded fries were extremely good. The salad had fresh ingredients, but wasn't that exceptional.
author: Bryce H.

description: Bump it to 5 stars. Just look at the number of my check-ins and you will know how much I love the classic chicken sandwich - fresh, hot, tender and yummy.
author: Frank W.

description: The spicy chicken sandwich was delicious! The spice level wasn't crazy, but it did have some heat that I enjoyed. I didn't get the slaw because I"m not usually a fan of slaw, but my friend said she liked it. I love pickles and felt like they complimented the sandwich well. The curly fries were crispy and tasty! Would love to come back to try their HH hot wings!
author: Alyssa P.

description: This spicy chicken sandwich is reallllly frickin good. I don't like apples and I'm not much of a coleslaw person but the apple coleslaw makes the sandwich so unique! Order it with the drink and you will feel complete. I will say it gets packed and seating becomes limited during lunch when I went. Tables get sorta messy but I think people care more about getting their sandwich quickly and eating than being worried about spotless tables. We ended up taking our food to a nearby park to enjoy anyway.
author: Cornelia C.

description:
I really love this place. Spicy chicken sandwich and side of pickled onions..oh so good!
They also serve spicy wings...my favorite!
Place gets pretty busy during lunch, but it's worth the wait!
author: Darwin B.

description: The best spicy chicken sandwich guaranteed! I have not tried the regular chicken sandwich as I am a fan of spicy, but if it compares to the spicy one it must be on point too! I would recommend going before or after the lunch rush because the line gets crazy long. You can't beat the price either compared to other establishments in SF!
author: Coleman T.

description: Saw this place on yelp as we were leaving the SF Museum of Modern Art. Possibly the best chicken sandwich I've ever eaten! There's no signage but it's across from Chipotle. A very small space with a few tables indoors and a few outside. The chicken sandwich comes regular or spicy. I love spicy so this is what I ordered. MAN! It's spicy! Has a delicious slaw on it that helps with the heat but I'm thinking they should develop an awesome made-from- scratch ranch! They offer a wide selection of can beers and sodas. The curly fries were also cooked crunchy and perfect. Very basic menu but they do it right, and include a breakfast chicken biscuit served all day. Friendly service that was quick. I would definitely recommend and eat here again.
author: Julie M.

description:
One of the best spicy-chicken sandwiches I've ever had (and I love my fried chicken).

Ordered a spicy-chicken sandwich, with regular curly fries and PBR, which came out to $15. Pretty filling, overall. Get there a little early, lines are usually out the door, but service is fast overall. Seating is limited/cramped inside, with overflow patio seating outside.
author: Jason D.

description:
Let me preface this with the fact that I LOVE fried chicken. This place is a fantastic addition to the downtown SF lunch scene, but expect it to be crowded with a line out the door during peak lunch hours. This is not the best fried chicken: it's better than KFC but lacking compared to true Nashville Fried Chicken.

I usually order the Spicy Chicken sandwich and split a curly fries with a friend. At $8/sandwich, the pricing is a steal for downtown SF standards. I highly recommend getting the curly fries for those who have larger appetites since one sandwich may not fill everyone up. I usually mix ketchup with Sriracha to dip my fries in.

After placing my order, it only takes between 5-10 minutes before my order is ready. The meal is simple, delicious, and easy on your credit card. Get here early, and you will enjoy a delicious meal.
author: Christina L.

description:
Spicy and Juicy!  Everything I ever want from a fried chicken sandwich.  Got a little messy by the end, but it was good to the last bite.   Krinkle cut french fries were good too.  I'd go to 5 stars if you could save a buck with a combo or something.  But as long as the line remains long, they have no reason to change or cut prices.

I'll be back.  And next time I'm probably adding an ice cream sandwich.
author: Chris L.

description: My work colleagues and I usually hit the Bird for lunch once a week, they only do chicken as a main course so if you aren't into a big fat breaded chicken thigh on a bun then you'll need to go elsewhere.  The chicken sandwich is awesome in its simplicity with the slaw and pickles...the bird is the werd:)  Curly fries never disappoint and the warm cookie ice cream sandwiches are delicious.  There is a reason this place has a line most days.
author: Bryan G.

description: Wow Great Sandwich. I wish there was on in Austin(cough).
author: Wil D.

description:
We went here for lunch on Saturday. We've had some great line karma lately, and walked straight to the counter. Our meal was out in less than 10 minutes (also great) and we had a table all to ourselves. The only downer is that they were out of koozies for our Happier meals. My man did not think the spicy chicken sandwich was spicy enough, but I did. Highly recommend upgrading to the loaded curly fries - my boo kept trying to eat my fries because he got his without all the fixins. 

All in all, a great chicken sandwich for those craving a certain chicken sandwich you can only get in Walnut Creek (for now). I preferred this sandwich (and price point) over going to Rove.
author: Jenny K.

description: Classic chicken sandwich surpassed all expectations I had! Juicy and crispy!
author: Alex P.

description:
Spicy chicken sandwich was delicious and JUICY.

Curly fries are meh and not worth the price. Next time I will get just a chicken sandwich.
author: Isai A.

description:
Decor - think minimalist then reduce by 50%.  Bit it works.  

No menu, it's on a board, but a description of the items would be nice.

Service - well, order takers.  Seemed pleasant and helpful.

Cleanliness was fine.  Well kept store.

Food - the chicken sandwich was very good.  Big ol piece of chicken that was cooked nicely.  Done all the way through but still tender and juicy.  Wasn't​a huge fan of the slaw, but that is a personal taste, nothing wrong with the slaw.  Sorta wish there was some melty cheese dripping down the sandwich.  That would have been nice.

The loaded fries well great.

Overall it's a good meal for a decent price considering the location.  Line was out the door, but service moved a long quickly.
author: Sean S.

description: My husband and I were looking for a quick snack, so we ordered The Happier Meal to share. So so so delicious. We left there a few hours ago and we keep talking to each other about how good it was. Everything about it was delicious. We are definitely eating here again!
author: Lauren H.

description: Worth the wait. The Bird is a fun lunch spot with a unique feel and good chicken. My favorite item was the loaded fries, but the chicken on the chicken sandwich had a bit too much fat for me. The breeding on the chicken has a unique sweetness that I personally wasn't a fan of, but other people I was with found it very tasty.
author: Haley B.

description:
Yes worth crossing the road for!

Best clucking chicken sandwich ever!!! Not a fowl thing to say :-) 

Cock-a-doo·dle-doo!!!! sooooo goood I'll have two!
author: Albert K.

description: The sandwich was horrible. Dry burnt and the pickles and the veggies were limp not crispy or fresh. Extremely disappointed never going back
author: Maria S.

description: So I was here when I was a "vegan" and I ordered their bacon fries without bacon. I was starving and finished them almost instantly, they aren't big on portions. My buddy whom I went with ordered the chicken sandwich I personally did not eat it but man... now that Im not a vegan anymore Im definitely going back.
author: Brandon H.

description: Excellent food and fast service! My friend and I came here for a post-Soul cycle lunch on a Saturday afternoon. The spicy fried chicken sandwich was pretty good, but not that spicy if you ask me...then again I have a high tolerance for spicy so maybe that's just my burned off taste buds talking. I was kind of curious what the "hot ice cream sandwich" was so my friend and I split a Salted caramel & Apple pie one. It's actually ice cream IN between a sandwich bun (which is hot)! I thought it was going to be between 2 cookies at first. Hah. Overall pretty good. Seating can be a little bit tricky to find though.
author: Scott K.

description: What a great breakfast sandwich! We got the spicy  chicken biscuit with egg and cheese.
author: Michael Y.

description: Very simple menu with spicy or non spicy fried chicken sandwich.  Just the chicken.  Or salad.  The food came out quick and the seats also turned over quick.  Nothing too complex.  I already recommended my lyft driver to try it out.  The chicken is dark meat which keeps it moist and delicious.
author: Kathleen T.

description: I have been two times now and I feel like the dam tasty fried chicken sandwich is not a fluke. I had the curly fries and beer deal. The house baked bread bun is delicious. The house-made cabbage coleslaw with pickles is scrumptious. The canned beer selection is excellent. I love the free beer koozie/coozy. The ordering and service is quick fast and efficient. I like the location. I look forward to many more meals.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
Tried them again. 

The chicken sandwich is still great. Everyone behind the counter was nice.

But the fries are still just plain terrible. Pre-cut pre-frozen sticks of cardboard, warmed up in oil.

Still worth a visit for a chicken sandwich and a beer. But just wait until another meal to have fries - these will only disappoint.
author: Hunter H.

description:
I have been reading about this place for a while in the SFWeekly. I have been wanting to go here very much for the longest time (3-4 months).

I read the Yelp reviews and I like to see the bad review equally as the great reviews just so I can draw my own picture after my experience. 
My picture is that it is good... Very good, flavor portion and service was good. 

Problem is food wasn't hot. I know they get busy during lunch during the week. This was a Saturday not busy. I could see all the chicken under the heat lamp. We ordered one spicy and one regular chicken sando(trust me the spicy is the better of the two... The regular isn't bad at all. It's just the spicy is more flavorful) it came out fast which was nice since we were hungry.

Problem comes (we both ordered the meals soda fries and sandwich which they very nicely cut in half on request so we could try each version)when we bite into the food and it is warm. Not hot and fresh how you would expect a meal to be when you pay nearly $30. 

We will go again. But will ask this time for 'hot fries and hot chicken'. Spicy of course.
author: Barry K.

description: The spicy chicken sandwich was really good and quick to deliver. The ambience isn't the best in that it's not a date spot or such but it's still a place I'd recommend for a quick, high quality, chicken sandwich at a great price.
author: Kurians P.

description: Sandwich was not good, the chicken wasn't crispy and the slaw they put on top was very bland and didn't really add anything to the sandwich. I couldn't finish it, but at least I got semi-full on the side of curly fries. I would recommend just getting the fries.
author: Cassandra F.

description:
Come before 11:30AM or there is a line and no seating.

SPICY FRIED CHICKEN SANDWICH w/ celery, house made apple slaw, mayo, pickles, and bun. Very flavorful, good size and not too spicy. Also get the loaded fries! Amazing!!! This is a fried chicken sandwich done right!
author: Karen H.

description: Today is the day of a first and an ending. My first double 5-star review for the same restaurant and the end of my search for a great breakfast sandwich in FiDi SF. Just had a sausage egg and cheese BISCUIT sandwich from the Bird and it was simply perfect. Nice salty crumbly but soft biscuit (I loathe the typical English muffin breakfast sandwich) with a nicely fried egg and gooey American cheese (PLEASE PLEASE for the love of god do not use any other cheese on a breakfast sandwich. I love sharp cheddar as much as the next person but it doesn't melt well and it should just be enjoyed solo). I would walk down for a second helping if we didn't have a board meeting in 15 minutes.
author: Brendan M.

description: Whoever came up with this fried chicken is a genius. Delicious, juicy, and crispy. The staff was very welcoming and the service was quick. One of my favorite chicken places.
author: Cindy S.

description: One of the best chicken sandwiches you'll ever eat in your frkn life. (O_O) breading and flavor are amazing.
author: Raman T.

description:
this place is too legit to quit.
lines may be long, but they move fast!

my coworker and i showed up and the line was about 15 ppl deep.  my coworker gave me the option to wait or walk half a mile to the other place we wanted to try, i opted to stay and wait in line.  my cute 4" shoes said there would be no additional walking that day... 

35 mins later ... not only had we waited in line, ordered, found a seat, but we also managed to finish eating!! our food was ready in less than 1 minute of ordering!  have you seen the Founder (movie about McDonalds)? that turn around time was reminiscent of that movie!!

this was my second time at the Bird.  food is consistently good.  staff was friendly each time.

will be coming back!
happy eating!
author: Tina F.

description:
For my first experience, I was underwhelmed by the food, which is what brought me in. The atmosphere? Hip. The signage? Super retro cool. The employee's and service? Nice enough. I ordered a chicken biscuit and an egg, cheese and bacon biscuit for breakfast. The chicken was really greasy and not a good chunk of meat. I think Try should be more selective on what they put on that biscuit. The egg and bacon was good. By the second biscuit I was thinking they were too buttery, but then ignored myself. Runny egg over a thick piece of soft bacon. Good sandwich, but I came for the bird. 

First time visit I don't usually review, but this is SF and in a time where developers at Twitter can't afford to live here. Earning a 4 or 5 stars needs to mean you nailed it. I'll update after a lunch visit for more bird.
author: Darin A.

description: Got in line at 12:15, ordered  my meal at 12:35, got my meal within 10 min of wait. It's very tasty, not very greasy, the spiciness was just to my liking. However the loaded fries were a bit of disappointment. I was expecting. Br more of flavor, small rather than big chunks of bacon, a bit more green onions and cheese. I'd suggest you can add spicy sauce to your loaded fries, it get a bit too much of fries food after you finish your burger. But overall rating it's a four star for sure. I'd bring my friends back for happy hour!! Can't wait to try to spicy chicken wings!
author: Lovetea C.

description: I really enjoyed the fried chicken sandwich. The fries were good, but it's all about the sandwich for me. I try to visit by 11:30am to avoid the ridiculous line.
author: Russ S.

description: Can't even try the food because the line goes down the block...
author: Jamal T.

description: Popped in here for breakfast before walking around SF for the day. My husband and I ordered the Egg Biscuit and the Spicy Chicken Biscuit, both come with tots, both were AMAZING! Loved the juiciness and spice of the chicken, the Egg, Cheese, and Bacon was simple perfection. They also have homemade sriracha which was awesome. Super reasonable prices, we (and our stomachs) left happy and full.
author: Tyler D.

description: The fried chicken was definitely crispy and juicy. Wasn't a fan of the cole slaw thought it needed more flavor or spice to it.  Didn't think the spicy fried chicken wasn't spicy either. The loaded fries were great! wish they came in a bigger portion.
author: Abby C.

description: The Bird sat on my bookmarks since forever! Since we were shopping downtown, we decided to make a lunch stop at The Bird. We had the Classic Fried Chicken Sandwich and the Fully Loaded Curly Fries. The fried chicken sandwich was HUGE! I was even more surprised when the chicken was most/tender on the inside, yet crispy on the outside! DELICIOUS! Definitely shareable if you're a small eater! I was a bit disappointed at the portion size of the fully loaded curly fries. It was pretty small for the price. :( Nonetheless, it was still pretty good. It was loaded with cheese, bacon, sour cream, and green onions. Even with so much on top, the curly fries were still crispy (including the bacon)! Overall, the meal was pretty good! I'd definitely want to come back to try their Spicy Fried Chicken Sandwich and see what that one is all about. :)
author: Philana C.

description:
Went here on a Friday lunch time and one morning for breakfast

Lunch:
Wait is unreal. While the line moves fast and the food comes out pretty quickly. The line is quite long and you're going to be in there for about 20 minutes. Is it worth the wait? YES. I got the loaded fries and a spicy chicken sandwich. The sandwich had a good kick but wasn't too spicy. If you are sensitive then I recommend the regular. They have a ketchup and sriracha dispenser so LOAD up on the sauces.

Breakfast:
Got a biscuit sandwich with sausage and tots. This was by far one of the best breakfast sandwiches I have ever had. The biscuit is great, not dry at all. The cheese is melted gooey onto the egg and the sausage is tasty. The tots remind me of the BK tots. still good. Again loaded up on the sauces and was in heaven.

Overall, this place lives up to the hype and you should come here.
author: edward k.

description:
This place is bomb-tastic! The spicy chicken sandwich, curly fries, and special curly fries are all really tasty and are unique in their own ways.

The chicken sandwich is great because the chicken is crisp, juicy, and has got some spiciness to it. I think the best part of it is the play with the sweetness and fresh crunch of the slaw and pickle. My bud and I both agree that the sandwich could use more slaw and/or pickle to bring better balance, although I can see how the owner would want to really emphasize that BIG piece of chicken in the sandwich.

The curly fries and special curly fries are delish and surprisingly taste quite different. Definitely get the sriracha+ketchup for these bad boys. The curly fries on their own are well seasoned and crisp. The special curly fries are smothered in sauce and bacon so you get a really rich creamy crunch when you eat them altogether mmmmmm

Already looking forward to coming back! Yum-o

The only problem I had with this place is that they have only one sign that says "The Bird" and it's on the ground on some crappy plastic sign next to the curb. Basically if you walk by looking at the storefront you'll miss this place. The storefront only has some cat holding a sandwich in its mouth everywhere. The owner really needs to improve on the branding presence with this joint.
author: Will C.

description:
Amazing fried chicken sandwich shop and so close to my work too! S/O to my friend who took me here (if you see this review!!)

I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich with curly fries and I couldn't get through half my sandwich because it was so filling. I saved the other half for dinner so win win. The curly fries reminded me of jack-in-the-box's curly fries and they are super bomb. Try it with their homemade sriracha! The sandwich was like heaven. If you're a dark meat lover (chicken thighs, wings, drumsticks), you have found your sandwich. I'm not sure if they give out white meat in other pieces but mine was pure dark meat glory. Super juicy and tender so be ready for a food coma!
author: Tiffany E.

description: Such a great atmosphere really good music playlist spicy chicken sandwich was amazing the coleslaw was A1 and the loaded curly fries were so amazing the curly fries alone were the best curly fries I've ever had! Will definitely be back again!
author: Fabian T.

description: One word to describe this place. Serendipity!  I was actually searching Yelp for another Fried chicken place that was referred to me by someone back home in Jersey. (Yes, I'm a new Californian) However, this place popped up instead and the pics of the spicy chicken captured my attention. Let's just say the pictures did it no justice. It was absolutely amazing!  Here's the best part, It's located within two blocks from my new job here in San Fran...  #Serendipity
author: Kenneth J.

description:
All I can say is wow. Best chicken sandwich ever.  Think of these sandwiches as a chick-Fil-a sandwich on steroids.  Just amazing!  Great mix of sweet and savory breading and the special slaw.  Get the spicy sandwich.  It is not to spicy but adds a distinct contrast against the breading.  

When I return to San Francisco I will definitely return!
author: Kenneth K.

description: The best chicken sandwich I've ever had. It's spicy, it's crunchy, it's juicy and it's flippin' delicious ... and it's only eight bucks!
author: Doug V.

description:
Flat out the best lunch/deal in the city! $8 for a friggin amazing fried chicken sandwich. Normally when you get lunch downtown, you expect to drop over $10 on a "decent" sandwich, and usually you are disappointed by the skimpy amount of meat.

NOT HERE! This is a BIG piece of chicken, amazingly tasty crispy exterior, and insanely moist chicken inside. 

The bread and topping don't disappoint either. 

Add in cheap cans of beer and what else do you need.

So don't sweat the lines, and make sure this place is able to crank out more chicken so they can stay the best deal in town!
author: Rich B.

description:
Ahhh! I love this place! It reminds me of a Wes Anderson film but in the form of a restaurant, with this synthetic grass doormat when you walk in, the fox on the wall (maybe that's what reminds me of Fantastic Mr. Fox), a movie-like board with the menu items, and window and table seating. Who says you can't have fried chicken for breakfast? I got the tater tots, orange juice, and spicy chicken biscuit sandwich at 8 am. There wasn't a lot of people at that time, so it was perfect and nice and intimate inside. 

I have to say, the spices were incredible. It was a little on the makes-me-sniffle-and-tear-up, but it was pretty good. Tater tots nice and crispy as well. I felt kinda awkward because my sandwich was breaking apart on me, and crumbling so I tried my best. If I could have done it over, I probably would have ordered a second biscuit because it was a little smaller. I wish I could've come back for lunch, but I will again!
author: Lola H.

description: I heard some great things about this place and it definitely lives up to the hype! The sandwich was tender and full of flavor. The place is definitely a bit small but I can look past that. I would definitely come back again!
author: Anthony K.

description: Solid Chicken Sandwich.  House made pickles and slaw are exceptional .  Spicy is really spicy.  Those looking for sanity in their spicy may want to opt for the sharacha sauce on the plain sandwich.  Curly fries and load fries are good but not awesome.  Great pricing for downtown SF.
author: Matt R.

description: The chicken is sweet but it taste good with the homemade sriracha sauce. The cheese fries are bomb 5 stars. I like how everything is packaged for to go orders.
author: Brooke W.

description: Love their fried chicken sandwiches! Super moist and crunchy chicken. Prices are also very reasonable, especially considering The Bird's location in SF SoMA/Financial District.
author: Jackie Y.

description: Okay chicken! Very small sandwich. It's Cheap and kind of tasty. Could be busy for lunch time on weekdays.
author: Ramin A.

description: Spicy is fantastic here. Super fast service. Don't bother with the ice cream sandwich.
author: Will D.

description: Amazing chicken sandwich! The best I've had by far. The chicken sandwich was soft and juicy. The kicker was the coleslaw and the spicy sauce!
author: Rommel Q.

description: Amazing simple concept. They do one main thing (and a few accessories) but they do it really well. Very good crispy and flavorful chicken sandwich with great slaw that's slightly acidic for a good balanced flavor. Good value for the money given SF prices. A must try.
author: Diana I.

description: Great sandwich, super juicy.. got the spicy one, wasnt super spicy and added nice flavor.
author: Nishant J.

description: OMG!!!!   LOVED this place !!!   During my weekend visit I stopped by my first day and had a spicy chicken sandwich combo..  Delish and made fresh!!  Atmosphere was GREAT!!  Cashier was super personable and cute .   Such a great experience with great food I decided to have breakfast there the 3rd day!!   NOT disappointed ..  breakfast sandwiches were amazing !!!!!   Will visit again on my next visit !!!   Only disappointment was they had NO locations in Los Angeles .   Great Food..
author: Yvonne C.

description:
4 stars of chicken sandwich
1 star for the fries
3 stars for customer service

ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and fries. When I checked out yelp, they have curly fries. When my order was ready, it was just a crinkle cut fries. That's actually the reason why I went there but their chicken sandwich was massive! It was worth $8. It was spicy and delicious. The fries tasted bland. I was so caught up with the sandwich I didn't realize if the fries has salt or not. The guy who took my order was nice but he sounded insincere because he was like saying it over and over again that the emotions are totally gone.
author: Kat P.

description:
Atmosphere was great and beer selection was extensive, but the chicken sandwich and fries were not.

The chicken sandwich was just too complicated; the slaw and breading overpowered the chicken itself. Plus there wasn't much chicken, just a lot of breading and it was all very oily. A chicken sandwich should be simple and the chicken should be the main attraction, but I didn't feel like the sandwich really focused on the chicken at all. 

The fries were very oily and soggy, and didn't feel like anything special.
author: Molly L.

description: I'm a chick-fil-a  kind of gal and this chicken sandwich knocks it out of the park. Crispy, saucy, and filling. I must say the price is on the pricey side but worth it. Paid $8 buck for just a sandwich.
author: Ngan T.

description:
Everything here, except the line at lunch time, is to love!! 

I got the spicy chicken sandwich (~$8) with loaded fries(~$3).  As I approached the pick up counter, I saw the assembly line of fried chicken that's dipped in spicy sauce and being put atop the bread -- it DID look like a BIRD.  =D . 

Similar to "loaded" potato wedges, the loaded fries here have bacon bits, melted cheddar cheese, green onions, and sour cream.  

I think they do a great job packing both the sandwich and the loaded fries to go over if you're looking to take something back to your desk or home.
author: Shubhra S.

description: Went here for the first time today after work and it was great! I heard the line is crazy during lunch but around 5pm it wasn't bad. The staff were all very friendly and the food came out fast. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich and it was amazing! First of all, who doesn't love a pump full of Sriracha? Put some in your ketchup and dip the sandwich! The coleslaw is soo good and the flavor was perfect. However the piece of chicken was a little too big (I know why am I complaining), it just didn't fit the bread and was hard to eat. My boyfriend goes here often and said that's usually not the case so maybe I was lucky! Overall it's a great place for a yummy, quick, hip bite and a beer!
author: Hayley H.

description: A solid fried chicken sandwich! There is always a line out the door, so I would recommend showing up around 11:45AM. The loaded fries are good, but combined with the sandwich put me into a food coma.
author: Bryan M.

description: This place is way better than that chicken coop place!  Cheaper for a larger burger and taste way better! Fyi get that hot ice cream sandwhich dessert! It's like a donut with ice cream. Migh hate yourself after but enjoy it!
author: Beto A.

description:
Spicy Chicken Sandwich, yes please!

I've heard about this place and about it's yummy chicken sandwiches but I was never super enthused because, how good can a chicken sandwich really be?

Oh after coming here, I was so wrong. Their spicy chicken sammie was sooo good. The chicken was suuper juicy and the celery mixture with slaw, mayo, pickles, etc just made the sandwich that much better. Also, the meal came with curly fries! Double win.
 
I came here for a late lunch around 1 PM and there was no line.. and we were able to find a table right away. But I do hear it does get crowded around lunch time but that's given because of its prime location!
author: Krystal O.

description:
I just dont know about rating a place that just does 1 (ONE) dish, but this was the BEST chicken sandwich I have ever had, and at that price? no wonder why there are lines outside at lunch. I was lucky to be here around early dinner time.

hit this place, NOW!
author: Carlos L.

description: With such a high review and a lot of good hype about this place. I was super stoked to try it. While finding this place we walked right by it since there was no sign or name. We ended up just going in since we recognized the menu. Came here around 1pm on a Thursday we order and our food came out very quickly. We both got a chicken sandwich and fries. The friend chicken was hot and crispy, batter on it had in interesting flavor which I wasn't to fond of. Kind of tasted like cinnamon. As for the fries....it tasted like any other fast food curly fries place. This place in all was such a let down. For the price I'm paying for I expected more. I would of been happier going to chick fil a than this place.
author: Ysabel N.

description: The chicken sandwich was extremely bland. I couldn't even finish it. The chicken was also rubbery. The curly fries, on the other hand, were delicious. Skip the sandwich and just get the fries.
author: Serenity D.

description:
I've been a little tired of the nearby lunch options, so The Bird is a welcome addition to the FiDi/SOMA lunch scene. 

From what I understand, there's often a line out the door. However, I usually don't grab lunch until 1:45 or 2:00, and by that point, there were only two other people in line ahead of me. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich with curly fries, and my order was called out much quicker than I expected.

The good: For $8, you are getting a really huge piece of fried chicken. The slaw complements the chicken really well and balances out the fried-ness (yes, that is the technical term.)

The bad: the bun falls apart very quickly. Unless you don't mind getting super messy, expect to eat a portion of your sandwich with a knife and fork.
author: Leigh R.

description: Small portions, friends loved the chicken. Salad was average.
author: Jackie L.

description: First time going to this spot. Must say it is great, the burgers are delicious. The fried chicken was moist and the buns were delicious. No wait last time I went but it was the weekend. Only thing I didn't like we're the fries and the ranch.
author: Baltazar V.

description:
Maybe it's just me, maybe it was a slow/off day, or maybe this place is overhyped because it's a new spot and there's a lot of Elites coming in and saying it's a great place. 

It *could* just be me, and you can ignore this 2-minute Medium article read. I had the classic sandwich, curly fries, and a beer. The sandwich was huge, which justifies the price, but when I took a bite it didn't taste nowhere near what it looked like. 

Don't get me wrong this food is super photogenic so get your Likes up, however, it didn't necessarily match the reviews I've read here. It was crispy, but sharp like when you're eating Cap'n Crunch cereal and it stabs the roof of your mouth. The chicken itself was dry for me, yet some parts of it were juicy. But overall it was flavorless, so maybe I should try the spicy? Do they season the chicken here? The slaw was unique, but didn't help my chicken experience. 

The curly fries were great! No food coma here, just regret that I didn't walk around the corner for a McChicken.
author: Euzcil C.

description:
tl;dr - Essentially Chick-fil-A with a cooler vibe (and no chain-restaurant feel).

It seems there is always a line out the door during lunch but the it moves quickly (we got our food ~10 minutes after getting in line). They gave out samples of their curly fries to people waiting in line... which not surprisingly led us to ordering curly fries along with the sandwich.

Both fries and the sandwich were delicious! I got the spicy chicken sandwich. The chicken is super juicy and everything tastes fresh. There seems to be some disagreement in the reviews on whether it is THAT spicy or not. Mine was not too spicy, just a little kick. Definitely less spicy than the Chick-fil-A spicy chicken sandwich.

There are a few long tables for seating inside and a couple tables outside but when I went (weekday lunch) pretty much all seats were taken. They also have some good happy hour deals that I would come back to check out!
author: Rica Z.

description:
There are very few reasons to want to flip the bird here. 

The chicken is spicy (or not, but I think that's a rookie choice), the slaw has celery bits in it, and the line is long but shorter than you might think and very short if you bring a friend or a book or a phone with a good looking facebook feed if you are a technology slave like so many of the ilk in this neighborhood.

Tips for the business:
1) Your buns can get soggy! 
2) Your buns have been cold. 

Tips for customers:
1) I don't love the pickle. I mean I know it's supposed to be a part of the sandwich but I just don't like it in there that much. So I guess I'm in a pickle...
2) As above, get the spicy. Non-spicy fried chicken is boring and spicy fried chicken is an adventure. Who knows, I may retract this one day but that day is not this one. 
3) Do not go between noon and one. It will make all the difference.
4) Congratulate yourself for getting outside! 

I hope the neighborhood doesn't have to say Bye Bye Birdie anytime soon.
author: Maya L.

description: Lackluster chicken sandwich. Not spicy. Quickly received food once order was placed - great lunch time process to keep the line moving
author: Kim M.

description: This place has delicious Nashville-hot style chicken sandwiches for a decent price - their adult happy meals are also a great deal at $12.50 for a sandwich, fries, and a beer! I'm pretty sure I've paid $12 for a beer so the fact that this come with a delicious chicken sandwich and fries and a huge bonus. I'd give it 5 stars if it was a bit less cramped but for now it's a reliable standby.
author: Georgeann G.

description: I was so excited to try this place since there isn't a good fried chicken place near work (Embarcadero Center).  I just happen to be in the area for an appointment and decide to stop in The Bird.  I work over by the Embarcadero, otherwise this would be a bit of trek just for lunch.  I ordered to-go; chicken sandwich and Loaded Fries.  I walk back to my office, 8 blocks away, excited to eat my lunch.  I was disappointed to discover they packed regular fries.  I really hate it when I pay the extra to get the fixings yet get the basic.  The chicken itself was also lacking flavor.  I wish I had opted for the spicy version instead.  I will give them credit for the great crispness to the chicken.
author: Michelle N.

description: That was a LEGIT Fried Chicken Sando.  Moist Chicken.  Not too Greasy.  Just Spicy Enough (they have Regular for you boring people). Bun was fresh and soft.  Slaw and Pickle provided just the right amount of Acid and texture.  Not overdressed (very important).  And the Ratio (bird:bun:slaw&pickle) was on point.  And I'm a sucker for a free koozie thrown in with the Happy Meal upgrade.  I'm going to have to forget that this place is just around the corner from my office.
author: Brandon S.

description: I walked by one day during the week around 11:15 AM and did a double-take because there was no line! I made a BEE-line right back to put in my order for a fried chicken sandwich. Such friendly service, and my sandwich was ready quickly. Yeah! I took it back to the office and gnawed away at it because I was starved - loooooved it! Perfectly fried, hot, and tasty with everything on it. I can see why there is a line out the door everyday at lunch time. Their menu is simple and straightforward and will be adding more items to it shortly. Love it and I will be back soon!
author: Maile N.

description: Delicious and simple. I tried both the spicy chicken sandwich and the regular chicken sandwich. Both were incredible and flavorful. Chicken was juicy. Generous thick slices of pickles and slaw with apples. Loved the homemade sriracha sauce, though it was more like a sambal oelek, which is probably why I loved it. I also love the curly fries. Glad they went with that instead of regular fries. Good packaging for to-go, sandwiches slipped into a nice foil sleeve for insulation. Some decently priced canned beers available too. Good amount of seating for 1-2 people parties. Long line during opening and lunch times, but no lines for dinner. Great place for dinner. Friendly owner. Nice inviting space.
author: Jennifer W.

description: The breakfast biscuit belongs on the dollar menu at McDonald's.
author: Sebastian S.

description:
Fantastic chicken - juicy and succulent. Don't miss the spicy version if you're into spicy food. The salad with a half portion of spicy chicken + blue cheese is my personal favorite. Quite reasonably priced for the area. 

A good lunch spot if you don't mind waiting outside in the line for a bit. Customer service can be a little better too.
author: Aditya J.

description:
This is one of the newer food places that opened up in SoMa, which is a nice change since that rarely happens here that is walking distance from most folks' offices.

Don't let the line discourage you from going, their simplified menu of a chicken sandwich (spicy/classic), curly fries (regular/fully loaded) and an ice cream sandwich dessert makes people zoom past the cash register pretty quickly. The line was about 20 or so people out the door, and it took me about 10 minutes to get my food and go.

The chicken sandwich was really good. They used thigh meat instead of the typical chicken breast, so expect a super juicy first bite. The apple slaw they used for the sandwich also was very tasty and helped cut the greasiness of the fried chicken.

Curly fries were very good as well. If you don't want too big of a mess, I would highly recommend just getting the regular curly fries since they're still really good.

My only complaint was that since I'm a slower eater, by the time I got half way through my sandwich the bottom bun was already soggy from a combination of the apple slaw and the chicken. If there's a way to rearrange the toppings to keep the moisture towards the center, that would've really made a difference.
author: Andy H.

description: I always love a place that serves like 3 things and does them very well. This is one of those places. Perfectly seasoned chicken. Dope curly fries. No fuss, no muss. Highly recommend.
author: Amir T.

description: The chicken sandwich was pretty amazing.  It was a little greasy, but my taste buds were happy.  The chicken was very tender and had a nice crunch to it. They have their own house Sriracha sauce that you can smother on your food so if you are a fan of spicy food you may be in luck.  The lines were really long when we came here for lunch but moves a lot faster than you'd expect.  Lines were sprawling out the door and we waited about 30 minutes before we placed an order because their menu is simple and the staff makes sure we are ready to order when we reach the counter.  My main complaint is that the loaded fries aren't really worth the price tag.  A $4 order gets you a little tray with some fries and sauces+toppings on top.  It tasted pretty good but I wouldn't get it again -- especially for $4.
author: Justin L.

description: Solid option! If you want a nice chicken sandwich in San Francisco this place is clearly in the Top 5. The price is good, quality is good. Why not 5 Stars? Probably as they do not have too many options or that special touch :) but it is definitely a good spot!
author: Christian D.

description:
Delicious fried chicken sandwich! Nice and juicy on the inside, good bun and flavorful toppings. Love the housemade hot sauce (wish there was another more "Crystal like" option vs. Srriarcha). 

Would love ranch as well but beggars can't be choosers.

Only complaint is my loaded fries were pretty room temp to cold which was a bummer considering they were $4. Really wanted these to be a homerun but I know they are still working out the kinks. Will def be back and can't wait to see the added menu items!
author: Sarah A.

description: Basically fast food, but good fast food.  They have chicken already fried ready to go for sandwiches.  Chicken was still warm and juicy and the breading was crunchy and not too thick.  The slaw was good and so was the house made "sriracha." Also the selection of canned beers was great! From Hamm's to nice local craft brew - something for anyone's budget. Overall a good find and I'm sure I'll be back to try the biscuit
author: Joseph G.

description: Tad expensive for what you get but the spicy chicken sandwich was nothing short of spicybut enjoyed the coleslaw/cabbage on it.
author: Kyle H.

description:
I just ordered a chicken sandwich and an ice cream sandwich to go and paid for it with my credit card. After being called, I collected my brown bag and walked back to my office. Upon arriving, I discovered that there was no ice cream sandwich inside.

Then, I walked back to The Bird to inform the staff of the mistake. When I arrived, I informed the cashier that I was missing an ice cream sandwich. The cashier asked if I would like the ice cream sandwich to be made.

First of all, what kind of stupid question is that? Do I want the sandwich I paid for to be made? Yes, of course I do.

Second of all, the cashier proceeded to make my sandwich WITH HIS HANDS after handling cash for who knows how long WITH HIS HANDS.

I wish I could revoke the tip I gave when paying for my meal. After finally getting back to my office, my food is now cold and unappealing. I also wish I could give fewer than 1 star.

I used to frequent the bird, but not anymore. This was an awful experience. 0/10.
author: Kristian F.

description: Welcome to the neighbor The Bird.. Oh how I waited for you. I had the fried chicken sandwich with all the topping, and the loaded fried with cheese, bacon, green onion and sour cream. The sandwich was crispy and tasty seasoned just right, wish I could have put cheese in it.. LOL The coleslaw was a little much, which made the bread to soggy. Other than that I will be back to try more food items.
author: Mae D.

description:
Whoa this place was so good. The line looks long and spooky but they passed out samples of their curly fries and warmed our hungry hearts. 

I ended up getting the spicy chicken sandwich (currently 1 of the 2 sandwich options you have) and it was amazing! Obviously got those curly fries after being hooked from the sample. Really good portion size and not crazy expensive.

They also have $2 beers. :) 

Coming back for sure!
author: Kacy M.

description: We were in SF and needed a quick bite before attending a show nearby and this popped up on Yelp w solid reviews and fairly priced. It proved to be an excellent choice for a casual chicken meal, solid fried and cheap beer. Plus they give you a promotional cozy for the old can of beer to use again and again,...or remind you return for a tasty bird. The cold slaw was tangy and the bird moist and crunchy - just what this time needs beyond the many burger joints and Gastropubs w their overpriced eats. A step above the food truck and fast, tasty and fairly priced. We will be back. Bird is the Word (look it up generation Xr's)....
author: alan c.

description:
A coworker of mine alerted me to this place on opening day, so I decided I'd check it out if the line didn't look to bad. I wouldn't call myself a fried chicken sandwich aficionado; I haven't even had a fresh one from Naked Lunch.

I see that others were complaining about wait or the place still getting in a rhythm because it was new, but I didn't notice anything egregious for the first day.

Since it was opening day, there were only two things on the menu: a fried chicken sandwich (spicy, or not spicy) and curly fries (loaded or not loaded). I got a spicy fried chicken sandwich ($8) and curly fries ($2.50) coming in at $11.53 after tax.

Sandwich: Very tasty, very moist since it's chicken thigh, not a breast. Not spicy at all. Kinda small.
Fries: nothing special on their own, not much portion-wise.

Overall, it's ok. I feel like I wanted more food, especially for almost $12, and I'm a tiny guy. I sit here 2 hours after lunch feeling quite famished. I would have also wanted the spicy sandwich to have actually been spicy.
author: Tim K.

description: Decided to check this place out since it is new and we were craving something cheap and fast. The chicken sandwich sounded like a great way to satisfy both those needs and it definitely did. I opted for the spicy chicken sandwich since the cashier said it wasn't too spicy, but man it was a killer in spiciness. My friend and I both ordered spicy and it made us both sweat a bunch. There was also a lot of spice oil dripping from my sandwich, which shows how spicy it was. We decided to share a side order of curly fries, which we both thought was pretty good for fries, but nothing special about it, so I'll probably pass on the curly fries next time. The loaded curly fries have sour cream, cheese, and bacon bits on it, but neither us like sour cream so we decided not to get it. However, I'm very curious to come back and try their classic chicken sandwich to compare the taste with the spicy one.
author: Edward W.

description:
While the flavor was good, I think the rush of the crowd of being a new spot hastened the assembly of the burger, because it came to me pretty sloppy.  The fixings were sticking out all sides dripping with whatever sauce(s) they use and you pretty much need gloves to pick the thing up.  The crust on the chicken wasn't very crispy and, maybe it was all that sauce's fault, but was also coming off the meat.  Also, after biting into it the chicken breast was of different shades of color which concerned me of the cooking thoroughness.  "Spicy" is an option which I selected but don't think I received. Fortunately there's a house made sriracha that remedied that, but unfortunately that meant more sauce.
For almost doubling the price you can change your ordinary curly fries into "Loaded Fries"; 
Don't bother,  you get a dollop of sour cream that looks like it was shot putted into them from 5 feet away some chopped green onion and bacon bits which pretty much all just fell to the bottom.
They have however, much potential.  Maybe after the Techies move on to the next new thing (give it about a week) they will have the time for some of these improvements.
author: John W.

description: Wow Frisco has produced a great chicken burger place! And it was super fast. Food was done within minutes of me putting it in. The spicy fried chicken burger was awesome!
author: Silas P.

description: OMG!!  This is the new hot place in the area and understandably why!  It is opened by the same people as Super Duper.  They only make 200 sandwiches a day and they open at 11.  Best bet is to get there early and expect a line no matter what.  But it is worth it.  The menu is small - fried chicken sandwich, spicy or not, and regular or curly fries.  I ordered the spicy fried chicken sandwich and it lived up to the spice!  The curly fries were good but not memorable. I'll probably skip those calories next time.  They had a note on the menu that they will be bringing in a grilled chicken salad.  This sandwich was so delicious but will definitely need to be a every once in awhile lunch.
author: Amanda K.

description: The rise of The Bird is one of the greatest underdog stories out there. It started with an unassuming storefront on New Montgomery and in just a few months it's become one of the Fried Chicken Titans rivaled only by Naked Lunch. However, becoming Big Chicken does have its drawbacks. What was originally a fast lunch place soon became a "stand in line all lunch" place as hungry office workers began to form Disney Land level lines that left people wondering if they were waiting to ride the Matterhorn or get a dank chicken sando. I'm excited to see how The Bird copes with its newfound success and I'm happy new players are breaking up the fried chicken oligopoly. If you give less than 5 stars to The Bird you just don't get it.
author: Zaid E.

description: This place is worth the wait! I always get spicy and it's always delightful. Fries are stellar. The new beer-sandwich-fries deal is a good one. One day I'll go here just for the ice cream which I haven't had room to try yet!
author: Nikki B.

description:
Solid chicken sandwich, but could use some work. The meat had the classic southern flavor you want in a piece of fried chicken. The downside was that the chicken was rather stringy. Also, unlike many places, the chicken is not served as one breast, but as multiple pieces. Not necessarily a bad thing, but it did make it a little trickier to eat. A few tips for those not too chicken to try it:

-Line is crazy long (around a 30 minute wait at noon), so get there close to 11am. The place has only been open for 3 days now (so I can understand the wait), but they only sell 200 sandwiches per day. Make sure to save yourself some heartbreak and get there early.
-Pickles are there, but just barely- super-thinly sliced spear pickles. Do yourself a favor and ask for extra.
-Pass on the loaded fries and save $1.50 with the classic curly fries.

Place has a nice vibe- very simple layout and furnishings. Lots of places to sit and eat which was unexpected. Would definitely come back, especially once they find their groove and can manage the line a little better.
author: Cameron S.

description:
Just opened. It's either first or second day so a few logistical kinks need to be worked out. That said, this is a damn good chicken sandwich. So I'm giving 4 stars, regardless of opening madness. 

A lot of hype around this place. Ran out of sandwiches but they let me in as the last customer of the day. Phew!! Think of this as a Super Super Burger but for fried chicken - which I had an insane hankering for today. 

Food is good. Spicy chicken sandwich could have been spicier. Slaw is nice, tangy, and crunchy. Given it was opening day(s), Wait took a long time (waited 20 min for a solo sandwich vs fries, etc but they apologized for the wait). If they can guarantee it will be faster next time I'll give it another go - especially when I crave that fried goodness.
author: Alex L.

description: Prices were really reasonable for middle of the city. Great food. The image does not lie it looks like what you get and it tasks amazing.
author: Alex G.

description: Amazing juicy and spicy chicken . Being from India very few places have acceptable spice level for me ...and this place was awesome !and very warm and friendly people
author: Abhilasha S.

description: Literally the best freakin' chicken sandwich I have ever had- and I've had a lot of chicken sandwiches y'all. I get the spicy chicken sandwich and I just don't understand how they make it so good. The chicken is super moist, and adding their lil' Sriracha sauces they give you on top makes it that much better + combined with the mayo and the crunch from the vegetables. The fries are great too- albeit small portion, but nonetheless, awesome! The line at lunchtime gets wild ~12:30, but go at 1 pm and there's almost no line!
author: Srinija G.

description:
Went here for lunch and ordered a mild fried chicken sandwich and some curly fries. Some people would call the chicken flavourless if they are used to salty fried chicken, but for me it was just right. The chicken was also very juicy.  Definitely one of the best fried chicken sandwiches I've had. My only complaint with the sandwich would be the coleslaw, but that's only because I'm not a huge fan of it.

The curly fries were a let down since the portions were fairly small. This is rated as single $ on yelp, but if you are getting more than just a sandwich, expect to pay more than $10 with fries + drink.
author: Michael M.

description:
I can't believe I hadn't heard of this place until recently. Went here for lunch on a weekday and while there's usually a line out the door, it was well worth it. 

The menu is simple which is perfect bc you go to the Bird for one thing only - chicken sammy and curly fry combo. You cannot go wrong with this sandwich. 

Also, curly fries!!!! Nuff said
author: Phil C.

description: This is the financial district Naked Lunch chicken sandwich, except you don't have to walk a mile to get it! The place is turning out to be a local hit, as there are long lines during lunch everyday! The staff is nice and even will pass out some french fries to keep everyone in line happy! The sandwich was very good, with the  chicken being nice and crispy on the outside but soft and juicy on the inside! I would definitely make this my weekly lunch spot!
author: Greg B.

description:
17.02.10          1st visit

Food------------- 4
Service  3 to 3 1/2  self serve
Cleaniness      3

Pretty good chicken sandwich with a nice apple slaw.
Kinda heavy for lunch ... 

Chicken Sandwich
    Thick crust ... heavy on the calories 
    Substantial meat ... 
    Apple slaw helps balance out the richness ... a little more tart be good
    Kinda heavy sandwich to eat during lunch time ... might put you to sleep at work later

I wish they make a lighter version 
   A lighter batter
   Don't put you to sleep
   Good for ladies
author: S.K. Y.

description: Oh the Bird. The spicy chicken burger is to die for. They have maintained the quality all this time. I will recommend the Bird any time.
author: Jack W.

description:
This was my first time eating at The Bird.  I work close by but hadn't eaten here yet as I don't eat out often.  I had two items:
1. Fully Loaded fries
2. Spicy Fried chicken sandwich
My taste buds are my own, I'm not assuming my taste buds speak for everyone but, while I loved the Fully loaded fries, I did not like the chicken sandwich.  There was nothing wrong with the bread, slaw or pickles, the chicken itself didn't taste like anything except a batch of cayenne.  No salt, no flavor.  I'm guessing this was either a one time thing, or maybe I'm not built for The Bird (because the large number of positive reviews must not be wrong) but it's just not for me.  I was splurging today by eating out and really wanted to like the sandwich but was not able to.  Sorry but again, this could just be me so that's why I put a 3, you haven't earned a terrible review, not at all.  I wish you continued success.
author: Sunshine B.

description:
I have eaten here a few times.

I'm not that familiar with a lot of fried chicken sandwiches; but, this one is really good and worth standing in a short line to eat.  If you don't want to wait in line, you probably have to get there before 11:15am.

I tried both the regular and the spicy.  To make it spicy, after they fry the chicken thigh, they dunk it into their red hot sauce.  Since so far, I have only ordered take out. I like the regular versus the spicy because I don't want the spicy liquid softening the crunch of the fried chicken.

If you want your sandwich spicier, you can't get more of their hot sauce; however, they have a sriracha sauce dispenser inside.  I put some sriracha on my regular sandwich, and I get a nice crispy sandwich with a bit of heat.

I'm not a huge fun of the apples in the coleslaw; but, overall it's a really good sandwich and I'd give it 4.5 stars.  Congrats for focusing on one thing and really doing it well, and for a fair price of $8.

As previously mentioned, the curly fries really aren't that special, and nothing to write home about.

I can't wait for them to open more locations...
author: Roy C.

description: Best fried chicken sandwich I've ever had.  Howlin Rays in LA is just aight compared to The Bird.  Kudos on the dope sando.
author: Felix L.

description: Don't expect to be able to get an order in during lunch rush, but it's a short wait for dinner time. The fried chicken sandwich tasted wonderful, putting chicken sandwiches from other places to shame. The fries were nothing special however.
author: Riley M.

description: THE BEST chicken sandwich in the city!! Each time when I feel unhappy I go to this place and the spicy chick sandwich and curly fries can turn me up so quickly! The only bad side is the wait is always long but the wait truly worth it!
author: Cathy S.

description:
I'm not a fan of chicken... usually, but I really like this place so it says something. I even went a second time to confirm that I wasn't just that hungry and actually really did enjoy it. 

The first time, the line was a little longer and they passed out curly fries with their housemade sriracha. Delicious (or I was super duper hungry). I took my food to go and by the time I got to the office, the fried chicken sandwich was still crispy. Amazing. The curly fries kind of lost it's crispiness and I was pretty meh over it, but the fact that there are curly fries near me gives them a plus regardless. 

The chicken sandwich was so good. The outer batter was delicious, a little spicy, crispy... while the inside was juicy. The apple slaw was delicious since it gives the sandwich an extra crunch. I do enjoy pickles but in this case, I'm not sure which item makes the sandwich a little wet. I can live with it though. 

The second time I went, the sandwich was just as delicious. I'll be back when I can indulge in another fried chicken sandwich treat!
author: Jeannie L.

description: The Fries were over cooked and for today, I thought I would give them another try and came during lunch time at 1pm. Sign posted closed will be back at 3pm.  Guess will be going somewhere else for lunch time.
author: Andy L.

description: Best chicken sandwich I have ever had. I went with the spicy. I have recommended this to everyone I know visiting San Fran
author: Jeremy B.

description: Excellent Spicy Fried Chicken Sandwich. The best chicken sandwich we have ever had. Way better than Chick-Fil-A or other restaurant sandwiches. Small place, but the food is fantastic, so carry-out if the tables are occupied. Curly fries and Apple Fritters were also tasty, and cheap sides. Was full after eating the sandwich and fries, but still craved the taste of the Spicy Fried Chicken. Cannot wait to go back.
author: Charles C.

description: Great hot fried chicken! Long lines during lunch time, but worth the hassle. Will be my go to place when in the city.
author: Tivanka G.

description:
The dark meat chicken throws me off and I've realized that I am not a fan of dark meat fried chicken sandwiches.  Spicy chicken is SUPER spicy, it's no jack n the box There was a line and it moves fast. 

The highlight of my meal were the loaded fries!! YUM!! I would go back for those, but I'll leave the sandwich behind.
author: Jaime K.

description: Finding this place is a bit tricky as they don't have a sign with their name. They have a fox eating a sandwich outside the shop. My food was good but nothing spectacular. If still rather go to Chick-fil-A. I can see the appeal though. The slaw on the sandwich is good. I got the spicy chicken sandwich. It was good but not impressed. Quick service and clean establishment.
author: Maryen B.

description: Oh man this food is good. And the boys that work there are super nice and cute.  Quick service, low key.  Definitely worth stopping in for a sammy.
author: Audrey S.

description:
Eating their awesome sandwich and curly fries as I write this.

The line was looong, however it moved quick (5-10 mins) and they even handed out samples of their curly fries while we waited!!! AWESOME!!!

I got the sandwich with everything (good choice) along with their loaded fries (better choice). It came out to $13 which is damn near what I pay for a burrito around the corner, only The Bird was a lot better :D

Great workday lunch spot, can't wait to take everyone I know there!

PS: spicy is not that spicy - do it
author: Cole S.

description: The spicy chicken sandwich is so good. The chicken is cooked perfectly, moist and hot. The pickle, mayo, and red cabbage adds to the flavor and highlights the flavor of spicy chicken. I definitely recommend it if you like spicy chicken.
author: Belal A.

description: Holy crap!  Probably the best chicken sandwich I've ever had.  I had the fried spicy sandwich with slaw, pickles and mayo.  Their house made sriracha is incredible.  And for Frisco it was very reasonable,$12 for a sandwich and a drink.  Nice!
author: Rick K.

description: Nah brah. Off day or something but the chicken was drier than the Sahara desert. got a chicken biscuit and a chicken sando and both were awful. The biscuit was hard as rock and I had to remove the chicken to just eat the chicken. Never again.
author: Tommy n.

description: Finally visited this place to check out all the hype. First off, there is no street parking or lot for this building, which is inconvenient and such a pain! I almost gave up on searching for parking, but last minute was luckily to be able to get into a parking garage around the block (which was pricy at $8/hour). It can be tricky to spot this place from outside because they literally have no storefront sign. I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich, which is apparently pretty popular here- the chicken itself was juicy and the level of spice was perfect for me. Unfortunately, I am not a fan of pickles so the pickled veggies/onions in it killed my vibe. The loaded fries were just OK - I did appreciate the bacon bits that topped it off. I do wish there was more cheese and sauce in the sandwich, but overall the flavor was alright. I definitely need to try the ice cream sandwich next time. I get full easily so I did get pretty stuffed from my meal and didn't even attempt at dessert. There were two ice cream options today: vanilla and wild berry. I went around 6pm (post-work time) so this place did get quite crowded fairly quickly.  But, I didn't mind because I was already seated at a table.
