However, it probably would have been unlikely to get a table here if I would have gone at a later time. I would not mind going back again, but it would also not be my first choice. Overall, this place is decent for what it is.
author: Mel B.

description: Ooh boy, there's a reason this place has a massive line - and it's not just because it's lunch time. But I should start from the beginning... I heard The Bird opened fairly recently in SOMA, so I finally scheduled a lunch day with my friend to go check it out.. and we were greeted by a not-so-friendly-length line which was nevertheless full of friendly people. It was a beautiful, sunny day out though and I was in no particular rush, so it wasn't too bad. When we finally got to the front, the server was friendly and full of energy; he seemed to enjoy working there. I ordered their signature chicken sandwich since I'm always a fan of a good chicken sandwich - I got the spicy one, to be more specific, which wasn't too spicy luckily. The chicken was sooo good - crispy and fried and juicy rolled into one. The price tag wasn't too bad either, for less than $10 in SF, and it wasn't difficult to find seats for 2 despite the busy-ness since there seems to be high customer turnover :) I'm looking forward to coming back soon for another go at their chicken sandwich, and maybe nibble my way to some sides too.
author: Bianca C.

description: It is a satisfying and delicious comfort food. Once in a while, if you need to curb your appétit for fried chicken, you are in right place. And  beware, you will come out smelling like fried food, so if you need to be somewhere important or handling a delicate meeting after that, just let you know! I had spicy chicken sandwich. It is indeed spicy like 7/10 or even 7.5/10 . Curly fried was delicious too.
author: Maryam N.

description: The fried chicken sandwich and hot wings are amazing, I had visited there 4 times in 2 weeks! It'd be my 1st choice burger in SF downtown.
author: Mark T.

description: Chicken sandwich and a mt tam pale ale - amazing lunch for a steal downtown! Chicken is all the spices and flavors
author: gina p.

description:
The Bird is great if you're in the mood for some tasty loaded fries or a fried chicken sandwich in the downtown SF area. I got there about 30 minutes after they opened and luckily didn't have to wait in a super long line. 

I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich- which has a spicy initial taste with a sweet pickled aftertaste which I didn't completely love. I also got the loaded fries- which were just amazing! The service is fairly quick but as I sat and ate in the semi- small space the place got very crowded & as I walked out the line was down the block so If you're planning lunch here I suggest getting there a little before 11:30. 

Overall will definitely come back for the loaded curly fries!
author: Jocelyn P.

description: First time visit. Spicy fried chicken sandwich is REALLY spicy - maybe not for beginners. Lunch special ($12.50) gets you a fried chicken sandwich, curly fries & a can of beer (premium beer upgrades available).  Not very busy around 2 p.m. on a Friday, which is surprising because  in LA there'd be a line out the door. Highly recommended.
author: Roger J.

description:
This is my first visit to The Bird, and I have to admit: this spicy chicken sandwich is *really* good. It seems like they put a slight sweetness and maybe a bit of cinnamon into the batter, but whatever it is, it totally works. I've never had anything like it.

Oh: and the spicy here really means spicy. My head is sweating. Yet my tongue is curiously reporting few pain signals, so maybe whatever they are putting in the batter neutralizes the spice a bit.
author: Marco C.

description: The very simple menu lets these guys focus on the important stuff--their fried chicken sandwich. It's good, I enjoy it, and I continue to go back.... there's just a small part of my that thinks the coleslaw on the sandwich could be a bit better which would rocket this to a solid 5 star. Also, the line is almost never small, but that is what happens when you do good work--people want your product!
author: Peter C.

description:
I ate the best chicken sandwich a few months ago in a town I'll probably end up never visiting again (sad face), and since then I've been on the lookout for something that could possibly satiate my fried chicken sandwich cravings.

The Bird's spicy chicken sandwich comes dangerously close to The Best Chicken Sandwich I Ever Had. Soft, chewy, fluffy brioche bun stuffed with a crispy, juicy chicken and crunchy, refreshing slaw/pickles... honestly you can't complain. HOWEVER... the only complaint I have is that the chicken itself was a little dry, resulting in some tough, stringy chicken chews (no bueno). Otherwise the kick of that spice was on point -- spicy without being overpowering and still lending the chicken tons of flavor!! 

ALSO.... this place serves curly fries instead of regular fries... which is ALWAYS a plus in my book :~) 

Chicken sandwich is ~$8, fries are ~$2, so your meal ends up being ~$10!! Drink prices are great too!! Their happier hour special comes with a sandwich, fries, and a beer all for $12. AMAZING.
author: Gloria P.

description:
No line on Saturday at 11:30. We had the spicy chicken sandwich, classic chicken, loaded curly fries and the hot ice cream sandwich. Sandwiches were heavy on the bun proportion which was a bit dry. Chicken was juicy and super hot out of the dryer, but the flavor was a little off (very floral/herby) for my taste. The slaw on the sandwiches is really good. 
The ice cream sandwich is a scoop of ice cream in a hamburger bun that is toasted warm. Again too heavy on the bread. 
Still searching for a good fried chicken sandwich in the city...
author: jane c.

description:
Solid 4-stars.
I think I prefer Bakesale Betty's for my chicken sandwich fix, but getting out of the city is a hassle.  I think The Bird is a good substitute.  
I tried the spicy and got some curly fries too.  Docking a star just cause it felt heavy and too greasy--but that may be my fault for going for fries.  I think their slaw could do more work to cut the grease if they increase the acidity and put more of it on. They have a meal after 3, I think, for a sandwich, fries, and a beer for 12 dollars which would be a good deal.  
My friends and I went here for lunch as a break from the MOMA.  Good location and a cheap eat for the area.
author: Maivy N.

description:
A new fried chicken place in the FiDi.  My friend who works at Salesforce invited me there for lunch as it's right around the corner from his office and he's been hooked since the place opened.  Got there for a late lunch at 1 PM and the place was still hopping.

Got a spicy chicken sandwich and curly fries - total came to about $12.  Very good chicken sandwich - well fried, crunchy, with a good slaw.  The only thing I'll say is the spicy is not very spicy, so keep that in mind if you order the spicy version and are expecting a tingle.  Curly fries are pretty standard - nothing new or amazing about them, but perfectly well executed.

Will probably start coming back more often, as long as the lines don't get too crazy.
author: John T.

description:
I had the spicy chicken sandwich. Tasty pickle and slaw, but it wasn't spicy (at all!) and my piece of chicken was dry and a bit stringy. I added the house hot sauce, which livened things up.

At $8 it seems like good value, and I'll give it one more try to see if the dry chicken was a one-off. Probably won't go back until the buzz has died down, it isn't worth the wait.
author: Magnus B.

description: It's tasty, but the oil and cole slaw combination inside the sandwich causes it to fall apart super easily and you are left with greasy hands and soggy buns. It is ~$8 for the regular bird sandwich, which is super juicy I must say, and you can add on loaded fries or curly fries. The sandwich is a good level of spice, with pickles and cole slaw inside of it, but I wasn't wowed. I was also still left hungry after eating it. Def try it once you know, but probably won't come back again. They make their own sriracha, which is more tomato-y and sweeter than regular sriracha.
author: Y W.

description: The cole slaw is amazing and the service is super fast. I would say this is my favorite place to get a fried chicken sandwich
author: Renee R.

description: I've heard nothing but great things about this place from other folks, but I got the most violent form of food poisoning I've ever experienced (and hope that that's the worst of it). The food was delicious at the time, but not so much 3 hours later when vomiting so much that two full pickles come out of each nostril. The spicy option did not bode so well when getting sick through your nose... had to use 5 rounds of my Neti pot.
author: Haley B.

description: I tried classic and spicy with curl fries. I think it's ok if you need to eat something for quick lunch but if you looking for something healthy, definitely this is not the place that you are looking for. Also the table was too small and close to next one.
author: Irene J.

description:
Huge lines daily made me think this is a great experience.  Not so.  Dark, greasy, almost undercooked meat.  The sandwich was also overrun by the coleslaw and onion.  I ordered curly fries too, the portion was minuscule, cold, and smashed in the bag.  

The staff was cool, I really wanted to like this place, but WOW this was the worst execution of fried chicken sandwich I've had.
author: Tim W.

description:
it's good. 
so very good. i found myself walking from my hotel 2 days in a row to get here. i always got the spicy chicken sandwich and i enjoyed every bit of it.  the freshness of the slaw provided great crunch and texture. the venue itself is pretty small but i managed to always find a comfortable spot for myself. the service is very basic. you order at the counter and pick up your food when your name is called. simple, fast.
i loved this place when i was here in san fran. i can't wait to comeback. definitely on my to do list.
author: Dana M.

description: Small place and usually buzzing during lunch time filled with young professionals who are catching a quick bite to eat before they head back to work. Really fast self service and clean bathrooms.
author: Hailey H.

description:
Fried chicken sandwich was pretty good. At $8, it's a decent value. The meat is dark, so it's nice and juicy. No dry breast meat here folks. The slaw that comes on it is pairs well, with unexpected bits of apple in every other bite.

They also offer fries and beer, what's not to love.
author: J K.

description: It was good.  I ordered the spicy naked chicken.  It was juicy and flavorful, but I was not too fond of the spicy sauce.  Not because it was spicy, it was the flavor.  Their home-made sriracha was good.  A very popular place.  I would probably try it again.
author: Christopher F.

description:
One of the best fried chicken sandos I've had in a while. Yum. Crispy but tender, not too greasy, and offers a good sizeable chunk of tasty chicken for $8.

I had the spicy sando, and wow it was actually spicy! Red hot but balanced out by some excellent slaw (nice subtle bits of apple coming through) and pickles aplenty. I'll be back for more soon!
author: Ronan F.

description: The line might look long but service is quick and organized. Tried the chicken sandwich and curly fries. Chicken is crispy outside and juicy inside, bun is fluffy and the slaw adds a refreshing crunch. All delicious, def will return. Community seating is limited.
author: Dee S.

description: Chicken sandwich was awesome-both spicy and regular. Only have curly fries which kinda sucks and there is limited seating. Music was hip and current. Must try if you like chic-fil-a
author: Betty D.

description: Good flavor but they use chicken thighs come on man!!!! A chicken sandwich or biscuit has to have a breast
author: Jeremy J.

description:
This restaraunt replaced the melt location. Personally for me its not the amazing thing but its mostly tasty and different. I love the sandwhich and definately the size is worth 8 dollars. Its has a bit of sweetness. 

But Every thing else seems to have the same problems the melt had:half baked combos. What I mean is alot of these businesses dont bother making combo deals. I ended up paying 14 with soda and curly fries, but for some reason you can have the combo only with a beer.
author: Carissa F.

description: An adult happy meal! Hell to the Yes! This place is awesome! The wait was a bit much but after eating that chicken sandwich and curly fries! Dat bomb.com! Totally worth the wait! Get there early and avoid the 12pm lunch rush!
author: Kyle W.

description: Clean place, friendly service, but I didn't think the (spicy chicken) lived up to the hype. It really wasn't very spicy -- though moist enough -- and the slaw and sauce was too sloppy and overpowering flavorwise. Fries were also just average.
author: Derek M.

description: This place is amazing! It's a unique spot if you're looking to get away from a run of the mill lunch in SF. I was mainly impressed by how quickly and efficiently their staff worked. My coworkers and I arrived with a line that went so far out the door we could barely see the sign. However, it only took about 9 minutes to get to the front of the line, and less than 3 minutes to get our food after we ordered. I definitely recommend checking it out!
author: Maureen L.

description: Delicious sandwich.  The spicy chicken was hotter than I thought it'd be, but that's a good thing!
author: David G.

description:
I finally tried it! I waited until 2:00, which was a great call because at noon, forget it, the line is extra long and down the street. The line made me imagine this would be the best chicken sandwich EVER. 

You walk in and the menu is very simple. I like that. Limited choices so of course it must be the best damn sandwich you've ever had in your life.  You can get a regular chicken sandwich or a spicy one. I opted for spicy because when I make them at home,  I dump on the Franks hot sauce. How great to get the spice built in, right? The sandwich is beautiful. Very crispy and the slaw has so many colors. I also like the texture of the bread. The spice was not enough for me,  but luckily they have homemade Sriracha sauce that I could dump on mine. 

If you've ever had Bakesale Betty's fried chicken sandwich, this is presented very similarly. But sorry The Bird, Betty's is still the best in the Bay!  The chicken in Bird's was tough. I consistently couldn't take a clean bite,  because the chicken was stringy in places. Bakesale Betty's soaks theirs in buttermilk, which significantly softens the meat. I doubt they do anything like that at this spot. Secondly,  the meat wasn't flavored. Salt and pepper go a long way to add flavor before you bread it. All the seasoning seemed to be in the spiced breading. Finally,  the slaw had chunks of celery. It adds a nice crunch, but the flavor doesn't blend in cleanly,  so I think they could ditch the celery. This is my personal preference, though. The apple slaw and pickles are great. I also appreciate that they source local, free-range chicken. 

After 3pm, you can get a combo meal for $12.50 which includes the chicken sandwich, curly fries and a beer. That's pretty awesome and I'll have to come back for it. The atmosphere is clean and casual. 

Keeping in mind that my comparison is with Bakesale Betty, this spot is great for this neighborhood. It's a welcome addition and I'll definitely come back. Next time I'll try the regular sandwich. They also have a warm ice-cream sandwich. Can't wait to try that!
author: Demetri S.

description: I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich with curly fries. The sandwich was good. I wish there was more seasoning to it though. All I tasted was spice, and there wasn't that much of the slaw to break the spicy flavor. The fries were really good, no complaints there. Overall I would come again, especially if the line isn't long. Luckily when I came there was no line.
author: Ren L.

description: This place has a good fried chicken sandwich. i like the spicy fully loaded with the curly fries. The homemade slaw makes it. We ordered takeout, for a group of 8 of us. Lots of food ordered and it did not take much time. A couple of friends had the ice cream sando and enjoyed it, I will try it next time. I like the concept and menu. I will be back.
author: Sam M.

description: I love this place just a stones throw away from my office. Gives me a real good home cooked feeling and all the food selections are excellent. My favorite is the breakfast biscuits ! Staff are very friendly ! My go to breakfast place when I want peace and quiet yet be able to enjoy a nice breakfast .
author: Jeffrey A.

description: Not sure what the hype is about, chicken was cold and had lots of breading.  Decent flavor.
author: S B.

description: You come out of a bar from the financial district. You're kinda drunk. You think: Damn, friend chicken sandwich sounds good. Well, it is good. It's pretty cheap, fast, and the spicy chicken sandwich with the homemade sauce is bananas.... pure bananas...
author: Shounak C.

description: Great little lunch place in San Fran. Simple counter service with a friendly staff. Sandwich was great.
author: Morgan A.

description:
tl;dr: totally solid place you won't be disappointed by, but it also probably won't be top 5 places you've been.

Experience: Showed up around 1 (to avoid the normal lines around noon for anywhere around here) and was presently surprised by how fast the little bit of line that was there went. Actually getting the food took a little longer than expected (but I think I came after a huge order). I had trouble actually hearing my name when they called it because the place was fairly full and therefore noisy, but appreciate them using names instead of numbers for a much more personal feel.

Food: I totally recommend the spicy sandwich (not really spicy). The apples in the slaw on the sandwich are a brilliant bit of diversity in flavor. The loaded fries are really good, but I am not sure they are worth getting again over the regular fries (definitely try them). Didn't try any of the beers they have, but they all looked fairly standard.
author: Cameron C.

description: definitely come here once a month - so good!! affordable fried chicken. even the breakfast one is so good! and the hot icecream sandwich is a++
author: Elisa L.

description: Hard to find the place but glad I did! Thank goodness they placed the apple fritters right up front. Omg...they were delicious and I do not even like desserts.  The chicken was really good but a little dry on the outside. Definitely needed extra Sriracha.  The slaw is an excellent compliment, I just wished they gave me more. Salad was great too but it definitely needed an extra dressing.
author: DJ L.

description: Overall, this is a solid chicken sandwich.  The line at the restaurant moves very quickly, and it's always easy to find seating.  Nice touch to have cans of local beer available!  My only complaint was that the chicken itself was a little stringy, but I think that's pretty typical when it comes to deep-frying chicken thighs.
author: Kristin K.

description: 2nd time here and I'm honestly not impressed. I got the Naked Chicken...I thought it was a chicken sandwich but without all the extra stuff, well it came with nothing...what I got were a few pieces of chicken cut up. They should have specified that but ok, maybe I should have asked. The chicken itself was terrible. Dark meat, was spongy and full of fat. Yuck! The spicy flavor was so spicy it was impossible to eat and it was drenched in grease. YUCK! Never coming back!
author: Venus T.

description: Fresh ingredients and a small "to the point" menu make  this a great place for lunch.  The ordering line moves fast.  Spicy chicken has just the right amount of kick and fresh curly fries are tasty.
author: Matt H.

description: YUM! YUM! YUM!! What can I say.. the best Fried chicken sandwiches are here!!  Great service, clean restaurant and delicious food. Love it !!! :)
author: Nancy A.

description: This maybe the best chicken sandwich I have had in my life. Please get the spicy one with curly fries ! The flavoring was just perfect. The "theory of diminishing marginal utility" did not apply on this sandwich  every bite was glorious ! I shall return ! It was buzzing during lunch so get there early to get a seat.
author: Amit T.

description: Yum! Simple and perfect balance of flavors and texture!must have for sure!i took to go and it was done super fast! Best part is that ate the sandwich 30 minutes after it was made and chicken still had its crispiness and wasn't soggy.
author: Adele A.

description: Awesome spicy fried chicken plus really fast service. This is a favorite lunch spot of mine.
author: Gesly G.

description: The spicy chicken sandwich was delicious. Right amount of kick to it. Slaw was fresh and paired well with the chicken. Nice atmosphere.
author: Asha L.

description: When I had seen The Bird on Yelp, I had come for a good Fried Chicken sandwich. I came in and got a great, friendly, homey atmosphere and the one of the best combinations of flavors I have had in a while. The Fried Chicken Sandwich and Fully Loaded fries, with a cold drink of your choice will be one of your best meals if you like things fried, cheesy, and savory. The menu is small but that no deteriment. You get what you ask for, and you get it well made
author: Tairen P.

description: Really good sandwich. I only got the spicy chicken sandwich, but it was so filling I could barely finish it. It can get crowded at lunch time, but the turnover is pretty fast.
author: Sam G.

description: Amazing flavor, simple, soul food. Got a spicy chicken and curly fries. Probably one of the best things I've ate recently
author: Sugi s.

description: Not a fan of fried chicken for lunch but 9/10 would come back for the salad. Have heard nothing but good things about this joint.
author: K. W.

description: The sandwich I had was out of this world!  They are a little far, but worth the walk.  The line is out the door, but once you are in they are pretty quick.
author: Casandra B.

description: It's clear from all the reviews the chicken sandwich is excellent.  What's not clear is the attention to customer service.  While waiting for my order at the height of the lunch rush, literally 20 folks grabbed their to-go orders without a simple "thank you" to the expeditor.  Hate stereotyping entitled tech millennials; but apparently, saying thank you is a lost art.  Well, thank you The Bird, for working so hard to make sure all our orders are right and for asking and making sure everyone waiting was taken care of.  Next person that does not say thank you when grabbing their food, just give them The Bird.
author: Carson L.

description: I'm a huge fan of fried chicken so this place definitely caught my attention. It's a small spot, easy to miss. The wait was very quick and the food came out quickly as well. The spicy chicken sandwich was incredible, I'd highly recommend it. Will most definitely be back!
author: Juan C.

description: This place has very simple foods but really good quality. Love the breakfast foods and lunch sandwiches that is why this place is always super busy
author: John L.

description: Saw about 25 fellas standing in line out the door so I joined them.  Got the classic sandwich.  Fantastic.  Fried but not greasy.  Pickle, cole slaw, great flavors.  Go get one!
author: Rick R.

description: Small menu with great fries and pretty good chicken ("Is that... Cinnamon?"). If give it a 3.5 if I could, so not bad, but just not the game change I was hoping for.
author: Chris W.

description:
Was ok, the chicken needed seasoning but it was nice and crispy.  
Staff really needed to pay attention to cleaning the tables all were dirty and staff was just standing around.  No one wants to sit at a dirty table.
author: Lydia E.

description: Yep, the chicken sandwich is as amazing and juicy and delicious as everyone says. The loaded fries are great, more than enough for 2 people.
author: Peter C.

description: Crazy good, the options are pretty straightforward their main chicken sandwich I assume is their best seller is superb in taste and juiciness. I also had their ice cream sandwich, very delicious.
author: Alfredo N.

description: Great lunch spot, just make sure to arrive before or after the lunch rush or you may experience a bit of a wait. I would personally recommend their spicy chicken sandwich option.
author: Austin R.

description: Went there for lunch today with friends..... wow the line was pretty long ... so popular already... but the line moved faster than expected.. i think we got our food in about 15 -17 mins..... I got the spicy fried chicken sandwich (without mayo) and I liked it... it was gooooood and it was big just for 8 bucks, I couldn't finish all tho... I think it was little oily but of course coz it deep fried lol... I think my friends loved it more than I did lol... they will probably give 5 stars to this place ... I also got the fully loaded curly fires and i loved it ... it was yummyyy .........
author: Subodhani M.

description: This place is awesome! Best chicken sandwich I ever had. They have coleslaw on it, I don't even really like coleslaw but this was fantastic. They also have a house made siracha that is amazing. The prices are good too and they have a solid beer selection. I love this place!
author: Alex K.

description: A huge delicious fried chicken sandwich for under $10 in the financial district deserves 5 stars!  Go for the spicy fried chicken.  Chicken is dark meat which the only way to go.  All fried chicken should be dark meat.  Tastier and moister than white meat in my opinion.  No lines at 11am so go early to avoid waiting for too long.
author: Anna C.

description:
Review for the Fried Chicken Sandwich (Spicy):

Food:
The Bird has one of the better fried chicken sandwiches I have had in SF.  The chicken is extremely juicy and tender, it's not at all greasy or oily, and the bread is soft.  The portion is a perfect lunch-size portion so that I don't feel like I just ate a brick and need a nap.  The sandwich is also very well constructed so as to not be messy.

Price:
The best part of this is the price point.  The Bird now falls into the extremely select group of lunch spots in the area that give a quality lunch for under $10.

Atmosphere:
The staff seems to care quite a lot about how the customers are enjoying the food (which is always a great sign).  There is definitely room to sit and eat-in, but taking the food to-go is just as easy.

Will absolutely be coming here regularly for lunch.
author: Cody C.

description: Great egg breakfast sandwich on a yummy biscuit! Love the little hash brown things, the apple fritters and the friendly service. :-)
author: Joy R.

description: Country style chicken sandwiches and beer. What else would eat for lunch  I recommend the spicy   chicken with coleslaw on the side with extra pickles...
author: Reynold M.

description: The bird makes the best chicken sandwiches. Classic or spicy, both are very good. Whatever they're doing to that chicken, they're doing it right. It's often my goto lunch spot, and I'm never disappointed. The line can be long at lunchtime, but they crank through it quickly.
author: Dan P.

description: Solid fried chicken sammies at a decent price. I'll have to come back next time for a chicken biscuit breakfast joint. Line was long, but only took 10-15 from when I jumped in line. It's a heavy sandwich, so I'd come back for lunch if I know my workload isn't too taxing lol.
author: Eduardo R.

description: My first time in San Fran I was taken to this little place kinda off of the beaten path. Glad i didnt miss out on this experience food was great.
author: Jay J.

description:
Hands down best spicy chicken sandwich anywhere. Go ahead, name a better one. 

Nice, clean, hip spot with super friendly service and nice beer selection. Great work-lunch or after-hrs spot for a quick bite
author: Ryan H.

description: Short work trip so I stopped in for a quick meal.  Got the happier meal and upgraded the beer to a good IPA for $1.  All told less than $15 for fries, spicy chicken sandwich and beer.  Plenty of food, the spicy chicken sandwich was perfect and the place has a good vibe too.  Highly recommend if you need really good comfort food.
author: Kevin C.

description: Best Burger Place for chicken burgers in the FiDi! Usually a huge line for lunch, so come early (the line is shorter at around 11.30). The fully loaded fries are amazing as well. And take the spicy sandwich (it's not that spicy).
author: Ben C.

description: The spicy chicken sandwich is really good. There is often a line. You get your food pretty quickly after you order. There is a much shorter wait at 1:30pm. The loaded fries are good.
author: Karl K.

description: place is legit. had a breakfast sandwich, which was a classic sausage cheese and egg biscuit, but it was REAL. and it had some kinda wasabi infused cheese. their apple fritters-- inspired. want to try everything on the menu. even their slaw salad looks legit. how is SF so good at southern food?
author: Matt J.

description: Delicious chicken sandwich! I tried their spicy version and let me tell you, my lips were burning all the way to the Cliffhouse after enjoying the meal! I don't like the area much just because of the traffic, took much too long to get there and parking isn't a breeze of course. I will definitely return... Very juicy chicken and the best way to describe it is with the title: tasted like a bird! A bit hard to find for newbies... It can be easy to miss because their sign is on a placard outside the door, so be warned. But definitely a must try!
author: Jules S.

description: This place is a winner! The menu is simple and straight to the point: fried chicken sandwiches, curly fries and beer.  The chicken sandwich comes topped with a wonderful bright and crunchy slaw that cuts through the deliciously moist fried chicken meat.  I had the spicy sandwich and the level of spice was *just* right, you could taste the heat but it wasn't overpowering at all. I really enjoyed my meal and would go back.
author: Enzo'nShanaynay Y.

description: The Bird is definitely my favorite place to get breakfast before work. It left me extremely satisfied, I ate a bacon & egg biscuit, hash brown bites with the house sriracha & the Apple fritter bites to top it off. I could eat the breakfast here all day every day.
author: Andy M.

description: There's nothing else in the city that reminds me better of the chicken sandwiches I used to get when I was little. Their curly fries is killer too. #1 on my list!
author: Francesca L.

description: The Bird does Fried Chicken sandwiches, either "Original" or spicy. Go with spicy, which is delicious. Original is a little bland and lacks a good sauce. Beer is just a dollar extra if you get a sandwich and fries. Unfortunately, I have not been able to get a beer when I've gone and a cup for water is a tiny tiny cup that makes you think really?!
author: Michael D.

description:
SF, thanks for bringing us The Bird. A thousand, million Thank You's. This is the BEST chicken sandwich I ever had in my life! Crispy, juicy, chicken with tart coleslaw sandwiched in between to cut through the delicious grease. 

Chick-a-fil-what? KFC-who? Ew, never again. Get "The Coop" outta of here! The Bird reigns supreme if it were to duke it out with any of these -- Iron Chef style. For all those peeps who rate it under 4, you don't deserve The Bird, but you deserve thee bird, the finger form kind.
*wink*
*smiley face"
author: Loan L.

description: Best spicy chicken sandwiches (spicy as in chili hot) if you like spicy. I think they use legs/thighs meat for the sandwich patty as opposed to breast meat so that makes it more juicy. Pickup service is fast but during weekday lunch time there's a long line of people. Inside and outside seating is very limited so pick up is usually the best option.
author: R A.

description: This place is mediocre. The quality of food was meh, and the sandwich had a strange blend of flavors that didn't harmonize well. It's not an awful restaurant, but the flavors alone lead me to believe I probably won't be going back.
author: Daniel H.

description: the best fried chicken i've eaten since i lived in the south can be found here and i am so thankful for this place, its hours which include being open on weekends, and.... the owner for providing us with their delicious food at a great amazing price. i love u for real.
author: Yves D.

description: The bird, is THE place to be if you want an unforgettable chicken sandwich experience. Be aware because since the sandwiches are so good you will probably have to wait at least 15 minutes in a line just to order but it is definitely worth it. The flavors in the spicy chicken sandwich were just perfect to me. All my friends said it was too spicy for them so people with a low spice tolerance should probably order the regular sandwich. You can probably get full on just the sandwich itself. I ordered loaded fries but they were kind of small and not really worth the price in my opinion. If you think chick-fil-a sandwiches are good you have to go here because they do not even compare and you will wish they had one of these on every street corner.
author: Itzak H.

description: Really good different flavor from traditional chicken sandwich shops  loved the apple cold slaw on it   If you like it really spicy just add siracha the spicy bird cause it was not hot enough for me ! I have the vanilla and sour cherry Ice cream sandwich it was a different spin as the bread was an actual bun the bun was sweet and soft i would of liked more icecrean in the center but it was good different feel I enjoyed.
author: Nora D.

description:
I decided to try this place based on a co-worker's recommendation. She's known this place to be a hit or miss. I was excited simply because I was craving a good fried chicken sandwich 

Firstly, the line is crazy long, I went around 12:30 for lunch. You'll be in line for a bit. There's plenty of space to sit though, so that's good

I ordered the spicy fried chicken sandwich, with loaded curly fries. I couldn't help myself, the loaded fries looked good. First thing I notice when I'm standing in line is that they've got a stack of already fried chicken cutlets sitting, drying... I was concerned because everybody knows you don't stack fried things on each other because it's hot and steamy and that makes the fry soggy... another thing is that, for the spicy they dunk it in a sauce and then let dry, stacked on each other... so my immediate thought was like it's gonna be soggy when I get my sandwich. Food comes fast. The sandwich is huge, it's a big fried chicken cutlet with a slaw... I was correct in that it was a little soggy, I didn't get a nice crunch, but it had a lot of flavor. It's honestly not spicy, more sweet and tangy if anything. I enjoyed it though. The meat was juicy not dry, it had a nice flavor, paired with loaded fries... yum. It's a lot of food so after that I felt like sleeping haha. Would I do it again? Sure... but I would go when it's hella busy so you know for sure the chicken isn't just sitting there getting soggy...
author: josephine v.

description: This best place for chicken sandwich. The chicken is cooked really well. The sandwich is big enough to make you full for rest of the day. There curly fries are good also. Decent price for sandwich. Will come back to this place again.
author: Deep S.

description: Ordered the spicy chicken sandwich with a side of loaded fries. The slaw is lacking and doesn't add much to the sandwich. Was the sandwich even that spicy? Because I'm a chicken when it comes to spicy and I hardly tasted it. The actual chicken was decent, but the size was unexpectedly small. Fries were warm, the cheese didn't even melt though...
author: Liliana P.

description: Meh.  I got the basic fried chicken sandwich.  Fried batter had a flavor that was a bit off.   I came in around 1:30, and fries were bottom of the barrel and they literally gave me a few scraps instead of what should have been a full order.
author: Amy B.

description: Maybe I don't get it. The Bird is not somewhere I'd go back. My husband liked his meal, but I found the spicy chicken sandwich messy, fatty (maybe I got a bad piece), and flavorless. Texture of the fried exterior was good but the flavor wasn't something I'd call spicy. Curly fries and loaded curly fries were fine. I found the atmosphere lacking - just because it's small doesn't mean it has to be 80 degrees inside. The seating leaves no elbow room. The water isn't cold. The beers are $4. Wasn't my thing I guess.
author: Heather S.

description: We trekked down to the city expressly for this chicken sandwich. Worth it? Yes, worth the drive, the awful downtown traffic, and the time, and the parking hassle, and the waiting in line . . . it felt like a pilgrimage, and all for an $8 sandwich. Hands down the absolute tastiest, freshest, best heavenly fried chicken sandwich ever. I have NEVER in my life finished an entire sandwich; I usually cut it into a half, 1/3, or 1/4. But I sheepishly and defiantly admit that I ate the whole thing, every single morsel and crumb. The bun: baked in the morning, flaky and with a bit of crunch. The chicken super moist meat and fried with panache--not a whit greasy with the perfect breading. I got the "plain" and my husband got the "spicy," which he loved. It comes piled high with red cabbage and tangy apple cole-slaw, an incredible mix of crunch and almost acts as a palate cleanser between bites. The bun's smeared with a bit of light mayo and 2 criss-cross pickle slices, which I took out, because I wanted the chicken experience with purity. Boy did I ever get in a zone with this sandwich--it felt like an intimate relationship. They only have curly fries, which I detest, and wish they had the regular . . . but frankly, who cares, cuz they do one thing and they do it better than anyone else. This is the benchmark for all other fried chicken sandwiches, and no other can live up to it. The price is more than right and reasonable for the quality and outstanding, astonishing flavor burst. It's a no frills interior and ambience, with aluminum stools and high chairs, wooden tables, order at the counter and pick-up. I kid you not, no joke: we order and turn around--in less than 30 seconds, we hear our name called and our entire order is ready! You'd think they had the stuff pre-made, right? Wrong. I peeked at the back of the kitchen, where this guy is flipping chicken with all the speed and fury of a pro, fresh off the griddle--turnover as high as any.  I'd make the drive in a heartbeat for this.
author: Ranjan P.

description: This place only serves one entree for now, their delicious chicken sandwich along with a few options for sides and drinks and desserts. Lunchtime line can get long but the wait isn't too long. Although I haven't had an amazing chicken sandwich to compare their sandwich too, i don't count Chick Fil A or Jack in the Box lol, The Bird's sandwich was good to the last bite! You can taste the work put into the sandwich. And it's the perfect crisp, not soggy after a while. I didn't get to eat my sandwich right away so I was surprised to see it still deliciously crisp. House made slaw, buttery breaded & fried chicken with fixin's and the perfect bun that hold it all together. I ordered a side of curly fries and they go pleasingly well with the sandwich. They have an option to get them loaded with sauce and bacon as well. There's a disclaimer on their menu that more items will be coming soon and I can't want to see what they have in store. Their Chicken Sandwich is as solid as one can get!
author: Rehana K.

description: Best chicken sandwich in SF. Hands down. Walking blocks from my office, standing in line, bending my diet - it's all worth it everytime for the taste of the Bird's famous sandwich. Stuffed with the own housemade slaw and fresh rolls paired with one of the best spice blends I've tasted on a piece of fried chicken... it's a weekly (or more) ritual that never gets old. Thanks y'all!
author: Brett Y.

description: This place is alright, the ingredients and everything is good and so is the service. But the batter sucks, it's sweet and tastes weird. It tastes like a waffle. The regular chicken sandwich is far too sweet and the spicy isn't spicy enough to mask the sweetness of the batter. If the batter was just regular fried chicken batter I'd spend obscene amounts of money here. The curly fries are good. But the batter is just too sweet
author: A C.

description: It's a great tasting and very filling chicken sandwich with a great amount of flavor coming from the seasoning and toppings. Some of my coworkers thought the spicy chicken was a little too spicy though. The curly fries are bad - would not recommend it. It was too soft/limp and very bland.
author: John E.

description: FAN TASTIC! I don't do cheat meals often, but when I do, I will definitely come here again! Prices are affordable and the menu is super simple, which makes it easy to order. A must try
author: David C.

description: Perfect 5/7, friend chicken sandwiches are flawless, especially the spicy.  They have tall boys of Colt 45 as well, which is amazing.  Simple idea with good execution, it's only flaw being that it is so good that there's always a line.
author: Kyle W.

description: Tasty chicken sandwich but spicy version is tame compared to other joints I've visited.  Next time I go I'll ask if they offer levels of spicy.  The chicken was tender and the accompanying slaw (on sandwich) offered a good crunch.  For an 8 dollar sandwich that touts local chicken in downtown SF you can't go wrong here.
author: Eric N.

description: The Bird was such a great find. The line can be a bit long (similar to Bakesale Betty) but it moves quickly. I was a total fat kid this day, I had the spicy chicken sandwich, loaded curly fries and beer. I was in heaven, almost. I wish they used chicken breast meat instead of chicken thighs.
author: Lea W.

description: Flavor flavor flavor! So sad I don't live in SF so I can make this a regular haunt. Line moves quickly and the layers of texture -- spicy and sweet -- crunchy and soft -- are just heavenly. Don't miss the chicken on a biscuit too. Doesn't come with the fab apple slaw but it is big treat. Run do not walk to this place. Didn't taste the fries but everyone else was ordering them.
author: J S.

description: Very nice. Almost no wait - we were in and out in 5 minutes. The sandwiches are not for the faint of heart - huge. Fried chicken is tasty and I like the slaw that it comes with. Bread is delicious.
author: Anne M.

description: I think I overhyped this place for myself too much before I even tried their food. I got the spicy chicken sandwich, spice was solid on the breading but my chicken wasn't fresh off the fryer hot ykno? I loved that the buns were barely holding the chicken sandwich together. Also love the pickles! Definitely wouldn't be able to afford eating here all the time for lunch, but I'll try again another time hopefully served a hot sandwich instead.
author: Kaileen S.

description: Had the spicy chicken sandwich. It was good but I felt the spices where a little too much. Especially, five spice powder was too strong. I got skimped out on the curly fries as well.
author: Larry L.

description: I ordered the spicy chicken sandwich. I was expecting something spectacular, but that wasn't the case. The chicken was not particularly moist, the breading seemed a bit overcooked, and the topping, while very fresh, was too sweet for me. On a positive note, while there was a line out the door, it moved very quickly. I'll go back to try the chicken biscuit.
author: Hools W.

description: Stopped by for lunch today and the spicy chicken sandwich is amazing. Long line out the door but it moves relatively fast.
author: Charley K.

description: Thank you, Yelpers!!! I went here after looking for an "inexpensive" lunch place in FiDi. I went early (11:30ish) because I was worried about having to wait in a super long line and I'm glad I did because when I left the line was out the door a few feet. The only problem I had was choosing between spicy and regular - I went with spicy and I'm glad I did! The spice wasn't really spicy; I would call it flavorful. The slaw and pickle were delish too! Great balance. I also got an order of fries which it turns out I didn't need because the sandwich was definitely filling enough but I'm glad I did. They too were great! Super crispy outside with a soft inside. YUM!!! The other plus was that my order was ready within minutes! I can't wait to go back!
author: Betty D.

description: I wasn't going to review this place, but Yelp sent me a reminder to because I found this place using the app. I had a pretty terrible experience here. I watched them give great service to everyone around me, and I'm not sure why I was singled out for poor service. Maybe I don't look like the clientele they're used to (thanks gentrification)? On 4/28, I ordered the happier meal (sandwich + fries + beer), and asked the cashier which beer I could choose because it wasn't listed clearly on the menu. He told me I could choose whatever I liked, and I completed the transaction. When my food was ready it was missing fries. I mentioned this to a man standing at the counter, and he accused me of lying about what I ordered. It turns out the cashier rang me up for something I didn't order, but the total cost was about the same as the happier meal (or should I call it the saddest gentrified chicken meal) give or take a few cents. I told them to just give me the fries that should have come with my meal, but they refused. You would think that after falsely accusing someone of lying, one would want to turn the situation around, but no. I ended up just asking for a refund and went elsewhere.
author: Kim G.

description:
Best chicken sandwich I've had.

I also got the loaded fries, which were curly fries, cheese, bacon, green onions, and sour cream. Those were pretty good too.
author: Enoch L.

description: best fried chicken sandwich I've ever had - the pickles and slaw were on point. chicken was juicy on the inside, perfectly crispy on the outside. definitely will be returning and will try the spicy next time!
author: Kristina L.

description: Loved it. Fried chicken Sammie and a ballast point! Oh perfect!! Great little location, tight squeeze in there but friendly atmosphere.
author: Speed Patrick P.

description: Delicious southern soul food. Choose btw a classic or spicy chicken burger with curly fries. Lunch place.
author: Christina J.

description: Damn good breakfast sandwich, cool vibes, decent prices on food and cheap beer. Will def come back to scratch that chicken and biscuit itch.
author: Patrick C.

description: Great fried chicken burger -- spicy and crunchy, but pretty expensive for what it is. Loaded fries were average. Small portion size for the price and not better than what you'd get at a chain restaurant. (And not a negative, but heads up that you're getting thin cut fries).
author: Steven C.

description: Great for a quick bite. Chicken biscuit was the right size for me, a soft fluffy biscuit with tender chicken inside.  I did have a small bone fragment in my chicken but I caught it so that's ok.  We also got the classic chicken sandwich and the apple fritters (3/$1.50) to munch on before the sandwiches were ready.
author: C C.

description: I am not trying to be overly critical but I honestly don't understand the hype behind this place. Speaking about purely the food, chik-fil-a is much better with cheaper sandwiches and simpler flavors. The spicy chicken sandwich I had was overly zesty and difficult to eat, especially with the acidity from the pickle and coleslaw. The loaded curly fries were decent but nothing special.  Would prefer waffle fries from chik-fil-A.
author: Daniel L.

description: I like the spicy fried chicken and curly fries. It is spicy enough for me that I haven't eaten in any sandwiches restaurants before.
author: Chelsea C.

description: Very good fried chicken sandwich. Be careful because this sandwich is big enough for two people, but you'll want to eat the whole thing! The line was long but moved very quickly, so it wasn't a problem to go here on a lunch break.
author: Brian A.

description: Spicy chicken is great- a good balance of spice, flavor and heat. The cinnamon adds a unique complexity that is worth a return visit. I opted out of the curly fries after being scarred by Arbys back in the day.
author: Rex L.

description:
Wow.

They want me to write more but you really don't need anymore information than that.
author: Hannah R.

description: Not quite sure what all the fuss is about with this place, the "spicy" chicken sandwich wasn't very spicy.  I guess I am used to spicy southern chicken though.  What we really did like was the eclectic beer selection - I haven't seen Olympia beer in years! Props to them for finding it!
author: Cody R.

description: Wow, what a find. This place is awesome - stumbled upon it when I was jonesing for some fried chicken and they delivered (and by that I mean I ate it there and it was delicious). Went for The Happier Meal: 15 bucks for an IPA, sandwich and fries. A little spicy for me since I went against my skin color and got the spicy version but damn was it good, and big. Will be back!
author: Jonny B.

description: Not bad, not great. The celery slaw is a good complement for the spicy chicken...but overall, don't see myself going out of my way for this again...
author: Derek A.

description:
I'm glad there is this new lunch option in the SOMA. I was getting tired of the standard fare (we all know there are hundreds of places to eat, but not all are good or even up to standard, or the others are just out of the price range of a decent lunch). Now that the Bird opened, I love it. Its like having an alternative to that fast food chicken sandwich place that isn't allowed in SF. The sandwich itself was extremely crispy, the bun was fluffy and perfect. What I could live without was the grease that was permeating from the sandwich, it looked like a hot chili oil. It made me feel a little grossed out. Also I think the mayo was a little heavy for my taste, and I love mayo. I think next time I'll say no mayo and probably try the regular sandwich. For 8 dollars though, this isn't a bad place to have lunch. I would go back again. 
1 - 10.
Sandwich = 8
Fries = 4
Service = 6 (they got my  name wrong and didn't correct it even though they saw it was wrong. So when they called my "name", I didn't respond. Maybe they are trying to be Starbucks?)
Cleanliness = 9
author: Daniel L.

description: Pretty good for being so new. I do agree that the spicy chicken sandwich needs a bit more oomph, but overall I was pleased. I look forward to seeing them improve over time!
author: Grant S.

description: This place is the bomb! You get a great chicken  sandwich with a load of Garnish that is so tasty do you want to return the next day for another. Seating is a little tight and you share tables but it's a fun restaurant and I would definitely return.
author: david m.

description: Great lunch spot if you're in the city. The menu is really easy to choose from but seating is limited so be sure to come early. Get the spicy chicken sandwich! It's crunchy, spicy, sweet, and tangy (from the slaw) all in one! Personally, I'm not a fan of the fully load fries because they become soggy under all the toppings.
author: Thao T.

description:
Hands down one of the best Fried Chicken Sandwich I ever had. Especially the spicy version. Right amount of kick and that slaw in the sandwich was awesome!. Yes its little bit too oily, but guess what its fried chicken. and yes it was dark meat chicken.  
    Another thing I liked , Simplest Menu. No million options to customize and they were fast in such a busy time. because they have simplest menu.
author: Rajesh S.

description: Sandwich was disgusting! Especially that Apple crap. Chicken was salty but juicy. Won't buy here again. The price was decent and sandwich was a good size.
author: Charletta S.

description:
amazing chicken sandwiches 
fatest lunch service that i have seen...you can be in and out in 20 mins.
author: Vish E.

description: Disgusting. My fried "chicken" sandwich was 90% deep fried fat and 10% dark meat. The foil bag this came in would have made a better lunch. One of the worst dining experiences I've had in a long time...
author: Dan K.

description: Small menu, which I like. No beef or pork, which I love. The sandwich was good, not great. It's something about the breading on the chicken...old oil to fry it maybe?  And I got the spicy sandwich and it didn't bring the heat at all. The best part was the curly fries!  Who doesn't love those?  Note: beer is in a can, not on tap.
author: Kelly D.

description: Sandwiches are tasty and portion is well worth $8.00. Would prefer another option than the curly fries.
author: hd r.

description: Best chicken sandwich in SF. Way better than the other places like little skillet, marlowe and etc. Make sure to get the sandwich without the slaw. The slaw is sweet and makes the sandwich taste weird.
author: Yi W.

description: This restaurant was a nice surprise. They have a great value meal, the happiest meal. Fries, sandwich and a beer for $13 and you can pay to upgrade to a better beer (I think it was just Hamms and colors included in the price). The spicy sandwich was the perfect spicy. The thin parts of the chicken was a little dry but everything else was super juicy. The chicken serving is super generous. Overall really good.
author: Britany W.

description: Tried this place for the first time, and I gotta say, the chicken was good, but the slaw ruined it for me. It would have 5 stars if the sandwich wasn't too heavy on the slaw. It was good, not great.
author: Jacob S.

description: I ordered the chicken sandwich, curly fries, and beer deal. I got my sandwich spicy and upgraded my beer. This was seriously the best chicken sandwich I've ever had. They do a spicy slightly sweet sauce on the chicken, bomb!! They put pickles, mayo, and slaw on the sandwich. The slaw has a sweet pickle flavor that really compliments the chicken. The curly fries were crispy and flavorful, omg so good.
author: Leah V.

description:
I thought The Bird was a solid lunch spot and will definitely come back. We went before 11:00 on a weekday, which was a good idea as there was no line and seats available. By the time we left, though, there was a line and almost no seats!

Tried the classic chicken sandwich and curly fries and both were great choices.
author: K. D.

description: Had a great brunch here on a Saturday morning. Great atmosphere. The food was very tasty, with a lot of specials on the board when you walk in.
author: Remy M.

description: We must have gotten to the restaurant a bit before noon so there was not a line which was great because we were very hungry. we ordered the spicy chicken sandwich with curly fries. I don't know what kind of sauce they use but it is amazing and the house made cold slaw complements the sandwich very well and I dislike cold slaw. I especially loved the hip hop they played (Mos Def) that was a bonus for me. next time I am in SF I will try this place again.
author: M R.

description: Best chicken burger hands down. A bit on the greasy side so it's not for the diet days. The slaw on the burger was amazing and the chicken is juicy and well flavoured. Can't wait to return but will bring friends :)
author: Yan Z.

description: Surprised that this place was not just a hipster trap trying to bring in the millennial crowd. The chicken is very crispy on the outside and tender on the inside and very true to its flavor. They don't offer too many condiments but I think it's to make sure you don't meee it up. Eat it and enjoy
author: Paul J.

description:
The line was over 35 deep after I got my sandwich! Maybe 40 people but over 35 for sure after 12pm! 

The chicken is moist and tender and juicy and the pickles and slaw are just plain awesome. Delicious!!!!!!  

The customer service is really good too and everyone there is respectful and they seem to enjoy their jobs even though it is very freakin busy.

The only negative is waiting in line next to some techie douche and his 3 or 4 friends/co workers. Besides that, the whole transaction went smooth from ordering to waiting for the food,

A classic or spicy chicken sandwich will set you back 8 bucks and curly fries are 2.50 and you need to try those or the loaded fries omg.

The manager will come out and give curly fries samples to the people waiting in line too!!

Eating this big ass sandwich gets messy though so get lots and lots of napkins. The portions are huge and you will have food all over your pants and shirt and on the table.

Now this might be bad for people who don't want high blood pressure, but you only live once my friends!
author: Gangsta G.

description: Picked up a large order of chicken sandwiches and fries for my office and the food and service were excellent!  The chicken sandwiches are REAL chicken sandwiches with gigantic pieces of crispy fried organic chicken breasts. My office has tried other fried chicken sandwiches in fidi and all other locations were disappointingly soggy and average at best. The crew at this location is also extremely nice and service is excellent. They got my large order perfect within a short amount of time.  My coworkers all loved it and we will be adding it as one of our usual lunch spots!
author: Fred S.

description: Out of his world chicken! Busy during lunch hour - limited seating so maybe plan on taking to go. Menu is simple, staff is friendly, food was great!
author: Dan E.

description: SO DELICIOUS! And such a cool vibe! Randomly came to the city with my boyfriend and we were trying to find a food place that's not the norm and this was the place! We both got the Spicy Bird sandwich with Curly fries! Dang. What a great choice we made
author: Chad B.

description: This place is probably the best thing about being at SFMOMA besides the art. A blocks walk for an amazing chicken sandwich, I suggest the spicy, just the right amount. Go after 3 An get the 'Happier Meal' sandwich, beer and curly fries for 13bucks. Super clean and great decor, I hope one opens in Los Angeles so I can bring mates for a happy meal
author: Tyler S.

description: Great flavor!! Crispy Chicken married the dressing and veggies very well. The buns didn't fall apart as it meshed finely with all the ingredients. Got our food really fast and staffs are friendly. Can't blame the line as it moves fairly quick if you come during lunch.
author: Shamoo S.

description: The line is long but it progresses fast. Hang in there if you want a perfect chicken sandwich! :)
author: Hossein R.

description:
Crispy, juicy and well seasoned boneless chicken thigh (at least on the spicy version). I had my doubts about the apple slaw, but it works to balance out the richness. Curly fries, both loaded and normal, were good. Loaded curly fries reminded me of potato skins.

I'll be back for sure! Come before 11:30 am on a weekday to avoid the downtown lunch rush.
author: Patrick M.

description: Sandwiches are big and consistently prepared. Pickles are a nice touch. Line moves faster than you'd expect.
author: Anjolie C.

description: This is probably the best chicken sandwich I've ever had. The original is great, but the spicy is next level! It's always a real, thick, juicy chicken breast perfectly brined and breaded with made-from-scratch slaw. They also offer really fast service for lunch which is great because they are deservedly popular!
author: Kale F.

description: Like I never leave reviews but it looks like a small businesses getting started in SF so lord knows they need em. Its basically the best fried chicken ive had it my life. You'd be insane NOT to eat here!!
author: Trevor J.

description:
Simple and straight forward menu since they are still brand new and likely working some things out.  The curly fries are nothing spectacular, but the spicy fried chicken sandwich is awesome!  Not all that spicy, but the portion of chicken is huge, its crispy, its juicy, and the accompanying slaw on the sandwich is a nice contrast of texture and acidity. Available condiments are ketchup or sriracha, or naturally, a sriracha ketchup blend. Right now they are only doing one thing, but they are doing it right!

Also noticed various beer options for $5 or less, which seems like a great deal in my book, especially for downtown.  Sandwich and fries will run you a little over $11 after tax, maybe a buck or two more if you want to tip.  But that's about par with most self respecting lunch spots in downtown, and the food to cost value seems reasonable when compared to other nearby places that are more expensive or just not as good. 

Can't wait to see what else they may add to the menu.  Hopefully it doesn't take away from what they clearly do so well.  My opinion would be to add some kind of salad option.  Fries, or loaded fries (which sound delicious), on top of a fried chicken sandwich, can be a bit too heavy.

Definitely will be back.
author: T. G.

description: Boy I hate to write this but the sandwich was not good. The batter is wrong and the chicken is too thick and its the wrong cut of bird. The sandwich is sweet. Gross.
author: John T.

description: I stood in line and visited The Bird. My honest sense is that people are just enamored with friend chicken at the moment. The sandwich was a well cooked chicken thigh with a light batter, slaw, and their special sauce. The curly fries were well seasoned, but a bit greasy. The place is jammed. Would I go back? Probably if I was nearby and wanted a friend chicken sandwich. Would I make a pilgrimage to eat here? No....
author: Jim C.

description: My favorite spot. The best fried chicken sandwich in the bayarea. Clean place , great staff and great prices
author: Moe S.

description: Damn that was a tasty Fried Chicken Sandwich!  I really enjoyed the apple slaw in the sandwich as well as the crispiness from the chicken.  I got the spicy version and it was delicious!  Got curly fries and I'm not normally a curly fry kinda guy, but this one was good!  Will definitely go back!  In fact, I'm going right now!
author: Raj G.

description: I wanted a salad with chicken on it. Normal request, I think. Menu says $6.50 for a salad, no indicator what the price to add chicken is. I order at the register, it's an extra $6.50 to add the chicken to the salad. So that means the price of a chicken salad is $13, compared to a chicken sandwich being just $8. I was fine with that, it seems like a similar price to what I pay at Mixt, but then I get the salad and 1) it's not mixed at all and there's no room in the container to mix it and 2) the blue cheese dressing I get is in a tiny ramekin and there's barely enough just to dunk the chicken tenders into, none extra to actually mix into the salad. So as soon as the guy hands me my salad with the tiny amount of blue cheese dressing, I ask him for an extra ramekin. He says no, that's an extra charge. And the line that I'd have to go through to order another ramekin of dressing is 20 people long. I pointedly look at the line and then look at the guy, waiting for him to say it's on the house just this time, but nope, he gives me no more dressing and the salad is gross because I don't have enough dressing for the lettuce. Will not return here.
author: Alex D.

description: Tried this place for 1st time time today ,the chicken sandwich looks good but they the gave me  one that was under cook took it back and got my money back!so beware of your sandwich!
author: Ramon E.

description: I've decided to check out this place since I love fried chicken. Came here around 11:30am and there was a line out the door! The line moved fast and I was at the order counter in about 10 minutes. Service is great and fast! They have a production line putting the sandwiches together.  I got the spicy fried chicken with curly fries. The chicken was moist and full of flavors! If you can't handle spicy, don't order cause it got a good kick. I'm definitely going back and try their classic fried chicken.
author: Cynthia L.

description: Work nearby, saw the lines everyday..had to try it! Chicken was kinda bland. Was nice and moist, but honestly the amount of slaw overpowered the chicken for me. Couldn't really taste the bird. Maybe I needed to try the spicy chicken. The wings look delicious.  Love the idea of the sammy, fries, and beer special at happy hour though. Good call. Will probably give it a second chance, but first impressions were meh.
author: Summer W.

description: I loved this sandwich, especially the slaw.  My only complaint is that they served me a sandwich so hot that, even though I immediately took it out of my mouth when I felt how hot it was, I had a visible burn at the corner of my mouth that hurt even a week later!    My advice is that you take your sandwich to go so it can cool a good ten minutes before eating.
author: Kelly M.

description: Incredibly fast, fried chicken is delicious-- there is cinnamon in batter that adds phenomenal touch of sweetness and the coleslaw has apple slices, which add even more to the experience. It was delicious!!
author: Josh R.

description: The Bird has one of the best chicken sandwiches that I have ever tried! The meat is very tender and it had just the right about of spices and sauce. I would recommend getting the curly fries to pair with the burger. On a side note, I would recommend going to this place when you are hungry because the portion and size of the sandwich is huge! Would recommend for people to try it out!
author: Henry C.

description: The outside seasoning on the spicy chicken was VERY good, however the chicken itself was practically inedible. It was nearly all fat, gristle, etc. and the meat was stringy and tough. I couldn't even tell if it was supposed to be a breast or not. The curly fries were tasty, but exactly the same as curly fries everywhere, making me wonder if they're frozen/pre-packaged.
author: Niki P.

description: This place is awesome.  Best chicken sandwiches in San Francisco.  Cluck Yeah!!!
author: Imani S.

description: I like the fried chicken sandwich!!! The food is served very fast!!! Best sandwich I have had so far in SF.
author: Lianfang W.

description: Got the spicy chicken sandwich and fully loaded fries.  Worth. Every. Calorie.  Will try classic chicken sandwich next time.  Or maybe the breakfast sandwich.  Let's just say I'll be back.
author: K C.

description: The spicy chicken sandwich is the bomb. One of the best I have ever had. Definitely recommend this place.
author: Sagar P.

description: I love the limited menu and the speed of service. Food is delicious and the curly fries are yummy. Warning: long lines at lunch, but worth the wait!
author: DJ Y.

description: I must have had my food within 5 minutes of walking in the door (Monday night). And it was fresh and delicious! Seems to be the best cheap eats option in the area.
author: Garrett S.

description: I walk by this place everyday during my lunchtime walk.  Finally went in today since there wasn't a line out the door.  The sandwich was really good.  I got the spicy sandwich. It was spicy but not too spicy.  I would definitely recommend this to friends.
author: Mari D.

description: Best spicy chicken sandwich of my life! It was so good I went two days in a row! The curly fries were okay. The ambiance is fine. Great spot for a quick, tasty lunch!
author: Barry M.

description: Staff is amazing and really chill. Definitely a place to visit whenever in the downtown/3rd street area. Super delicious and juicy chicken sandwiches. So, plan accordingly during the lunch rush.
author: Cory R.

description: Went for the first time today and I'm a fan.  They are quick, which I appreciate during lunch on a business day and the chicken is nicely seasoned and delicious.
author: Ana C.

description: It was good. Not great. The homemade siracha is on point. The sandwich is a 7/10. The curly fries are above average curly fries. Long line but it goes fast. Worth a try. I don't regret the experience but I probably won't be back at least until they expand the menu.
author: Conner A.

description: Spicy chicken sandwich is I think the best I've ever had. Straight fire. Quick service as well.
author: Charles A.

description: One word WOW, just had their hot chicken sandwich with pickles and slaw, boy was that good.  This place make those chains who sell chicken look second class!  You must try this place, you will not be disappointed...
author: Robert B.

description: I went for the first time on a Tuesday and their spicy chicken sandwich was so good I went back each day for the rest of the week. A+
author: Westin F.

description: The loaded curly fries were soggy by the time I got back to the office. The sandwich was good. I will give them one more try by eating in their restaurant for a better experience.
author: zia h.

description: Great Spicy Chicken sandwich. Love the curly fries too. Pretty crowded around lunch time when I went. Essentially standing room only.
author: Ben M.

description: Almost the best sandwich in SF. Only problem is not enough tender, juicy, crispy chicken for the bun. Wife couldn't eat all her's. Appears to be very trendy. Coming back.
author: William A.

description: a small and "no thrills" menu deceivingly presents to you some of the best fried chicken sandwiches you'll ever have!! great spot to enjoy some food and brew while you people watch from their giant window seats.
author: Daniel C.

description: Holy cow.  Possibly The best fried chicken sandwich I've ever had!  They need to change the fries though... Skip those.  They taste baked from a bag.
author: marie s.

description: Damn, one good ole fried chicken sandwich. Classic or spicy - couldn't go wrong. Always get the 'happier' meal with a burger, fries, beer and a Koozie 12.5 $$!?!! You go  Bird!
author: Kate W.

description: Again...simple and delicious!  A bit crowded during lunch, however service was friendly and the wait wasn't too bad.
author: LaShaunda J.

description: Great new addition to the area. Juicy chicken sandwich.  Got the spicy addition which made it a bit messy. Slaw was awesome add. Love the menu... Chicken sandwich (basic or spicy) curly fries (plain or loaded), and beer. Makes for simple decisions.
author: Andrew H.

description: I've been to this place twice.  I tried the fried chicken sandwich the first time and I really didn't like the taste.  They use a spice in their batter, which I believe might be cinnamon.  I went again this morning to taste their breakfast sandwich.  I ordered the sausage biscuit.  They gave me a sausage, egg and cheese biscuit.  I should have been more specific because I didn't want the egg or the cheese.  Just sausage and biscuit.  The biscuit and sausage were good.  The egg looked good but because they put liquid cheese on that side I couldn't eat it and it tasted horrible.  Not sure why a place that makes everything homemade puts what I think it is liquid Velveeta on a breakfast sandwich.  It was gross.  I will try it again and be more specific on what I want.  But, so far, I haven't had the experience that makes me really want to go back.  It's very popular and the lines are always out the door, so give it a shot at least once.  You may have a different opinion.
author: Gail O.

description: I had the salad with half fried chicken and it was delicious. They give you a great portion size at a reasonable price and they have great service despite how crowded they are (the line is always out the door). Cant wait to go back to try the chicken sandwich.
author: S A.

description: As a southerner living in the bay area I wanted to like the Bird. It has some real issues though. I got a spicy chicken sandwich. To start with the spicy is just a dunk in some spicy sauce, that is basically flavorless, so no idea if the breading is any good or not. Slaw was ok. But the biggest downside here is the cut of meat being used. Now I enjoy chicken thigh in lieu of breast, since it is a tastier cut, but this shit was 50% fat. If you enjoy eating deep friend chicken fat sandwiches then this place is the shit. I am betting though that it's too much fat for most people since I heard 3 other customers complaining about it on their way out. On the bright side the curly fries are decent enough. But for $30 for two lunches I'd like more than tasty curly fries and a sandwich that I had to leave 50% of it behind. Also I'm very confused how any poster could compare Bakesale Betty's sandwich to this. Bakesale Betty's sandwich, while not the best, is a solid choice in comparison to the Bird's offerings.
author: Sally M.

description: Excellent customer service!  Somehow there was a misunderstanding and we only got one order (sandwich and fries) but the staff/management took it upon themselves to correct it immediately AND offered us a hot ice cream sandwich.  Since I am lactose intolerant, I opted for another order of fries.  But the gesture meant so much!  Thank you!
author: Jamie M.

description: Chicken was nice and crispy but the spicy was way too hot. Was looking forward to tasting the vinegar slaw but the spice from chicken was too much. I like spicy but it was too much. Curly fries were perfect. Will try the regular chicken next time.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Tried the spicy sandwich.  The meat was tender and juicy, the breading was good and crunchy, the seasoning was like someone just shoved an entire bag of bar-b-que chips in my mouth.  Crunchy sugar and B-B-Q flavor.  The slaw was a bit bland next to it (maybe some more lemon juice or rice vinegar??).  Not really worth the gut pain and calories.  Cute place and I wish them luck!
author: Jennifer D.

description: Food is simple, good quality, and delicious! This is how food is supposed to be and I loved this place. I got the classic sandwich with the loaded fries and I will definitely come back. Chicken was juicy, full of flavor, and definitely worth the price! What a great concept and idea to just serve a few items on menu as sometimes less is more!
author: D W.
